name: THE Place to See Sydney's FIREWORKS
summary: The ultimate way to experience Sydney Harbour; fireworks, the bridge, and the proximity to the city means you can experience everything this city has to offer.  Tucked into the Balmain Peninsula, you're close to parks, pubs, shops, buses, and more!
space: An entertainer's retreat!!  Views of the Sydney Harbour are unparalleled, the house is spacious and modern, the neighbourhood is friendly.  Your bedroom opens out onto a grassy backyard with views of the city and features your own en suite bathroom with shower.
description: The ultimate way to experience Sydney Harbour; fireworks, the bridge, and the proximity to the city means you can experience everything this city has to offer.  Tucked into the Balmain Peninsula, you're close to parks, pubs, shops, buses, and more! An entertainer's retreat!!  Views of the Sydney Harbour are unparalleled, the house is spacious and modern, the neighbourhood is friendly.  Your bedroom opens out onto a grassy backyard with views of the city and features your own en suite bathroom with shower. You'll access all areas except the master bedroom and spare bedrooms, this means the guest room with en suite, garden, kitchen, living, laundry, pantry, and powder room are all yours. We're just a phone call away to assist you with any questions or features of the house, there are many! We're 5 minutes from the bus stops (to the city or to the Balmain East ferry), 4 minutes to a park with tennis courts, and 2 minutes to an iconic Balmain pub, the Bald Rock Hotel.  The grocery store, b
neighborhood_overview: We're 5 minutes from the bus stops (to the city or to the Balmain East ferry), 4 minutes to a park with tennis courts, and 2 minutes to an iconic Balmain pub, the Bald Rock Hotel.  The grocery store, bottle shops, and Darling St boutiques/shops are about 10-15 minutes walk depending on how fast you move :)
notes: We live with our stud dog, and our son; we won't be here during your stay, but if you're allergic to dogs or babies, best to pick another place. :)
transit: Parking is available on the street in front or behind the house.  Buses come every few minutes, in less than 15 minutes you're in the heart of Sydney (QVB in CBD), or take one in the opposite direction and you can hop on a ferry from Balmain East wharf to Circular Quay or Darling Harbour, and experience all the sites Sydney has to offer (Opera House, Luna Park, Barangaroo, Milson's Point, etc.)
access: You'll access all areas except the master bedroom and spare bedrooms, this means the guest room with en suite, garden, kitchen, living, laundry, pantry, and powder room are all yours.
interaction: We're just a phone call away to assist you with any questions or features of the house, there are many!
house_rules: Treat our home in the way you'd expect yours to be looked after.  Be courteous of our neighbours, and our belongings; they may be material but they hold lots of memories for us.  This is our home, not a hotel, please treat it as such.  Rest assured we are in hospitality so you'll be taken care of as best we know how!

name: Surry Hills Studio - Your Perfect Base in Sydney
summary: This spacious, light filled studio has everything you need to enjoy Sydney and is the perfect base for exploring. The harbour is an easy walk, Bondi a short bus trip away.
space: Comfortable studio with a great layout. The bathroom has a full size bath tub and shower. Complete set of kitchen utensils etc for cooking and a full size fridge. The 3 seater sofa and 42' TV mean you can comfortably relax after a day at the beach or exploring.  Large lounge room windows provide harbour views.
description: This spacious, light filled studio has everything you need to enjoy Sydney and is the perfect base for exploring. The harbour is an easy walk, Bondi a short bus trip away. Comfortable studio with a great layout. The bathroom has a full size bath tub and shower. Complete set of kitchen utensils etc for cooking and a full size fridge. The 3 seater sofa and 42' TV mean you can comfortably relax after a day at the beach or exploring.  Large lounge room windows provide harbour views. You have full use of the entire studio and complete privacy during your stay. You have complete privacy during your stay. Surry Hills is a vibrant eclectic community and an amazing place to live, and this studio is in the centre of it all. A fantastic range of small bars and restaurants are on your doorstep, along with Sydney's best breakfasts for the next morning. Central to public transport, busses to Bondi Beach and the city are 50 metres from the front door. Travel Card 'Opal' travel cards work on all Sydne
neighborhood_overview: Surry Hills is a vibrant eclectic community and an amazing place to live, and this studio is in the centre of it all. A fantastic range of small bars and restaurants are on your doorstep, along with Sydney's best breakfasts for the next morning. Central to public transport, busses to Bondi Beach and the city are 50 metres from the front door.
notes: WiFi, Apple TV with Netflix App (for use with your own iTunes / Netflix account), 42' TV, Sound Dock
transit: Travel Card 'Opal' travel cards work on all Sydney public transport (trains, busses, ferries). The card itself is free and can be obtained (and value added) at train stations and most convenience stores and newsagents. Travel fees are capped at $15 / day, no matter how far or often you travel in that one day.  Busses Regular busses to Bondi Beach / City / Opera House etc are 50 metres away.  Trains Central train station is a 10 minute walk. Trains from / to Sydney airport arrive at Central Station and  Museum station (you can catch a train to / from the airport at Central or Museum without changing trains).   Uber Uber is readily available throughout Sydney and very reliable.
access: You have full use of the entire studio and complete privacy during your stay.
interaction: You have complete privacy during your stay.
house_rules: No smoking:  No smoking any substance, including e-cigarettes. Lost Keys / Locked out of Apartment:   If you lose the key to the apartment building itself (i.e., the yellow security key) the cost of replacing it is $250. It will be deducted from your security deposit.  If you lock yourself out of the apartment, it is solely your responsibility to contact a locksmith to open the apartment door for you. You are also solely responsible for the cost of the locksmith, including the cost of replacing the lock mechanism if necessary. If the lock mechanism needs to be replaced by the locksmith,  you must provide 2 copies of the new key.

name: Friendly Apartment, 10m from Manly
summary: A friendly apartment block where everyone knows each other and there is a strong communal vibe. Property has a huge backyard with vege garden and skate ramp. 7min walk to the beach and 2min to buses.
space: Great bedroom with a queen bed and window with views facing out over Balgowlah area, with great views of sunset. Large cupboards and drawers available for storage space.
description: A friendly apartment block where everyone knows each other and there is a strong communal vibe. Property has a huge backyard with vege garden and skate ramp. 7min walk to the beach and 2min to buses. Great bedroom with a queen bed and window with views facing out over Balgowlah area, with great views of sunset. Large cupboards and drawers available for storage space. You will have access to kitchen, bathroom, lounge room, separate laundry and well as the large garden space. I will be contactable by phone, housemate is friendly man who love meeting new people. All other apartment tenants are also very helpful and welcoming. Fairlight is the suburb between Manly and Balgowlah. It is quiet, close to the water and no more than 10mins away from everything you could need. Balgowlah shops is a 10 min walk with many cafes and restaurants. Manly is a 15min walk away, a very nice walk along the water. 3 mins from Sydney Rd where you can get a bus to Manly or the City easily. 15 min walk to Manly
neighborhood_overview: Fairlight is the suburb between Manly and Balgowlah. It is quiet, close to the water and no more than 10mins away from everything you could need. Balgowlah shops is a 10 min walk with many cafes and restaurants. Manly is a 15min walk away, a very nice walk along the water.
notes: Everyone in the block of apartments know each other and will often hang out together in the backyard. Big mix of ages and professions- everyone loves surfing and skating. Also worth noting, there will be a party in the backyard on NYE which you'd be welcome to join.
transit: 3 mins from Sydney Rd where you can get a bus to Manly or the City easily. 15 min walk to Manly Wharf to catch the ferry.
access: You will have access to kitchen, bathroom, lounge room, separate laundry and well as the large garden space.
interaction: I will be contactable by phone, housemate is friendly man who love meeting new people. All other apartment tenants are also very helpful and welcoming.
house_rules: This would best suit a down-to-earth, friendly person or couple who want to be near the water over the summer.  Non-smoking, no pets. Please do not have extra guests without notice.

name: Sydney Hyde Park City Apartment (checkin from 6am)
summary: Our city apartment is a bright, comfortable 1 bedroom with 24hr front-desk access. It is conveniently located directly across from Hyde Park and within walking distance of delightful cafes, restaurants, parks, major city attractions and public transport, including Museum Station which has a direct connection to Sydney Airport.
space: SPACE  Comfortable 1 bedroom which has a queen-sized bed, is air conditioned and has a self-contained kitchen, including:  fridge, dishwasher, oven, cooktop, microwave.
description: Our city apartment is a bright, comfortable 1 bedroom with 24hr front-desk access. It is conveniently located directly across from Hyde Park and within walking distance of delightful cafes, restaurants, parks, major city attractions and public transport, including Museum Station which has a direct connection to Sydney Airport. SPACE  Comfortable 1 bedroom which has a queen-sized bed, is air conditioned and has a self-contained kitchen, including:  fridge, dishwasher, oven, cooktop, microwave. SECURITY  Secure 24hour front-desk access with full access to the rooftop area which  has stunning views of Hydepark and the city, and includes: pool, sauna and gym.  Laundry facilities, which are located on the mezzanine level and has coin operated washing machines and dryers. MY AVAILABILITY I am easily contactable at anytime. If I am unable to welcome you personally I will leave the keys to the apartment and any further information marked for your attention at the front desk. AREA Located withi
neighborhood_overview: AREA Located within a vibrant and contemporary part of the city that is seeped in rich history and within walking distance of many attractions including: Hyde Park, St Mary's Cathedral, NSW Art Gallery, The Domaine, The Sydney Museum and less than a 30 minute walk to The Sydney Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge, Darling Harbour, Chinese Gardens, Wildlife Parks and Aquarium.  SYDNEY PRIVÉ If you wish discover why Sydney is such an extraordinary place then I would highly recommend  Sydney Privé, which is an exclusive concierge service that specialises in providing personalised tours and luxury experiences for the most discerning traveller. To truly experience Sydney, one must explore the local hideouts,  and there is no better place to do this than in Darlinghurst. Darlinghurst is the heartbeat of the city!  Checkout our airbnb Guidebook for some of our favourite hideouts.  The Guidebook will provide you with website links and actual location.
notes: IMPORTANT:  Our apartment is privately owned and serviced. It is not part of the hotel that is operated from within the building. Internet:  Our internet connection is wifi and dedicated to our apartment. So there is no sharing with other guests and no need to pay additional fees for internet usage.
transit: TRANSPORT Public transport: Easily accessible with buses, trains and taxi's.  Train Station:  Museum Station is 250meters from the apartment, so that approximately 3 minute walk to the station. Airport Museum Station has a direct connection to/from the Sydney International and Domestic airports. The train takes approximately 15 minutes to/from the Sydney airports.
access: SECURITY  Secure 24hour front-desk access with full access to the rooftop area which  has stunning views of Hydepark and the city, and includes: pool, sauna and gym.  Laundry facilities, which are located on the mezzanine level and has coin operated washing machines and dryers.
interaction: MY AVAILABILITY I am easily contactable at anytime. If I am unable to welcome you personally I will leave the keys to the apartment and any further information marked for your attention at the front desk.
house_rules: GENERAL HOUSE RULES: That guests have good behaviour, are responsible for any damage caused and leave the apartment clean and tidy.  That the apartment is only used for 2 guests  and not to be used for parties or events.  That guests are mindful of our neighbours, and adhere to safety and security rules of the building and staff.  Check-in : 2PM Check-out : 10AM EARLY CHECK-IN/CHECK-OUT:  If would like to change your check-in/check-out time, please let us know this information when making your booking.  We will make every effort to accommodate your request, however this may not always be possible as we have the cleaners, fresh linen drops and maintenance scheduled. LOST KEYS AND SECURITY TAG: In the unlikely event that the keys and security-tag are lost or stolen, for security reasons we will need to replace the lock, keys and security-tag. For this reason there is an additional charge of $450.  If you are in this unusual situation please contact me immediately so that I can ensure you

host.host_about:
At the centre of my life is my beautiful family...home is wherever my family is.

I enjoy filling my life with positive experiences and love to travel and experience new cultures, to meet new people, to read and just enjoy the beauty and wonders of the 'littlest' things in the world around me and my family.

name: Great studio opp. Narrabeen Lake
summary: Great studio apartment freshly painted and decorated.  Queen bed also with a pull-out sofa bed  Separate bathroom with fully equipped laundry.  Located across from Narrabeen Lake.  8km walk around lake - or borrow our bikes. Kayak/stand-up paddle boards available for hire. Short walk to Narrabeen beaches/Woollies/shops and main bus line to the city on Pittwater Road. 20 minutes to Manly and Manly wharf or take a stunning ferry ride to Sydney city or the new express B-line double-decker bus.
space: Private entrance + small private terrace. Has loads of parking available.  Woolworths and BWS are a short walk along the lake for any supplies needed. Cleaning fee included in nightly rate

Plenty of good restaurants along the lake and beachfront within walking distance.  On Fridays there is a fantastic Growers markets nearby with great produce and crafts - worth a visit We are unique in the fact we are across th
neighborhood_overview: We are unique in the fact we are across the road from Narrabeen Lake with a beautiful 8.2km walking track.  This time of year you will be able to see a large number of black swans on the lake or take a kayak or stand-up paddle board to take a closer look. There are coffee shops on the beach side of the lake where there are plenty of restaurants and the bus stop to the city.  You have a selection of beaches that at very close by that are all patrolled
notes: Kayak/stand-up paddle boards and more  are available on the lake   Great choice of restaurants within walking distance.  And of course the choice of several of the beautiful patrolled Narrabeen beaches
transit: We are a 5-10 minute walk to the main bus line on Pittwater Rd. From there it is 20 minutes by bus to Manly. From Manly wharf you can take a stunning ferry ride to Sydney city or you can bus into the city from Narrabeen which will take you about 40 minutes. Alternatively, head 20 mins north to Newport, Avalon or Palm Beach, a favourite spot where 'Home and Away’ is filmed. Sydney Airport to Narrabeen by car is around 45 minutes (in good traffic - allow longer in peak times, for convenience there are shuttles or taxis and plenty of Uber’s available.
access: Guests have access to backyard saltwater pool
interaction: Happy to give any local tips that we can.  Plenty of good restaurants along the lake and beachfront within walking distance.  On Fridays there is a fantastic Growers markets nearby with great produce and crafts - worth a visit
house_rules: No smoking

summary: Fabulous architect-designed home with incredible space, natural light and bush surrounds, on the cosy Greenwich peninsula. Equipped with heated pool, multiple indoor/outdoor spaces, it's ideal for a luxurious holiday and comfortable entertaining. Please note minimum stay is five nights.
space: The home has generous spaces, two living rooms, pool table, pool with courtyard for entertaining, separate BBQ deck for chilling, loads of outdoor space and grass for kids.

host.host_about:
I'm an entrepreneur with a couple of different business interests. I work from home on the Sydney lower north shore. 

One of my businesses is based in Shanghai, the other has operations in Shanghai and Singapore (mainly). 

I travel more than I would like, and am looking for an alternative to always staying in hotels, which get old after many years. While travelling, I usually spend most of my evenings doing email after having dinner out. No wild parties, but I enjoy a beer and/or a glass or two of red : ) 

I use a personal email address for correspondence associated with AirBnB and other websites to do with travel and administration.

name: Studio convenient to CBD, beaches, street parking.
summary: It is a spacious basement studio with a small kitchen.  It has its own external entrance, but is attached to our home.  For the best views feel free to use our table on the shared verandah. Close to Harbour beaches and beautiful walks, and Direct buses to the city run at least two times an hour in both directions. Shops and restaurants are walking distance. There is plenty of on-street parking.
space: The room is a cozy and private basement studio with a bathroom and external, private entrance.  There is a queen bed and a very comfortable king single.  Two yellow chairs make out into twin beds.  We have tried to be a comfortable and affordable base for Sydney travel by providing items that every traveler needs.  We provide things like laundry soap, hair dryers, basic kitchen pantry items, a TV, etc.    While we can sleep five (that is probably best for short one or two night stays.) BATHROOM.  Shower, hairdryer, great water pressure.  And if you forgot something (toothpaste, razor, etc.) just ask. KITCHENETTE:  Has two induction hobs and George Foreman grill, dishwasher, toaster, tea kettle, fridge and freezer.   BBQ and Balcony:  For $2.00 per use you can use our outdoor BBQ and you are always welcome to eat on our covered balcony for free.  (this is a shared space).

neighborhood_overview: We are walking distance to harbour beaches.  And Manly is 5 min away driving and 30 min walk along the beautiful Spit-Manly foreshore walk.  You can also take a swim at local harbourside beaches, walk thru the neighbourhood to some of the most scenic spots in Sydney.  A Coles grocery store is walking distance as are other local shops (I have a map in the room with details).
notes: OPAL cards are available for adults and children.  I try to make sure the correct number are in the room, but if they are not, just ask. As summer has arrived and doors and windows are open you may hear voices in the morning from us and the neighbours.  Mainly In the evenings around dinner time and in the mornings as the family is getting ready for work and school you can hear sounds.
transit: Direct buses into Sydney CBD and Direct buses into Manly are a 4 min walk.  G@@gle Maps is a great option for finding your way around on public transport.  Sundays are $2.50 AU for the entire day of travel if you use OPAL cards. Please let us know how and when you intend to arrive here.  We may be able to help you in some way.  Particularly if you arrive to Manly by ferry.
access: There is a private, external entrance to your room.  And there are stairs leading to the entrance. PARKING:  Is on the street and there is always plenty available, so it is free.  There are no parking restrictions on our street. GARDEN:  We have beautiful outlooks and garden areas.  We expect you to make use of them.  Most guests eat breakfast outside on our balcony if weather permits.  And some will work on laptops during the day.  Others enjoy a glass of wine in the evening.  If you would like to use the BBQ please inquire, we are happy to oblige--just be sure to wash up.  Note:  we do charge $2.00 per use for gas.
interaction: We are generally on hand as needed.  And I like to meet guests.  Self check-in is available.   I am easiest to reach through the Airbnb app, but you can also text me. We expect guests to take advantage of our garden spaces and verandah, Make yourself at home and enjoy the view.  We are always happy to chat if we are outside.  :)
house_rules: Treat our home the way you would want your home to be treated. Keep towels hung. Recycle. Follow checkout rules posted for checkout--check room, take sheets off the bed, recycle. Have we run out of an essential?  Text us and we will get it to you. Did you forget something?  Text us and we can usually help.

host.host_about: We are a family of four (Two teens).  We love meeting our Airbnb guests and sharing our favourite places to eat, travel, hike, cycle, or sight see in Sydney.  We are originally from the US, but have lived here for over 10 years.

host.host_about:
I am a professional photographer, based in Sydney. Australia. Covering lifestyle subjects such as Food, Interiors and travel, mostly for magazines and books and advertising clients. Born and raised in Sydney, I do love to travel and I have been lucky to have done a lot of that both personally and professionally. 
I enjoy making things and have always got a project on the go
Cooking is another great passion of mine. Hence the offer of baked goods and homemade jam!
Please feel free to email me with any question you might have.

name: Bright Inner West Terrace Value+
space: Come and stay in wonderful Petersham! This amazing and large terrace house is located only minutes from the train and buses that will have you in the heart of the city within 15 minutes.  The room is a large and sunny double room, located on the first floor of a renovated terrace overlooking the garden. You will have a private and relaxed stay. The room is perfect for a couple or single and is easily accessible to the shared bathroom. We are very close to public transport (and even a pub next door) but it is quiet and relaxed so no need to worry about noisy trains waking you up at night!). We are a short walk away from Leichhardt which is Sydney's amazing Italian dinning and entertainment precinct. On the other side of the railway line is Petersham's famous Portuguese dining strip. Glebe, Balmain and Rozelle markets are a short bus trip away. This is a lovely and safe area to walk around at any time of day or night. host.host_about: I love traveling and exploring the world with all its amazing adventures. I live in and love sunny Sydney and find the inner city to be one of the most exciting and interesting places to live. I run my own business so am out and about most of the time - but more then happy to lend a helping hand when it comes to local information on what to see and do!

name: Bondi Beach Dreaming 3-Bed House
summary: This peaceful house in North Bondi is 300m to the beach and a minute's walk to cafes and bars. With 3 bedrooms, (can sleep up to 8) it is perfect for families, friends and pets. The kitchen was recently renovated and a new lounge and chairs installed. The house has a peaceful, airy, laidback vibe  - a perfect beach retreat. Longer-term bookings encouraged. Parking for one car. A parking permit for a second car can also be obtained on request.
space: Serene space with three bedrooms, including a studio at the back, 300m to the beach and near to best cafes and bars in Bondi. Parking for one car. This wonderful house is designed to cater for families or groups with plenty of space and flexible bedding arrangements. There are three bedrooms including a master bedroom with a king bed, separate studio with a queen bed and a room with two single beds (with an additional two single trundle beds) that also can be converted into a king-sized bed. Just 300 metres to the beach, you'll find great cafes, bars and a small supermarket within a two-minute walk. The house has a front deck and back garden area. A new kitchen was recently installed with all mod cons including an induction cook top, Nespresso machine, dishwasher and microwave.  The foodies will love the good quality cookware and lots of bowls and platters for salad and food preparation. There is also a semi industrial vegetable juicer, orange juicer, soda stream machine and blender.

neighborhood_overview: North Bondi is laid back with great food and coffee. You can walk to low key wine bars or larger pubs or stay at home and enjoy a peaceful space. Favourite local haunts that are literally a two-minute walk away include the organic bakery (Organic Republic) on the corner, the local piadina cafe (La Piadina) and a great dumpling cafe and cocktail bar (Mamasan). Just a short stroll to the beach and buses to Bondi Junction where you'll find a giant Westfield shopping mall and connections to the city. Bondi Beach also has boutiques and other speciality shops like the famous Messina Gelato and Bills.
notes: Please nominate the correct number of guests before you arrive. There are extra charges for extra guests and if you do not declare guests I will make a resolution request to Airbnb and review you accordingly. Please note we have friendly neighbours and a security camera at the front gate.
transit: There is parking for one car and a second car can be parked with a street permit arranged in advance.  It's a stroll to Bondi Beach or walk one minute around the corner to the bus stop where you will find buses to Bondi Junction and the city. All cafes, bars and supermarkets are in walking distance.
access: The house has a front deck and back garden area.  I can be flexible with checkin and checkout when possible. If I can't  offer early checkin I can  offer bag drop (from 10.45am) before checkin at 3pm. If you require a super early checkin I offer a discounted rate to block the previous day.   It's also possible to checkin late in the day or night.
interaction: The house is offered as a whole. I won't be around after I've checked you in but the neighbours have my phone number and will call me (or knock on the door politely) if there is loud music or a party that is disturbing them. Please note if guests don't consider neighbours they will he asked to leave.
house_rules: Guests should have Airbnb verification at time of booking. We expect guests to be respectful of our lovely neighbours and keep the noise down, especially after 10pm at night. No loud music at any time of day. That means no parties, move all social gatherings into the house after 10pm. No smoking inside the house. Pets welcome.

host.host_about: I like furry friends and stylish surrounds.

name: Aquilla House - Ocean Views Newport
space: Enjoy breathtaking Newport Beach and ocean views from   every room except the bathrooms of this beautiful, family home. Positioned overlooking the stunning Pacific Ocean, with a south easterly aspect, this relaxed family home is perfect for a holiday escape!  Ideal for both family and entertaining, set against inspiring ocean and Newport Village views, only a 5 minute short walk to the beach via steps leading down from the garden.  > Four bedrooms, two bathrooms; two bedrooms and one bathroom on each level with level access to entrance.  > Spacious open plan living and dining, polished timber floors, open fireplace.  > Stunning gourmet kitchen features large preparation island, European appliances and professional Ilve oven and gas range hob.  > Open plan lounge and dining leads to an expansive deck with sweeping 180 degree views of the Pacific Ocean via bi-fold doors..  >  Landscaped, tiered ocean view garden with in-ground trampoline at the front for the kids.   > Fully equipped with

house_rules: Please, No Smoking and no pets but apart from that, please treat the house as if it was your own.  It's our family home and we want you to enjoy it as much as we do. Max 2 cars parking at front of house and guests to park at top of driveway as the private drive needs to accommodate neighbours cars also. Thanks.

name: Super location - Walk to the City!
space: Stay for a long weekend, a week or the whole month!! Come and live in my beautiful Art deco 1 bedroom apartment. Furnished with an adorable mix of retro and modern furniture. It is fully equipped and ready to move in for short or long stays.  The apartment has a very clever layout with great use of space. There is a separate bedoom with double bed & ensuite bathroom with shower over bath. A Walk-in-robe keeps all your clothes and suitcases out of sight!  An L-shaped living area wraps around a separate kitchen. The lounge room has a 3 seater lounge and armchair and a LCD TV with good TV reception. Cute dining space seats 4 and is a comfy spot to sit with your laptop.  Kitchen has a bar fridge with freezer, 2 burner cooktop and combined microwave and convection oven (it grills, it bakes and it microwaves!). Its also equipped with crockery, cutlery, pots and pans.  Its a lower ground floor apartment on a sloping block looking into an internal shared courtyard and walkway. Surprisingly qui

house_rules: Make yourself at home. Please leave the apartment clean and tidy though. No parties. The walls are thick so you don't hear much from next door neighbours but no loud music etc  -please be cosiderate of the neighbours Max of 2 people to stay in apartment - couch is for sitting and maybe a midday nap but not for an extra guest  Electricty and water are included.  No internet or Wifi provided Free to Air TV - Foxtel is available for longer stays if you want to connect it at your cost Bedding, towels etc provided Tea and cofee and a Small breakfast hamper provided to start off your stay I try to be as flexible as possible with checkins and checkouts - however I do need to work around other bookings and also my work.  Checkout by 11am - unless I dont have anyone booked for the following night.

host.host_about:
Im an HR Professional currently working for a large not-for-profit organisation. 

We love living in the inner city and the convenience to the city as I tend to meet friends in town to catch up over a drink (cocktail for me) or try a new reataurant. 

In 2011, I started lindy-hop dancing (1930's-40s style) which I absolutely love and now do weekly. The community is great and I love dancing so a much easier way to get some excercise in. 

I also love the beach so do try to stop at the beach or pool on the way home in summer for a swim.

I love travelling and seeing new things - Ive seen a lot of eastern Australia and slowly getting through my large bucket list of things to see overseas.

name: Beautiful Ensuite Room -Easy access to city
summary: The house is big, clean and spacious, with all modern amenities,multiple living rooms, and large courtyard w/ bbq.  Ensuite Room with private balcony, walk in wardrobe & TV . It will feel like staying in a hotel room  :) Express buses to the city and 1 stop to central on the train.
space: ACCOMMODATION: Beautiful 3 bedroom house near Green square train station (Direct line to the airport and city loop). House is big, beautiful, clean and spacious, with all modern amenities like dishwasher, dryer and wifi. Home office area, multiple living rooms, and large courtyard with bbq and outdoor setting. You will be sharing the house with 2 professional couples  of ages between 25-35 . All friendly, sociable & easy going. Fully furnished ensuite room with  Queen bed, balcony, tv & air conditioning. ADDED EXTRA'S: I've created for my guests an In House Visitors Directory which has loads of suggestions on things to do ie. Best restaurants, bars, supermarkets, car hire, public transport etc. I've also have the local guide books for Waterloo, Surry Hills, Paddington,Woollahra, Glebe which are packed full of information. At check in you'll receive a bottle of vino! CHECK IN/CHECK OUT TIMES; are flexible to suit your needs.

neighborhood_overview: Quiet leafy street with a Park in the front with tennis courts and bbq area. It is also minutes walk away from " The Grounds" a beautiful space with cafes and food carts and "The potting shed", a greenhouse style bar with incredible atmosphere, which you shouldn't miss out on if you are in Sydney!
transit: Airports (Domestic & International) are a $20-25 cab/uber ride or if you are moving solo you can just catch the train to/from Green square station (6 mins walk away from the house)  Sydney CBD it's really easy to access as you can always catch a cab or public bus transport on Botany Road or it's a $10-15 cab ride . It takes 15 mins to get to the city. Public transport is so easy as it's only a 2 minute walk from my door to a bus stop ( with express buses to the city and the beach)or 5 minute to Green Square train station (it is the direct line to airport and city!!!) If you hire a car you can park  on the side street with no metre restrictions.
access: Full access to everything in the house.
interaction: You will interact with me. I'm always available to offer help if needed on getting around or showing the best cafes and bars in the area.
house_rules: Please treat the house as if it were your own.

host.host_about: I'm new to Airbnb and so far I'm loving the experience as I've met some gorgeous people. I'm an outgoing friendly person who enjoys travel, great wine & food and meeting new people.

name: Executive Luxury design Apartment
summary: 84 Queen St has an eclectic countryside feel and features neutral sisal carpets, ceramic tiles, a stainless steel kitchen, warm walls throughout and an Italian marble bathroom. There is natural light throughout, including a skylight in the kitchen
space: No84 is an executive serviced apartment with a fully equipped kitchen and laundry services. Located in the heart of Woollahra we are central to many cafes and some of Sydney's best known restaurants.   Should you tire of eating out the apartment is equipped with everything you need.   Relax and enjoy your meal on the full sized deck overlooking a leafy courtyard.   And if its BBQ you prefer feel free to cook away on the deck.     A sunroom can convert into a 2nd bedroom for those guests that just don't want to leave.      A full sized bath tub and separate shower are located in the nearly renovated marble bathroom.    Relax and enjoy the bath products supplied. A rare secured parking space is also included. For those that like their privacy No84 is located just behind Queen Street in a leafy laneway. The apartment comes stocked with fresh flowers and the aroma of a welcome loaf of bread along with boutique jams and milk for the supplied tea and coffee.   For those needing to work whils

neighborhood_overview: A village atmosphere with great cafés, restaurants and bars.  Galleries and beauty salons all in walking distance.  A fantastic book shop and lots of clothing boutiques.
notes: Cenntenial park is walking distance away for your serenity moment - bike riding and horse rides available if you don't wish to sit at the cafe or take your own - and Bondi Junction for your shopping fix is a walk away.   Paddington Markets on the weekend is amazing. Cafe's abound.  Sydney Cricket Ground is a walk away.
transit: Buses along the street to various locations. Close to CBD and lots of shopping in local area and westfields bondi junction close by.  Sydney's largest park a 5 minute walk.
access: WELCOME PACKAGE :  includes: large fresh fruit platter, loaf of fresh bread, boutique jams (and yes vegimite) butter, milk, fresh flowers and sparkling water.  Assorted teas and Nespresso coffee machine and pods provided.  Juicer machine for your fresh juices.  Full kitchen, outdoor bbq, full laundry facilities, secure parking in leafy courtyard. Large bath tub - bath products by 'serenity' included.   Foxtel.  Safe.  Printer & scanner.
interaction: If you need more ... let me know.   Want a chef to cook an onsite meal for a special occasion - no problem.   Fully stocked fridge pre arrival - no problem.  Roses throughout for your special person - no problem.  Anything you want - dream it and we will create it.  (small print - yeah of course there is a charge - lets talk about what you need and go from there - happy to make your stay enjoyable!)
house_rules: Smoking and pets are not permitted.  We are a quite and friendly neighbourhood so please no large groups and noise.    Due to the stair access we are unfortunately not wheelchair or child friendly

name: ROOM + ENSUITE INNER CITY MOD HOUSE
summary: Large room with en-suite full personal bathroom plus own TV  in modern house with all mod cons less than 10 minutes to the city by bus and a short walk to cafes, restaurants and pubs plus shopping. Set in a quiet friendly back street with parking.
space: New to the market. A large private room with a double bed, en-suite bathroom  and city views in my newly renovated and completely refitted house, just 10 minutes by bus from the centre of Sydney. Located in a quiet corner of the Balmain/Rozelle area, the house is just a short distance from the heart of Balmain and its famous cafes, markets, pubs, shops and restaurants. You are welcome to use the kitchen and living room facilities and the wireless internet connection. Victoria Road is also just a 3 minute walk away with frequent bus services to the city, Circular Quay and also west to adjoining suburbs. This is a non smoking house however there is a small courtyard at the front for those who like to sneak one or two. As my house is always kept clean and tidy I would appreciate it if my guests followed suit, and I have a dishwasher for those who like to cook so easy cleaning up. Other than that I am very relaxed so make yourself at home.

host.host_about: Hi, What can I say other than I am 39 years old, professional female in a relationship. Very easy going. I just recently renovated my whole house, pretty much a knock down job so new everything. I heard about air B&B and thought what a great idea. I have a clean house including a great kitchen so feel free to make yourself at home when you stay with me. Just let me know if there is anything in particular you may need. This is also the perfect room to shut yourself away in if that is what you'd prefer.

name: Harbourside Apartment - Water Views
summary: This one bedroom apartment is bright and airy with unique views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, Sydney Harbour and surrounding North Sydney and Kirribilli. One Queen Bed + Sofa Bed, wifi, balcony, undercover parking, 5 minutes to Ferry wharf, 7 minutes to Milsons Point train station, 2 minutes to bus.
space: This apartment is quiet, neat and compact, with a newly renovated kitchen and bathroom and a great balcony for entertaining or just taking in the view. There is also a common grassed area just beneath the apartment with views of the Harbour Bridge as well which is excellent for picnics.  The apartment has a Queen Bed in the bedroom but also a Double Sofa Bed which would be fine for occasional guests or perhaps a child, though the apartment is ideal for 1-2 adults. There is a flat screen TV, DVD player, fully equipped kitchen, table and chairs (in the main room, plus an outdoor table and chairs on the balcony) ceiling fans, heaters and wireless internet access, as well as a common coin operated laundry one floor down from the apartment and an undercover carspace.
description: This one bedroom apartment is bright and airy with unique views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, Sydney Harbour and surrounding North Sydney and Kirribilli. One Queen Bed + Sofa Bed, wifi, balcony, undercover parking, 5 minutes to Ferry wharf, 7 minutes to Milsons Point train station, 2 minutes to bus. This apartment is quiet, neat and compact, with a newly renovated kitchen and bathroom and a great balcony for entertaining or just taking in the view. There is also a common grassed area just beneath the apartment with views of the Harbour Bridge as well which is excellent for picnics.  The apartment has a Queen Bed in the bedroom but also a Double Sofa Bed which would be fine for occasional guests or perhaps a child, though the apartment is ideal for 1-2 adults. There is a flat screen TV, DVD player, fully equipped kitchen, table and chairs (in the main room, plus an outdoor table and chairs on the balcony) ceiling fans, heaters and wireless internet access, as well as a common coin opera
neighborhood_overview: This is unique part of Sydney to stay in - quiet and safe but with plenty to do, right by the Harbour and within minutes of the CBD. I lived in the apartment for four years, and I absolutely loved waking up to a beautiful Sydney sunrise and the Harbour Bridge, and then watching the sparkling harbour from the comfort of the couch.  There are a number of beautiful harbourside parks nearby with excellent views, and Kirribilli Village is just a 7 minute walk away. Here you will find a number of excellent restaurants, cafes, bars and shops (including an excellent boutique Choclatier), as well as the wonderful Kirribilli Markets (on every second weekend), Luna Park, and award winning restaurants such as Garfish (excellent seafood), The Botanist (great cocktails), Batch (fantastic burgers), Street Market (great Asian Tapas style restaurant) Cool Mac (great Japanese fusion cafe) and Ripples Milsons Point - perfect for a casual meal under the Harbour Bridge. There are a number of great cafes wi
notes: There will be basic provisions in the apartment for you upon your arrival, as well as instructions for the apartment and a guide of things to do/places to eat nearby/in Sydney. Obviously all linen, kitchen items, iron/ironing board and whatever else you need for your stay are provided - just make sure to let us know if you will require the sofa bed so we have all the linen ready. There are a number of unique artworks decorating the apartment of harbour scenes from the surrounding area by a local artist which are for sale - if you’re interested, let us know!
transit: You can get to the city by ferry, bus or train: North Sydney Ferry Wharf - 400 metres Milsons Point Train Station - 650 metres Bus to CBD (direct to York St, no stops) - 280 metres The Ferry Trip to Circular Quay from North Sydney Wharf is stunning - a 15 minute trip over and a 10 minute trip back. From Milsons Point Train Station (7 minute walk), you are one station (a 4 minute train ride across the bridge) from Wynyard Station, Town Hall (8 minutes) or Central (12 minutes).  From Kirribilli/Milsons Point you can also access the public stairs to walk across the Harbour Bridge to The Rocks. The trip to and from Sydney Airport by Train takes 30 minutes, or a Taxi is roughly 15 minutes.
access: You will have private access to the entire apartment and laundry, plus car space if needed.
interaction: Basic provisions, welcome manual and dining suggestions provided. If you have any problems during your stay I'm usually easily contactable by phone or email, and there is also a Building Manager who can help in emergencies. My husband and I used to live in the apartment but now live around the corner so we’re very nearby if there’s anything you need.
house_rules: Just common sense really - please leave the apartment as you found it, and not do anything that is likely to disturb the neighbours (no parties)!  The building is strictly no smoking, and unfortunately no pets are allowed due to Strata rules. There will be instructions in the apartment about where to dispose of rubbish and any other details like this you might need. Children are welcome though the apartment is not child proof, and there is a balcony (one level above ground). Please be careful on arrival and on returning to the apartment that you get the right building - the next one along is almost identical!

host.host_location: North Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
host.host_about: I'm a born and bred Sydneysider, working as a Cellist and teacher full time. After living in the apartment myself for many years, I now live around the corner with my husband and daughter. I love living in Sydney and travelling, trying new places to eat and enjoying all the great things to do in our beautiful local area.

name: Bundeena Garden Studio near beaches
summary: Light and stylish self-contained studio, perfect for that out-of-town break. Just 1-2 minutes walk to pristine beaches, close to Royal National Park bush walks. Located in Neil St, very close to Gunyah beach. Spacious and comfortable bed-living room (4x6m), kitchen and bathroom, shady deck with lush garden outlook. Please note that current construction work on an adjacent block may cause some noise on week days 7am-5pm. 10% discount for stays of 4 nights or more.
space: Private and completely self-contained space, with queen bed, kitchen and shower room, ideal for a self-catering couple. Sorry - because of unfenced areas and wildlife it is not suitable for children or pets. Please note that there is a 2 night minimum stay, 3 night minimum on long weekends. Check costs by entering your intended dates, as seasonal rates apply.

neighborhood_overview: Bundeena is a unique village completely enclosed by national park and four beautiful beaches, yet still within the Sydney metropolitan area and only an hour away from city restaurants, galleries and concerts. In Bundeena you will find: - Unspoilt beaches, with the opportunity to swim, kayak, snorkel or go fishing. - Walking access to the famous Coast Walk (Wedding Cake Rock, Marley Beach, Wattamolla) and short drive to other Royal National Park bushwalks. - Cafes, restaurants: there are cafes open for breakfast and/or lunch on most days, and a few options to eat out at night. The Community and Services Club is open for lunch and dinner every day, and has great views over Port Hacking. At 'The Bowlo' there is a bistro with Asian/Australian meals. Driftwood Cafe also has evening dining on Wed-Sat evenings. The IGA is great for picnic/self-catering provisions, with fresh bread, hot chooks and a good selection of beer and wine in addition to all of the basics. - Talented artists who open t
notes: Minimal kitchen supplies (eg tea/coffee/milk/sugar/condiments) are provided, please bring other supplies. The local IGA is a few minutes walk away (near the ferry wharf) and is open 8am to 8pm every day for groceries, fruit and veg and liquor.
transit: The drive to/from the city of Sydney is around 60-80 minutes depending on traffic. There is a ferry to/from Cronulla ever hour until 7pm in the summer, until 6pm in the winter. From Cronulla you can get a train to the city - total trip around 90-120 minutes depending on connections. If arriving from the airport, take the train to Cronulla and then ferry to Bundeena, but car is easier and quicker. Bundeena is easy to walk around, everything is within walking distance. Note - there is no bus service or taxi service. You can also do tours of Port Hacking by ferry. Search on 'cronulla ferries' for Ferry information.
access: Guests have their own access through the garden. Studio facilities include TV/DVD, ipod dock, CD player/radio and basic wireless internet. There are books, CDs, DVDs and board games for your entertainment. Linen and towels are included (but byo beach towels). The shady deck overlooks the garden, and there is a small private courtyard with gas BBQ.
interaction: We live in the main house on the same property but guests have their own access through the garden and do not need to interact, however we are available to answer any questions.
house_rules: House rules for Bundeena Garden Studio: Please read this carefully before your visit so you know what to expect. If you need anything at all or have any other questions, please don't be afraid to ask – we want to make sure you enjoy your visit ☺  • CHECK IN/OUT  Please advise of your time of arrival by text message or email. Check in is usually after 2pm, check out is normally before 12pm (noon), but these can be negotiated if there are not adjacent bookings. • KEY You can pick up the key from us in the main house, or will be advised where to pick up if we are not at home. Ensure when you leave the studio that the doors are locked. • YOUR ROOM Sheets are changed for each visitor, but not the bedcover and cushion covers, so please keep them clean. The room is not serviced during your stay, so please hang towels for re-use. • FACILITIES A broom is provided – a mop and vacuum cleaner available on request. There is a clothes airer in the kitchen, and also retractable washing line under the

host.host_about: I have lived with my husband Chris in Bundeena for 28 years, bringing up our two sons who have now left home. We are artists and educators. We love photography, music, food, movies and travel, and believe you are never too old for the next adventure.

name: Inner City Terrace - 2 rooms 2 beds - 4 ppl.
summary: Our home is located in Darlington, a small niche suburb of Sydney with a relaxed, friendly and safe atmosphere. We are located a 10 min walk to Broadway, Glebe, Newtown, The University, surrounded by fantastic restaurants, cafes, pubs, markets and public transport. It is a 20 min walk to the city centre.
space: Our house is a classic 110 year old renovated inner city terrace with original timber floorboards, fireplaces and high ceilings. We have kept the rustic charm to the front section of the house, with the kitchen and bathrooms being renewed.  Our kitchen is well equipped with a gas stove, appliances and utensils. We also have a pantry of cooking essentials, an assortment of teas and Italian ground coffee.  There are two rooms with this listing in our 110 year old renovated inner city terrace. The room is on the second level and contains a new double bed with advanced comfort and support, double wardrobe with polished original timber floors. The second room is the attic on the third floor and has skylights with views over the suburb and contains a new double bed with advanced comfort and support, and a comfortable chair to relax in the morning sun. There is no door to the attic space however the room is still private.  The attic room may not be suitable for: Really tall people (pitched ro

neighborhood_overview: Darlington is a small inner city suburb of Sydney surrounded by many trendy suburbs like Surry Hills, Glebe and Newtown, all with a great mix of shops, cafes, restaurants, bars and people. We are within a 15 min walk to the below; Arts: Seymour Centre and the Carriageworks, performing arts theatres,  Attractions: Chinatown, Darling Harbour, Fish Markets, QVB. Markets: Eveleigh farmers markets, funky Glebe markets and Paddys, Food: @ Glebe, Newtown and Surry Hills. Pubs: Ask for a list.... how much time do you have? Shopping: Broadway, Central Park University: University of Sydney & UTS.  The city is a pleasant 30 min walk or easily accessible by public transport.
notes: There are detailed instructions on how to arrive to our house by various methods once you have booked. We also would consider people looking for long term stays or WHV, please send me an email with the details.
transit: •Darlington is approximately 2 klm's to the centre of the city. •3.8 klm's to Circular Quay and Sydney Harbour. •A 5-10 min walk to Redfern or 15-20 min walk to Central train station. •There are buses to the city 5 min's away at Broadway. •Sydney airport is  9 klm's. •There is off street parking or a parking station at the end of the street. •There are two shopping centres (Broadway & Central park) and another supermarket (Spar Redfern) all within a 10 min walk for any grocery or shopping needs.
access: Please enjoy all areas of the house, relax on the lounge, turn on the TV or radio, enjoy a book or magazine from the bookshelf, prepare a delicious meal in the kitchen, there is also a tranquil garden to relax in out the backyard. * CHECK IN/OUT: We are flexible with guests arrival and departure times. Guests can arrive in the morning to leave luggage, or welcome to leave luggage for the day if they have an afternoon/evening departure.
interaction: We have a good knowledge of restaurants, bars and clubs, tourist attractions and sights to see in Sydney and other parts of Australia. There are maps of Sydney and Australia and guidebooks on the bookshelf. We are happy to assist with information or let you explore on your own.
house_rules: We enjoy sharing our home with you and other Airbnb guests, please be considerate, enjoy the house, treat it with respect and apply some common sense! We are relaxed and easy going, we do not have rules or a curfew, however from our hosting experience we have generated some simple guidelines; •	Please ensure the house is locked for everyone's safety and security when you leave.  •	If you cook or use things in the kitchen place it in the dishwasher, and if you make a mess please clean it up. •	Please be considerate when using the bathroom, and be thoughtful for the next person to use it.  •	Please hang wet towels behind the door or on the rack provided. •	We enjoy cooking and are happy to share what we have in the fridge or pantry, but please do not freeload, for longer stays please be thoughtful by replacing or buying your own products. •	We appreciate that people enjoy their own space, may be tired after a long day or have limited/basic English. This is our home, please be courteous t

host.host_about:
Hey I'm Jason. I enjoy travelling, photography and beer!

We have had a little girl!
Our calender will be closed for a while. If you are a repeat guest send me a message and we might be able to open the calender for you.

I spent many years living in England, Ireland and Italy; and have travelled to Andorra, Austria, Bali, Belgium, Bulgaria, France, Germany, Hungary, Malaysia, Portugal, Romania, Singapore, Spain, Switzerland, Thailand & Vietnam. 

My partner Luana is from Verona, Italy. 

We started hosting in Oct 2015 and enjoy meeting people from around the world and listening to stories about their country and travels.

We have a good knowledge of Sydney (sights, attractions, shopping, beaches, day treks, restaurants, pubs & night clubs) and various places around Australia.

name: Tamarama Penthouse apartment
summary: If you want to be close by Tamarama and Bondi, this is the Beach Pad for you. Tucked away in a quiet cul-de-sac and only a stone's throw to the beach they call "Glamarama" and minutes walk away from Bondi and Bronte Beaches.
space: This unique penthouse apartment hosts colourful flavours of Morocco, is situated across the road from Tamarama Beach and has a spacious living and dining area opening to a verandah with spectacular views. Relax in the 1930's Huon pine boat daybed in front of floor to ceiling windows or just BBQ on the verandah. The kitchen combines elegance, functionality and a touch of Spanish. It has a double oven, Ilve stove top, steamer oven, dishwasher and microwave. The main Moroccan style bathroom has a double sink and combined bath/shower. The main bedroom has a queen size bed and build in wardrobes, the 2nd bedroom has a queen size bed and ensuite, the 3rd bedroom and study has bunk bed (double on bottom & single on top). There is one off street car park and the apartment is walking distance to local shops, Bondi and Bronte beaches.

neighborhood_overview: Nestled between two rugged headlands, Tamarama is a small coastal neighbourhood  that sits in the middle of the great coastal walk from Bondi to Coogee. Tamarama Park, which flows down to the much loved beach, is regarded by locals as their private reserve. Tamarama Beach has plenty of cosy barbeque spots, a playground and a café.
notes: HOUSE RULES - JUST A FEW THINGS TO GET OUT OF THE ROAD & THEN PLEASE ENJOY YOURSELVES. Please treat this apartment as if it were your own home and treat it with respect.  Please leave the apartment in the state you found it in. We will take care of washing, standard cleaning and vacuuming. If you would like to leave the last load of dishes washing in the dishwasher, that is fine. Please transfer all rubbish to the outside bins. *red/general rubbish, yellow/bottles, plastic & tin cans, blue/paper &cardboard). Please leave all dirty linen on each bed so we don’t get it mixed up. Dirty towels can be left in the bath. Please do not leave any acquired goods on the property (e.g. scooters, children’s toys, surf boards etc without consulting owner).  Any excess cleaning or rubbish removal will be charged. host.host_about:
I am a retired solicitor living in our home with my wife Judith who is a high school French teacher. Currently two of our three grown-up children live with us and we have a spare room. We have always had guests in our house since the children were very little and it is something that we would like to continue doing as I believe connecting with other people and learning about different cultures is wonderful. 
We love film, food, travel and music. This is a very musical household. Sport is also a very big thing- you will always find somebody watching the tennis/cricket/football on the television or going for a wok or bike ride. 
We ourselves love Airbnb and have used it all over the world in recent years. In Canada, France, South America and of course all around here in Australia. 
My life motto: you could die tomorrow so live life to the full!

neighborhood_overview: Pyrmont is just 2km from the Centre of Sydney's business district, a leisurely stroll across Pyrmont Bridge and Cockle Bay.    The Jones Bay and Cockle Bay wharf restaurant precincts are within walking distance offering access to some of Sydney's best restaurants and nightclubs, including Flying Fish, Pontoon and Home, while event centres such as Doltone House and Dockside are nearby. Also located in walking distance are The Star casino, Sydney Fish Markets and IMAX.   The Sydney Aquarium and Maritime Museum are both just over the bridge. Several lovely parks are also in the local area.
notes: There is construction going on in this building between the hours of 7am and 5pm. We have reduce the rates because of the potential for noise. Late check-out and early check-in is available where possible. When you arrive at the property you will find a kitchen and bathroom welcome pack with travel size amenities to ensure you do not need to head to the shops on your first day. We also provide top quality linen and towels. Cleaning services are available during your stay at additional cost. Your host has chosen to use the services of MadeComfy to ensure your requirements are met. A MadeComfy concierge service is available to help you with transport, theatre tickets, food and grocery deliveries or any special requests.
transit: A Pyrmont location makes Sydney easy to get around. Walk to the City centre, Glebe, Fishmarkets, restaurants and Darling Harbour.  Or grab an Opal card and you can get around Sydney and it's surrounds easily, Central Station, light rail and Sydney's bus network all located within a few minutes walk. We highly recommend using ride sharing service Uber.  Check out the TripGo app for transport timetables.

Please treat our home with the same love and care you treat yours. We have the following house rules whilst you stay with us: 1. Please be mindful of sound levels after 10:00PM to avoid neighbour complaints. 2. If you break something please let us know to replace it. Please leave your beds unmade Kindly clean up your dishes and put them away In case you have rearranged furniture, please put it back to the original location We would highly appreciate if you could take out the trash Please ensure all appliances and lights are off and doors and windows are close

notes: Our house is not a museum, however we have carefully preserved the centre as a heritage showpiece with original furniture, rare photographs and documents. The majority of people come to Ann's place to 'crash' but there are some enthusiastic history buffs!

Explore the many bars, cafes and restaurants that line the shoreline or take a stroll through the lanes to find one of the many hidden gems. In the city centre you will find large shopping centres with high end stores, Australia Department stores such as David Jones and Myer and many other well knows brands and Australian designers. Located close to the Central CBD is Hyde Park and the Botanical Gardens, both are a beautiful place for a stroll or picnic. The CBD area has many great areas to explore, from Circular Quay and The Rocks, to Barangaroo and Darling Harbour or China Town, there is always somewhere to see. notes: This great 2 bedroom apartment is as central as it gets. Located in the centre of the city, only minutes walk from all of Sydney’s great sites such as the Sydney Opera House, The Sydney Conservatorium of Music & Circular Quay.  Your apartment, located in the historic heritage listed Cliveden building, boasts high ceilings & a newly renovated common room. The Cliveden also has a fantastic rooftop pool, which will provide a relaxing atmosphere.  With all your modern conveniences provided, this is truly your “home away from home” in Sydney.

host.host_about:
My team and I at The Apartment Service are proud to have been helping people with short and long stay apartment rentals across Sydney since 1989. 

Property professionals say location is everything and we believe that a convenient location is essential, especially in the rental market. We can offer you some of the best locations accross all the major areas of Sydney, and all of our  apartments are carefully selected for their proximity to cafes, key business and retail districts, public transport, and tourist hotspots.

Furnished apartments are a cost-effective alternative to five star hotels and have the added advantage of feeling like you are staying in your own home with separate lounges, kitchens and laundries, and modern appliances.

We've found Airbnb to be a perfect fit for our apartments and we're proud to have achieved a high volume of 5 star reviews consistently since joining. 

Please don't hesitate to view our 150+ properties listed on Airbnb across all areas of Sydney, and do get in touch for quick and friendly assistance.

Can’t wait to welcome you to Sydney :) Cute rustic apartment with modern interiors, Well styled room with sunlight and a super comfortable queen bed (electric blanket) with organic cotton sheets. Sunny & leafy balcony with French door entry, Split level single apartment. A maximum of 2 guests only. The location is EVERYTHING being right next door to the City or Bondi Beach! Our neighbours include 10 William St, Paddo Inn, The Paddington, Fred's, St Peter's & The London, these are all great venues for going out being on your doorstep! We are also 5min
neighborhood_overview: Paddington is one of the oldest and dearest suburbs in Sydney! Most comparable to London's, Notting Hill or New Yorks, East Village it really is a top cosmopolitan location with some of Australia’s BEST restaurants & fashion boutiques right next door! We also have a great local market across the road every Saturday & 5 minute walk from Sydney Vegan market on a Sunday. Not to mention only a minute walk away from Centenial park, and a 24hr Gym across the road too
notes: Smoking available outside only (balcony) Be kind to our pets (Cat) Kitty litter is kept outside I work full time so the apartment will be mostly free No more construction in the area  PLEASE NOTE- Large main bedroom will be on offer to guests as of December (currently decorating) at no extra cost!
transit: 1 mins walk from a 24hr bus line! (Bus # 333 Circular Quay to Bondi Beach) 10 mins from train stations. Taxi friendly or just walk.
access: Full access to all amenities- including NBN WIFI, Netflix, Apple TV  Also I have a Scooter  that is available for day hire if you have a valid International riders license! Our place is a 10min ride to the beach
interaction: I am available for all questions and recommendations via email or phone, if not in the appartment myself... looking forward to welcoming you to Sydney! :)

name: Self-contained beach accommodation near Manly
summary: A beautiful room overlooking a sunny garden, just a few minutes walk to Curl Curl & Dee Why beaches & ideally located for tourist destinations in & around Manly, the northern beaches & the stunning city of Sydney.  You’ll love the Garden Room because it is quiet yet in a beautiful location, with close proximity to wonderful walks, beaches, restaurants & public transport.  Ideal for a couple or single female.
space: The Garden Room is a completely self-contained space within a quiet family home (we have 2 well behaved children aged 13 & 12).  As our welcomed guests you will have access to a well equipped kitchenette within your living space, a large private ensuite bathroom, plus your own spacious deck (with table & chairs) overlooking a peaceful, sunny garden.  If the weather is not so good you have a table & stools to enjoy using inside the Garden Room.

As our welcomed guests you will have access to a well equipped kitchenette within your living space, a large private ensuite bathroom, plus your own spacious deck (with table & chairs) overlooking a peaceful, sunny garden.  If the weather is not so good you have a table & stools to enjoy using inside the Garden Room. You will have your own independent access through the back entrance sliding doors (watch out for the friendly golden retriever), with a larg
neighborhood_overview: North Curl Curl, especially up on the headland, is unique as it's one of the quieter beaches with little development (except at either end of the beach).  North Curly has a superb surf beach (probably the best next to Narrabeen for keen surfers, yet safe enough for beginners too).  You can walk down to Curl Curl beach & Dee Why beach in minutes, & of course there are the superb restaurants along Dee Why beachfront to enjoy.  If you are reasonably fit you would enjoy the cliff top hike between North Curl Curl Surf Club & Dee Why beach, & of course you can also enjoy the superb walk from North Curl Curl to Manly (45-60 minutes walk), which meanders along beaches, through landscaped parks & a stunning boardwalk.
notes: FYI we do have a (very quiet) friend who stays in our cabin sometimes but she is hardly ever there!  We also have a golden retriever & 6 chickens/bantams (feel free to feed the chooks & take an egg or two if you find any there).  We also have a veggie patch so feel free to help yourself if there is an excess of any fresh veggies in there ; )
transit: Bus transport connections are superb for Manly, the city & Chatswood, which you can access at the bottom of our road.  No need to worry about finding a parking spot near the beach - you can just walk to either Curl Curl or Dee Why beaches from the Garden Room in just a matter of minutes!
access: You will have your own independent access through the back entrance sliding doors (watch out for the friendly golden retriever), with a large sunny back deck for your private use to enjoy leisurely breakfasts overlooking our garden while listening to our chickens.  You also have exclusive use of a large sumptuous & contemporary ensuite bathroom.
interaction: We will most likely be home but sometimes we are away - you may well not see us even if we are home as you have your own independent access to the Garden Room.  Of course if we are home, then please do wander upstairs to ask us any questions you may have.

neighborhood_overview: The location is perfect - just five minutes from Sydney's CBD, Kings Cross and Potts Point, and two minutes from Oxford St. Bus stops that service Paddington, Bondi Junction, Bondi Beach and beyond are right on your doorstep. Darlinghurst is a cosmopolitan suburb, with busy cafes, restaurants, bars and nightlife venues along Oxford, Crown, Victoria and Stanley Streets. The Darlinghurst Village is a heritage precinct where the majority of buildings are early 20th century terrace houses. It comprises 20 blocks bounded by Barcom Avenue, Forges and Oxford Streets and Taylor Square. Oxford Street is Sydney’s most famous shopping street, where you will find everything from supermarkets and gift shops, to alternative clothing boutiques, late night bookshops and music stores. Darlinghurst is home to a range of exceptional designer and home wares outlets, as well as a great selection of various ethnic cafes and restaurants, from basic to up market. Oxford Street' exclusive cinemas, the Chauvel
notes: We have 3 apartments in this block, but only one car space. Parking can be provided on a first-come-first-served basis for $20 per night. Street parking is restricted and limited, though there is a multi-storey car park next door to the building.
transit: There is no shortage of public transport options surrounding this apartment. Catch a bus from any number of bus routes with numerous stops within a 1 minute walk. You can get to Museum or Kings Cross train stations in a 5 to 10 minute walk, or you can walk into the CBD in the same length of time.
access: You will be provided with instructions for self-check-in once we process your booking. Once you collect your keys from the property, you will be able to access the apartment via the lift after you enter the building through the front glass security doors. Once inside, you will have access to the entire apartment.
interaction: We leave you to enjoy the apartment in peace, but we do live nearby and are able to discuss any questions you have over the phone, or we can get to the apartment in around 20 minutes to attend to anything urgent.

If you are in any doubt as to this policy, please contact us immediately. Following these rules will ensure your security bond is returned to you in full and on time. Breaking these rules may result in charges being incurred as detailed in our terms and conditions. If you respect the apartment as you would your own home, you can relax and enjoy your stay.

host.host_about: We live in Sydney and run an executive accommodation business in Sydney and Brisbane. All our apartments are located in high-demand inner-city locations, a short distance from the CBD. Whether you’re on a business trip or vacation for a few days, or are after a longer stay due to relocating or home renovations, we have executive accommodation to suit your needs. Our apartments offer everything you require for a short-term or long-term stay. All our apartments are fully furnished and have a fully equipped kitchen (complete with all kitchenware), a washing machine and dryer, a brand new flatscreen tv and a Nespresso coffee machine, along with an initial supply of capsules for you to enjoy. We provide linen and towels, platinum Foxtel (cable tv) access and free wifi in every apartment. We pride ourselves on our customer service, ensuring that your stay is a uniquely positive experience. We encourage guests to provide feedback, and regularly update our apartments and services based on your recommendations. We look forward to having you to stay and aim to ensure you keep coming back.

host.host_about:
Joanne – I’ve always loved to travel and even though my three boys now keep me closer to my home in Sydney’s Inner West, I take every opportunity to enjoy family holidays in apartments and houses booked online throughout Australia and New Zealand.

Ali – I’ve been living in the Blue Mountains since 1993, so I could be called a local! This means I have a wealth of knowledge about this amazing part of Australia that I have decided to call home. It also means that I have the opportunity to stay in some of the most beautiful and unique houses in the world.

name: Elegance and Peace in Potts Point
summary: My beautifully renovated Art Deco studio apartment is in the heart of Kings Cross, yet so peaceful and quiet. New bathroom and modern kitchen, in the Art Deco tradition, are stunning to be in. A Sleeping Duck queen bed which is absolutely fabulous, 4G unlimited wifi, high quality washer/dryer and dishwasher. Fully self contained!
space: Meticulously restored studio with attention to detail. Australian Blackbutt solid timber floors, classy and comfortable. One floor up from street level in a 1930's three story building with views of the harbour from the common area roof top. Totally self contained with all new appliances, Meile dishwasher and cooktop, and Bosch combo washer/dryer. Fully equipped kitchen. Sleeping Duck new queen bed. Tastefully renovated Art Deco bathroom with large shower/bath. Samsung smart TV and 4g high speed wifi with unlimited internet. It's simply beautiful! The space is dreamy to be in. I know you will love it!

neighborhood_overview: This spacious studio has good neighbours. When you walk out of the building there is a bright, tree lined cul de sac which leads you directly to the heart of everything great in Sydney! I adore this place! And the common area roof have clothes hanging space and a nice view of the surrounding buildings and the harbour.
notes: Sleeping here is divine, and the space is especially peaceful to be in. There are no views as it looks into the light well, but it is airy and quiet. There is roof access for hanging clothes if you wish with a view of Sydney harbour. I have a floor fan to move the air in general as well as a whisper quiet Hunter ceiling fan over the bed. Then in winter I have a small but toasty heater. It does not really get too cold or that hot.
transit: Super convenient location with level access to buses and the train only meters away. And of course the ever available taxi.
access: A safe, security building located only 100 steps level access from Kings Cross fountain. You have access to everything in the apartment. There is also a roof top laundry and drying area with a nice view of the Harbor. Woolworths grocery store is across the street with a bus stop to central station and the City in front. Minutes from Wilson Parking Station and 200 meters to the Kings Cross train station. Minutes to Harbourside parks ... Beare Park and Rushcutters Bay park to name a few.
interaction: Either I or my partner Don will meet you with the keys and show you the apartment and how to use the appliances. Please ask us any questions about the area and we are not far away if you need anything.
house_rules: Please enter and leave the building quietly. This is a non smoking home. Be respectful of my home with care and consideration. Please take your trash out to the bins in front of the building and leave my place as you found it!

host.host_location: Elizabeth Bay, New South Wales, Australia
host.host_about: I love Sydney and all her natural beauty.  I immigrated here many years ago and still get excited every time I step out the door. I know this city well and can help you with information and tips. Bird watching and snorkelling are high on my list of things to do. I also love hosting people and making sure they feel at home in my home. Mi casa es su casa.

You’ll love my place because of the comfy bed, the location and the homeliness. There is a fully equipped kitchen with Nespresso machine and breakfast essentials. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers.
space: This cosy, bright 2 story terrace is located on a quiet street in leafy Surry Hills. It's a 20 minute walk to the heart of the CBD and only a 10 minute stroll to the beautiful Hyde Park.

neighborhood_overview: Surry Hills is a foodies haven - there are heaps of great coffee places and restaurants all within a short walk. Ideally located between the CBD and Centennial Park, Surry Hills is an ideal base location to visit the iconic sights and also catch a cricket, AFL or rugby game at the SCG/Allianz.
notes: Flexible on check-in when possible and have a key safe in case you arrive when I'm at work etc.
transit: There is a bus stop 10m from the front door which goes directly to Circular Quay via Martin Place. Central Station is a 10 minute walk to get anywhere you could possibly need to, including the airport. Taxis to and from the airport take around 20-30 mins depending on traffic - an uber to the airport is usually the best way to go.
access: Full kitchen with amenities, including Nespresso machine. Shared bathroom with full amenities Washing machine and dryer Iron and ironing board Wi-fi Barbeque
interaction: I live in the house and I'm a professional working in the city so you have the place to yourselves during the day. I'm friendly and easy-going and I'm happy to give you ideas for things to do whilst in this great city.

host.host_about:
Hi, I'm Hayley. I moved from the UK to Australia in November 2015 with my boyfriend and we love living in Surry Hills.
I'm very active; I enjoy the gym, running in Centennial Park and exploring all of the great walks around NSW and beyond. I volunteer for a women's charity and I'm also a Girl Guides leader.
I love to cook but with the variety of amazing restaurants on our doorstep it's hard to not eat out all the time!
As both a guest and host I'm polite, considerate and tidy. I like for our guests to feel at home when they stay with us - so if there's anything you need, just ask.

name: Chic City Pad with Leafy Outlook
summary: Recently renovated and truly spacious studio apartment in the heart of Potts Point. Within walking distance to some of Sydney's best attractions and an easy 8 min walk to Kings Cross Train Station. Beautifully renovated and appointed, you will have access to free Wi-Fi, the new kitchen with cooking facilities, washer & dryer and the building's stunning pool!  The space works for solo adventurers and business travellers, with the comfortable queen sized bed making it perfect for couples.
space: My studio apartment is beautifully renovated and spacious, with a super comfortable queen sized wall bed, making it perfect for a relaxing stay in Sydney. There is a full sized kitchen with cooking facilities, if you feel liked a home cooked meal and coin operated clothes washing and drying facilities on every floor of the building.  Access to the apartment is hassle free, through the gorgeous new entry foyer and up the newly refurbished lifts. The apartment has free wireless internet and a HD TV, with access to online movie rental services, if you feel like staying in. I know you will love the space and the city views from the large windows, as I have endeavoured to see to every detail, to make your trip and stay as comfortable and convenient as possible.
