neighborhood_overview: Potts Point is one of Sydney's premier suburbs. Its tree lined streets, beautiful old apartment blocks and easy access to Sydney CBD, Royal Botanical Gardens, Woolloomooloo Wharf, Circular Quay and all of Sydney's best attractions, make it one the most desirable places to live and visit in Sydney. You'll love the local cafe and restaurant scene and the gorgeous boutique shopping that is literarily on your doorstep. A perfect place to base yourself for your stay in Sydney.
transit: Kings Cross Station is an 8 min walk straight down Macleay and Victoria Streets, where you can directly access all of Sydney and the Airport. Potts Point is a popular suburb close the CDB, so there is also a multitude of bus services on your doorstep and there is never a shortage of taxis.
access: You will have full access to all the facitilities of the apartment, such as kitchen, bathroom, laundry, wireless internet etc.  The building also features a swimming pool, which you are welcome to use at your leisure.
interaction: I will be available 24hrs each day during your stay, just phone or email me. I will also most likely be there to check you in and show you around the apartment when you arrive in Sydney.

host.host_about: Hi I'm Vickie! I am an avid traveller who loves my city and Airbnb allows me to share it with you and!!! I truly enjoy meeting new people and look forward to welcoming you to my beautiful city.

name: Cute studio with Sydney Harbour Bridge views!
summary: This bright and airy studio apartment offers a fabulous balcony view of the iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge and is conveniently located near buses, trains and the ferry. Just one train stop to the city, or a 30 minute walk across the Harbour bridge. Restaurants, cafes, bars & grocery stores within 10 minutes walk. Apartment has fully equipped kitchen with fridge, microwave, gas stove & oven, dishwasher and espresso machine. Free wifi (ultra fast NBN) and complimentary tea & coffee.
space: Despite it's relatively small size, this studio has a bright and airy feel that makes you feel right at home. The balcony is equipped with table & chairs, so you can enjoy your breakfast or evening glass of wine with views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge.  You will have access to full kitchen facilities and desk space. The TV is also equipped with an Apple TV for complimentary Netflix & Stan - plus DVD player for a collection of near 200 movies to choose from.

neighborhood_overview: This studio is located only 10 minutes walk away from Kirribilli Village, a suburb that not only houses our Prime Minister but offers a variety of lovely cafes, patisseries, bars and spectacular waterfront harbour views.  From Kirribilli, you only need to walk 5 minutes further to visit Sydney Luna Park, or take a walk across the iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge, taking you to the city in just under 30 minutes.  Also 10 minutes walk away is North Sydney CBD, a bustling business district offering supermarkets, cafes, restaurants, shopping malls, hair dressers, gyms, dry-cleaners... as well as the dry-cleaner located right next door to the apartment itself!
notes: The great thing about my apartment is it's location, however being so close to the city means whisper quiet surrounds are not guaranteed. The road outside my apartment can get a little busy during peak periods such as the morning and evening commute. If you are particularly sensitive to noise, this is something you should consider when staying at mine. It can get very warm in Sydney during the summertime. Although I don't have full air-conditioning installed, I provide a portable air-conditioner for my summertime guests. For taller guests 6 foot and over, my bed might be a bit of a squeeze. For couples I recommend putting the taller person on the pulled-out section of the bed where at least there's no frame hindering the feet! ;)
transit: Getting around is ridiculously easy from my place. Walk 5 minutes down the road for North Sydney Ferry wharf, 7 minutes to Milsons Point Train station, 10 minutes to North Sydney train station and bus stands.    From Milsons Point station, it's only one stop to the city. Should you want to explore a little more of the Northern side of Sydney, the bus stop right outside the apartment complex will take you to the suburbs of Neutral Bay and Cremorne, home of Australia's most beautiful independent cinema The Hayden Orpheum Picture palace; built in 1932 and restored to its amazing former Art Deco glory... for all you movie buffs out there, it's definitely worth a visit!
access: Guests have access to the entire apartment - Make yourself at home! ^_^
interaction: Although you might not see me in person, I'll be available for any questions or issues via mobile or Airbnb message!
house_rules: Please use coasters for glasses, and use a tray or tea-towel if you're resting plates on any furniture that's not a table. If there's any spills, breakages or other accidents, please let me know as soon as possible - accidents do happen, but the sooner I'm notified the more likely we can come up with a fix ^_^ The only people who should be residing in my apartment are those listed as my guests on Airbnb - if you intend on having visitors please do me the courtesy of clearing it with me first.  Thanks! ^_^

host.host_about:

As a well-seasoned traveler, I hope to provide the kind of experience that I would expect and appreciate as a guest. Should you make a booking, you can expect a pleasant, no-fuss stay with maximum convenience. And of course a very warm welcome from yours truly! ^_^

neighborhood_overview: The Area Located near Botany Bay, the area where Captain Cook initially landed when exploring Australia, Monterey neighbours Brighton Le-Sands (10 Min walk away) providing ample dining and entertainment options. There is a beach half a block away that stretches for kilometres on end, a perfect destination to relax and a great swimming beach for children as no strong waves. With a plethora of restaurants to choose from, you will never be bored from the variety of cuisine available.
notes: Please be aware that my son is only 7 so is not always quiet (we are up around 7am), we are out a lot through the week (working/school) but in the weekends/holidays we are home and in the daytime it can be a little noisy at times. Also I need the house to be reasonably quiet after he goes to bed (8pm).
transit: Public Transport Situated around the corner to the bus stop, whether you're heading to the CBD or local train station, Rockdale (bus 478), there are plenty of options to take when planning to visit the city or suburban Sydney. The train trip to the CBD takes around 25 minutes while a bus ride usually takes 45. Please feel free to get in touch if you have any questions. Looking forward to meeting you.
access: Bedroom, main bathroom, kitchen, dining room, balcony and laundry (baskets on top of laundry cupboard to put your dirty washing in, I will return it outside your bedroom door when dry).
interaction: My son (7) and I live here so can be on hand most days to help out with questions.
house_rules: If using - please hide the key safe numbers for security. If you could keep the noise level to a minimum after my son goes to bed, closing the bedroom door when making phone calls, chatting or watching tv and closing hallway doors quietly (they are noisy doors and the handles need to be pushed all the way down to close quietly) that would be great. After 11pm please refrain from using the shower, running the bathroom taps for too long, loud phone calls or banging doors as I am a light sleeper and these do wake me. Turn off  bedroom/bathroom ceiling fan and lights when going out to conserve electricity. house_rules: - Guests 25 years old or older can book this property. - Any noise complaints received from neighbours during your booking will result in the forfeiture of the entire bond and may result in the immediate termination of the booking. - No consumables are supplied for this booking.   - Guests are to ensure dirty dishes are all cleaned and put away in the cupboards (and dishwasher empty) prior to the end of the booking.  - All rubbish is to be removed from the interior of the property at the end of the booking and put into the council bins available onsite in the carport.   - Council rubbish bins must be taken out to the pavement on Sunday evenings each week as the council collect the rubbish early Monday mornings.   - No smoking  - No left luggage facility available - There is a key replacement fee of $50 per key for lost keys (or keys accidentally taken home at the end of the booking). - Personal items left behind at the end of the booking can picked up from the property at a time suitab

The playground of Australia, Sydney boasts some of the country's most iconic landmarks and we're in the perfect location to experience the wide array of things to see and do in Sydney. Any more than 3 adult guests overnight will attract an extra $19 per night, per additional guest. The sleeping arrangement for the 3rd and 4th adult would be on a 3-seater sofa bed which folds out to a queen with extra quilts, pillows, sheets & covers. name: Quiet Stylish Mosman Apartment
summary: My 3br ground floor apartment is close to Balmoral beach, buses, city, parks, harbour foreshore walks. You'll love the room as it has its own private courtyard. Lift access.. Comfy bed. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers.
space: has its own private sunny courtyard.
description: My 3br ground floor apartment is close to Balmoral beach, buses, city, parks, harbour foreshore walks. You'll love the room as it has its own private courtyard. Lift access.. Comfy bed. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers. has its own private sunny courtyard. Guests will have access to the whole apartment apart from main bedroom. There's lovely outdoor seating and a wrap around courtyard and a BBQ. I'm in and out but love talking to people so if I'm home happy to interact or if guests would prefer to be left alone that's fine with me. I'm always happy to give advice on how to get around, things to do in the area and tips on places to eat and of course where the best coffee is. name: Manly Harbour House
summary: Beautifully renovated, spacious and quiet, our 3 Bedroom, 3 Bathroom home is only a  10 minute walk to beaches in Fairlight or Forty Baskets,  or a 30 minute walk to Manly via the coastal promenade, or an Express bus runs every 20 mins at your door.
space: Our home is a thirty minute walk along the seashore promenade to Manly, one of Sydney's most beautiful beaches, with its village restaurants, cafes, and shopping.  If you prefer more variety, the Manly ferry will take you to the Sydney CBD in 15 minutes.   The residence is sited in a sought-after family-friendly street only a short stroll to nearby North Harbour reserve and Forty Baskets cafe and beach. It's a short walk further to express CBD buses, ferries, and Manly entertainment. Or there is a bus (#131 or #132) around the corner that drops you in Manly in 8 minutes.  Our home features a stainless steel galley kitchen, including Ilve oven and gas cooktop. We have two separate living areas on the ground floor. The front lounge enjoys P&O window surrounds with a fireplace, Grand piano and wall mounted TV.  The separate family/ dining room at the rear has two long white leather lounge sofas and a 65” wall mounted TV. The dining room table extends to seat 8 comfortably.  There is a cov

neighborhood_overview: Balgowlah Heights is one of the most prestigious areas on the Northern Beaches.  Filled with seaside character and a boutique way of living, this suburb offers everything you could need.   Located approximately 11km from the CBD, and only 2 kms from Manly, Balgowlah is surrounded by pristine water frontage including North Harbour, Forty Baskets, and Sydney Harbour.  Filled with a vast array of public parks, pools, marinas, beaches, sporting facilities and Sydney Harbour National Park. Local Amenities •Forty Baskets Beach, Reef Beach, North Harbour Park, 40 Beans Cafe, Clontarf Beach, Castle Rock. •Nearby Spit to Manly walking track that leads left along the promenade to Manly or right through scenic Sydney Harbour National Park around to Clontarf. •Balgowlah Heights shops, offering a supermarket, delicatessen, boutique shops, cafes and more •Nearby Stockland Mall offers a vast range of cafes, supermarkets, eateries, boutique fashion stores, home wares shops and Fitness First Gym •Array
transit: Balgowlah - Manly bus # 131 or #132  (Bus stop is 3 doors down, around the corner) takes you to Manly Ferry in 8 minutes.  Manly ferry gets you to Sydney CBD in 15 minutes.
access: Guests have access to whole house except locked basement and storage room. (Rear ground level studio not included.)

host.host_about: I am a Canadian who has made Australia her home for over ten years. I appreciate a good place to stay, having had many travel adventures myself.  My home is in Balgowlah, a pretty harbourside village next to Manly with easy access by bus or ferry to Sydney CBD.

name: LUXICO - Principino
summary: Sweeping views to the Sydney Opera House and Bridge will make your Sydney stay ever so special at Principino. Gated and private from the street, this beautifully presented home features 4 bedrooms, multiple living areas and pool and is just a short walk to the shops.
space: Set in manicured gardens, this home is ideal for families and designed over three levels to make the most of the incredible views. Upstairs is a large open plan living area with contemporary kitchen, extensive living and dining area and separate TV cinema room. An enormous terrace is ideal for entertaining. The middle level also boasts incredible views from the main and second bedroom. Two other beautifully furnished bedrooms are light and bright. The main bedroom is enormous and has its own ensuite while the second and third bedroom share a large two way ensuite. A large rumpus room or retreat sits on the lower floor and comprises a kitchenette and is fully contained. The space overlooks the pool and garden.  This property comes complete with secure off-street parking for two cars in a stunning Sydney location. Home Truths :  Bedroom #1: King Bed w/ ensuite bathroom (shower) + shared balcony w/ bedroom #2 Bedroom #2: 2x King Single Beds + shared balcony and large two-way ensuite bathr

neighborhood_overview: One of Sydney’s grandest suburbs, Mosman is located just 8kms from the CBD over the Sydney Harbour Bridge. It’s a suburb many aspire to live in and once you’re there, there’s little reason to leave, with plenty of shops along Military Road, stunning scenery and even the iconic Taronga Zoo to keep you amused. Balmoral Beach offers a more relaxed atmosphere, with parks, swimming and beachside cafes. It’s tempting to stay at home and get lost in the harbour view from your balcony, but at some point it’s important to leave the house. A walk through Mosman is an excellent workout due to the inevitable hill-climbing challenges. There’s a community bus for short trips and plenty of buses into the CBD; or the ferry if you prefer a water crossing. Small clumps of village shops include delicatessens, bakeries and specialty gift stores, while the major shopping precinct is located on Military Road.
notes: Bookings made via AirBNB are subject to the standard booking terms and conditions displayed on the Luxico Holiday Homes website.  You must be over 28 years old to book this property. Please contact us if the majority of your guests are aged under 28 to confirm suitability of this property.  Parties are strictly prohibited. Payment of your deposit constitutes acceptance of our terms and conditions. Please contact us if you would like a copy of these terms prior to booking.  For security reasons, a copy of your Australian Drivers License or International Passport is required prior to check-in along with confirmed names for all guests staying at the property along with a signed Booking Agreement before access details can be provided. This is not negotiable! Please don’t book with us if you are not comfortable providing this information.
access: All Luxico guests receive a bottle of bubbles in the fridge plus a gourmet welcome hamper including tea, coffee, jams, muesli, milk and some tasty treats.  We supply luxury toiletries and towels and our beds are made up with top quality linen ensuring a comfortable stay.
interaction: One of our superhosts will meet you at the property to hand over keys and answer any queries you may have about the home. Our 24/7 concierge team are on hand to help you with any special requests during your stay.

host.host_about:
Why stay in a hotel when you can enjoy the space and amenity of a designer home?

Luxico manages designer and luxury homes across Melbourne, Sydney, Palm Beach, Byron Bay, Noosa and the Mornington Peninsula with many new locations coming in 2018.

All Luxico homes are  fully equipped with 5-star linens, towels, luxury toiletries, gourmet welcome hampers, free Wi-Fi and all the essential items that you will require during your stay.

Luxico's Housekeeping and Concierge Services teams are on hand to assist with airport transfers, grocery deliveries, catering, extra cleaning and anything else you might require.

Guests travelling with children can request toys, activities, travel cots and high chairs, whilst pet owners have a number of great properties to choose from with doggy beds, water bowls and other items provided to minimize your luggage.

host.host_about:
Hello and thanks for taking the time to read my profile. I am a roaming New Zealander now settled in Australia's most picturesque city of Sydney. I am delighted to become an Airbnb host of apartment/condominium/self-contained/flat style of accommodation right here in Sydney. 

45 years old, I have been a travel agent since my early twenties, this job experience coupled with my own extensive travel around the world (including many successful stays booked via Airbnb) plus meeting my travel client expectations has armed me with extensive knowledge base of what guests require of their stay.

Please do not hesitate to contact me with any questions you may have in regards to the property you will be staying in, transport, activities, events, Sydney itself, I will be very happy to help with any information I can.

name: Bondi-Tamarama BEACHFRONT Apartment
summary: This gorgeous 3-bedroom apartment is directly across the road from the beach. It's very light, beautifully decorated and all within minutes of Bondi, Bronte, restaurants, shops and buses to the CBD. Watch the waves as you have a drink on the balcony.
space: Here are a few of the highlights of The BEACHFRONT Apartment: THE APARTMENT The building only has 7 apartments in total. Your new neighbours are lovely. They all enjoy spending time at the beach and they are mature enough to avoid late nights and loud parties so you won't be disturbed. THE BALCONY It wraps around the front of the building and gives you a huge entertaining space. From the balcony you stare straight at the water and out to the horizon. It's stunning! INTERNALLY We have furnished the apartment using light and bright colours to capture all of the sun that pours into the rooms throughout the day. There are three different eating areas - the dining table, the breakfast bar with views out to the beach and an outdoor table and chairs (where you'll probably spend most of your time) ENTERTAINMENT If you want to, you can sit inside and watch the huge 54" TV and use the DVD player or you can walk to Bondi and watch some real life entertainment at any one of the bars, clubs or live

neighborhood_overview: Tamarama is the younger, arguably prettier, sister to Bondi Beach. It's a relatively quiet beach where locals spend hours bathing in the sun. There is a park here with BBQs, toilets, changing rooms and a large grassy area to make a picnic. GREAT OCEAN WALK While you're in the area, you must take the Great Ocean Walk. It's a pathway that hugs the coast line all the way from Bondi to Coogee beach. Thankfully, it crosses your doorstep. Just join the throngs of people making the pilgrimage every day. SCULPTURES BY THE SEA Every year artists erect a series of sculptures along the Great Ocean Walk. It's a magical display set against the ocean views along the walk and it attracts thousands of local people and others from around the world. This year it is happening from 24 October - 10 November.
notes: FREE BOTTLE OF CHAMPAGNE We want you to have a great time when you stay at our place. We like the idea of you sitting out on the balcony celebrating something and admiring the view. So, anyone that books for 3 nights or more will find a bottle of Veuve Cliquot in the fridge upon arrival. SAVING LIVES We are really thankful to live by the beach and it's a stunning beach. One of the things that makes this beach a great place to swim and have fun in summer are the lifesavers who volunteer their time to look after the people who use the beach. Chances are that you've chosen our place partly because of the beach out the front. So to thank the guys that look after the beach for us, 10% of everything that you pay to us will be given to them as a donation. It's the least we can do for the guys that keep the beach safe. We'll send you a copy of the receipt and any comments that we get from them in thanks.
transit: BUSES The local area is serviced by buses that will take you to other transport hubs that will take you anywhere you need to go or you can catch a local bus directly to the CBD and be there in about 15 minutes. You'll have access to the internet from the computer set up for you in the apartment. Just either call 131500 and ask them for help or search 131500 on a search engine and you'll find a website showing all the timetables. You're not too far from anywhere!
access: All guests will have free access to all the amenities and facilities in the Apartment. This includes a coffee machine, dishwasher, washing machine, dryer, 434 litre fridge, a complete library of books, 54" TV & DVD Player, wireless broadband internet, sound system and an intercom / security system. TRANSPORT Once you arrive at The BEACHFRONT Apartment you probably won't want to leave. But should the need arise, there is transport immediately out the front. The #361 bus stop is across the ride and it will take you to Bondi Junction or Bondi Beach. From the Junction you can catch buses and trains to the city. The bus is handy, however, most things are within walking distance anyway.
interaction: Unfortunately, we don't get to meet the guests. We leave keys outside in a 'lockbox' which allows you to collect them whenever you arrive. We usually stay nearby and are available in the event that you need help with anything.
house_rules: Please be mindful of our neighbours and leave our home as you found it :)

host.host_about:
Hi there,

My name's Wayne. I live in Sydney, Australia with my fiancé, Kate.

I'm a management consultant, an author, a commercial helicopter pilot and I've recently developed a real love of travel with time in LA, Turkey, Greece, London, Vietnam, Thailand, Camboodia, Bali, Hong Kong and France all in the last 12 months.

We've done quite a lot of share living both at home and abroad so we'd like to think we know what makes a good environment in a home.

Hope to meet you soon!

Wayne and Kate

neighborhood_overview: LOCATION: Suburbs close by - Surry Hills, Chippendale, Alexandria, Newtown, CBD, Central, Eveleigh, Waterloo, Moore Park, Darlington.  Redfern is an inner-city suburb of Sydney. Once decidedly bohemian, Redfern is in the later stages of gentrification. Situated alongside the ever-popular and fashionable Surry Hills, and just moments from the CBD, Redfern is a perfectly positioned city base.  Conveniently located close to Sydney’s CBD (Redfern station is just one stop way from Central station by train) together with a well-serviced bus network, Redfern is primed for getting around. Also in close proximity to the airport. Redfern residents are thoroughly enjoying its revival. There is a mix of young professionals, young families and mature locals enjoying the convenient lifestyle. There is a hip and creative vibe in the area. With a mix of warehouse conversions, Victorian terrace houses and new apartment buildings, it’s a vibrant and eclectic mix of architecture. People can be found enjo
transit: Closest train station - Redfern Station. Next stop is Central Station, which is central to all trains and a central part of the city. There are buses that go into the city also and can be found close by. These run regularly. My favourite places to go for brunch are – Bean and Berry, Baffi and Mo’s, Three Williams, Henry Lee’s, Brickfields. Great food, coffee and service. My favourite bars are – The Dock, Arcadia Liquors, The Bearded Tit, Cake Wines Lovely places to go for dinner – Pitt Street Diner, The Continental. You’ll love my place because of the coziness, location, the people, and the ambiance. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, families (with kids), and big groups.
access: Their room, lounge room, kitchen, bathrooms, courtyard.
interaction: Certainly be able to help with anything you need. Please let me know and I'll do the best I can to answer your questions or point you in the right direction. Ask away! I am very sociable and will be happy to stay and have a chat or if you would like your privacy, I'll also respect that.
house_rules: No shoes in the house.

host.host_about:
Hi!

I am really easy going and friendly and always up for a chat and a laugh.

I like to keep fit and spend my time going to exhibitions and finding new things to do in my own city. 

Whenever I can, I like to travel and see the world and catch up with my friends.

name: Stunning Tamarama 2BR apartment with ocean views
summary: If you like the ocean and to surf you won’t find a better place to spend Sydney this summer. With sweeping and uninterrupted views across MacKenzie’s Bay, Tamarama, Bronte and beyond our home is an ocean and surfing lover’s paradise. This 2-bedroom apartment is also very spacious with a large King room with sun room and a second double room with a separate fold-out single bed. When in the large open plan living and kitchen areas you feel like you can reach out and touch the ocean!
space: House setting: Welcome to the world famous Eastern Suburbs of Sydney. Home to some of the city’s top restaurants, cafes, boutique shopping and a number of stunning beaches – including Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte and Coogee. Come and enjoy the best of what Sydney has to offer! Your home during your stay is our spacious and light filled 2-bedroom apartment with uninterrupted views over Mackenzie’s Bay, Tamarama, Bronte and beyond. Check the surf from the apartment before you decide which break to surf!  Kitchen and living areas: This really is the place to be in our home where you get to experience the ocean views as soon as you walk into this area. It is also the social hub of the home. The kitchen has all the modern equipment you would expect to find including a microwave, kettle, fridge/freezer, coffee machine and electric hob and oven.  The Living room has ample and comfortable seating and if you can take your eyes off the ocean views long enough then you can enjoy the large flat screen

neighborhood_overview: In Tamarama you can experience the chilled and surfing vibe of this beachside suburb. Tamarama beach has its own café and free public BBQs to be enjoyed. If it’s boutique shopping, trendy cafés, restaurants and art galleries then head straight to Bondi’s Hall Street and Curlewis Street which offer everything that you might need. If you’re looking for food and can’t take yourself away from the beach then maybe drop into Icebergs, North Bondi RSL or the Bucket List to get a taste of the local dishes and a cold beverage while marveling at the stunning ocean views. If you want to explore the stunning beaches and coastline between Bondi and Coogee just continue south of Bondi and follow the path to the neighbouring beaches: Tamarama beach, affectionately known as Glamarama to the locals due to the beautiful and glamorous nature of many of it’s visitors, is a small and stunning beach just 10-minute walk from Bondi Beach (25 minutes using the coastal path).  Bronte beach, a further 5 to 10-mi
notes: An initial supply of fresh linen, bath towels and toiletries (shampoo, body wash and toilet paper) will be provided along with a fully equipped kitchen and washing machine.
transit: While you remain in Tamarama, Bondi and Bronte everything is within a short walking distance.  A 5 to 10-minute drive or 10-minute bus ride will take you to Bondi Junction, the closest shopping centre and transport hub for the City and other beaches.  A further 10-minute train ride will take you to Town Hall, the heart of the CDB, and another 10 minutes to Circular Quay where you’ll get to enjoy the sights of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House, The Rocks, and everything else that this wonderful city has to offer. All this from the closest bus stop only a 5-minute walk away on Dudley Street. All bus and driving times are subject to traffic flow and buses depart approximately every 10 minutes.
access: You will have complete access to the apartment during your stay.
interaction: While we are away we will have someone to meet you who will be available to you by phone/sms/email (whatever you prefer) for the duration of your stay. They will also meet you at the end of your stay to collect the keys.

I ask that you show courtesy and respect for our neighbours, especially when it comes to loud music and other noise. host.host_about:
Me:
I'm Brazilian living in Australia since 2010. I speak Portuguese and English and I love meeting new people from different cultures and languages!

As host:
I hosted over 80 people in 2 years of Airbnb and we earned Super Hosts status 2 years in a row! 
My husband Claudio is Italian and I'm Brazilian. We work from home and we are very fast replying guest messages when we are not here to answer in person. Despite our apartment being small, we have a comfortable size bedroom with a double bed and many cosy pillows so you can relax and rest after exploring Sydney! Also, we are 15 minutes walking distance to Coogee Beach (our favourite!).

As a traveller: 
I prefer quiet and relaxing homes and when travelling I barely stay on my Airbnb room as I am constantly exploring. I like to chat with my hosts to find out the best places to eat and see from a local's point of view as well as building friendship with my hosts.
I either travel alone or with my Italian husband Claudio.

Across the road is direct access to Bronte Park with children's play area or walk up the gully to discover the rock pool stream.

Beautiful kitchen, Double Smeg oven with 6 burners/ additional teppanyaki burner & seperate grill. Miele dishwasher, large Fisher& Paykel fridge with water cooler/ ice maker. Butlers pantry, bar fridge , 2nd sink.

transit: Sydney buses (399) stop right outside the house and will take you directly (with no transfers) to CBD, Opera House, nightlife spots and University of NSW.  (UNSW). There are also a number of additional buses travelling to the city and Central Station that run along, Anzac Parade, the main artery to our area.  These buses stop at the shopping centre which is a 10 to 12 minute walk from the apt.
interaction: We are happy to interact with our guests or offer any assistance you may need during your stay, but otherwise you will have complete privacy.
house_rules: Only checked in guests my stay overnight. As there is no cleaning fee please leave the place clean and tidy on your departure.

host.host_about:
Hi, We are Fred and Bernadette.   We love meeting new people, have traveled extensively, visited many different countries and are very interested in other cultures.  
We enjoy spending time with family and friends . I am into running marathons and Bernadette enjoys tennis, trail walking and is currently learning Italian. We enjoy good food,  music, theatre, walking, hiking - most things in life !

name: Light Drenched and Private Cabin
summary: Our cabin is spacious and light drenched. It offers a queen size bed, built in, small kitchenette (w/ bar fridge, microwave, kettle, toaster), bathroom, study area, air con, internet and a smart tv (w/netflix).  It has bamboo floors, a timber deck, fly screens and a lovely little garden. There is easy access down a shared driveway to come and go as you please.  We have 2 young children and 2 cats. The cats are not allowed in cabin.
space: A new building, with an abundance of natural light, which maintains the character of the main 1920's house. The cabin looks out on to garden with flowering plants including a magnolia, camellia and star jasmine.  There is also a little herb garden that our two year old son likes to tend to (i.e., pull off unripe fruit/veggies and do a runner!).   Also, has all mod cons including internet TV, netflix and air conditioning.

You will have your own gate key to come and go as you please.  Guests h
neighborhood_overview: Petersham is a great place to live.  It is littered with good cafes (some of the best are less than 500 meters and is known for it's Portuguese chicken and tarts (the best ones from Sweet Belem.)   There are several good pubs / bars in the area within walking distance including the Oxford Hotel, the West Village and the Public House.   A few minutes walk away on the main road is Archella Fresh (run by Frank and his wife Rebecca) who have great fresh produce and a wonderful range of fine foods.  There is also a range of parks in the neighbourhood.  The Cabin is also close to several of Petersham’s popular venues including Petersham town hall and the Petersham tafe.
notes: Being in the inner west of Sydney, there is air traffic noise but this stops at 10pm and doesn't occur before 6am.  We have two ragdoll cats which occasionally hang out in the backyard. We also have two small children, a boy aged 4 and a girl who is 2.5 going on 13.
transit: The Cabin is close to several modes of public transport allowing guests to easily access the city and other major destinations.   Petersham train station is a 5-7 minute walk away. It is 2 stations from Newtown and only 10 mins, or five stops, to the city.  Petersham station is also on the inner west train line that accesses the Olympic Park precinct and Homebush.  The light rail is a 10 - 15 minutes walk away in Lewisham and provides convenient access to Star City, Paddy's markets, China Town and the Fish Markets.  Buses to UTS and Sydney University depart 500 meters from the Cabin (the stop is conveniently located in front of the nearest coffee shop!).    The airport is 20 - 30 mins from Petersham by taxi or uber, or you can catch the train with one change at Central Station.
access: The cabin is accessed via a shared driveway with an electric gate.  You will have your own gate key to come and go as you please.  Guests have access to a small timber deck where they can have breakfast and read the morning paper.  Guests are also welcome to use the shared backyard.
interaction: We are in and out throughout the day so will be available and happy to help if you have any questions at all
house_rules: Just to treat the cabin as if it was your own. We have 2 small children therefore it is not a place to party. The cabin is strictly no smoking inside.

name: Whale Beach Sensation
summary: A superb modern 6 bedroom home spanning three levels with fabulous ocean views. Seven minutes walk to the beach and perfectly positioned in a quiet street.
space: This stunning 6 bedroom home is beautifully renovated and perfectly positioned to capture light and spectacular ocean views.  There's ample space with three lounge areas, an out door grassed area and a kids lounge with games. The layout is over three levels. Level 1 is the entrance with modern gourmet kitchen, dining table for ten and lounge area with glass doors opening onto the large balcony.  On this level there are 2 bedrooms, the master suite with spectacular views and two bathrooms.  Two further bedrooms and bathrooms are on the next level up as well as another lounge room and another balcony. The bottom ground floor has a kids lounge area with toys and television and another bathroom, plus two rooms with 4 bunk beds! The ground floor lounge opens onto a grassy area. The interior design is modern with excellent finishes. The house is perfect for families with so much space on each level. Spectacular views of Whale Beach. 7 min walk to beach or 5 mins walk to The Boat Shed cafe.

host.host_about:
Hi my name is Terry. I live in Sydney with my very loving and caring boyfriend.  I recently opened an Airbnb account because i found out from a lot of people its a very cheap way to get accommodation and get to met really nice people around the world. 

We have a very cozy clean empty  room in our apartment which we would love to use to host people wanting a place to stay. Anyone that stays with us will find that we are very clean, easy to talk to and  genuinely helpful.
 
On the other hand, anyone one that is fortunate enough to host us will find that we are both very easy going happy couple. We love cultural cuisines and exploring.

name: Luxurious 4 to 5 Room The Rocks Large House Sydney
summary: Walk 5 minutes to the Sydney Harbour Bridge, Barangaroo Reserve, The Rocks and view the Opera House at Circular Quay. It is right in the centre of Sydney. Stay at the heart of Sydney's famous old town - The Rocks. Enjoy the beautiful c1800's Victorian architecture while in creature comforts of the newly renovations and furnished with beautiful modern fittings home.
space: Free Unlimited WIFI - 4 bedroom 2 bathroom well designed self contained home. Essentials including Sydney map, toiletries, coffee, tea and treats will be waiting for you to help you get settled. Street parking permits available at a daily rate of $45 per car. I only have a handful and need to know if you require this once you book to hold them for you. Fully equipped kitchen with oven, gas stove, microwave, toaster, fridge, rice cooker, pots, plates, glasses and cutlery. A washing machine also available for you to use. There are 3 bedrooms with plush queen beds and portable airconditioning/heater. 4th room has a double bed. All mattress beds have electric blankets in Winter. The living room has a single sofa bed that can be closed off into a 5th room. For guests who want to sleep on the sofa beds, we will provide bedding and linen in a basket for you so you can enjoy the use of the lounge during the day. Portable cot and high chair can be provided for babies.

notes: You cannot get any place more central or convenient than this! :)
transit: This is the best location in Sydney for any visitor. 1 block away - Be stunned by the massive Sydney Harbour Bridge and Observatory Hill. 1 minutes walk - Get a taxi outside the door. Taxis regularly drive on this street in this famous area of Sydney. 2 minutes walk - Restaurant area, Lord Nelson Pub and convenient store to pickup your Opal travel card. 3 minutes walk - The Rocks Markets held every weekend. 5 minutes walk - Best day spa in Sydney is 1 block away at the Langham hotel. 5 minutes walk - See Sydney Opera House from Circular Quay 6 minutes walk - All major public transport in Circular Quay. Train station, ferry stop, bus and taxi ranks
access: You will have the entire house to yourself.
interaction: My husband and I live a few minutes away and will come by Monday to take the bins out and Tuesday to take them in. We also need to drop off fresh linen into the linen cabinet the day before or on the morning of your check-out. We are happy to answer any questions while we are there. I am contactable via mobile and Airbnb messenger all day if you require assistance and can help provide suggestions on things you must do and famous local places to eat.
house_rules: - No loud noise after 10pm as a respect to other neighbours sleeping - Strictly no parties - Maximum of 8 people in property at any time, including visitors - If above rules are broken, you will be evicted immediately at your expense and security deposit charged. - The oldest person staying must be over 28 years old and digital photo ID will need to be provided to Suzanna within 24 hours after booking - If you need to smoke, please do so outside - Clean used kitchen utensils before leaving - Wipe kitchen down after use and do not leave food or crumbs around to prevent attracting insects. - Street parking permits available at a daily rate of $45 per car - No flushing wet wipes or anything other than toilet paper in the toilet. - Switch off airconditioning & heaters when leaving the house. - Remove shoes inside property property. - Don't hang out right outside the house chatting as it disturbs the neighbours. If you are waiting, please wait inside. - Damages must be advised within 4 hour

host.host_about:
I am privileged to have grown up in Sydney with it's unconditionally generous people, crisp clean air, beautiful harbours, quality produce and delicious fusions of the most amazing cuisines from around the world.
Living in the city is super convenient as I practically walk everywhere.
I love travelling the world so I know how travelers feel when they arrive from a long trip. That's why I create them a welcome pack of essentials in the apartment to help them relax and get started on their amazing Sydney adventure.

name: Entire garden sanctuary terrace : heart of Newtown
summary: Shala the cat will welcome you to this delightful period terrace in the safe and friendly Newtown neighborhood which is famous for its colourful character. Close to an aquatic centre with pool and gym, yoga centres, a big park and Organic Food Markets on Sunday. Enjoy the gas cooking,  unlimited wifi and al fresco dining in a lush tropical garden. It's close to all the live music, street art, bars, cafes, galleries, theatres, restaurants and vintage & antique shops: the best of the  inner west.
space: Rich with rustic charm, this haven oozes plenty of character with a lovely sense of home. Sitting in a quiet, leafy street, it is ideally positioned for everything : transport, delicious eateries plus the local shops of Marrickville and Newtown.  With comfortable couches and dining table and all my friends' art on the walls, the living space is very practical whilst being simple and attractive. You will be sharing with and caring for my cat, Shala, who has access to the garden through her own catdoor. She eats cat biscuits morning and night - and is great company. The front double bedroom upstairs has french doors that open onto a private balcony with tree orchids and often Queen of the Night moon lilies. The back 'treehouse' bedroom upstairs has early morning light and overlooks a garden canopy of beautiful trees and bird life. There are 2 extremely comfortable sofas in the lounge room that can be 2 single beds or moved into a double bed overnight. The rear garden is a delight providi

neighborhood_overview: My place is in an area called the Inner West, so its a built up area, but close to the city and has a great inner city community feel. You can see the whole spectrum of Sydney people around you, with city workers, students, artists, musicians, and plenty of people from various liberal persuasions. There are a few parks close by, a huge variety of remedial massage and new local craft beer breweries all around.
notes: I live in a terrace with a very steep stairwell up to the bedrooms, so if you have problems with stairs in any way, this may not be the best place for you.
transit: It is a 5 min walk to the Newtown and St Peters Train Stations, and buses to everywhere including the Sydney beaches. Its great to just walk around the suburb as it is full of fashion, bricabrac, op shops and vintage shops, as well as different architecture, graffitti art and local buskers.
access: You are welcome to use the whole house, including al fresco dining in the lush rainforest back garden. The kitchen is small but cooking with gas and you are welcome to cook. Access to the bathroom is outside the back door but still undercover, so it overlooks the garden.
interaction: I know Sydney very well so can help out with tips on your interests.

host.host_about: Kassandra makes sculpture for private commissions, museums, film, theatre, festivals and events. Her skills include props making, mould-making, prosthetics and puppetry

name: Bundeena Base Art House, Sea View with Heated Pool
summary: With fabulous views, overlooking the sea, Bundeena Base offers self-contained accommodation for up to 8 people.  With your own private in-ground solar heated pool and 3 beaches 500 meters away, you're spoilt for choice. 3 bedrooms, lounge dining, well equipped kitchen, generous 3-way bathroom suite & outdoor covered terrace, perfect for dining or relaxing with a cool drink of your choice   Prices based on 6 guests $35 per additional guest
space: Please note that the airbnb site does not show the exact location of the property.  We are in fact much closer to the water/beaches, one row of properties between us and the water front. The view you see in the cover photo shows this clearly.  Airbnb do this to protect hosts. This property would suit families and groups of friends just as much as a couple wanting a bit of luxury and privacy. We are open to dogs staying at the property but please contact me prior to booking so we can agree on some details. There will be an additional cash fee of $30 towards extra cleaning. Smoking is not permitted at the property.  Parties are not allowed. Quiet time after 10pm. No glass within pool area. The accommodation comprises three bedrooms: •2 queen size beds •1 double bed •1 single bunk above the double bed •1 single trundle bed with full sized mattress (very comfortable) •There are three portacots suitable for toddlers and 2 bassinets for babies •We can provide 2 highchairs, 1 change table, 1

We are open to dogs staying at the property but please contact me prior to booking so we can agree on some details. There will be an additional cash fee of $30 to
neighborhood_overview: Untouched beaches, the Royal National Park, cultural and historical walks, a thriving art scene, aboriginal rock carvings, kayac and paddleboard hire, cafes, local musical events, are just a handful of the many attractions Bundeena has to offer. We have a well stocked supermarket that is open from 8am to 8pm.  Bundeena also has: chemist, newsagent, petrol station, resident doctor, ambulance station, fire station.  We are lucky to have a selection of cafes for those times you just want to kick back and look at the view and recently a newly opened restaurant.  We have a local bowling club that also has a restaurant. The name Bundeena is an aboriginal word meaning “noise like thunder” and when you hear the waves lap up against the white sand its easy to understand why. On Bundeena's southern edge, footsteps of the people who walked before us echo across the land. On the beach and in the bush, there’s hidden evidence of a life well-lived… you simply need to know where to look. Only nine ge
notes: Please be aware that for the safety of everyone, glass in the pool area is not permitted. There are parasols in the pool area for you to use but be aware that they need to be put down at the end of the night or if the weather turns windy. This is a self catering accommodation although we will provide you with a starter pack of milk, tea, coffee (both instant and fresh ground), sugar, salt, olive oil, wine vinegar, washing up equipment, liquid clothes washing detergent, fabric softener, toilet paper, shampoo, hair conditioner, shower gel. We have a really good independent supermarket, it is stocked with most things you will need for your stay here they are open from 8am to 8pm. If you are staying for a few days, you may want to consider having your food supplies delivered.  Coles will deliver here, but Woolworths does not. We also have a chemist but be aware that he closes midday on Saturday. Bundeena has 3 restaurants, a newsagent, 3 cafes, a petrol station, car repair shop and a gift
transit: Once in Bundeena, you really don't need a car but if you plan on taking day trips to other National Park areas, you will need to buy a pass. Day passes are available from the local newsagent or petrol station, or if you are going to an area that has a ticket machine, you can buy a day ticket there. Day tickets cost $12. A delightful 20 minute ferry ride to Cronulla will give you a great view of the surrounding area and is a lovely start to a trip to Cronulla (or take the train to Sydney for the day).  Ferry timetable can be found by a search for Cronulla Ferries. To get here, the car journey is approx 25 mins from the Pacific Highway turn off at Sutherland/Loftus. The other option is to take a train to Cronulla station, walk the 10 minutes to Cronulla Ferry jetty and take the passenger ferry to Bundeena. The ferry journey takes approx 20 minutes and leaves Cronulla on the half hour, leaving Bundeena on the hour.  For full timetable, check with Cronulla Ferries on their website.
access: We prefer someone to be here when you arrive, so I will text you the morning of arrival date to check your eta and make sure someone is here to welcome you. We have parking for upto 3 cars on the property driveway.
interaction: Someone will always be available, in person or on the phone, should guests need to ask any questions about the property or locality.  We will provide our contact telephone number should you need to get in touch for any reason.
house_rules: We are open to dogs staying at the property but I must ask that you contact me to go over some details that we must agree upon before your booking is accepted.  Please don't arrive with your dog without prior agreement. - No glass within pool area - Pool parasols to be put away at the end of the day or if it gets windy - Quiet time after 10pm - Smoking permitted outside only, away from doors and windows - No additional guests without prior written agreement - Upper bunk suitable for children age 6 and older

name: Central & Modern Apartment in Heart of Sydney
summary: The apartment is ideally located in the heart of Sydney CBD, less than a block away from Hyde Park. It is beautiful one bedroom apartment, recently renovated, with a nice balcony to enjoy the city and rest under the sun.  The apartment is surrounded by great cafés, bars and restaurant, and extremely close to Sydney's attraction and landmarks.
space: The beautiful and spacious apartment offers city hoppers and business travels the comfort they need to discover Sydney. The open plan kitchen and living area is modern and has artful details to make you feel home.  The stylish bedroom has a super comfy queen bed and fresh hotel quality linens are provided for your stay. The sparkling ensuite bathroom has a sleek, elegant design in keeping with the rest of the apartment.

notes: 'It’s worth noting Sydney does have a tropical climate, and so there may be a few bugs about in any property you stay in - nothing that would negatively impact your stay though!'
transit: TRANSPORTATION •Trains The closest train station is MUSEUM Station located 2min walk towards Hyde Park. It goes to Circular Quay (Opera House & Harbour Bridge) from Platform 1 and the airport from Platform 2. You will need to purchase an Opal Card as paper tickets are no longer available in Sydney. •Buses  Next to Museum Train Station there is a major bus stop with routes going to Bondi Junction, Bondi Beach (Bus 333), Coogee Beach, Bronte Beach, Watsons Bay  •Uber Your best way to travel across the city. Download the app directly on your smartphone.

name: Apartment among the trees
summary: This unique apartment has been stunningly designed and built using all natural materials. The mud render and recycled timber complements the surrounding bush and light spills through the windows and skylights. You really feel immersed in nature and secluded from the outside world. The space is really versatile and works well for couples and families with kids. Close to a number of beaches and Avalon village, this place makes for a perfect beach getaway!
space: This lower level apartment is massive and the space is very versatile. The kitchen is fully equipped and includes a gas stove top, sink, coffee and tea making facilities and small fridge. The lounge has a day bed which folds out into two singles, a large couch, TV with digital network and dining table and chairs. The bedroom has a comfy queen size bed, a chest of drawers and a hanging rack. Lie in bed and look out through the tress, listen to wildlife and lose yourself in the tranquility. The bathroom is light and bright and has a bath and separate shower. Outside there is a small deck, an outdoor shower - perfect for rinsing off after the beach. There is also plenty of parking on-street, just at the end of the driveway. The walk from the car space on site to your front door is around 60 meters. It is a little steep and there are a set of stairs (see pictures).

The bathroom is light and bright and has a bath
neighborhood_overview: The property is a short stroll to Paradise Beach, on the Pittwater side a perfect place to escape the summer crowds. This property is in a great location to enjoy all Avalon has to offer – beautiful beaches, famous breaks, boating, sunset picnics on the Pittwater and great cafes, restaurants and boutique shopping.  You will find a house manual available at the property that details all the local favorites - cafes, restaurants, best beaches etc.
notes: It's worth noting that the walk from the parking to the entrance is a little steep as the property is located on a hill. Please be careful when walking down to the apartment especially if it is dark or has been raining. There is also a set of stairs from the driveway (stairs featured in one of the pictures). Please also note that some guests may find this space a little rustic. It is in the bush and has been beautifully constructed using mud render and recycled materials. There is also a separate studio on the property that sleeps 2 and can be rented out as well.  This listing is available by looking at the 'hosts other listings' .
transit: There are buses right outside the door and close by that can take you into the village, to the surrounding beaches and in to Sydney city.
access: Guests have full access to the downstairs apartment and the area just outside the apartment.
interaction: The owners live on the property but do not actively interact with the guests. As a cushie property you have guest support available throughout your stay. The level of contact is completely up to you - we can act as a local guide or leave you to discover and fall in love with everything the Northern Beaches have to offer.
house_rules: - The apartment is a lower duplex so please respect the noise levels at all times.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is positioned on the border of Redfern and Alexandria and is less than 3 kilometres from the Sydney CBD. Throughout the area there are countless cafes, bars, restaurants and parks.  Redfern and Alexandria have a wide range of dining and bars to choose from such as The Lord Raglan, The Dock, Redfern Continental and Kepos Street Kitchen. Neighbouring suburbs such as Surry Hills, Erskineville and Newtown also host an enormous selection of venues to choose from. Known for its café culture and brunch scene, Alexandria is home to some of Sydney’s finest food and coffee such as in warehouse the most sought after cafes in Sydney such as The Grounds and Bread & Circus. Popular nearby parks such as Prince Alfred Park and Alexandria Park offer expansive green space as well as tennis courts, play equipment and a swimming pool.
transit: Redfern Station is a short 400 metres walk which provides immediate access all areas of the Sydney CBD. There is a Bus Stop directly in front of the building providing further convenient access. For a more scenic commute, Sydney’s cycleways can be reached through nearby George Street and span throughout the inner-city suburbs.

name: Comfortable cottage near all Balmain's attractions
summary: You have exclusive access to one storey of a traditional weatherboard cottage at street level, no stairs. It is fully self-contained and private. You’ll find this is a typical Balmain neighbourhood; surrounded by historic hotels, harbour-side parks, cafes and restaurants. It's ideal for couples and solo travellers seeking a quiet area with free on-street parking and yet only a three-minute walk to the main shopping area and public transport.
space: The space retains many of its traditional timber cottage features, with the addition of a modern bathroom and well equipped mini-kitchen. The walls are decorated with collected prints, photography and original works by local artists. You will enjoy the sunny veranda and walled front garden.  A mini-kitchen is tucked into a corner of the lounge/dining room. With a bar fridge, microwave, induction hotplate and other appliances, you have everything you need to cook or order-in meals. Cooking utensils, tableware, tea, coffee and some basic ingredients are provided.

Cooking utensils, tableware, tea, coffee and some basic ingredients
neighborhood_overview: Eight of Balmain's famous old pubs are within easy walking distance -- The William Wallace, The Royal Oak, and The Dry Dock are literally just round the corner -- all with bistro dining options.  A little further down the street is Mort Bay Park, a great vantage point for watching fireworks displays or starting your harbour-side walk.
notes: A Visitors Parking Permit is available for your use. It must be displayed on the dash of your vehicle to obtain unrestricted parking on the street outside the house. The local Council charges a $131.50 fee to replace lost permits, so please be sure to return the permit when leaving. * There is a walk-in shower in the bathroom, but no bathtub. * There is a portable air conditioner and ceiling fan for summer. Space heaters and electric blankets are provided in winter. * A change of towels and bed linen is included for bookings of seven days. * The lower storey of the cottage is home to two friendly cats who may stray into your front garden. Just shoo them away if they bother you.
transit: Take a ferry to town. It's only a five minute walk to the Balmain ferry wharf near Thames Street for trips to Circular Quay.  The Balmain East ferry wharf (at the end of Darling Street) has more frequent services to Darling Harbour and Circular Quay.  There are buses to the city (442, 441) usually every 10 minutes from nearby Darling Street, three minutes walk from the house. Frequent buses (433, 445) also serve other parts of the Inner West
access: The front door has a digital lock operated by a PIN code that is unique to your visit. The PIN-code entry allows for self-check in. You can arrive at a time that suits you. We are available to meet and greet you - or not - as you wish.
interaction: We are available at short notice to answer questions or assist you in any way we can. All the information you might need is in a printed manual. We will email all essential information when you confirm your reservation.
house_rules: Observance of these house rules would be greatly appreciated: * One or two persons only can stay. * Please leave the property as clean and tidy as you found it. * For your safety and convenience, follow the directions in the house manual regarding cooking, waste disposal and laundry. * If you use the Visitor's Parking Permit it must be returned before leaving. If it is lost or not returned, the local council's $131.50 replacement fee (!) will be charged against your deposit.  * The free standing cottage is divided into separate apartments on two levels. Please respect your neighbours next door and below by keeping noise to a minimum.

host.host_about: My wife Dianne and I have travelled the world  together for over 30 years. Now that we are hosting with airbnb we hope to create the character, convenience and comfort of the  accommodation that we liked in places as diverse as Bali, Provence, Andalusia, Kyoto, Marrakesh and Sicily.

name: Self contained studio cabin (last minute standby)
summary: Attention: Late check in - no earlier than 6 pm. Occasionally I have last minute cancellations, booking alterations & all sorts of other unpredictable/unforeseen changes from guests. It's a real pain to try & work them back into the main listing so to keep things simple I just post all those sort of impromptu accommodation opportunities here. Standby bookings on this listing can be added to the ordinary bookings on my other listings for longer stays. See main listing for detailed description.
space: Because we'd like to have as many of our days more relaxed when possible and free to do the things we like, unfettered by a daily obligation to clean and service the granny flat in a very short rigid time frame, we prioritise our accommodation reservations on a 3-2-1 priority: • 2 weeks or more - bookings taken up to 6 months in advance. • 3 nights or more - bookings taken up to 3 months in advance. • 2 nights or more - bookings taken up to 2 months in advance. • No minimum stay - bookings taken up to 1 months in advance. Each of these options has a separate specific listing on our profile. Occasionally, when odd left over days happen between multiple night bookings, we make them available early for shorter stays on the other listings. So if you're getting in early for a single night or two and our accommodation doesn't seem to be available it may be worthwhile checking back later when short stays are opened up for booking on our calendar.  Alternatively (if you are really keen to stay

neighborhood_overview: If you insist on lovely suburban tidy townness, neatly trimmed herbaceous borders, minimalist generic and tediously `nice` hotel decor, or twee boutique pensions this may not be the place for you, but then again you probably should be reconsidering staying in and about Newtown on that criteria.  Our fantastically artistic and creative surrounds (Newtown  / Marrickville / Enmore / St Peters) are one of the funkiest hubs of Australia, a rare inner city island resounding with alternative anti-gentrification energy and and sans bourgeoisie vitality - we live here because we love the community and our home is emblematic of that.
notes: 6 pm CHECK IN - you will not be able to enter the accommodation before this time. (Luggage may be deposited though earlier in the day). VERY IMPORTANT - STRICT CANCELLATION POLICY As this listing is for last minute and often same day bookings there is a strict cancellation policy in place. This means once you have booked your payment is not refundable upon cancellation. Once we confirm your booking request there is no refund if you change your mind or book other accommodation. There will always be a time lag between when you make your booking request and when it is accepted and confirmed - sometimes this is minuscule and we deal with your request almost instantaneously; other times, for other reasons, it may take considerably longer to get back to you.  WE DEAL WITH ALL BOOKING REQUESTS ON THE ASSUMPTION THEY ARE LIVE - It is therefore your responsibility to cancel any as yet unconfirmed booking request BEFORE confirming and paying for alternative accommodation, or if you change your m
transit: Short stroll to St Peters railway station - just a couple of stops to the CBD or the airport (but a short taxi ride may be cheaper). King Street Newtown is close with all its buses. If you're a bit of walker town is not very far away or you're welcome to use one of the free bicycles.
access: Make yourself at home in our spacious yard - vegetable gardens taking shape from which you should be able to pick fresh produce for your cooking. There is a prolific spice garden right outside the kitchen - multiple fresh variants of both Asian and European herbs. Free WiFi access, fresh mangoes, papaya, lemons, dragon fruit, bananas, tomatoes and strawberries from the garden (in season), washing machine, worm farm... Mi casa es su casa - But be aware it is a working art and creative workshop of constantly shifting materials so some will be anarchic , neglected and frankly a bit messy.
interaction: Interact or not as much as you feel comfortable - the granny flat is yours alone while we're likely to be pottering about in the garden. Feel free to grab one of us if you want some local advice or history or philosophical discussions - similarly if you're here for a bit of a look around maybe we can lend a bit of a hand. Apart from that I can be as scarce or handy as you feel appropriate.

host.host_location: St Peters, New South Wales, Australia
host.host_about:
Inveterate traveller who has spent a great proportion of my life on the road benefiting from the kindness of strangers - hitched, trekked, bicycled, motorcycled and trained independently to all sorts of far flung and unpronounceable points of the globe. Sometimes for years at a stretch. Extreme tourist as defined by Wikipedia. In between times a performer and photographer and occasionally all of the above simultaneously as photojournalist or touring actor.
I like to think I can tell great stories but I may be wrong...

During my idle hours I enjoy backpacking through universities collecting degrees and living a full life of adventure, discovery and art so if your interests and/or qualifications run to theatre, literature, fine arts, art history or the law then you've a ready partner for intellectual discussion.
A well stocked library is assured for convenient reference.

As you can probably tell I'm more than just a little bit xenophilic, enjoying the company of travellers, creative spirits and those just enjoying the freedom and discovery of the road.

My home is a sprawling quirkily evolving eclectic canvas; part tropical greenhouse and jungle, part improvisation workshop, part art studio, all of a slightly anarchic constantly changing composition. (I would never consider shopping at Ikea or watching any TV program involving adversarial reality and/or bogan house make overs, although I'm always enthralled and inspired by Kevin McCloud and Grand Designs.)

My place is a patchwork of sprawling, overgrown alternative comfortable anarchy.
If you insist on lovely suburban tidy townness, neatly trimmed herbaceous borders, minimalist generic and tediously `nice` hotel decor, or twee boutique pensions this may not be the place for you, but then again you probably should be reconsidering staying in and about Newtown on that criteria.
Our fantastically artistic and creative surrounds are one of the funkiest hubs of Australia, a rare inner city island resounding with alternative anti-gentrification energy and and sans bourgeoisie vitality - we live here because we love the community and our home is emblematic of that.
The vast majority of those who chose to stay with us seem to love it that way.

In any case hopefully our genuine hospitality and relaxed easy welcome will allow you to overlook some rougher edges in evolution and allow us to reciprocate the marvelous generosity we've benefited from in our travels.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you are a new Airbnb member, we have a few recommendations.
These three steps can be done by going to the main page after you login,
click on your name on the top menu for a drop down menu.
Select 'Edit Profile', and then:

1. Submit a photo of yourself on your profile.
2. Submit a phone number (mobile), email address and verify some form of identification [See https://www.airbnb.com/help/question/450 for more information about Verified ID].
3. Fill out information about yourself so we know who to expect.

Thank you.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you are yet to join Airbnb, but are just browsing our place for an affordable place to stay close to Newtown, you should follow this link www.airbnb.com.au/c/smenteith to join up. You will get some free Airbnb travel credit for your second trip and we'll get some Airbnb travel credit too.

name: Cosy, calm room minutes from CBD
summary: My place is cosy & in a prime location. It's an easy 10 minute walk from Central Station where you can comfortably travel to the best locations in the city, 15 minutes from the CBD where you can visit Sydney's top monuments & shop to your heart's desire. My place is just on the edges of Chinatown where cheap, tasty food is on the menu. Hyde Park is not far from there. It is best suited to solo adventurers (or in twos if one doesn't mind the sofa) & business travellers.

neighborhood_overview: We smack bang in the hub of Bondi : Hall Street.  A village like feel with a stretch of entertainment which take you 5 mins to walk down from our place to the beach. Walk left and you’ve got a few other options on Cerlewis Street and the Beach Road Hotel. Walk right and keep walking to Bondi Road : a busy long road full of all sorts of shops and  restaurants and cheap eats. You can do the Bondi to Coogee walk via some great scenery - there’s so much to do!
transit: Uber if you are leaving Bondi ! If going to the city grab the bus from outside the apartment direct to Bondi Junction then get the to train.  Bicycles are great and there’s lots of routes to go - you could ride to Watson’s Bay or Rose Bay!

neighborhood_overview: Birchgrove is in Sydney's inner-west, perched on the Balmain peninsula.  The waterfront location and the cafe, boutique shopping precinct of Darling street, feature the best of this "hidden" neighbourhood. Our home is centrally located to the local highlights -   - Birchgrove Wharf for ferries to Circular Quay  - Darling Street for cafe culture and boutique shopping  - Dawn Fraser pools for a refreshing swim, fitness, or inspiration!   - Ballast Point Park for relaxation, views, or just for a beautiful walk. - and so much more . . . .
transit: Ferry  - The F3 leaves from BIrchgrove Wharf (and Balmain Wharf) every 30 minutes in the morning, and then every hour,  if you're working in the CBD, or want to connect to Manly, Sydney's famous Taronga Zoo, Watson's Bay or more. Buses  - The 441 service operates from Grove Street  (3 min walk) every 20 minutes into the City.  Stops include the Queen Victoria Building (15 minute trip), Town Hall Station (connects to every train line in the Sydney network) The Royal Botanical Gardens (Art Gallery of NSW) and the famous Mrs Macquarie's Chair - worth the trip! Car There is untimed, non-metered parking around our home.
access: Guests have full access to the whole home.
interaction: You will be met on arrival and farewelled on departure by the team from Urbankeyz.  They will also be on call for you if there are any special requests or matters needing attention during your stay.

host.host_about:
We are both live busy lives working in creative industries, travelling a lot. When we are home we love nothing more to stick to our local neighbourhood and enjoy everything that we can walk to, which is pretty much everything we need!  

When our home is listed, that means we are working out of Sydney, so the team from Urbankeyz will be taking care of you on our behalf.

host.host_location: Saint Ives, New South Wales, Australia
host.host_about:
I'm from the UK originally but love the Aussie life with my Queenslander hubby. We have two small children so travel has become expensive in recent years, and Airbnb is a great help towards the cost of a holiday for us. 

We're clean and tidy people by nature but having kids, two dogs and three chickens means we know all about getting mucky too and enjoying an outdoor life. We feel very lucky to have a home where we never run out of activities to keep the kids happy. There's enough space to play games in the garden, swimming is always an option and the indoor space is open plan so it's easy to keep an eye on everyone!

notes: Watertower access hours: POOL / BBQ: 6am to 11pm daily, other than Sunday which is 8am to 11 pm. GYM: 6am to 9pm daily. Weekends 9am to 9pm.
transit: If you intend to use public transport (trains, buses and ferries) for getting around the greater Sydney,  then purchase an OPAL card (either at the Airport train station or at a city or suburban newsagent outlet).  Getting from the Airport (options): (1) Train (one way $17.60 per person from International / $17.00 from Domestic).  You will need to change train lines at Central station or Wolli Creek station to go to Redfern station. (2) Shuttle "Ready2Go" door to door service (one way $22 per person). Purchase/pickup curb side at airport.  (3) Taxi - price depends on time of day and traffic (approx. $25 to $45)
access: Private bathroom, laundry, TV, fridge, kitchen (prefer cooking for light meals only), wifi, complimentary shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, tea, coffee. name: Vaucluse hideaway
summary: Bright, cosy & airy apartment in Vaucluse over looking diamond bay reserve with ocean views. This apartment has its own character it is perfect for people who are active, love nature & who are looking for a peaceful, quiet area but want to be in close proximity to the city. Free street parking, 2 bedrooms , 1 Bathroom with shower and bath. Fully functioning kitchen with dishwasher. Own laundry with washer. Fully furnished living room with tv & Large balcony. Unlimited wifi available.

name: Spacious Master Room M with ensuite,AC, study desk
summary: The premises is a 5 bedroom shared house. Our queen sized bed very comfortably sleeps 2 people. With facilities such as an ensuite bathroom, built in wardrobe, fresh linen, free parking and a concierge service, this is the perfect place to stay for a quiet relaxing getaway in metropolitan Sydney. Early flight? Use our shared facilities including bathroom from 8am on check-in day. We also have two smaller rooms available for a lower price. Feel free to message us for further details. **NO KIDS**
space: Our space is unique in that we offer the following: 1. ANYTIME CHECK-IN/LATE CHECK-OUT. Have an early flight? Want to have a late night out? No problem. Feel free to ask us for early or late check-in. Even if early check-ins are not available, you can use shared facilities include a fully stocked kitchen, laundry, bathroom and dining room, from 8am on your check-in day. Late check-outs are also available, as long as these times are available and do not clash with other guests bookings. The latest time for checkouts is 4pm, as we have cleaners that need to clean the room and shared facilities in preparation for the next guest.  2. FREE PARKING. Our street has a 2hour free parking limit. However, we have a parking permit available, which allows unlimited free parking in the area during your stay. 3. CONCIERGE SERVICE. Have any special requests? Don't hesitate to ask us and we will strive to accommodate your request. Please only contact us during the hours of 9am-12am. 4. FOCUS ON IMPROVE

transit: Getting around from the property is extremely easy, as public transport is readily available nearby. Some common places of interest and how to get there is included for your convenience below: MACQUARIE PARK STATION: (8 min travel time) 1. Walk southeast on Paul St towards Lane Cove Road. 2. Turn left onto Lane Cove Road. Walk 500m and station is on left. MACQUARIE SHOPPING CENTRE: (Approx 13 min travel time) 1. Walk to Macquarie Park Station (see above) 2. Catch the train on Platform 2, T1 North Shore, Northern and Western Line towards Hornsby Station. 3. Get off the train at Macquarie University Station (1 stop). CENTRAL STATION: (Approx 36 min travel time) 1. Walk to Macquarie Park Station (see above) 2. Catch the train on Platform 1, T1 North Shore, Northern and Western Line towards Central Station 3. Get off the train at Central Station. TOP RYDE SHOPPING CENTRE: (Approx 15 min travel time) 1. Walk southeast onto Lane Cove Road. Turn right and cross the road to reach bus stop at L

There is a bus line, on the street of the apartment, to Sydney CBD.  This brand new luxury apartment, offers a large, light filled, open plan living space with all the comforts needed to provide a homely environment.  We provide free onsite parking, free unlimited internet & free Foxtel.
space: Fully equipped and furnished with quality appliances, as reflected in our photographs.  Amenities include:    •Free Internet - Unlimited WIFI  •Free Cable TV (Foxtel) •2 x Air conditioners (One Upstairs & Downstairs) •Starter Essentials (Coffee, tea, milk, sugar, butter, biscuits, toilet paper, water, eggs, bath towels, bed linen etc)  •Free Parking On Premises (1 Car only) Bedding Configuration There is one bedroom upstairs with large ensuite and a queen bed.  Downstairs is a double fold out sofa bed.   Bedding suitable for 4 adults or 2 adults &  2 children over the age of 6 years + Washer/ Dryer  all in one located in the kitchen. neighborhood_overview: SURROUNDS & ENTERTAINMENT *Centennial Parklands (Across the Road) – Enjoy jogging, bike riding, horse riding, picnics or a casual stroll with easy access to coffee shops in the park. A stone throw away from trendy Paddington." *Royal Randwick Racecourse  -2 min walk  *University of New South Wales  (UNSW) *Prince Of Wales Hospital/ Sydney Childrens Hospital *The Spot – Thriving district of Randwick with Cinema, bars, cafes & restaurants *Royal Randwick Shopping Centre On Belmore Road – Supermarkets, clothes shops, banks, optometrist & a variety of cafes & restaurants.  Belmore Road is a main bus hub to a selection of areas including beaches and sporting venues. *Fox Studios (Entertainment Quarter) – Wednesday & Saturday organic market & flower market, Hoyts cinema, cafes & restaurants, adjacent to Horden Pavilion (Concert venue) *Sydney Cricket Ground & Sydney Football Stadium (Allianz Stadium) *Bondi Junction & Westfield Bondi Junction Shopping Centre  *Close Beaches  - Bondi, Bronte,
notes: HOUSE RULES * Turn Off air conditioning & lights every time you leave apartment *No Pets *No Smoking *No Lit Candles *No Parties Or Events *No haircuts in the bathroom *Keep the Noise to a Minimum * Please do not throw sanitary items down the toilet. Please use bin provided in bathroom. *All Rubbish Should Be Disposed Of (Including Bathroom Rubbish) *All Perishable Items must be Removed From Fridge when Departing *When Departing, Please Ensure Lights, Airconditioners & TV Are Switched Off when you leave the premises. * A weekly inspection of the apartment will be conducted if guests have booked  a long stay. (Ie If booking is for one week or over) . We will contact you via email to organise a time. *Maximum Of 4 people Only at one time to Occupy Apartment (Incl. either 2Ad/2Child or 4 Adults)
transit: TRANSPORT Conveniently located on bus line (339) to Sydney CBD & Clovelly Beach Other buses are also accessible from Alison Road (2 min walk) to beaches & shopping centres, movies theatres and restaurants & cafes.
