name: Sandstone Cottage, Great Mackerel Beach
summary: This sandstone cottage is one of the original cottages on Mackerel Beach. Set on the absolute beach front, North East facing and receiving sun all day long, this gorgeous property has a main house and separate studio with 3 bedrooms comfortably accommodating 8 people. It is just 10 metres from the water and 60 minutes from Sydney CBD.
space: The house has a prime beach front location and is situated on a double section enjoying uninterrupted views of the Pittwater, Lion Island, Barrenjoey Heads and Palm Beach. The main bedroom is the house has a queen size bed and large window that looks out over Pittwater - you go to sleep listening to the waves of the ocean and wake up to the most spectacular sunrises over Barrenjoey Heads. There is also a bunk room with 2 sets of bunks which is perfect for the kids (and even the adults). The Tree House, which is a separate studio from the main house, has a queen bed, single bed, its own bathroom and sliding doors onto a private balcony. The house is perfect for 2 families or a group of friends.  The kitchen, dining and living room is open plan, opening out onto the deck which has sweeping views of Pittwater and beyond. The kitchen features concrete bench tops, wooden cupboards and a large double sink. It is fully equipped with all the appliances and utensils you would need during your s
description: This sandstone cottage is one of the original cottages on Mackerel Beach. Set on the absolute beach front, North East facing and receiving sun all day long, this gorgeous property has a main house and separate studio with 3 bedrooms comfortably accommodating 8 people. It is just 10 metres from the water and 60 minutes from Sydney CBD. The house has a prime beach front location and is situated on a double section enjoying uninterrupted views of the Pittwater, Lion Island, Barrenjoey Heads and Palm Beach. The main bedroom is the house has a queen size bed and large window that looks out over Pittwater - you go to sleep listening to the waves of the ocean and wake up to the most spectacular sunrises over Barrenjoey Heads. The Tree House, which is a separate studio from the main house, has a queen bed, single bed, its own bathroom and sliding doors onto a private balcony. The house is perfec
notes: There are no shops on Mackerel Beach so you will need to bring up your own food and beverages. As noted above, there are pantry goods like oils, condiments, salt, pepper, tea and coffee which you are welcome to use.  All sheets and bath towels are provided for your stay.  Unfortunately no cats are to be bought onto Mackerel Beach and if you wish to bring your dog, it must be secured within the property on a lead at ALL times. The dog can be exercised off lead on the Northern end of the beach before 9am and after 5pm.  The house is run off water tanks, so it would be great if you can use the water sparingly. We would appreciate you using the black tub in the sink to rinse your dishes and then throwing it on the plants when it gets full.
transit: You will need to catch the ferry or book a water taxi/ barge in order to get across to Mackerel Beach.  The ferry leaves on the hour from Palm Beach Wharf on Barrenjoey Rd, returning on the half an hour from Mackerel. Check the timetable as the occasional ferry goes direct to Mackerel, rather than via Coasters, the Basin etc...  To order a water taxi call the number listed in the information sheet that we will send to you. Bookings are essential ahead of time. You will want to bring your walking shoes as there are some divine bush walks through the national park and down the valley.
access: You will have complete access to all areas of the house and should you have any issues we are always a phone call away.  All sheets and towels are provided, plus pantry goods like oils, condiments, salt, pepper, tea and coffee.
interaction: We do not live on Mackerel Beach but are only a phone call away should you need anything.

host.host_about: When we discovered Mackeral we couldn’t believe that such a beautiful and secluded spot could exist within an hours drive from central Sydney. Claudia and I instantly fell in love with Mackeral and over the years have introduced many friends to this piece of paradise.

name: Portobello Manly Beach (Apartment #1)
summary: This 1st floor 3 bedroom apartment is located 50 metres from Manly Beach and 5 minutes walk to the Corso with all of its fabulous restaurants and cafes.  It has a large balcony, quiet street, ocean outlook and off street parking. The apartment includes 5 star beds and bedding, 55 & 48 inch smart TV's with Netflix in lounge & free wifi.  The apartment also has reverse cycle air conditioning in the living area and main bedroom.  Please note: there are 2 identical apartments in this block of 2.
space: Our place is unique because of the proximity to the beach and all Manly has to offer. Our place is also a a spacious, newly refurbished three bedroom (URL HIDDEN) apartment is located a 50 second walk from door to beach (I've timed it!)  There is a fantastic café/restaurant 2 minutes walk from the apartment which serves great coffee and does a mean breakfast, lunch and dinner. Less than a five minute walk further down you'll hit the Corso in the heart of Manly which boasts great restaurants, bars and shopping.  Walk the other direction and you'll wind your way along a short costal walk to the beautiful Shelly Beach which offers a beautiful eating experience at The Boathouse. Not to be missed!

notes: If you need an early check-in or late check-out please ask us in advance. If we can, we will try and accommodate you. Otherwise, check-out is strictly 10am and check-in is 2pm-5pm (face to face) and if you arrive after 5, I will leave the keys in the lock box and you can let yourself in. I usually like to meet my guests so if I don't get to greet you in person on arrival, I will greet you the next morning.
transit: The Bus stop 150m from the apartment on Glenayr Ave which takes you to the city, Circular Quay, Surry Hills, Paddington and Bondi Junction (where you can also hop on a train). Buses also run to South Head where there are a number of amazing harbour bays, including Watsons Bay and Camp Cove. For fast bus city services, 333 & 389 on Campbell parade (opposite end of Hall St), about 23 minutes bus ride will take you into the city. Uber is popular as it's only 7kms to the city. There is also a GoGet car nearby which you can hire online. Plus, enjoy your own private parking space.
access: The apartment is located on the top (3rd) floor of a secure building and has a lock-up garage (additional charge $20/day) and negotiable for longer stay.
interaction: We'll arrange to meet and greet you at the door when we can and if you want to know where to go and eat, we're always just a phone call away.

If you are booking for someone else, you must seek approval prior to booking as this is a violation of Airbnb's Terms of Service.  No groups under 25 years old, families welcome of all ages. Refundable deposits is 2 x current deposit for stay over 28days. This is refundable after inspection of property for damages etc. 1) Strictly NO shoes in the apartment to keep apartment clean. name: Garden studio with own bathroom
summary: This studio is peaceful and separate from my house. It's a lovely simple space to chill out or do work/study while looking out onto the greenery and trees of my back garden. Nearby are cafes, three bus routes and Sydney Light Rail. There's on-street parking and good wi-fi is included. Note that access to the studio is via the house and there is some aircraft noise. I enjoy meeting and orientating international guests as well as welcoming locals. I own a cat :)
space: The city meets country in this studio. Located in my back garden, it is surrounded by windows with an outlook of greenery and trees.  The studio is clean and comfortable inside with a queen size bed, toilet and shower, and living area that includes two bucket chairs and TV. You can relax in your own space. If you have to do work, I can also set up table and chair for this. The studio is separate from the house. The house needs to be used for access, breakfast and cooking. But I am an experienced host and are conscious of the importance of privacy. My suburb is in the Italian area of Sydney and specialises in  restaurants and cafes. We also have excellent weekend markets focusing on food (Orange Grove Market), local art (Glebe Markets) and eclectic 2nd hand goods and clothing (Rozelle Markets). For those who enjoy walking, there are beautiful parks along the shores of Sydney Harbour, a movie cinema and an Anytime Fitness gym nearby. I also have another listing, Chic Room in Welcoming Ho

neighborhood_overview: Within a short walking distance of our house is the Norton St restaurants, the pretty Italian Forum and wonderful Saturday morning foodies market at Orange Grove School. Walk ten minutes to the Lilyfield light rail station to enjoy a beautiful scenic ride to Glebe, Ian Thorpe Aquatic Centre, Darling Harbour and the City.  In the daytime, ride the bus to trendy and colourful Newtown.
transit: I am near to bus stops on several routes to the City and Newtown. There is on street parking outside my house available for guests. Feel free to message me if you would like details.
access: The studio now has a kettle, microwave and bar fridge. You are also welcome to use the kitchen in the main house. It has an older gas stove which works well, but needs to be lit by hand. Guests who have experience with this type of stove are welcome to use it. As well as the gas stove, the main kitchen has a microwave and a fridge. Washing up is by hand. You also can share the house's verandah that can be sunny or shaded by means of a retractable awning. The verandah can be used for relaxing as well as eating meals. You will need to have footwear on the verandah as its surface is a little rough (but it meets safety standards and is still a lovely spot). Meals can also be eaten in the kitchen/living area that looks out onto the verandah and garden.  Happy to put on a load of washing for you washing every 3-4 days. I'll want you to peg it on the line, if that's okay. Drying is by means of pegging on a clothesline (it seems like the right thing to do in this warm dry country).
interaction: I am often at home working on report writing. I also occasionally go away for a few days. I am well organised when I travel, so I make sure my guests are happy.
house_rules: Please take care of all components of my property and try to avoid all damage, including minor damage. If minor damage occurs, could you let me know? I will be kind review wise if you tell me about the damage and we discuss what should be done. It is a quiet neighbourhood, so I would want you to keep the noise to normal suburban home levels when outside the cabin. However, if the door is shut and the windows are only open a little, you can  make noise in the cabin and it will be fine.  I do not want any parties. I accept smoking outside provided no-one else who is present is uncomfortable with it. I have had smokers stay and they have used my outdoor seats and the verandah and that has been fine. Note that it could be cold out there at night, particularly in June, July and August. Also, be careful not to put any item over, or within 30 cm of, the heater. Otherwise, there is a risk of fire. It is important to turn the heater off when you are out. The studio is well insulated and holds h

I like connecting with nature, history and culture, and hope to visit places like New Zealand, India, Europe and Singapore. I like to read crime fiction that critiques the society we live in as well as non-fiction on the same subject. My favorite shows include all of Shaun Micallef's shows, most of the Chaser, The Castle, Roy & HG, The Wire, The Bill, Spooks, Call the Midwife, Little Britain, The Young Ones, Allo Allo (1970's). I love creative food.

I respect privacy and diversity. The most important thing is to provide my guests with decent, comfortable accommodation. However, I am interested in your background and story if you are up for a chat.

Kingsgrove train station is located just a few minutes walk (800m) then 5 stops to Domestic / International Airport Train Stations (10min). Sydney CBD is approx. 25 mins via train.  Our place is good for couples, business travellers and families (with kids).   We are a young family and our Granny Flat is available for you to enjoy your stay.

Our place is fully equipped with everything you need. Our Granny flat has a comfy queen sized bed and double bed in the lounge area. We also provide a travel cot and high chair if needed (for up to 2 years old). Children older than 2 years old need to be booked as additional guest. The Kitchen has a Nespresso coffee machine, gas cooktop, electric oven, toaster, kettle, rice cooker, microwave, dishwasher and fridge/freezer. Tea and coffee is provided.

There you can find a big supermarket (open from 7am until midnight every day), quality restaurants (Italian, Greek, Thai, Vietnamese etc.) hairdresser, a bottle shop, beautician, pharmacies, major banks, post office, butcheries etc.
notes: Host owns a small friendly dog but it doesn't have access to your place as the granny flat is fully fenced and separate from the main house.
transit: Driving? Easy on street parking and fantastic road access to the city, Southern and Eastern suburbs( entrance to the M5 highway is just around the corner, which takes you everywhere in Sydney in moments).  Public transport is just a few minutes walking distance. Trains come every 15min.  A taxi from the airport will take less than 15min if it is not in peak hour traffic.

neighborhood_overview: Palm Beach, affectionately known as 'Palmy', is situated at the end of Barrenjoey Peninsula, less than an hour's drive from Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and the CBD. Palm Beach is blessed with a unique contrast of lush evergreen bushland and beaches of golden sand, and enveloped by the pristine waters of the Pacific Ocean and the calm sailing paradise of Pittwater. Just a short boat ride and a packed lunch and you're able to enjoy some of the most beautiful and isolated beaches in Sydney.
transit: Palm Beach is accessible by a few different methods, the most interesting of which is by Sea plane, either Sydney Seaplanes or Sydney by Seaplane are able to get you there safely. From Sydney airport you can pre book a shuttle bus, try My Shuttle or ASN or grab a taxi or Uber for the fastest journey door to door. If you have time on your side, there's a train to the city and then the L90 bus to Palm Beach.
access: The guest has the entire apartment to themselves to enjoy. Access to the apartment is via the building front door back gate and roller door. Early check in can be arranged by prior arrangement with host.
interaction: Beach Stays will be contactable via Phone if there is a problem.

name: Newtown: comfort, character and charm
summary: Whether you're looking for a cosy hideaway or want to be close to the action, this charming Newtown terrace home offers the best of both worlds. It's close to the cafes, bars, restaurants and attractions of King Street, but tucked away on a quiet, leafy residential street. Great for couples and singles.
space: Lovely home with everything you need for a short break or longer stay: cosy bedroom, spacious living areas, workspace, bathroom, laundry facilities, a well-equipped kitchen, and large, private courtyard with separate back lane entry.  -The bedroom has plenty of storage with a large fitted wardrobe. The living room is great for lounging, with a comfortable 6-seater couch and a 60-inch LCD TV.  - The kitchen has a family size fridge, microwave, toaster, kettle and Nespresso coffee machine.  With the exception of the cooker/oven, all equipment and appliances and are brand new. - Laundry facilities include a new washer/dryer as well as a clothesline outside. The bathroom is a little rustic but has all the essentials.  -  Outside is a lovely courtyard/entertaining area with a 6-seater table and barbecue. Great for a few drinks or a dinner party (with due consideration of our neighbours!) -  The neighbourhood is very family-friendly.  There is a playground very conveniently located two doors

name: Elegant quiet luxury home at Bondi
summary: 10 minutes walk to 3 world class beaches.  Recently renovated 4 bedroom luxury home with yoga studio.
space: Our home appears from the street as a pristine 1910 federation cottage, and opens out to a recently renovated 4 bedroom, 3 bathroom luxury home. Each room is a delight, from luxurious bedrooms and ultra modern bathrooms to our huge living area.  Downstairs there's the master bedroom with en suite, a double and a single bedroom and an extra brand new bathroom. The living area and kitchen easily accommodates eight for sit down dinner informal gathering around the lounge and TV.  Upstairs has a cozy "3D" TV and games room, new bathroom and fully equipped ten person yoga studio (converts to 2nd double bedroom). All original artwork with most furniture custom made from antique Australian Kauri Pine.  Mature private garden with outside fresco dining, fountain and barbeque. Our road is a quiet leafy cul de sac, just a minute's stroll to local shops cafes and restaurants. 10 minutes walk to your choice of three beautiful surf beaches, Bondi, Tamarama or Bronte. 10 minute's drive to central Syd

host.host_about:
I have a dwelling in Bondi Beach and live with my partner. I am often out trying new cafes, restaurants and bars throughout the city. In summer I love swimming at Ice Bergs pool or in one of the  many amazing beach and harbours in Sydney. I am passionate about local and handmade clothing and homeware products. I  frequent local organic farmers markets mostly Bondi beach and Double Bay, but also like The Carriage Works markets. When I am not attending to guests, I enjoy hand making my own clothing and tending to my honey bee hive. 

I am available to guests within 20 minutes from their property. I provide a 24 hour point of contact for guests. I do my best to keep the place perfectly maintained and hire professional cleaners  to make sure the place is in impeccable condition for incoming guests.

name: Bright studio apartment close to Sydney Uni!
summary: This simple yet spacious studio has everything you need for a wonderful stay!  It has a queen size bed, a two seater couch, a fully equipped kitchen and Apple TV! It is located in a great location, just moments from Sydney University and the buses from Parramatta Road that can get you to the city in a few minutes. It is also within walking distance of RPA and UTS. This studio apartment has lots of natural light and is well located to catch a glimpse of sunset! Simple, adorable and affordable!
space: The apartment is located on the last floor of the building, so there are a few 3 sets of stairs you need to go up to access it.  There is a very comfortable queen bed along with a fully equipped kitchen - feel free to use everything there including the Nespresso coffee machine! There is a small ironing board too and a tv for guests with Apple TV! This includes a Netflix account for you to enjoy! Guests have access to cooking staples & toiletries, towels, and professionally cleaned linen.

notes: LAUNDRY: There is no washing machine in the studio. However, you can use a laundry around the corner, where your clothes can be washed and dried for approximately AUD15. The laundry is quite affordable. Another option is to hand wash clothes and hang it outside. The clothes dries quickly under hot Australian sun.  The nearest laundry: St John's Laundry and Dry Cleaning: 176 St Johns Road, Glebe, NSW 2037.  Another laundry (15-20 minutes walk): Glebe Ezy Wash, 144C Glebe Point road. CLEANING: if for some reason something is broken or missing or not clean upon arrival, please let me know as soon as possible so I can rectify it! Guests can use off-street car spots located in front of the building (those without cones).
transit: Unless you have a car, buses are probably the best way to get to/from the city. There are numerous buses on Parramatta, just a short stroll away (150m).
access: Guests can access the whole apartment. Building bins are at street level in the room next to the clothing racks.
interaction: I'll do my best to greet everyone, but in case I can't.. the keys will be located in the mailbox (number 28). The combination to the lock will be included in the house manual.  Guests are welcome to contact me directly on my phone (or Airbnb) if any issues arise.

host.host_about:
Hi there!

My name's Brock.  I'm a down to earth Aussie dude who has lived in all different parts of Australia ( Sydney, Townsville, Melbourne, Adelaide, and rural NSW) but have now decided to call Sydney home.

I am passionate about travelling and learning more about the world and like to go on holidays every chance I get!  I also love introducing people to this beautiful country of ours and hope they enjoy it as much as I do!

I've been hosting for a while on Airbnb and have travelled as a guest with Airbnb many times. I love the platform and the opportunity it gives you to connect with new people from all over the world!

Come and stay at my place!

name: Unit close to CBD available for Christmas & NYE!
summary: Welcome to our bright and cosy home, located in a quiet area which is a short train ride directly to the famous Sydney NYE Fireworks!
space: The apartment is in a small, secure,  building on the first floor.  Our home has a big combined living/dining room, fully equipped kitchen, two good sized bedrooms, a clean bathroom and a balcony.  The living room is spacious and bright with cosy chase sofa, foldable dining table and large space for Yoga. The balcony is accessible from the living room.  The main bedroom is large and airy with a comfy queen bed, huge built-in wardrobe, drawer chest and drawers under the bed.  The second bedroom has a comfy single bed with drawers and a baby cot, plus a double wardrobe. The cot will remain in the room and if you have a baby you are welcome to use the  cot free of charge and we can leave the toys as well.  All kitchen necessities, as well towels and linnen are provided.  Please remember, this is our home, so be respectful and keep it clean and safe. neighborhood_overview: Hurlstone park is a great, safe and quiet family neighbourhood with wide, shady streets and lots of parking, big park and lots of playgrounds. There are few playgrounds close to our home, one is just up the street and there is one enclosed playground just opposite the excellent bakery café on the main street. The Cooks river walk/bike path and the big park is just 5 minutes walk. The park is right next to the Cooks river pat and has big grassy areas with shades and covered tables for picnics, kids playground and football field. To the west you can walk down to Aldi/Woolworths in Canterbury and to the South/East towards Marrickville.
notes: $300 fully refundable key deposit is required.
transit: Our place is on the Bankstown line which takes you directly to Sydney CBD or Circular Quay (home of the Sydney Opera house and the famous NYE firework). These are approximate distances t o important places from our place: - 2 minutes walk to the train station & bus stop - 10 min walk or 1 train stop to the light rail that takes you to Darling Harbour - 25 min train ride to Sydney CBD - 2 min walk to the main street where you can find a supermarket, Asian shops, a bakery, excellent bakery café, few hairdresser and beauty salons, news agent, ATM, laundry & dry cleaners  - 5 min walk to the great Cooks river bike/walking pathway - 5 min drive/15 min walk/1 train stop with the Bankstown line to Aldi/Woolworths supermarkets -  10 min drive to Ashfield shopping mall or 15 min on the bus 406 (bus stop in front of the train station) - 2 min walk to the bus stop (in front of the train station) where you can take route 418 which will take you to Bondi Junction (1hr ride)  - Sydneham junction tra

interaction: You can contact us via email, or viber and we will also leave contact numbers from our friends/neighbours.
house_rules: - Quiet hours 10pm - 8am

host.host_about:
Hello fellow travellers! We are a young family of three that enjoys traveling, exploring new places, meeting new people and sharing knowledge and experiences.
Pre-baby we travelled a lot and our favorite destinations so far are Amsterdam and Thaliand. 

Our travel experiences enriched our lives and enhaced our firm belief in sharing, nurturing and respect for human relationships and Nature. 

We believe that people are people, and they have more or less same issues or life questions and strive for happiness no matter what their socioeconomic, religious or cultural background is. After all, we are all made of the same material - Star dust, all other differences are just shades on the canvas called life.

name: Cute Beachside Get Away
summary: Our very cute two bedroom apartment is in a quiet apartment block of 8. It is one step away from the beach, parks and the amazing rock pools of Coogee.  It's 10 min walking distance from the shops on Coogee Bay Road and it has great connectivity to the city (25 min bus aprox) and the adjacent beach Suburbs, Bondi and Maroubra.  We have really nice restaurants within walking distance, and great coffee around too. This is the prefect place for couples or a family with kids.

neighborhood_overview: Greenwich is a hidden gem of Sydney.  It's close to the city and even closer to the restaurant districts of Lane Cove and Crows Nest.  Because it's a harbourside suburb, and this is Sydney,  the terrain is hilly and quite steep in parts and the views are breathtaking.    The suburb has wonderful urban, green, pretension-free, harbourside vibe.  It's a great place for hiking.  If golf's your thing, there's  a public golf course just up the road.  An absolute must see is the iconic Greenwich baths, one of the few remaining Sydney Harbour public swimming baths.    It you love to work your muscles, there are many parks with outdoor training facilities (the best is at the bottom of my garden),  tennis courts for hire, an aquatic centre in Lane Cove, all this with great transport links to the CBD for the business traveller.  What's not to like?  There's a reason that most who move to Greenwich tend to trade up and stay in the vicinity rather than moves to other parts of Sydney.
notes: SECURITY - HOUSE ALARM AND VIDEO/AUDIO SURVEILLANCE Alarm: The interior of the property is fitted with a back to base monitored alarm system.  Instructions for the operation of this system are included in both the House Manual and the Arrival Directions. It is extremely simple.  Please note that this system does not capture or record any visual or audio information, it simply detects motion. Exterior Surveillance:  There are 3 cameras covering the exterior of the property and 1 within the non-guest area of the property which record video and audio and store and upload to the cloud in real time. Note that tampering or removing these cameras will not prevent the information already recorded from being transmitted and stored.   The actual location of all exterior cameras will be shown to you at check-in. There is no surveillance inside the listing nor in the backyard/pool area.  These cameras feature a two way audio feed, so I can speak to you, and you me via them if necessary. Smoking is
transit: We have a stop for a bus travelling to the centre of Sydney at the front of the house, buses which travel up and down the nearby Pacific Highway on their way to the Sydney centre, airport, north west, northern beaches and eastern suburbs, two train stations and two ferry wharves with services to the city and Parramatta to choose from.  With so much choice it gets confusing,  so I advise guests to download any of the many local public transport apps to use during their stay. Our house is one of only five in Greenwich that has direct access to the Sydney Harbour foreshore and is also on the main bus route (Route 261) to the centre of Sydney.  The bus stop is 60m away and the bus travels to the very centre of Sydney's CBD.   We are within walking distance of St Leonards and Wollstonecraft train stations.  St Leonards is a main transport hub and trains from here run to most parts of Sydney including Macquarie University.  Buses from St Leonards run to the city, the northwest and also the n
access: Guests have access to private sitting room with Foxtel IQ , kitchen, solar-heated swimming pool, BBQ area with large Weber gas BBQ, well-equipped laundry and a range of interesting and comfy outdoor dining and lounging areas with stunning views over a Sydney Harbour foreshore rainforest. There's also parking for one guest car on the property and free street parking.
house_rules: NUMBER OF GUESTS IN YOUR BOOKING I do NOT have a 'children under 2 don't count as guests and don't pay a fee' policy. Every human in your group must be included in the guest numbers and guest numbers must not exceed 2. Unfortunately,  Airbnb's system will not calculate the correct guest numbers for those 2 and under.   To manually override this, enter children under 2 as though they were in the 2-12 category.  I require the names and ages of all guests in your group at the time you book.    The guest in whose name the booking is made  must be physically present at check-in unless previously agreed. CHECK-IN AND CHECK-OUT TIMES Check-in is any time after 3pm, check-out is any time before 11am.   SECURITY Please close and lock all doors and windows and turn on the alarm when you're not in residence. SMOKING Smoking is allowed outside only in the designated smoking areas. POOL SAFETY Do not prop open the pool gates or door or make any attempt to override the self-closing door mechanism.

host.host_about: I love to create beautiful spaces for humans which delight and deliver peace, comfort, privacy and efficiency with a sense of fun.  As a seasoned business traveller who's spent far too much time in hotels,  I've developed an aversion to  giant towels marinated in fabric softener, mean little shards of shrink-wrapped soap, toilet paper origami,  shower gels that could degrease a sea otter, coat hangers that require Tetris-like manipulations to unleash their hanging power and bio-hazardous pillow shams.   With this in mind, I've put a lot of thought into creating an accommodation experience that avoids inflicting these hospitality sins on my guests.

summary: This spacious and modern house epitomises Sydney coastal indoor/outdoor living. Conveniently located between the City and beaches. With two spectacular beaches - Maroubra and Coogee only a short 7min drive away, and excellent public transport to the City.

You'll love our place because it's so close to the beach and public transport is only a short walk away too, you'll be in the heart of Sydney, within 15 minutes on the bus or train.

neighborhood_overview: Rising above Sydney’s famous Bondi Beach, Bondi quietly watches surfers hit the lip from its elevated perch in the city’s eastern suburbs. Bondi’s relative shyness to its rowdy neighbour doesn’t mean it lacks style, charisma, or personality. On the contrary, its local shops are neighbourhood institutions and its classic bungalows preserve its beach town charm. Share a brew on Bondi Road or skate to the beach with your board—it’s easy to take it easy in Bondi.
transit: Bondi Beach - 2 minutes walk Bondi Junction Station - 15 minutes by bus Sydney CBD - 25 minutes by bus and train  Darling Harbour - 45 minutes by bus and train Harbour Bridge - 40 minutes by train Opera House - 40 minutes by train Airport - 55 minutes by bus/train
access: The apartment is within a communal block. Guests will have access to the entire apartment during their stay.
interaction: I will be contactable by email or telephone during your stay.

If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, a $120 fee will apply.

name: Beachside room not far from the airport,
summary: A family home near the beach, airport and city. Have all the benefits of being 15km from the airport and city, but with the advantage of being a 2 minute walk from the beach. Great views from the upstairs lounge out over Malabar bay and headland.

We have a pool or, alternatively, Malabar beach is a 2 minute walk away. The airport is 15km away (20mins in a cab), the city is 15km away, and a bus stop just around the corner that takes you straight into the city. A cab or uber will take about 20mins to the city, the bus can take for 40 - 50 mins.

neighborhood_overview: The beach is at the bottom of the road. Surrounded by golf courses! Malabar is one of Sydney's best kept secrets - quiet beach not far from the city. Gentle waves with no rips so ideal for families and fishermen! There are 3 coffee shops 5 minutes walk away, along with take aways, a couple of restaurants, a convenience store and a pharmacy. There is a children's playground and BBQ area right next to the beach. Coastal Walks around the headland and in surrounding suburbs. Maroubra is a short drive away with another great beach, surfing, and plenty of restaurants. Little Bay & La Perouse are also a short drive or couple of bus stops away with restaurants, take away shops and yet more beaches.
notes: There is a TV / monitor in the lounge, but no TV channels available. If you have streaming apps on your apple devices (netflix, seven etc) these can plugged into the TV via an HDMI cable.  We also have a dog FYI - if this is a problem please contact us prior to booking.
transit: There are buses from outside the house (number 399), directly into the city, travelling past the beaches, Randwick,  Centennial Park and the SCG, ending at Circular Quay. This can take 40 - 50 mins depending upon traffic. There are also frequent buses from Anzac Parade (approx 5- 10 mins walk) to the city and Central Station. These buses take a more direct route and can be a little quicker into the city.
access: Guests can have free use of the pool and upstairs lounge.  Unlimited WiFi for free.
interaction: This is as much or as little as guests require - we can give advice on how to get around, where to get the best coffee (in our opinion anyway!), the best places to go. Or we can leave you alone to discover Sydney yourselves.

host.host_about:
My partner Steve and I are originally from the north of England, but have been in Australia for over 12 years now. We are new to hosting on Air BnB but have used it as guests and thoroughly loved it.
We have been living here in Malabar for 5 years and feel so lucky to live in such a fantastic beachside suburb yet so close to the city.
Hopefully we can look after guests as well as we have been looked after by other Air BnB hosts.

name: Character renovated house close to city
summary: My house is a charming older house with character and renovated for comfort. The ground floor has 2 bedrooms, lounge/dining, kitchen, laundry and bathroom. The upstairs has a main bedroom, and another bedroom, and a large patio or balcony. There is a rear courtyard garden and pond.

Frequent buses pass through Glebe Point Road - 2 minutes away - to the city, Central Railway Station and to the suburbs of Newtown, Leichardt and the beach side suburb of Coogee. Blackwattle Bay and the public parks and walkway around it, an arm of Sydney Harbour , is but a short walk from the house. The city , and its attractions of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Botanical Gardens, Pitt Street shopping mall, Circular Quay, is within 15 to 45 minutes from the house, by transport or walking. Glebe Point Road , a street of cafes restaurants and retail centres is close by. Broadway Shopping Centre, with an Aldi supermarket, a Coles supermarket, a Harris Farm fresh fruit and vegetable outlet, cafes, restaurants, clothi
description: My house is a charming older house with character and renovated for comfort. The ground floor has 2 bedrooms, lounge/dining, kitchen, laundry and bathroom. The upstairs has a main bedroom, and another bedroom, and a large patio or balcony. There is a rear courtyard garden and pond. The house is about 200 m2. It is in a quiet street. It is a street block from the Glebe Light Rail station which light rail connects to the Fish Markets, Pyrmont, Star Casino, Darling Harbour, China Town and Paddy's Markets, Capitol Theatre and the Central Railway Station. Frequent buses pass through Glebe Point Road - 2 minutes away - to the city, Central Railway Station and to the suburbs of Newtown, Leichardt and the beach side suburb of Coogee. Blackwattle Bay and the public parks and walkway around it, an arm of Sydney Harbour , is but a short walk from the house. The city , and its attractions of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Botanical Gardens, Pitt Street shopping mall, Circular Quay, is within 15
neighborhood_overview: Glebe is an early and original inner city suburb off Sydney dating from the 1800's. It is marked by terraces and workers cottages. It has a mix of people from students - for the nearby University of Sydney - to those renting to owners of all walks of life. Its closeness to the city but without the business of a city is its attraction.
notes: There is no off street parking. Streets in the area and in the Glebe suburb are mostly restricted parking of 2 to 4 hours between the hours of 8am to 6 to 10 pm each day. Visitor parking permits are available allowing daily parking in any Glebe suburb restricted parking streets where the parking signs exempt Area G permits - which is streets around the house and in almost all other streets of Glebe. The upstairs rooms are accessed by stairs. The stairs are like usual stairs in Sydney terraces. The stairs are carpeted with a hand rail. Some may find the stairs "steep". Some one with a physical impairment, or of some age with physical limitations, may have difficulty negotiating the stairs. The stairs are shown in photos of the house. Two bedrooms are on the ground level on the house so those who may not be able to use the stairs will have unimpeded use to these rooms.
transit: Buses regularly connect to the city and suburbs along Glebe Point Road. Times between buses is 10 to 20 minutes. The Light Rail, nearby, regularly connects to the city and Central Railway Station which has a direct train connection to the domestic and international airports. The Light Rail runs every 10 minutes in peak hours and 20 minutes at other times.
access: The house has a rear courtyard and pond sheltered by a large tree, which allows for  outside meeting and eating. The kitchen has a Miele electric oven, a gas 4 plate stove and a dishwasher. The laundry has a front loaded Bosch washer and a separate dryer. Wifi is available. The house has 2 TV's - one in the upstairs main bedroom and one in the lounge. There is air conditioning in the 2 upstairs bedrooms and air-conditioning in the bathroom.
interaction: There will be contact available to guests with the host or his agent during their stay.
house_rules: 1 No quests in number to exceed the number  identified on booking. 2 The total number of quests not to exceed 6. 3 The house and property to be kept clean in the same state as it was when the quests take possession. 4 Any damage to the property or items, however caused by the quests or anyone else, during the period of possession by the quests, to be the responsibility of the quest(s) who shall compensate the host for the costs of fixing the damage, or the replacement cost or value of the lost or damaged item as the case may be as the host shall determine. 5 No smoking of tobacco or use of any illicit drugs or substances in the house or its grounds at all.

host.host_about:
I am a retired lawyer. I live in Sydney, Australia. I was born in Tasmania and lived there until I moved to Sydney 25 years ago. I live in Glebe, an older and early suburb of Sydney west of and close to the city. It is close to public transport - light rail and buses - and is between 15 to 35 minutes from the city depending on whether you bus or train or walk. My house is close to Blackwattle Bay an arm of Sydney Harbour.
I have travelled and intend to travel in the future. I usually travel alone or with my partner a pharmaceutical representative.
We love food, music and theatre and experiencing the joys and wonders of different cities and places. Our favourite places have been Asia, Europe and USA.
We are friendly, personable and considerate with a clean and tidy attitude.

name: The Paddington Cottage | Sydney Eastern Suburbs
summary: A member of Dinnigan Cocks | Bespoke Homes. When we acquired this property we chose it for its small scale charm and its history.  It is the perfect, other-worldly Georgian cottage, tucked away in the heart of Paddington. It is an area rich with historic landmarks and stories, and was originally home to the Gadigal peoples of the Eora nation. *NOTE: this terrance has a narrow and steep staircase to L2/L3 not suitable for young children and elderly people.
space: Mary Place retains all the proportions of the original artisanal cottage, complete with the chimneys and fireplaces; pretty sash windows and tiny staircases that snake right up into the rooftop third bedroom. The style of the cottage is unique, decorated by Collette Dinnigan with her signature mix of fine country antiques, beautiful bed linen, towels, and eclectic paintings. The tiny private courtyard trimmed with evergreen shrubs and annual flowers - opens out from the well-appointed kitchen -and is the perfect place to dine and enjoy a good glass of red. The atmosphere we have sought to create is personal, warm, somewhere magical to escape, something to explore. A discovery and a home. We hope you love it as much as we do. Total space: 70 sqm 2 Queen Beds, 1 Single Bed
description: A member of Dinnigan Cocks | Bespoke Homes. When we acquired this property we chose it for its small scale charm and its history.  It is the perfect, other-worldly Georgian cottage, tucked away in the heart of Paddington. neighborhood_overview: Tranquilly and privately nestled in one of Paddington's finest and oldest enclaves, this exceptional Cotswolds cottage style residence is a home of unquestionable quality. Beautifully presented, this freestanding c1850s Georgian terrace is well placed just metres to village life.
notes: - Seamlessly melding period charm and contemporary comfort - Intuitively designed to maximise the flow of light and space - Carefree entertaining with adjoining lounge and dining areas - Modern user-friendly kitchen, stainless steel gas appliances - Versatile living with a secluded attic retreat/guest bedroom - Bathroom, frameless glass shower, integrated laundry - Master bedroom with built-ins, sun dappled garden courtyard - Timber floors, skylights, plantation shutters - Moments to cafes, regular transport, cinemas and boutiques Simply minutes to Centennial Park, Five Ways and the city
transit: Our cottage is located close to cafes; a hair salon; some good unique Australian clothing stores and a comprehensive grocery store at Five Ways in Paddington. It is a vibrant area with a village style vibe.  Within a 1.5km radius are the Victoria Barracks; two art house cinemas; art galleries; and many great restaurants. It is a 5 minute taxi ride to the CBD and 10 minutes to the Opera House and Bridge.
access: Check-in instructions will be sent upon completed reservation.
house_rules: Please note that all our homes have no party policies as noise travels to neighbours easily in both residential and hinterland areas. No extra guests are allowed to the houses and noise levels are to be respectful at all times. There is to be no outdoor music or outdoor entertaining after 10pm. Noise complaints will result in bond deductions and possible eviction. We apologise for being so strict but noise is a serious issue and keeping our neighbours happy is of paramount importance.

host.host_about: From Sydney, Australia.

name: The Cov @ Marrickville (the Brooklyn of Sydney)
summary: Relax and enjoy our welcoming and light-filled Federation two-bedroom home which is a perfect urban retreat for a family, couples, grey nomads or just friends who want to experience the heart and soul of the inner west. Situated in a leafy and quiet street, The Cov house offers our guests a friendly and vibrant neighbourhood with cafes, bars, music venues, shopping and restaurants minutes from your doorstep.
space: With high ceilings, stained-glass windows, original polished timber floors throughout, in combination with a modern and fully-equipped kitchen (stainless steel gas stove and large oven, Nespresso coffee machine, dishwasher and microwave), The Cov offers a relaxed environment to return to after a day immersing yourself in Marrickville or exploring our beautiful Sydney. During the evening you can sit on the front porch with a glass of wine, a gin & tonic or a cup of tea and share the many stories of your day.
description: Relax and enjoy our welcoming and light-filled Federation two-bedroom home which is a perfect urban retreat for a family, couples, grey nomads or just friends who want to experience the heart and soul of the inner west. With high ceilings, stained-glass windows, original polished timber floors throughout, in combination with a modern and fully-equipped kitchen (stainless steel gas stove and large oven, Nespresso coffee machine, dishwasher and microwave), The Cov offers a relaxed environment to return to after a day immersing yourself in Marrickville or exploring our beautiful Sydney. During the evening you can sit on the front porch with a glass of wine, a gin & tonic or a cup of tea and share the many stories of your day. You can access all areas of The Cov. It is entirely at your disposable for
neighborhood_overview: The Cov is very comfortable Federation home located in a quiet neighbourhood with amazing city views at the end of the street offering easy access to a vibrant, ethnic Australian community awash with exciting food,  cafes, shopping, entertainment and of course ‘The City of Sydney’ just down the way. You can walk down to Lazy Bones for some great live Jazz or to Camelot Lounge for some eclectic World music.Prior to your check-in you will get an email with our own Foodie Tips and Handy Hints which will ensure your stay is both enjoyable and allows you an immersive experience into our own  'the Brooklyn of Sydney.'
notes: We provide high quality bed linen and bath towels. Once you have made your reservation please advise whether you will be needing both bedrooms made up (maximum of 4 x guests) or just one bedroom during your stay. Both bedrooms have supremely comfortable Queen beds and pillows, with ceiling fans for the summer and gas heating for you feel cosy throughout in the winter.
transit: In Sydney an Opal Smartcard is a requirement for public transport. It can be purchased Online, at the Airport, most Newsagents.  Load up a dollar value onto your Opal card at the airport or any station to cover trains, buses, ferries and light rail on the NSW Opal Network. AIRPORT TRANSFER: Yep! You can do it by train but after a flight with suitcases and case of jet lag why not just take an Uber, Taxi or Hire Car. It’s affordable and The Cov is only 15mins drive. Prior to your check-in  I email a very comprehensive Travel Tips guide which includes info about trains, light rail, buses which are all walking distance and minutes away.
access: You can access all areas of The Cov. It is entirely at your disposable for you to relax and enjoy. Our Federation home is on one level (no stairs to negotiate). The beautifully tiled bathroom offers both a bath and a large walk-in shower with washer and dryer facilities. The living room has a large comfy couch to enjoy the LCD TV ( with Fetch TV and free movies from Movie Box). The wifi is free and fast. Street parking is at your doorstep and available with no time restrictions.
interaction: Prior and during your stay I am available by mobile or email if you have any questions or need any assistance to ensure you have a relaxing and comfortable stay.
house_rules: Please treat The Cov as you would your own resting place otherwise an extra cleaning fee will be deducted from the security bond. Friendly reminder that for the comfort of all guests there is a STRICT NO SMOKING in the house. There is   also a STRICT NO PARTY POLICY. Any violation of this will result in eviction from the property and additional cleaning management fees being charged to the Bond. Yes, there is a Bond but I have never once had to make a claim on it. Let's all keep this good track record !

host.host_about: Am a woman who  believes that "grey is the new black." I also believe that travelling should be both a comfortable and a welcoming experience and that's why I'm confident that when you visit you will return again...and again.

name: Harbour Views from North Sydney High Street
summary: ** LAST MINUTE AVAILABILITY FOR DECEMBER DUE TO CANCELLATION** Bright 1 bedroom apartment on the Kirribilli/North Sydney border delights all guests with its space and views. Have your morning coffee on the balcony watching the cruise ships, navy warships and ferries come and go through the iconic harbour. With allocated parking and easy ferry access it's a great base to explore from. Backed up with 24/7 help from a dedicated holiday rental agency you can rest assured your stay is in good hands.
space: Located on the fourth floor of a secure building this apartment is just a few moments walk from the High Street ferry wharf, on a direct route to Circular Quay, it's easy to get into the heart of the city to explore Sydney further. Trains are available at Circular Quay also if you want to travel further afield but Milsons Point and North Sydney stations are within ten minutes walk too. The kitchen is well equipped for anyone wishing to cook up a storm during their stay. If you need to do any laundry during your stay there is a laundry room within the building with many large coin-operated washing machines and dryers. The apartment is not suited to families with children under 5 but young, sensible children over that age should be fine. This is a no smoking apartment. The apartment has one allocated parking space for your exclusive use; it is a large space but accessed by a slightly narrow ramp so best for smaller cars and/or confident drivers. The apartment is provided on the basis tha

neighborhood_overview: Many people think of North Sydney as the CBD alone, but the CBD is surrounded by some of the best living in Sydney. If you work in the city you are spoilt for choice when it comes to transport. Trains and buses are constant. On a nice day walk to work across our great bridge. Stroll to nearby restaurants at Blues Point Road, Crows Nest or Neutral Bay, or stay in North Sydney itself with a great variety of restaurants and good pubs. Everything is walking distance in this suburb. There are great shops at Greenwood Plaza, Walker Street, Neutral Bay or Crows Nest for all your grocery needs or late night requirements.  Visit the great markets near the North Sydney council on Friday nights and Saturdays. Parks are plentiful with North Sydney oval and Cammeray park perfect for kids and families, or take a leisurely stroll to the harbour.
notes: All the apartments we manage come with a welcome letter and a full instruction manual so you know how everything works to ensure you can get the most out of your stay. The manual also contains many menus from local restaurants to give you some idea of what is available nearby and also information on tourist activities available in Sydney. There is also a local map with some highlights such as the local supermarket and train station plus maps of Sydney for those not familiar with the area. All bedding and towels are included along with beginner basics such as tea, coffee, sugar, milk, shampoo, bodywash and toilet paper to get you through the first few days. We try to meet all guests on arrival in person so a time will be arranged in advance of your arrival which will also be confirmed in the day once you know your plans. On arrival we ask all guests to quickly fill in some contact information and tell them a little bit more about how we hope they'll look after the apartment. Please note
transit: The ferry is just a few moments walk away at the High Street ferry wharf which takes you directly to Circular Quay for The Rocks and the Opera House. There is a train station at Circular Quay also if you want to travel further afield.
access: Guests have full use of the apartment to make themselves at home. You will of course have your own keys to come and go as you please.
interaction: As a professional holiday rental agency we are available to answer any questions or help with any problems that crop up. Unlike part time casual owner-managers we do this for a living professionally, it is our core focus, we hold professional licences to do this and we are ALWAYS just a message away if you need us. You won't be left high and dry with us!
house_rules: THIS SECTION CONTAINS IMPORTANT INFORMATION, PLEASE MAKE SURE YOU READ BEFORE BOOKING : This is a quiet building and we expect all guests to be considerate of the neighbours. Please treat the apartment as your own but please no wild parties. We kindly ask guests to wash and put away all used items from the kitchen and leave any rubbish in the external rubbish area when they leave. If you require use of the sofabed for your stay please book for 3 or 4 people to ensure the small additional cost for the bedding is included in your booking. Occupancy of one or two people is understood to just use the bedroom. On arrival, like staying in a hotel, we ask guests to fill in a registration form to ensure we have full contact details for them. This form also provides more information about the Security Deposit for damage and breakages held by Airbnb for your stay.

host.host_about:
SHR prides itself on how we look after our guests with friendly, attentive, knowledgeable service. We aim to meet all guests in person on arrival to help them into the apartments we manage and we work hard to ensure guests have the best stay possible. We're a licensed real estate agency so you can be sure you're dealing with reliable professionals who can always be contacted rather than people who have many other things demanding their attention in life. For us, our guests will always be our number one priority.

We're actively looking to take on new properties throughout Sydney so if you need your holiday property managed by professionals that lead the field in customer satisfaction and occupancy rates please get in touch through Airbnb or Sydney Holiday Rentals dt com dt au.

The thriving high street, which extends from Erskineville train station towards Newtown, offers up the coffee, brunch and gourmet del
neighborhood_overview: Home to three of Sydney’s best pubs – including the iconic The Imperial, which featured in Pricilla, Queen of the Desert – within a brisk walk from one-another, you’re never short of options for a lazy afternoon’s drink. The thriving high street, which extends from Erskineville train station towards Newtown, offers up the coffee, brunch and gourmet delights. Despite sitting shoulder to shoulder, the small-scale terrace homes that crowd the narrow streets all possess a distinct sense of personality. Erskineville may well be one of the hottest inner city spots, but it hasn’t sacrificed any of its charm by way of jarring developments. Erskineville’s creative conscience runs deep. From the colourful residents, the dramatic drinking dens, fringe theatre at PACT, to the gourmet food stores and cafes, there’s a sense of thinking differently here that’s embedded within the tight-knit community. There’s an Erskineville way of looking at Sydney, which makes it one of the most prized lifestyle po
transit: Walk and explore Erskineville/Newtown or even walk into the city 5km's.  Public transport is also fantastic and extremely close with a train station within 400m and bus stops 100m away.
access: Shared lounge room/kitchen and bathrooms and back court yard.
interaction: I'm home intermittently throughout the day and weekends.

host.host_about:
Hi, 

My name is Matt and i live in Sydney, Australia.

I love traveling, photography, film and exploring on weekends.

My housemate just moved out and i have available the main bedroom of the house for 4 weeks until a friend of mine moves in.

Weekdays I usually get up early and leave the house by 8:00am and can sometimes be in and out at home throughout the day as i can occasionally work from home.  I make the most of my weekends by eating out and exploring the city and beaches.

Happy for guests to treat the place as their own.  I hope you enjoy it as much as i do!

name: Beach House Manly Apartment 4
summary: Well done !!! you won't find a better location in Manly. The “Beach House” Apartments overlook Cabbage Tree Bay Aquatic Reserve between Manly and Shelly Beach, in one of Manly's premier locations  Swim, dive, snorkel, surf, paddle board, coastal walkways, ocean pool, restaurants, all literally at your doorstep, or simply chill and unwind. Manly is amazing, I look forward to welcoming you

It's like a boutique hotel suite where you can hear the ocean waves at night. This fabulous two bedroom apartment provides Fully furnished apartment    High quality comfy beds and linen   Built-in wardrobes and ample storage  Beautiful large bathroom with a bath  WIFI included  Shared laundry facilities with the other 4 apartments at the Beach House   The apartment is fitted with all amenities for your stay, fresh linens, shampoo and conditioners, and essential pantry items. This is what beach lifestyle is all about. Relax you have found your own little paradise

neighborhood_overview: Manly is a pretty special place to stay. It's part holiday resort and part style conscious city suburb While Manly is definitely all about sun, surf and the outdoors, it also has a really vibrant food and drink scene. Every kind of dining option from pub to beachside casual to evening chic is available. Some of my favourites include Bower Restaurant (next door neighbour’s) The Boathouse Restaurant at Shelly Beach, Hugo’s at Manly Pier, Yok Thai in Manly and Garfish on the Esplanade.
transit: The apartment is a 5 min walk to Manly Beach, the Corso and Shelly Beach (voted one of the world’s best beaches and a 15 min walk to the beautiful North Head Reserve. Your apartment is also  5 minute walk to the surf beach, Manly Ferries, shops, local markets, restaurants and cafes, so traveling around is easy. There are buses or ferries to the city, if you have a car, there is off street parking available at the apartments for $40 per day (subject to availability) If they are already taken we  will supply our guests with a council parking permit for free 24/7 street parking (upon request). Locally you'll find you probably won't drive at all as everything you need is walking distance. You can also rent bikes as there are bike paths all around Manly and along the beachfront, including the path right in front of your apartment   Manly Fast Ferry is a 5 min walk away and will get you into Sydney Circular Quay in just 20 mins  You can also catch the ferry to Watson's Bay from the Manly wha
access: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy as your own. There is a key lock box with a code so you will be able to check in on your own. We will send you check in instruction a few days before your arrival.
interaction: Our aim is to help you enjoy the apartment and Manly as much as we do. The apartment has everything you will need for a comfortable stay, and it is professionally cleaned to a high standard before each guest arrives. If there is something we can do to make your stay  more enjoyable please contact us

name: Club Cliff for a great beach vacation.
summary: Spacious beach haven with modern conveniences. Hampton's style decor. Three level house all to yourself! One floor dedicated to living spaces, open plan kitchen/dining/living rooms with balconies either side. Top floor has main bedroom with ensuite and balcony with water views. Ground floor has two bedrooms, bathroom and study which opens up to backyard. Internal access to double garage. Minutes from beaches, ferry and everything Manly has to offer.  Multiple living spaces, perfect for groups.
space: The living space can grow and enclose as it has a deck either end whose doors at both ends will bifold back to give you one big space full of sun and light. The northerly facing front deck is in sun all day and the rear deck with BBQ makes for fun dinners and cocktails. Beach Shower outside and under the stairs ina cupboard are beach chairs, umbrellas and sunscreen so you can indulge in what makes Manly famous, its beach! The leafy rear garden is wonderful on a hot day to cool off in and share a drink.

neighborhood_overview: Like most of Manly Club Cliff is in a street of a mix of houses, townhouses and appartments. A short walk to the corner and you can see the arc of manly beach stretching out in front of you! You can stay quite happily here and not drive at all! The ferry service consists of 2 types, the regular service on large green and Yellow ferry which takes about 45 mins to get from Manly to Circular Quay. Or the Fast Ferry which takes about 20 mins for the same journey. Its a great way to see Sydney's famous harbour and Opera House.
access: Guests have access to all spaces, including the double garage which also has 2 bikes and Kayaks to play with. There is a storage room behind the garage which will be locked and not accessible. Plenty of towels, beach towels and linen is all there. Own front door up a path direct from the street and internal access from garage. It is on 3 levels so there are stairs.
interaction: I wont be available but my co host will be for any questions.
house_rules: - As we are close to the beach please use the beach shower to rinse off sand

host.host_about: Maryanne Kolek from Sydney Australia. I like to walk, go to parks, yoga and kyak. My daughter lives in New York so I hope to travel there more. I dont smoke and neither does my husband.

neighborhood_overview: Chippendale is one of the most vibrant, eclectic and 'up and coming' areas in inner Sydney. With cafes, bars, grocery stores, fitness centres and tourist attractions everywhere you go! It's one of the most central parts of Sydney without having to be in the concrete jungle of Sydney's central business district! There's a cool bar, art and cafe scene at every corner.
notes: Please note that I can check you in from 2pm onwards every day. For check-ins between 2pm-8pm, I can do an in-person check-in (facilitated by my cleaners and helpers Vanessa and Glaucia). Alternatively, I can also do check-ins with a lock-box from 2pm until late on your day of arrival if you like! This is often easier and more convenient for guests, I've found! Check-ins after 8pm can only be via the lock-box method!
transit: Public Transport is right at your door step - with Central Station just 5 minutes walk away for trains, buses running up and down Regent Street (which is on your doorstep), and ubers and cabs within seconds. You can also walk to the Sydney CBD and Central Park in 5-10 minutes!
access: The apartment is private and just for your use, including the kitchen, bathroom and laundry. There is nothing to share!
interaction: I am not often around in Sydney. If you've selected to check-in via the lock-box method, I'll send you simple instructions to find and access the lock box and then the apartment! If you'd like to check in in person, my cleaners and helpers, Vanessa and Glaucia, will check you in and show you what the apartment has to offer. They are terrific and helpful and will do everything needed to help you settle in :)

Offering generous sized bedrooms, open plan kitchen dining, family room, large outdoor entertaining area, formal lounge/dining area and resort style pool/spa, this home is perfect for a relaxing family holiday.

The sparkling resort-like pool is north-facing with a handy retractable sun umbrella. neighborhood_overview: Located in a peaceful neighbourhood this home is only a 5min drive to Manly and right on the door step of Manly Dam, which provides fabulous trails for either walking or mountain bike riding.  Child-friendly Clontarf Beach is only minutes away or challenging surfing can be found at an array of beaches close by. You will be spoiled for choice on what to do during your stay on the Northern Beaches but one thing is for sure, you will relax in style in this beautiful well-appointed home.
notes: ***Please Note*** Accommodation is for a minimum of 7 nights and change over is on a Saturday.
transit: Sightseeing in the CBD is also very handy to this property, with direct buses to the city leaving regularly or why not bus it to Manly and take the Manly Ferry across the harbour. The "Hop, Skip and Jump" shuttle bus service takes you to Stocklands Balgowlah and on to Manly. A selection of fine dining is also within easy walking distance and located down at the Spit, overlooking Middle Harbour.

neighborhood_overview: Maroubra is the older brother to the famous beaches Bondi & Coogee. It is slightly more rugged water wise but has the calmness the two other beaches are missing because of the over crowdedness by tourists. Almost just as close to the city & airport we would choose to spend our days surrounded by the calmness of this suburb any day. With everything you could possibly need within walking distance and many cute cafes and restaurants down by the waterfront you truly feel the surf vibes here. The whole suburb and neighborhood has a super relaxed feel & atmosphere and its very safe at any time of the day or at night.
notes: Please note that the garage you can see on the floor plan will not be accessible to guests. However there is private off street parking for 2 cars.
transit: The best way to get around is either by car or bus. Busses are plentiful and can take you straight to the city or any of the other beaches. The bus stop is less then 3 minutes walk away. We have two off street car parking spots.

Fresh linen as well as bath towels are provided and all you have to bring is your suitcase. The kitchen is fully equipped with all one could need including a dishwasher and state of the art cooking facilities. And you also have access to an internal laundry with washing machine and a line to hang your cloth out to dry. The house is stacked with all essentials and then some and wifi is also available for your convenience. Parking is available off street for 2 cars.

house_rules: NO Shoes in the House BBQ cleaning fee of 50 applies if found dirty  The property is perfect for families, corporate groups or a group attending a wedding.  We do NOT accept Bucks or Bachelor parties whatsoever. We have a very strict NO PARTY policy and only the guests who are staying at the house, are allowed to be on the premises. We have very close neighbours surrounding the house and therefore want to minimise excessive noise. Your help in keeping noise low, is much appreciated. The property is a great place to base yourself in Sydney however there is a strict NO PARTY policy. Adjoining neighbours will complain to the police, council rangers will come and this could lead to an eviction of the property. This can all happen really quickly - so best use the house as a base to explore Sydney or for your family gathering. Please dont plan or start a party, as this will lead to a quick eviction and loss of bond.  Our property is NO SMOKING inside and is also not pet friendly.  Your coope

Close to the city, eastern suburbs, swimming beaches 400 mtr away , organic cafe 10 mtr from the home ,many more other cafe's, shopping and airport, the best thing about Sans Souci is the holiday feel that makes all worries disappear. ( Sans Souci is french for ` without worries`). Once you enter the house you will find plenty of light, space and a modern and stylish interior. The open plan kitchen, dining and living area are located on the ground level.  The kitchen is equipped with everything you need to prepare delicious meals for you friends and family.  The TV room is perfect for relaxed movie nights or lazy Sundays. You will find 3 spacious bedrooms with double beds and a modern bathroom with bathtub and shower. Guest have access to full house. We will lock one bedr
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is quite and family friendly. Nestled on the Southern most tip of the St. George Peninsula, it is surrounded by water and features some of the finest boating clubs in NSW.  You will find some of the best eateries and just great living in this bay side area and Sans Souci is generally referred to as The Peninsula. Ramsgate Beach Shopping Village atmosphere is a great place for a coffee stop over lunch and dinner.  The extensive bike tracks, the beach and the parks make this location perfect for active outdoor activities with the family.
notes: 'It’s worth noting Sydney does have a tropical climate, and so there may be a few bugs about in any property you stay in - nothing that would negatively impact your stay though!'
access: Guest have access to full house. We will lock one bedroom on the ground level to keep our personal belongings.
interaction: Please message me via Airbnb or mail.

If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, a $300 fee will apply for replacements. - - Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music.  - - Please be respectful of personal belongings in the home.

It's 3 mins away from Erskineville train station, which is 5 mins away from Central station by train. 5 mins to all the nice cafes and bars, and 10 mins to one of the best areas in Sydney, Newtown! My housemate is a nice and chilled Aussie girl and she has a cute cat, Lulu. Welcome!

host.host_about:
A poet and an emerging artist, curious about life and enjoy my freedom
I found my freedom through art, music, reading philosophical books like Also Sprach Zarathustra from Nietzsche. I enjoy great conversation and stimulate my mind and soul. I’m open minded, enjoy meeting new people and keep learning. 
My life journey includes a long professional career within the contemporary art and education. I have traveled to America, England, France, Germany, Holland, Switzerland, and some of South Asia countries. I wish to continue my travel, explore new cultures, art and of course write about my life journey

I’m looking forward to meet you and make your stay in Sydney pleasant.

name: Retreat in Chic Cozy 2BR APT - ❤️ of SYD CBD
summary: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION !!!  Explore and live like a local in Surry Hills which ranks as the 23rd most stylish neighborhood in the world & No.1 in Australia! If you are looking for an amazing apartment in the best location in SYDNEY CBD look no further. Step outside to the vibrant and colourful Elizabeth St with easy 3 min walk to Central Station, Chinatown, Darling Harbour, World Square and short stroll to Opera House & the Rocks.   2 Bedrooms + Double Sofa Bed, 1 Bathroom, Free Wifi.
space: This is without doubt THE BEST LOCATION you could ever ask for when visiting Sydney. Surry Hills is an amazing inner city neighbourhood in Sydney's Eastern Suburbs, recently voted 23rd most sytlish suburb in the world! Incredibly relaxed place, great facilities including a start of the art new library, awesome bars, cafes & restaurants. 2 minute walk to everything that is wonderful and local in the inner-city village of Surry Hills, and a short walk further to Sydney's CBD, Hyde Park or Centennial Park. Across the road from the iconic Sydney Cricket Ground and other sporting venues, 15 minutes to Sydney's beautiful eastern suburbs beaches including the world famous Bondi Beach. Start your day with a coffee at the amazing Bourke Street Bakery just few minutes away. Fantastic mix of creative types, families, professionals & interesting locals :-) You will love it here. While in the neighbourhood, be sure to enjoy a well-known Sydney pub, there are many to choose from! Enjoy a meal at one

neighborhood_overview: Surry Hills is just 1km South-East of Sydney city and the area has an abundance of restaurants, pubs, cafes, shopping and parks. Great coffee! Fabulous shops to explore, and local places to dine, you will love living locally or enjoy the location for easy access to all of Sydney. You are within walking distance to Central Station, CBD, Oxford St and Circular Quay. With great public transport links, grab an Opal Card and get to Bondi Beach, Centennial Park and enjoy Sydney. Central PIZZA is right next to our building if you're too hungry :)
notes: NOTE: Please take off your shoes at the entrance and please leave the apartment clean and tidy as when you first find it. We really appreciate your courtesy! Take advantage of our LATEST PROMOTION and SPECIAL OFFERS and make your stay with us truly unique! Book early to secure your accommodation because we are often booked out during this period. Sydney is a bustling city and we're located right in the heart of it (which is part of the reasons why we love it!) so noise is inevitable. There is a construction going on from the right hand side of the complex so you might hear some noise during the day but hopefully it won’t affect you much as you’ll be exploring Sydney during daytime. This pad accommodates 4 adults comfortably but a max of 6 overnight. Any more than 4 adult guests overnight or extra sofa will attract an extra AU$30 per night, per additional guest. The sleeping arrangement for the 5th to 6th adult would be on a 2-seater sofa bed which folds out to a double with extra quilt
transit: 2 minutes walk to Central train station and bus interchange this apartment is perfectly located to get around Sydney. Leave the car and just walk everywhere! The City Centre is a 3 minute walk, Sydney Opera House 20 minutes and the Botanical Gardens 25 minutes. If you want to go further afield or just prefer public transport there are several bus stops within a 5 minute walk, which can take you around Sydney, including to Circular Quay, Bondi Beach or Centennial Park and of course you can get anywhere from Central train station. All public transport is close by. On street parking is available and the airport is literally 15 minutes away by cab or train.
access: Everything is yours to enjoy so treat the apartment as your own. Up to 2 x Key Fob and apartment keys will be given to each party or individual to access the apartment, and I will meet you in person or make suitable arrangements if I can not make it.  FAMILY & CHILD-FRIENDLY Accommodation! Baby travel cot, high baby chair and stroller can be provided at additional cost. There is also a laundry/dry cleaners below and they're amazing at ironing! and you can store bags at this location before and after you check in and out. There is no left luggage or luggage storage available at the property before you check in and after you check out. There is a Storage Service in the Laundromat below this building (Sydney Laundry @ 234 Elizabeth St). Costs are definitely the cheapest in Sydney CBD: only $2/day for small bag, $5-6/day for large luggage. Another options: Across the road at Central Station called Smart Carte (5 minutes walk) or World Square Shopping Centre (4 minutes walk).
interaction: You'll be the only guests staying, so enjoy the space! We will be there to welcome you in and answer any questions you might have, then we will be just a quick text or phone call away! Guests will check themselves out and leave keys on the table. All we ask is that you be respectful to our neighbours.  Please note I like to accommodate my guests arrivals and departures as best as possible, just let me know what time you would like to check in and check out and we will do our best to let you stay as long as possible, but at times we will need the apartment to be vacated by 10am and the check in to be after 3pm.  The best way to contact us is via AirBnb. Otherwise you can also reach us via SMS or Mobile when necessary. Rest assured, my response time is pretty much instant. I or a trusted friend will be available leading up to and during your stay to answer any questions you may have.
house_rules: - Welcome to our cozy and comfortable apartment - located in the most convenient location in Sydney CBD!  We want you to feel like home, this is our policy and it worked for a very long time. Many of our guests are friends now and we do keep in touch and visit. If this property is booked, look at the other one which is linked to this one.  Respectful, quiet (no parties) and clean & tidy people are welcomed in my home. NO rowdiness please consider other guests.  The house is always spotless as I am a very proud home owner. I love to socialise but privacy is also respected and assured. Happy to give you directions & ideas about touring Sydney etc. Smoking is only allowed outside if required. Please leave the room as nice and tidy as you found it.  *Key pick-up:* Please text me via Airbnb few days before the check-in date to arrange key pick-up.  *Keys: A LOST KEY WILL BE CHARGED $250 - THIS IS NON NEGOTIABLE FOR WHAT A KEY FOB COSTS TO REPLACE IN THIS BUILDING.   *Check-in time*: Check-i

host.host_about:
We can't live without sunshine, an open mind, kind hearted people, good food and our family. 
We are crazy about the artistry of food and always on the hunt for new creative food experiences, and the Surry Hills/Darlinghurst and CBD are sure bets for all foodies out there!
We love travelling, getting to know new cultures and people.
We try to make each day count. 
We choose to be happy. 
We love my Airbnb experience, both as a host and a traveller and cannot recommend it highly enough.

We are blessed with amazing opportunities everyday, and lucky enough to not work for anyone, instead we manage our own portfolio of properties and our clients'. We are providers of boutique executive and holiday accommodation in popular locations across the city. Our properties are selected for their style, features, luxury, amenities and convenient locations. Our aim is to provide a modern and vibrant approach to short term accommodation. 

We frequently service corporate relocations, business travellers, extended holiday makers and families that prefer “home-style” accommodation with kitchen and laundry facilities. Our properties come complete with linen, towels, kitchenware and free wifi internet.

If you are a property owner or would like to know more please contact us.
