name: Sydney CBD Unique Loft Apartment with WiFi
summary: You will be comfortable in this unique warehouse loft apartment in a historic building in the heart of Sydney CBD, close to Darling Harbour and public transport. Upstairs there are 2 bedrooms/en-suite that we keep for our own use. Downstairs has an expansive living area with a well-equipped kitchen, internal laundry and we offer quality accommodation for 2 in the downstairs double bedroom with its full modern bathroom. It is a safe home away from home to enjoy Sydney's fabulous attractions.
space: The loft apartment is unique in the CBD - - a Heritage listed warehouse conversion, low rise building that used to be a winery in the 1800's; now comprising 21 units, only 10 of which are residential. It has CCTV for security, double glazing to moderate the buzz of the City, and every modern convenience to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. It is a direct train ride from the airport; and within walking distance of all major attractions.

neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is unique: the CBD offers world class restaurants, the iconic Opera House, the renowned Botanic gardens, boutique theatres (e.g. Angel Place; The Genesian; The Ensemble Theatre just across the Harbour Bridge); Darling Harbour is right next to us; striking distance of the historic Rocks precinct if you wish to sample fantastic craft ales and enjoy a pub meal; three Olympic pools and gyms including Cross fit 1 block away, to work off the calories. 7/11 convenience store downstairs.
notes: Please note that there is no lift in this heritage listed building. Please arrange with the host if you would like assistance in carrying luggage and this will be gladly provided. transit: 1 block away from Town Hall train station--a major hub and on the Airport line (25 mins from airport). But if you're keen to explore, the best way is on foot; with major world class attractions, shopping districts, restaurants, movies, opera, art galleries, museums, pools and gyms all withing walking distance.

neighborhood_overview: Dee Why is considered the heart of Sydney's Northern Beaches region, with the beach being the neighbourhood’s main attraction. If you’re looking for a beach holiday without sacrificing proximity to the city, This may be your best choice of Sydney accommodation. The beach stretches 1.8 kilometres, offering plenty of space for both locals and holidaymakers. This gorgeous shoreline is a mecca for couples and families alike with shower facilities, barbecues, a childrens' playground and terrific surfing conditions. The Dee Why SLSC patrol the beach each day. A fantastic bushwalk over the headland provides some sweeping views across the Tasman. If you need a break from the beach sun, head across the street and grab a table at any one of the many local restaurants or cafés with a great view of the surf instead. The beach’s promenade is also a fantastic place for a walk in the evenings.
notes: The flat is best suited to a single or a couple, but within the flat there is a small, somewhat scruffy back storage room with a built-in single bed (listed here as 'bedroom 2', for lack of a better description). This area could be – and has been – used to accommodate a third person (kid, tipsy dinner guest?) should you require it. Refer to the floor plan 'spare' area. It's an older, creaky building and sound travels. You may hear us upstairs to some extent from time to time, and we may hear you.

access: You'll have exclusive run of the whole flat, as well as the large outdoor covered deck area. Also includes the smaller 2nd bedroom (see 'other things to note'). There is a cast iron claw-foot tub in the bathroom for your enjoyment, and laundry washer & dryer within the flat for your use. Small stereo, bedside clock, Foxtel movies on the TV and WiFi complete the package.
interaction: We just live upstairs, and are happy to show you around the neighbourhood or answer any questions you may have. We can give you the 2 minute welcome tour of the flat, or leave you to discover its charms on your own, if you prefer.
house_rules: - This is not a party house. We have neighbours and respect their right to peace.

host.host_about: We are a married couple with young son, and live upstairs. My wife works at the local hospital, and my son works at the bookstore in Westfield Warringah Mall. I am generally around most days, as I work from home as a designer.

name: Absolute harborfront 2-bed luxury heaven MAR SALE!
summary: SALE MAR 27-APR 1!!! Having said that, it's all very child friendly with locks on all windows and toys for a wide range of ages. I love my tech... Music is via new Yamaha Bluetooth soundbar in the living room, G Home in the master bedroom and G Home Mini in the kitchen for music and timers when cooking. No real limits on noise, within reason and sensible hours. TV in living room is new Samsung QLED 55" 4K with 4K subscriptions to Netflix and Stan for 4K/UHD streaming which will blow you away, and master bed TV is Samsung 40" HD panel with a Chromecast for Stan/Netflix/streaming from your own devices

name: Close to park and sea: Light and airy family apt
summary: My renovated 1930's apartment is in a family friendly block of 4 apartments. It is light and airy, has wooden floors, plantation shutters, a second toilet and bifold doors off the kitchen leading out to a garden deck with a lounge and BBQ. It is calm and relaxing and best suited to families looking for a quiet holiday. Everyone seems to enjoy being here, so I hope you do too.
space: My apartment is my sanctuary and much loved home. The apartment is on the first floor and has one set of stairs leading up to the doorway. It has period features including high and decorated ceilings, and lead light windows. The master bedroom has a queen bed and through a door, to the sunroom and study. The sunroom/study has one single bed. The second bedroom, is my son's bedroom and has a King Single bed with Single trundle.  Further down the hall to the rear of the building is the recently renovated and refurbished living area and kitchen. The kitchen opens out through bi fold doors to the outdoor verandah, with outdoor seating a BBQ and a leafy outlook. Please note this apartment is best suited to families, not groups of adults.

neighborhood_overview: Randwick is a large suburb in Sydney's prestigious eastern suburbs and has many notable landmarks including the famous Randwick race course, large university campus, lively and family friendly cafe and restaurant scene, state of the art hospitals and surrounded by the large Centennial Park on one side and the beachside suburbs to the east. Approximately 6-9kms to the CBD, it is well connected by public transport and the perfect base for exploring Sydney.
transit: The 339 Bus Stop is at the end of the block. City bound it will take you to Central Railway, the CBD, Circular Quay and to the steps of the Harbour Bridge. There is a path to walk across the Bridge, and catch a ferry back to Circular Quay. Or catch the 339 beach bound to Clovelly Beach, just a 10 minute bus ride down the hill.  The apartment is walking distance to: - 10 minute walk to Westfield across Queens Park - 5 minute walk to Centennial Park - 10 minute walk to Royal Randwick Shopping Centre - 10 minute walk to Frenchmans Road and the cafes and restaurants there The local 400 bus goes from Bondi Junction to UNSW.
interaction: Our Hosts from AirButler will give you your key and tell you all you need to know about your stay and also guide you to anything you need in the local area. They will also be available to contact for any issues that might arise during your stay.
house_rules: We ask that you treat the apartment as you would your own home.  Absolutely no smoking in the apartment, on the outside terrace or anywhere on the grounds of the apartment block.  Please be mindful of the other tenants in the block.  We are all friends and hope to keep the harmonious atmosphere.

neighborhood_overview: Situated one block back from the famous Manly Beach, this impressive residence combines beach side and luxury living at its best. Manly is the only place to be during Sydney's summer, with it's unlimited beaches, swimming spots, bars, restaurants and activities for all ages. From this family home everything Manly has to offer is on your doorstep - you just need to put on your flip flops and go! If your adventures take you further than Manly, access to the rest of Sydney couldn't be easier with the ferry wharf being a ten minute walk away. Traveling by boat is the best way to get around in Sydney and from Manly Wharf you can get ferries to Circular Quay, Watson's Bay, Darling Harbour and Taronga Zoo. Closer to home the newly built ' Andrew Boy Charlton' swimming pool complex is a few minutes walk away where you will find a 50m pool, a 25m pool, kiddies play pool and steam room/sauna. This property will allow you to embrace everything that Manly, the Northern Beaches and Sydney has to of

neighborhood_overview: Pyrmont is mostly known by outsiders as that one suburb in Sydney with a casino in it. That’s a bit of an unfortunate reputation because the folk that live around here know just how charming and spectacular the booming area can be. By the water there’s newly developed park land that shows off the Sydney’s incredible sandstone cliffs and high-end dining establishments that feed the city’s power offices (both (Hidden by Airbnb) and Fairfax are in the wharfs). Further inland there’s hip cafes like Clementine’s and Miam and a surprisingly multicultural food scene - try Kopitiam for Malaysian, Vic’s Meats for American barbecue, and Willis Canteen for Indonesian.       Then there’s the big draws, the Fish Markets and the Casino itself – not for gambling though, simply because it contains some of best restaurants in Sydney.
notes: Late check-out and early check-in is available where possible. When you arrive at the property you will find a kitchen and bathroom welcome pack with travel size amenities to ensure you do not need to head to the shops on your first day. We also provide top quality linen and towels. Cleaning services are available during your stay at additional cost. Your host has chosen to use the services of MadeComfy to ensure your requirements are met. A MadeComfy concierge service is available to help you with transport, theatre tickets, food and grocery deliveries or any special requests.

Please treat our home with the same love and care you treat yours. We have the following house rules whilst you stay with us: 1. Please be mindful of sound levels after 10:00PM to avoid neighbour complaints. 2. If you break something please let us know to replace it. Please leave your beds unmade Kindly clean up your dishes and put them away In case you have rearranged furniture, please put it back to the original location We would highly appreciate if you could take out the trash Please ensure all appliances and lights are off and doors and windows are close

name: Quiet Terrace on the City Fringe
summary: Welcome to our peaceful little Erskineville terrace.  The spacious and cozy two bedroom terrace house will be the perfect escape during your stay in Sydney.  It's in a secluded and quiet cul-de-sac with virtually no traffic. It's just 4 minutes walk from the station, cafe, restaurants, parks etc. It's only a 15 min taxi from the airport too.  The upstairs bedroom has air-conditioning and the downstairs area is shaded and cool in the summer months.
space: The house is on two levels with a bed and bathroom both on the ground and first floor. The back half of the house is an open plan space leading onto a private courtyard lined with lush plants. Upstairs is reached by a central staircase with a double height ceiling and skylight flooding the house with light. A curtain separates the stairs from the main upstairs bed and ensuite. This room looks onto the numerous trees filling the open space behind the classic Sydney terraces on the block. neighborhood_overview: Here are some of the many places to eat, drink and enjoy near our place. Cafes  It is hard to have a bad cafe experience in Erskineville/Alexandria (let us know if you do). The possibilities are nearly endless and we have only explored a fraction ourselves. These are our regulars: Ella Guru, 104A Swanson St, Erskineville NSW 2043 Closest cafe - very friendly and good value. Toasted sandwiches a great quick lunch. Meet Gerard,  54 Henderson Rd, Alexandria NSW 2015 Further to walk but our favourite by far. Excellent coffee and delicious breakfasts, cakes and sandwiches. If you need to get a train from Redfern Station (e.g. to go to Bondi Junction) then this is a good place to fuel up on caffeine on your walk to the station. Restaurants Again you’ll struggle to find a bad meal. There are a small number of restaurants along Erskineville Road which are all pretty good and if you venture to King Street...well you can have just about anything.  Here are the local places that draw us back agai
notes: Here are few things to be aware of: In most parts of Sydney - especially in summer - it is almost impossible to live completely free of bugs like mosquitoes and cockroaches. We have the house professionally cleaned before your stay and use repellents. However, since the weather suits having the windows and doors open, it is very difficult to completely rid a house of them. We have left some repellent, spray and mosquito coils but otherwise, we hope they don’t disrupt your stay. Sydney can get very hot in the summer months. By keeping blinds down during the day (including the lightwell in the kitchen), and running the fan and leaving windows open at night, it usually stays a very pleasant temperature. There is aircon in the upstairs bedroom if you need it. Unfortunately some years we get a string of super hot days. We do hope the temperature is pleasant for you. This is our home most of the year, so some things might be a little different to professionally run accommodation. We hope tha
transit: Getting there:  5 Ada Street is a short taxi or Uber ride from the airport. We are also a 5 minute walk from Erskineville Station. However, the airport train is about $18 one way (depending on times), so for two people it is often a similar price to take an Uber/taxi, unless you are in the middle of peak hour (around 7:30-9am or 4:30-6:30pm) when traffic is very heavy. Public transport:  There a several train stations at a short walking distance: Erskineville (5 mins), MacDonald Town (10 mins), Newtown (10 mins) and Redfern (20 mins). From Erskineville Station you can take a train directly to Circular Quay and the harbour. You can also take the train to Central (two stops), which has connections to the airport. We encourage you to get an Opal card from a newsagent of seven eleven (there is one just past the station on Erskineville road). This is a pre-paid card that is necessary for many trains and busses and can be used on all public transport including ferries (check fares here (Webs
access: We offer our entire home while we are out of town so there are no off limit areas. Both beds are set up if needed and we supply hotel quality towels. There are a few cupboards we keep off limits for privacy.
interaction: We take a very hands off approach letting guests have as much space and privacy as they need. We give as much info as we can here on Airbnb and my support team will respond  to messages.
house_rules: - This is my home, please treat it as if it were yours, as well! - Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm. -No parties and no smoking. If you disrespect that rule there will be penalty fees. - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, an $80 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, a (up to) $300 fee will apply.

name: BONDI BEACH HIDE AWAY ❤️
summary: The perfect beach pad located a few steps from Sydney's iconic Bondi Beach. Newly renovated, sunlight 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment located on the first floor of an Art Deco building  directly opposite Bondi Beach.  The perfect little apartment to immerse yourself in the Bondi culture.
space: Our super cute 40m2 apartment is set on Campbell Parade and is meters from the famous Bondi Beach, pools and bus stops. Ideally suited for a single traveller or couple, the apartment is cosy and has all the basics you need to explore Bondi.  Surrounded by the best cafes and restaurants, you will have the best Bondi Beach experience in this incredible apartment. - 200 metres from Bondi Beach - Comfortable queen size bed with hotel linens and towels - Air-conditioning with heating and cooling settings - Fully equipped kitchen - Internal laundry with washing machine - Modern furnishings and classy touches

Just bring your bathing suit and come and relax. Whi
neighborhood_overview: Bondi Beach is Australia’s most iconic beach. Reliable waves draw in surfers while, the locals swim in the Icebergs ocean pool year-round. Trendy, health-conscious Sydneysiders head to laid-back cafes and restaurants around Hall Street, while hip backpackers frequent the area's casual pubs. Walkers and joggers use the clifftop Bondi to Coogee Coastal walk, with its amazing scenery. Fun fact: Bondi Beach was a working class suburb throughout most of the twentieth century with migrant people comprising the majority of the local population.
notes: - We only have Chromecast available on our TV as there is an issue with getting reception via an antenna in the apartment.   We'll provide you with instructions on how to setup Chromecast (if you haven't previously used it).  Once downloaded, its super easy to stream NetFlix, Stan, Free TV etc. - Parking can be a bit difficult in Bondi.  We don't have parking on site however paid street parking is available in front and behind our apartment block.  There is also a number of parking stations close by.
transit: Bus stops are directly outside our front door with buses running frequently to Bondi Junction and the CBD.  Look for bus routes (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) .
access: You have access to everything in the apartment.  Just bring your bathing suit and come and relax.
interaction: Whilst we don't have a concierge, I'm available to answer any questions you might have, both pre-stay and during. I try to respond to all questions quickly & I'm available on mobile, SMS and messenger. :)
house_rules: - We have a close relationship with our neighbours.  We ask that you respect our neighbours privacy and monitor noise levels during the night time.   - To reiterate our apartment is also a non smoking area.  If you need to smoke, please smoke outside and dispose your cigarettes afterwards.  - Please leave our home in a clean and respectable state.  Our cleaners will charge extra should the property be left untidy and they are required for a longer than usual period of time.

We are back and forth between Melbourne and Sydney so if you need any pointers on where to start, we will happily share all of our hot spots and awesome tips with you :)
Happy travels!

name: Curl Curl Getaway | Pool & Spacious 4 BR House
summary: Curl Curl Getaway is a modern, spacious 4-bedroom home with all the makings of a dream holiday.  Theres a lot to enjoy here, whether you explore the surrounds, or just sit back and relax by the pool.  This large home includes a new kitchen & laundry, a pool, out-door BBQ and dining and lounge area. It is conveniently located less than 1km from from Sydney's beautiful Curl Curl Beach.
space: On entry your eye is immediately drawn to the inviting pool at the rear of the house. A spacious hallway leads through the formal dining/sitting room to the open plan kitchen and lounge area. Through the doors at the rear you will realise your holiday has begun. Relax in the casual outdoor area where you can watch the kids in the pool all day long. The property boasts an integrated Sonos sound system allowing you to stream your music to multiple speakers around the home using a wireless connection.  The garden and yard is relaxed, private and includes a hot and cold out-door shower which is perfect after a swim or returning from the beach.  The bedrooms are located on the upper floor. As well there is a second TV and lounge area for the kids to escape and have their own space.  The bedroom configurations are a master king size bedroom with ensuite, two queen bedrooms, a fourth bedroom with two King Single beds and a single trundle under each. There is a second bathroom on this upper fl

neighborhood_overview: Curl Curl Getaway is ideally located to take advantage of all the unique attractions the area has to offer. Guest may like to take a stroll or bike ride amongst the picturesque Curl Curl Lagoon which leads you to the beautiful and unspoiled Curl Curl Beach and Cafe. At Curl Curl Beach you will meet the breathtaking ocean board walk. Follow the board walk south and you will come across Freshwater Beach (about 10 mins walking) or head north and it will lead you to a track through coastal bushland to the next beach, shops and restaurants (Dee Why Beach Front). Take a scenic bus ride or easy walk into Manly by following the coast line south. It will take about 20 mins walking over the headland to get into the heart of Manly and the Corso. There are companies in Manly who offer all kinds of adventurous sporting activities such as kayaking, Stand-up paddle boarding, snorkelling and scuba diving, whale watching (when the season is right), bike tours and ocean adventures. To get into the city
notes: The garage will be locked during the stay but parking is available on the premises on the driveway for 2 cars and 1 additional over the driveway on the street. There is ample parking on the street. There is no Dryer available at this property, but ample hanging space for your clothes is provided. Please note that dining table and chairs will be available outside under cover for your stay. Currently on order! Kitchen and laundry are new.
transit: Public transport is very convenient. A bus stop close by can take you to the shopping mall or to Manly Wharf. For transport by bus - Sydney Buses mainly need Opal cards which are obtained from local newsagents. A 10 minute bus trip will get you to Manly where you can catch a ferry into the city which will take about 30 minutes. The regular Manly Fast Ferry takes 18 mins to get to the city. Sydney Ferries (State run) depart every 30 minutes.
access: Guests will have access to the laundry (no dryer) and appliances as outlined in the welcome manual. Garage is not available, however, there is off street parking and parking on street is ample.
interaction: Our Airbnb home manager Katie will meet you for your check-in and can be contacted between 7am and 7pm daily if required.
house_rules: Please strictly follow rules regarding air-conditioner unit (provided in welcome manual on arrival) as misuse will damage it at cost to guests. This home is for family group bookings only. Food and shoes are not allowed on the upper level.

neighborhood_overview: Zetland is an inner-eastern suburb of Sydney, NSW, Australia about 4 kilometres south of the CBD, in the local government area of the City of Sydney.  The East Village shopping centre is very modern and has Coles Groceries, butchers, fishmonger, bakeries, cafes, restaurants etc.  There are also many nearby parks, with some that are leash free for dogs. There are also basketball courts, bbq areas, a library and several children's play grounds.
notes: It’s worth noting Sydney does have a tropical climate, and so there may be a few bugs about in any property you stay in - nothing that would negatively impact your stay though!
transit: Zetland is an excellent suburb for transport. TRAINS are at Green Station which is 1km away and would take about 12 mins to walk there - or about $10 in a taxi or uber. Green Station also takes you directly to domestic and international airports. BUSES TO CITY are within 3 min walk from apartment and TAXIS are 5 mins walk away - approximately $25 to get to airport in 10 mins. CAR SHARE - Go Get is a car-share company and has many cars available in Zetland within walking distance.

name: Architecturally designed studio
summary: This architecturally designed furnished studio apartment is east facing with ample natural light, open plan living, a well equipped kitchen including cooktop, oven and full size fridge/freezer, fan and reverse cycle air conditioning, wifi, TV and laundry facility including washing machine and trough and a small balcony. Moments from Danks St and Redfern St shops and restaurants. Sydney Cricket Ground, The Entertainment Quarter, Centennial Park and Randwick Racecourse all within a 3km radius.
space: This studio apartment is architecturally appointed with cleverly detailed spaces to feel light and spacious. The bathroom is located on the lower floor. It is newly built, a modern clean space with a very large shower, toilet and marble basin. There is a clothes washer and laundry sink also located in the bathroom.  The bathroom has towels, soap, shampoo, limited toiletries. It contains a clothes rack, iron and ironing board. The kitchen and sleeping is upstairs in a locked room above the garage. The kitchen has a beautiful cement bench top. There is a full size cook top and oven and a full size fridge. Coffee and selection of teas and breakfast spreads are supplied.

neighborhood_overview: Waterloo is a suburb on the fringe of Sydney City. it boarders Surry Hills, Redfern, Moore Park, Alexandria, Zetland and Rosebery. It is a mixture of luxury apartments, large terrace houses, light industrial and council housing. The housing is as eclectic as the people. It has a well know cafe strip Dank Street which has many lovely galleries, cafes, restaurants and bars.
transit: Arriving from the airport. It is similar if not cheaper to catch a taxi than the train for 2 people. It will be around $25-$30. Buses and trains require an Opal card available from newsagents etc. Best to look up on the internet. There is a bus 50m away on Elizabeth Street (route 343) that takes you into the city. This bus route stretches from Chatswood to Eastgardens. Redfern train station is a 10min 1km walk away. Central Railway station is a 15min 1.5km walk away.  There is NO onsite parking but the streets around the property are a mixture of timed and untimed parking. There is often parking available.
access: The studio is entered through the garage door. The garage is used by Kristin the owner of the main house so there is no parking available on the property. As the studio is above the garage there will be some noise in the room upstairs when the garage door is opened. You may cross paths with Kristin while accessing the studio and the bathroom which is located downstairs behind the parking space.
interaction: The studio is self contained and there is limited interaction between host and  guests. Arrangements, questions and any issues should be firstly directed to Nichola who is your main contact. If you are unable to contact Nichola then please ask Kristin.

You can relax and enjoy morning sunshine or afternoon tea on the large and airy balcony.  This place is close to Roseville College, and Roseville is a very friendly and peaceful neighborhood in Upper North Sydney.  If you are a new comer or tourist to Sydney, it is super safe and convenient to live here. Oh, if you like shopping, you cannot miss the famous Chatswood CBD, which is just 5 minute drive from here!

name: LUXICO - Vaucluse Manor
summary: Offering all the glamour and class of a seductive Mediterranean-style coastal lifestyle where curvaceous terraces, stately columns, tropical gardens, harbour views, poolside entertaining and generous indoor living awaits. Vaucluse Manor delivers on coastal luxury with a prestigious Vaucluse location and is just a casual stroll from beaches and Sydney harbour. No matter the season, this private two-storey family home is the ideal restful beachside escape.
space: Vaucluse Manor is quick to impress you with its striking entrance, curved architecture and irresistible harbour views. There’s no better place to enjoy those views than on the ground floor’s curved terrace. This space is made for relaxation, whether you settle in for a sumptuous brunch, BBQ or evening drink. Indeed, you’re spoilt for choice when it comes to dining. You have a formal dining room off the entrance that provides seating for up to 12 guests, while a dining area off the classic white kitchen has access to the terrace and is bathed in natural light via a wall of windows and doors. The kitchen offers high-end appliances and plenty of bench space, making meal preparations a breeze. In the two living rooms, curved walls of windows provide views of the harbour beyond and pool below. In the informal living room, cool nights can be spent around the fire, while the formal living area is the place to retreat after an evening on the terrace.  There are four bedrooms on the ground floo

neighborhood_overview: Located just a 10-minute walk from beautiful Parsley Bay Beach and within walking distance to Kutti Beach, harbour parks, bush tracks and local cafes and shops, everything you need is close by. Historic Watsons Bay Village is a quick car trip, as is the stunning coastline and historic buildings of South Head. If you want to travel to the CBD, there’s a bus stop right on your doorstep, while a car trip to the city will take around 30 minutes. And if you want to see more of the picturesque harbour, simply catch a ferry from Watsons Bay Wharf.
notes: Bookings made via AirBNB are subject to the standard booking terms and conditions displayed on the Luxico Holiday Homes website. Payment of your deposit constitutes acceptance of our terms and conditions. Please contact us if you would like a copy of these terms prior to booking. For security reasons, a copy of your Australian Drivers License or International Passport is required prior to check-in along with confirmed names for all guests staying at the property along with a signed Booking Agreement before access details can be provided. This is not negotiable! Please don’t book with us if you are not comfortable providing this information.
access: All Luxico guests receive a bottle of bubbles in the fridge plus a gourmet welcome hamper including tea, coffee, jams, muesli, milk and some tasty treats. We supply luxury toiletries and towels and our beds are made up with top quality linen ensuring a comfortable stay.
interaction: One of our superhosts will meet you at the property to hand over keys and answer any queries you may have about the home. Our 24/7 concierge team are on hand to help you with any special requests during your stay.
house_rules: - STRICTLY NO PARTIES. $5000 PENALTY (refer to terms and conditions) - No smoking inside the house - Please respect our neighbours. Fines may apply for excessive noise if reported - If you break something, please let us know so that we can replace it for the next guests

host.host_about:
Why stay in a hotel when you can enjoy the space and amenity of a designer home?

Luxico manages designer and luxury homes across Melbourne, Sydney, Palm Beach, Byron Bay, Noosa and the Mornington Peninsula with many new locations coming in 2018.

All Luxico homes are  fully equipped with 5-star linens, towels, luxury toiletries, gourmet welcome hampers, free Wi-Fi and all the essential items that you will require during your stay.

Luxico's Housekeeping and Concierge Services teams are on hand to assist with airport transfers, grocery deliveries, catering, extra cleaning and anything else you might require.

Guests travelling with children can request toys, activities, travel cots and high chairs, whilst pet owners have a number of great properties to choose from with doggy beds, water bowls and other items provided to minimize your luggage.

host.host_location: Surry Hills, New South Wales, Australia
host.host_about: I bought the building in 1996 in a very run down state. It was originally a grand Victorian Terrace and had been divided into 5 flats with shared bathrooms.  I embarked on a full renovation with my builder and later employer Michael Wagstaffe which included building another level on top where I now live. I decided to trial Airbnb in mid 2017 in the smallest apartment which has been very successful. In December 2017 apartment 5 became vacant so I upgraded  it for Airbnb to be ready for NYE. I   have installed double glazing and acoustic flooring to make my guests stay as comfortable as possible.  My building is in  vibrant Surry Hills so you can step out the door and find restaurants and bars a plenty than come back to peace and quiet. I try to give the best service possible to my guests.

host.host_about:
Hi there!
My name’s Tim andI live with my partner Liz in Sydney.

I have recently returned from living in London for 2 years. I have traveled alot in the UK and Europe using Airbnb, I now welcome you to stay in my apartment!

I have lived in Sydney most of my life and I invite you to stay in my flat to see my beautiful city. I can give you travel tips and where to eat!

I work in Environmnetal Management but I have worked in several sectors from Recycling, to Governance, Pizza Delivery and McDonalds!

I love to watch football (or soccer here in Aus), binge on Netflix and  youtube. I love to go camping around Sydney too.

name: Beautiful Bondi Beachside Home
summary: This beautiful sun-filled, renovated and fully furnished three bedroom house is right in the heart of Bondi Beach, a three minute walk to the cafes, bars and shops, and a five minute walk to the beach. The house has three bedrooms opening to a brand new open plan kitchen and family room, with bi-folds that open to a deck and garden. High ceilings, polished floorboards and white shutters make this a beautiful beachside home. It is baby and child friendly (cot, high chair, and toys available).

No noise, and the sound of birds, yet five minute walk to everything. It is very light and airy. Also includes: - Generously proportioned living, dining & kitchen with a wonderful flow of space; - Brand new induction kitchen with dishwasher; - 3 large bedrooms. name: Camp Cove Tropical Retreat at Watsons Bay
summary: A spacious contemporary apartment with a large under cover verandah, and private tropical garden and pool. The newly renovated space is located a 1 minute walk to beautiful Camp Cove Beach and a 5 minute walk to the ferry. The living area is filled with natural light and looks out to a beautiful and tranquil palm-filled garden.
space: Access is via outdoor stairs down the side of the house, through a secure gate leading onto the veranda and garden.  Enjoy the luxury of a king-size bed and hotel quality linen.   The galley kitchen is equipped with microwave, an electric cooktop, espresso machine, kettle, toaster, plunger coffee & tea pot.  A Weber gas barbecue is located on the outdoor verandah.
description: A spacious contemporary apartment with a large under cover verandah, and private tropical garden and pool. The newly renovated space is located a 1 minute walk to beautiful Camp Cove Beach and a 5 minute walk to the ferry. The living area is filled with natural light and looks out to a beautiful and tranquil palm-filled garden. Access is via outdoor stairs down the side of the house, through a secure gate leading onto the veranda and garden.  Enjoy the luxury of a king-size bed and hotel quality linen.   The galley kitchen is equipped with microwave, an electric cooktop, espresso machine, kettle, toaster, plunger coffee & tea pot.  A Weber gas barbecue is located on the outdoor verandah. The pool and garden are for your private  use during your stay.   Use of the pool is restricted to 10pm. Please respect our neighbours by keeping noise to a minimum. After a swim or a day on the beach please use the outdoor shower (hot & cold) at the top of the stairs. We would like you to feel at home
neighborhood_overview: Watsons Bay is a destination suburb with beautiful beaches, coastal walks, and several popular local restaurants and coffee shops. It is home to the iconic Doyle's beachfront seafood restaurant and the Watsons Bay Hotel.
notes: The kitchen larder and fridge is stocked with a selection of delicious breakfast items including fresh baked crusty bread, cereal, muesli, fruit juice & yoghurt.  There is espresso and plunger coffee and a selection of Twinings teas.  And the bottle wine is with our compliments.
transit: Watsons Bay is easily accessible by public transport as well as car. Frequent ferries run to the Sydney CBD, Manly, Milson's Point, Balmain and Barangaroo. It is also serviced by several regular bus routes.
access: The pool and garden are for your private  use during your stay.   Use of the pool is restricted to 10pm. Please respect our neighbours by keeping noise to a minimum. After a swim or a day on the beach please use the outdoor shower (hot & cold) at the top of the stairs.
interaction: We would like you to feel at home during your stay and therefore respect your privacy.  However if at any time you need assistance or have questions please contact us by mobile (our numbers are in the compendium), or knock on the front door.
house_rules: Guests must seek permission from Host prior to inviting friends to the property. Pool not to be used after 9pm

host.host_location: Watsons Bay, New South Wales, Australia
host.host_about: I have enjoyed a career in accommodation hospitality for over 40 years managing hotels in Melbourne and regional cities in Victoria and NSW.  I am now semi-retired living in Sydney and have just started operating a fantastic little B&B property in the Eastern Suburbs.   Both my partner & I have had busy careers (she is an architect) and we both have grown up families.  We are now at a stage in our lives where we have the freedom and opportunity to enjoy travel and all the good things in life.

name: Bondi Beach Large Studio with Ocean Views
summary: Embracing the idyllic oceanfront lifestyle of a superb location, this large studio features sun-drenched, open-plan living space with beautiful partial ocean and beach views.
space: Set back from the road on the eastern side of the landmark Bondi Pacific Tower, the studio captures superb partial views over the beach and ocean, and features convenient dual access with an alternative entry via Notts Avenue to the beach, Icebergs Pool and the Bondi to Coogee coastal walk. Enviably positioned on the southern end of the golden stretch of Bondi Beach, it is just a leisurely stroll to the popular cosmopolitan strip of local shops, trendy restaurants, cafes and CBD bus transport. The Features: • 1 x Bedroom • 1 x Bathroom • 1 min to Bondi Beach • Beautiful partial ocean and beach views  • Right next to Bondi Icebergs and pool • 55 inch Smart TV with unlimited complimentary Netflix • Bluetooth speakers  • Unlimited Wi-Fi • Fully equipped kitchen with stove top, oven, fridge/freezer, microwave, kettle and toaster  • Dining table with seating for 4 • Electric heating • Pedestal fan with remote control  plus cross ventilation and cool ocean breeze • Vacuum cleaner, iron, iron

neighborhood_overview: Worldly famous Bondi Beach offers a great choice of Hipsters cafes and restaurants, trendy boutiques and a super cool Sunday market. Walk down Campbell Parade to immerse yourself in the Bondi bubble. Get a take away coffee across the road at Bondi Massive, breakfast with a view at Trio Cafe, a healthy Middle Eastern pita bread for lunch at Sababbah and some tasty Asian Fusion tapas at China Diner or a traditional simple but really tasty pizza or pasta at Gelbison. Finish up with an amazing 'Specials board' gelato at Messina or.. if you are young, free and fabulous, or want to mingle with the locals, grab a drink at Bondi Hardware or Cafe Bikini.
notes: Please get in touch in advance if you wish to book undercover parking space subject to availability It costs an extra $20/day.
transit: Bus stop is located directly to the front right of the building. Jump on the 333, 380 or 381 to get to Westfield's Bondi Junction where you can find all the exclusive shops or Bondi Junction Train Station. The 333, 380 bus takes you to the City all the way to Circular Quay to the Opera House approximately 30-40 minutes From Circular Quay you can catch the Ferry to Mosman, Balmoral Beach, Manly, Birkenhead Point - Sydney's largest outlet shopping centre.
access: Fresh quality bed linen and bath towels are provided. Bring your own beach towels. 2 folding beach chair are provided.  We also provide Nescafe, tea, sugar, milk, biscuits, shared bathroom essentials including Full Size shampoo, conditioner, body wash, soap and body lotion. Guests can also help themselves to cooking condiments, cleaning / washing products, and whatever else is available at the property.
interaction: We will check you in and will be just a phone call away to help with anything you need throughout your stay. :) Self check in also available.

name: Exquisitely Elegant Sydney Apartment
summary: View the dazzling Sydney skyline from the comfort of the private balcony of this elegant flat. Stretch out in the modern, comfy living room or unwind in the marble bathroom. Guests have access to the entire property which includes a pool and gym.
space: This lovely apartment is located in the heart of Sydney.  This hotelesque apartment is perfect hideaway for your time in Sydney -  whether it be for business or leisure. There is a fully equipped kitchen with all your basic cooking needs - equipped with cutlery, crockery, pots and pans. You will also have access to your own washing and drying machine. The spacious living area consists of a dining room table and a large smart tv -accompanied with a sofa which is perfect for kicking back and relaxing. The bedroom has a comfy queen sized bed and is attached to a huge beautiful marble bathroom. Perhaps the most pronounced aspect of this apartment is the huge balcony, which is perfect for al fresco dining. Then you can unwind on the Balcony sofas and watch the Sydney lights glitter.
description: View the dazzling Sydney skyline from the comfort of the private balcony of this elegant flat. Stretch out in the modern, comfy living room or unwind in the marble bathroom. Guests have access to the entire property which includes a pool and gym.
neighborhood_overview: Walk everywhere!  It is an easy 10-minute stroll to the Sydney Opera House. Other nearby attractions include the Sydney Harbour Bridge, Royal Botanic Gardens, Sydney Observatory, Barangaroo Reserve, Hyde Park, and Chinatown.
notes: There is very limited 15 minute parking outside on Kent street,
transit: My apartment is located in theart of Sydney CBD it is only 5 minutes from Circular Quay Station or alternatively bus stops are located all around the area. Failing that feel free to catch a ferry across the Harbour
access: Guests have access to the entire property - as well as a pool and gym.
interaction: I wont be available in person - but I will be available through the Airbnb guest messaging platform 24/7
house_rules: - No noise after 10pm. - Please remember that if the keys are locked in the apartment at some point of your stay or after check-out, we might need to call a locksmith or have the keys replaced and this will need to be charged to your account. - Please remember that our property is located in a tropical country and therefore some small insects such as mosquitoes and cockroaches are present in the area. We love the warmth of summer and so do these bugs. Be careful with leaving food behind and/or with leaving windows and doors open at night as these critters will find their way in. We do our utmost best to prevent this, but please do not be alarmed if one is sighted and simply inform us and we will make sure we do our best to help you - Please respect the 10am check-out time, if our housekeepers are not able to do the cleaning on time, we may need to charge you a delayed entry fee. Please do send us a message if you wish to check out late and we will do our best to help you.

host.host_about:
Hi I am semi-retired ,have lived in Australia since 1979 coming from New Zealand, with my husband Ralph and two boys.
We sold a Business within the building industry last year which we ran together for 35 yrs, Ralph being a ex builder and myself out of admin work .
We love sailing, travelling , gardening, swimming, bushwalking, catching up with friends and spending time with our grandchildren also a glass or two of nice wine.
We both love the contact with Air B and B and the people we meet, we just want to be good at it and enjoy the journey.

host.host_about:
My team and I at The Apartment Service are proud to have been helping people with short and long stay apartment rentals across Sydney since 1989. 

Property professionals say location is everything and we believe that a convenient location is essential, especially in the rental market. We can offer you some of the best locations accross all the major areas of Sydney, and all of our  apartments are carefully selected for their proximity to cafes, key business and retail districts, public transport, and tourist hotspots.

Furnished apartments are a cost-effective alternative to five star hotels and have the added advantage of feeling like you are staying in your own home with separate lounges, kitchens and laundries, and modern appliances.

We've found Airbnb to be a perfect fit for our apartments and we're proud to have achieved a high volume of 5 star reviews consistently since joining. 

Please don't hesitate to view our 150+ properties listed on Airbnb across all areas of Sydney, and do get in touch for quick and friendly assistance.

name: Luxurious One Bedroom Apartment in Kings Cross
summary: Beautiful, large one bedroom apartment in the heart of Kings Cross! Located at the top of Bayswater Road, right by the famous Coke sign, is a well appointed one bedroom apartment with all the amenities you may need!  All guest are welcome!
space: The apartment contains all amenities that you may need including an internal laundry with washing machine and dryer.  The kitchen is stocked with all necessary appliances/crockery/cutlery and pots and pans. The convenience of the Coles located next door means that you have the choice to cook your own meals at home.  The bedroom is large and there will be hangers provided for your clothes. The bedroom can be separated from the main apartment with sliding doors or can be left open for a more spacious feel.  The apartment does not have an outdoor area and looks into an internal courtyard so does not have a view. However, given this, it is so quiet at night despite it's location! There is a tv fitted with an Apple TV, a chrome cast and a set top box, so feel free to connect your own Netflix so you can continue right where you left off with your favourite shows! There are innumerable great restaurants in the area, ranging from easy take away or more up market restaurants just down the road

name: Tranquil beach home with pool & ocean glimpses
summary: This private, sunny family home on Sydney's Northern Beaches offers beautiful glimpses of the sea down the coastline, in amongst lush bushland. With a light-filled open living, dining and kitchen area leading onto the large upstairs deck, this pet-friendly, family holiday home presents amazing opportunities to enjoy the tranquility. There's no better place to escape the madness of life! Just minutes from various, equally glorious beaches, and a selection of delectable cafes and restaurants.
space: Relax on the upstairs deck, overlooking the lush green landscape that Bilgola is renowned for, while catching glimpses of the beautiful blue ocean.  Enjoy a family BBQ on the shaded downstairs patio, or spend a chilled evening around the open fire pit. Take in the peace and quiet while relaxing in the sun-soaked formal lounge, or choose between watching family movies on the oversized, comfy couch and playing board games in the spacious rumpus room. Very private setting, surrounded by lovely gardens. The near-flat lawn is perfect for the kids to play on. Go for a  dip in the glistening salt-water pool or sunbathe on the lounges.
description: This private, sunny family home on Sydney's Northern Beaches offers beautiful glimpses of the sea down the coastline, in amongst lush bushland. With a light-filled open living, dining and kitchen area leading onto the large upstairs deck, this pet-friendly, family holiday home presents amazing opportunities to enjoy the tranquility. There's no better place to escape the madness of life! Just minutes from various, equally glorious beaches, and a selection of delectable cafes and restaurants. Relax on the upstairs deck, overlooking the lush green landscape that Bilgola is renowned for, while catching glimpses of the beautiful blue ocean.  Enjoy a family BBQ on the shaded downstairs patio, or spend a chilled evening around the open fire pit. Take in the peace and quiet while relaxing in the sun-soaked formal lounge, or choose between watching family movies on the oversized, comfy couch and playing board games in the spacious rumpus room. Very private setting, surrounded by lovely gardens.
neighborhood_overview: Bilgola Plateau is a small delightful community which sits on top of a hill between Newport & Avalon, with some spectacular views of water and bushland. It is never crowded, has a couple of lovely coffee shops & delis and is only five minutes to just about everywhere.
notes: We respect our neighbours and trust that our guests will do the same. Well-trained, well behaved pets are welcome.
transit: You may be tempted to just stay in when you are here but then you'd miss out on exploring all the beautiful local beaches with their golden sand and crystal clear warm water - Newport, Clareville & Bilgola are only 5 minutes drive away, and Palm Beach and Monavale not even 10 minutes.  For local shopping & dining, Avalon & Newport are on your doorstep. We'll even supply a local parking permit so that you don't have to worry about how long to spend enjoying yourself while you're out and about!
access: Make yourselves at home! We want our home to be your home-away-from-home while you are here. You have access to the pool, garden and entire house with the exception of our locked storage sheds. Upstairs has three spacious bedrooms with the fourth bedroom situated downstairs.   The upstairs deck and downstairs fire pit area seat 8 comfortably,  while the BBQ area downstairs has a table that seats 10. Superb kitchen with all mod cons and two separate lounge areas, both with TVs.  Bread, milk and other breakfast provisions await you upon your arrival. We provide fresh flowers, candles, and essential toiletries. There are both bath and beach towels available for your use. Our TV has Foxtel (with all sports channels)  and Wifi is available. Fans are provided in all rooms.
interaction: Glorious beaches, plus the delights of Avalon, Newport & Clareville within 5 minutes drive. The perfect holiday destination that will feel like you are hours away from Sydney when you're not!

Try Farinha Pizzas e Massas Restaurant and many more just around the corner. Head along the famous Eastern Suburbs coastal walk down to Coogee Beach where you can dine at your pick of café along Coogee Bay road or pick up supplies from Woolworths supermarket if you’d rather cook up a feast at home. If you happen to visit on New Years Eve enjoy great views of the Coogee fireworks from Blenheim Park, a few minutes up the road. The living area has a coffee table, smart TV and a sofa convertable to a very double comfortable bed. Bedding and linen supplied - pillows, quilt blanket, towels etc. The bathroom has a double bath as well as a shower.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in a very convenient location within walking distance to Kingsford's many restaurants and cafes.  South Juniors Club and its restaurants, gym, pool and entertainment facilities is directly across the road. University of NSW and NIDA are within walking distance (15-20 minutes).  Randwick’s vibrant shopping precinct surrounded by an array of high street shops, boutiques, cafes and restaurants is also very close and easy to get to by either a longer walk, or short bus ride. This also applies to the Spot precinct with its Ritz cinema and Maroubra junction shopping precinct. A direct short bus ride to Royal Randwick Racecourse, three major hospitals, Allianz Stadium, Sydney Cricket Ground, Coogee and Maroubra Beaches and Westfield Eastgardens shopping centre
notes: The apartment is fully self contained and there are no shared spaces, it is however at the front (attached) to the main house where the hosts live. This is a pet friendly property. The owners cat has a tendency to visit if windows are open, for this reason it is not suitable for people with pet related allergies.
transit: Public transport is easy with Kingsford Five Ways just a short walk away with its many buses going frequently in many directions.  If driving off street parking is easy during the day, or a space can be made available on the driveway in front of the house.

interaction: The hosts live at the back of the house and can be contacted by email, text or mobile at any time.

neighborhood_overview: Kings Cross, Potts Point is known for nightlife, especially the neon-lit clubs and bars of Kings Cross. Daytime brings a buzzing cafe scene, with locals heading to Macleay Street for bistro brunches and edgy fashion. On Sundays, Kings Cross Market is filled with craft vendors and food stalls. Nearby, Llankelly Place is a foodie hub of hip multicultural eateries, while Victoria Street has backpacker pubs amid terraced houses. It sits on a ridge immediately east of Woolloomooloo, west of Elizabeth Bay and Rushcutters Bay and north of Darlinghurst. The suburb has a roughly trapezoidal shape, and at its greatest extent is no more than one kilometre long by 200 metres wide. Potts Point's eastern boundary is Macleay Street. The suburb's other boundaries include Darlinghurst Road to the southeast, William Street to the south, Brougham Street and part of Cowper Road to the west. ---Wiki & (Hidden by Airbnb) maps
notes: This is not a party house.
transit: Bus & Kings Cross station just near by
interaction: My phone always on. I can easily be reached by phone or texts

name: Luxury Waterloo Apartment - Resort Style Living
summary: The perfect base for exploring the best Sydney has to offer! Perfectly located in the cosmopolitan suburb of Waterloo, 3.5km from Sydney CBD & one stop from Sydney Airport & Central Stations. Experience a relaxing stay in our stylish apartment featuring an abundance of space & natural light. Enjoy convenient access to everything you love with resort style living. You’ll love our place for the location, the facilities & the neighbourhood. Great for a small family, couples, & business travellers.
space: Welcome to the comfort of our beautiful, stylish and spacious apartment home, with all of the amenities of resort style living.  Nestled in the cosmopolitan suburb of Waterloo, explore Sydney's most iconic landmarks from the Sydney Harbour Bridge to the Opera House, or venture out to the spectacular eastern suburbs beaches, then head home after a day of adventure for a dip in the outdoor lap pool and a sizzling BBQ on your open air private balcony. Our modern, open plan apartment features a large master bedroom with built in robes and ensuite. Second bedroom with built in robes and main bathroom. Laundry facilities, air conditioning, onsite gym and swimming pool.  There is also a 42" TV in the living room and panasonic music player. The kitchen has everything you would need to cook with. But there's plenty of eateries to tempt your tastebuds right on your doorstep!

name: Sydney City Pad
summary: *Open plan in the heart of trendy, vibrant Darlinghurst *Newly furnished and designed by Sydney-based Interior Designers *Sleeps 4 with full kitchen, laundry & bathroom facilities *Moments from Oxford Street, Hyde Park & Kings Cross Train Station *Eateries, bars, galleries, shops and more in the immediate local area *Neighbouring trendy suburbs of Paddington, Surry Hills & Double Bay
space: Designed with the traveller in mind, this inner city apartment offers the perfect balance of relaxation and excitement for your stay. Ideal for singles, couples, groups and business travellers. This space has been created by Interior Designers to strike a balance between beauty, comfort and functionality. The open-plan layout features distinct dining, lounge and work areas. There is a private bedroom with a Queen bed, a balcony, storage and the bathroom is next door. There is a fully equipped kitchen with a SMEG kettle, gas cooktop and oven, drawer dishwasher, fridge, sandwich press and all the utensils you might need to make good use of it! The pantry is stocked with condiments, plenty of tea and more. Note, if you would like eggs and milk to be provided for the beginning of your stay please let me know (or you can try one of Darlinghurst’s amazing breakfast spots nearby)! The enclosed laundry area is equipped with washer, dryer, iron board and iron. The beautiful marble dining table

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is very conveniently located, less than a kilometre from Kings Cross station, just 400m from Oxford Street, around the corner from trendy Stanley Street cafes and 550m from Sydney’s iconic Hyde Park! Darlinghurst is one of Sydney’s most diverse and cosmopolitan suburbs, featuring hole-in-the-walls, galleries, bars, shops and more. Other nearby locations not to miss are the Australian Museum, the Art Gallery of NSW and the Boy Charlton Pool. Whether you’re looking for great live music, want to learn about Sydney’s history or want to shop in Sydney like a local, this is the place to be. We live locally and are always trying new places so please ask for suggestions!
notes: Please note that you will need to walk up a flight of stairs. Please also note there is currently renovations occurring in neighbouring buildings, but this is only during working hours per local council laws.
transit: To get here, you can catch a train from the airport to Kings Cross train station for $18 and walk to the apartment (if you are more than one, a cab is about $40). There are also shuttle buses to Kings Cross. Darlinghurst is very walkable, and you can always opt to get public transport to many of Sydney's best locations nearby.
access: We supply high quality toiletries, towels, linen and amenities. Cleaning services are available during your stay at an additional cost. Private, secure entrance.
interaction: I am available by phone, email or in person throughout your stay so please don’t hesitate to contact me! We live nearby and are available for check-in at your your convenience after 3pm. Please let us know your approximate time of arrival when you book and closer to your booking. Check out is 11am to allow for cleaning services.

The penalty of $300 applies as it can leave an unpleasant smell and can make next guest's stay uncomfortable. - Professional cleaning charges of $25 per item apply if blood or any other bodily fluids are found in towels, bedsheets, pillowcases, blankets or any other surfaces. - A penalty of $200 applies for playing music or making loud noises outside the house after 10 pm.

name: Drummoyne oasis, close to the bay
summary: Head to the City using Sydney Ferries, from Chiswick wharf. Just up the street visit local cafes and restaurants of varying cuisines, and Birkenhead Point is a famous outlet shopping centre located on the bay in Drummoyne. The local bay run is a famous 7km running track nearby. Feel free to stop along the way in Lilyfield or Rozelle at one of the many cafes, or why not have a drink at the UTS Rowing Club on the deck. Drummoyne Oval and a bay walk are located 2-5 minutes away by foot.
space: Dine outside on the beautiful deck and have a BBQ overlooking the trees, or sit inside in the loungeroom with the air conditioning. Whatever tickles your fancy, the house has all the space you need.  With a bathroom upstairs and downstairs, a kitchen with a Nespresso machine, a full laundry with dryer, our place is sure to make you feel at home within moments.  Off street parking for two cars is available on the driveway.

It is a trendy area with many organic and raw cafes too.  This steps up a level in the surrounding suburbs, a stone-throw away like Balmain and Rozelle.  The City of Sydney is 15 minutes away by bus or ferry.  The ferry wharf is a 15 minute scenic walk from our home. Download the TripView App for access to public transport options.
interaction: I will greet you to hand over the keys and give you a quick run down on the place.
house_rules: Please avoid long showers of more than five minutes in the upstairs bathroom, as the modern shower screen creates a flooding issue. Only open the upstairs balcony door if a breeze is required.  Before departure, ensure all dishes are washed and put away, bins are emptied and house is left neat and tidy.  Strictly no parties.  A small gathering is permitted but no uninvited Airbnb guests can attend unless prior approval.    No music after 10:30pm as it is a quiet neighbourhood. The dining table permanently stains easily. Please use the protective table cloth at all times to avoid stains. The bond cannot be released if these rules aren’t met. Thank you!

Ideally located with access to various modes of transport and walking distance to a shopping centre, restaurants, cafes and pubs.
space: The space is suited to 1-2 adults with a comfy queen sized bed, lounge space containing a big screen TV and laptop desk with unlimited wi-fi.  The ensuite bathroom has a large rain shower, fluffy towels and a hairdryer.  A kitchenette with bar fridge, toaster & kettle, microwave and sink with some basic supplies.  An iron and ironing board, hangers and hanging space is also provided. A quiet, bright airy space with block out blinds for privacy and sleeping. Reverse cycle air-conditioning to keep cool in summer and warm in winter!

The rear lane is well lit at night with a s
neighborhood_overview: Leichhardt is located in Sydney’s Inner West approximately 6km from the CBD. Famously known in the past as “Little Italy” for it’s Italian culture and restaurants, there is now a much more varied selection of dining options available. We are a 3 minute walk from the local shopping centre, Leichhardt Marketplace that has Woolworths, Aldi, a bottle shop, Chemist, Butcher, Grocer/Deli, Bakery and specialty stores/services.  Cafes, a pub, restaurants and laundromat are located a short 5 minute walk away on Marion Street, Leichhardt. A 10 minute walk will get you to the famous Norton Street where there is a vibrant selection of pubs, restaurants, cafes, wine bars, bookstore, cinema and specialty stores. Leichhardt is a convenient suburb with easy access to all modes of transport to get you around Sydney and its sights from Bondi to the City and to The Blue Mountains!
notes: Located in the inner west suburb of Leichhardt, we are subject to some aircraft noise.  As Sydney airport is under a curfew there isn’t any aircraft movement between the hours of 11:00pm and 6:00am. Check In: 2:00pm Check Out: 10:00am Early check in and late check out is possible subject to availability.  Please note, there is a security surveillance camera on the entry gate from the rear lane.
transit: Trains, buses and the light rail are all within walking distance from the Studio. The train is a short 5-10 minute walk away and is a 14 minute ride to the CBD. Alternatively the light rail is a 10 minute walk away and the bus stops are a 3-5 minute walk away depending on where you want to go. A taxi to/from Sydney airport is approximately $35 to $45. Unmetered street parking is available if you are travelling with a vehicle. We can provide you with a map of where to park in close proximity to the studio.
access: Located at the rear of the property above our garage, private access is via a secure digital entry gate to the studio. The rear lane is well lit at night with a street light directly above our gate and a sensor light in the side passage entryway. With private digital entry you can come and go as you please.  Unmetered street parking is available in surrounding streets if you have a vehicle.  Note there is a narrow staircase of 17 steps up to the studio, please refer to images.
interaction: Being a young working family, we come and go from the main house throughout the day however are just a phone call away. We are happy to assist with any advice on local attractions, dining, amenities and transport. A smooth and simple check in and check out with all digital entry, the exchange of keys is not required.
house_rules: - No Smoking in the studio or on the property. - Please be respectful of us and our neighbours and keep noise levels to a minimum. - We appreciate that our guests will expect clean, well maintained accommodation and ask that you respect the property during your stay.

The home is also available for a whole house booking and comfortably fits 6 adults.  Please see 'The Paddington Estate' for more information regarding a whole house booking. neighborhood_overview: You will experience the essence of Paddington lifestyle - central to an abundance of cafes, restaurants, art galleries, pubs, parks, boutique shopping and Paddington markets. We are walking distance to Five Ways village, Centennial Park and Woollahra. By bus, we are minutes to Bondi Beach and the city centre. Paddington boasts a number of stylish pubs and wine bars including The London Tavern and The Grand National Hotel, both a stone throw away. Your stay could not get more central and special than this.
notes: Please be mindful that this is our home.  We love to share our unique home with people and in order for this to be sustainable, we do not allow "guests of guests" for visits, pool swims or otherwise.
transit: How to get to our place: Oxford Street is the closest main street. We are between two pubs on Underwood Street - The London and The Grand National. From the Oxford Street, walk down either William Street or Queen Street and turn onto underwood (we are a couple minutes walk from Oxford Street) From the Airport: Take the train to Museum Station and catch either one of: 380, 333, or M40 (red bus) and get off at the first stop after Paddington Town Hall (Opal cards available at the kiosk at the bottom of the stairs at Museum Station) OR Take the train to Central Station, take the Eddy Ave exit Take the 440 bus (Sydney Buses) Ask for the William St stop in the centre of Paddington, on Oxford St. Opal available from kiosk at station. Cab from airport is around $40 -$50 Uber is around $25 - $30 There are buses on Oxford Street  that take you to the city or the beaches. When arriving, the destination is: William Street, Paddington Bus Stop / Paddington  Inn Hotel (then 5 minute walk) Buses on

interaction: Check in time is 2pm and check out time is 10am.  We like to stick to these times in order to accommodate other guests and cleaners.   There is a key-less entry to our home and we will supply you with the code prior to your arrival.

host.host_about:
Hello,

We are creative, down to earth and open-minded couple, who enjoy a healthy lifestyle and a vibrant home.    There are much happenings in our home, from photo shoots, to art salons to creative dinners and occasionally short film making.

We have been greeting and hosting guests from all over the world, for just over three years. We host a wide variety of people from all over the world.  Our home is a unique step into an old world reality, and we enjoy sharing it with others.
 
As an alternative,  if you are after the privacy of a one bedroom Paddington pad, have a look at our listing at: https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/3795958?preview

We hope you enjoy your time in our home!
Arnie & Lorraine

It is on the first floor and only 100m to the beach. Mona Vale Beach is essentially two separate beaches separated by an ocean rock platform. There is something for everyone. There are several different beach breaks, plus a surfclub patrolled swimming area. At the south end of the beach there is an uncrowded beach area known as Cook
notes: There are many lovely walking and cycling paths in the area. Narrabeen Lake is a favourite amongst the locals for canoeing, and the trail around the lake is a stunning 8.4km circuit for running, cycling and walking. Mona Vale Golf Club is a short 10 minute walk. There are also many other beautiful beaches along this coastline, and a magnificent national park very close by.  There are weekly farmers markets with freshly picked produce within a 5 minute drive. (Website hidden by Airbnb)  There is also a plethora of great restaurants and cafes in the local area.
access: It is on the first floor and only 100m to the beach. Mona Vale Beach is essentially two separate beaches separated by an ocean rock platform. There is something for everyone. There are several different beach breaks, plus a surfclub patrolled swimming area. At the south end of the beach there is an uncrowded beach area known as Cooks Terrace. The bay to the north is called The Basin, and here you’ll find a small right-hand reef break, perfect for cruising on a long board. You will often see ocean swimmers using the basin for their training ground.  The rock platform which splits the beach in two has a 25 metre ocean-fed lap pool (free entry) and a smaller pool for the children. During low tide there are some lovely rock pools for the little ones to play in also.
interaction: My husband or I will meet you to give you a set of keys or leave them in a secure location for you to collect. We will be using the apartment for weekend getaways so it will be fully equipped with anything you may need. We live and work not far away so we will be able to assist you if necessary.

summary: Modern, light filled family home very close to public transport, local shops, cafes and Manly Beach.  Off street parking for 2 cars, fully fenced level backyard. Plenty of room for up to 6 people to enjoy the fabulous Northern Beaches of Sydney.

The living room has floor to ceiling windows on 3 sides and a vaulted ceiling with designer chandelier. 2 comfortable lounges that can seat 6 comfortably. Wall-mounted flat screen TV with Netflix access and unlimited free WiFi. The kitchen has induction cooktop, electric oven, fridge / freezer with ice maker, dish washer, double sink, toaster and kettle. The kitchen table seats 6. All 4 bedrooms have ceiling fans. There is plenty of storage space for clothes in the wardrobes and drawers. The family bathroom has a rain head shower, bath, storage and underfloor heating. Quality towels, shampoo and conditioner are provided. The outdoor covered terrace also has a table that seats 6. There is also a gas BBQ. Downstairs there is a large rumpus room with sofa and TV area, double bed, bathroom with shower, vanity and toilet, laundry

neighborhood_overview: Seaforth is a village suburb close to Manly and the inner harbour beaches. Manly is only a 10 min drive or short bus ride away. Seaforth village is 5 mins walk and has many cafes, restaurants and local shops. Within 200m of the property you will find a 'Friendly Grocer' convenience store, a great coffee shop and gym.
notes: A tailored welcome basket for breakfast is provided when you arrive as well as a few basics to get you started.
transit: The property has off-street parking for up to 2 cars. Driving to the City takes 30 to 40 minutes. Main bus stops to Manly and the City are only a couple of minutes walk from the property. The ferry from Manly to the City is a trip that has to be experienced.

name: Sydney City Elegance & Pool.
summary: If convenience, comfort and resort style amenities are what you are seeking, then look no further than this fantastic abode. Situated a few steps from Sydney’s Martin Place, you will be residing in the heart of the Sydney City. You will have access to the entire space suitable for 2 people with all your needs covered. Fully functional kitchen, bathroom, super comfy lounge room, private balcony and king-size bed. Enjoy the roof top pool and spa area, with plenty of space to cook a BBQ and relax.
space: This convenient and comfortable apartment has everything you need to relax while being in the heart of Sydney's busy CBD. The bright and spacious apartment is located on the 11th floor of this luxurious apartment complex. Boasting resort style amenities such as a roof top pool & spa, BBQ area, basic gym equipment, and plenty of day beds to soak up the sun and relax with the view from the 14th floor. The apartment has everything you need, with the following inclusions:  - large balconies with city views of Sydney. - Fully equipped kitchen with oven, microwave, toaster, kettle and gas stove.  - Internal laundry with washing machine and dryer. - King size bed. - Reverse air conditioning / heater. - Flat screen TV. - Unlimited high speed internet.

name: Surry Hills Gem - Private Bathroom & Bedroom
summary: The room is private, with private bathroom. It is of medium size with two  windows over looking court yard garden. Surry Hills is listed as one of the best suburbs to stay in because of all its amenities. My husband and I are well travelled. We love to meet people and learn a different way of seeing the world, from perspectives different to our own. Looking forward to meeting diverse people from all countries and cultures. We’re LGBTIQ friendly.
space: Your room overlooks a lovely courtyard with potted garden.  A very bright sunny room, which is  cosy & comfortable- even though you are in the inner city it has been said by guests you could be in the country because you can hear the birds and sit inside or out side to view the peaceful garden.  In the house also lives our small Maltese dog who sleeps most of the day. Our house is our home, eclectically decorated, cosy and comfortable. If your preference is for the new, sleek, slick and shiny, we would love to host you but please note our tastes are a little more rustic. There are  places to sit outside of your room. You’re welcome to sit in the kitchen,sunroom or courtyard – these are shared spaces, with us.

neighborhood_overview: Surry Hills - has been rated as one of the top places to visit in the world it  is a very unique and old suburb full of history. Many events that happen in Sydney are only a short distance away. As are the main Art Galleries, theartes, cinemas, CBD, & the Sydney Opera House. The area is know for its great cafes, bars and restaurants. We are a 7 minute walk from one of Sydney's biggest gay hubs - Oxford Street. The famous Sydney Mardi Gras is an annual event in the first weekend of March, bringing a welcoming and inclusive atmosphere to Surry Hills.
notes: The Room is for one person only-  There is no option for extra guest. No other guests / friends allowed in the house before consulting us.  Definitely No Drugs/No Smoking /No heavy or excess drinking of alcohol. Please do not leave food in your room. The climate in Sydney attracts insects please leave in fridge or kitchen cupboard, please eat in the kitchen, dinning room or garden. Please no washing clothes in bathroom (you can use the laundry for this, happy to provide laundry soap, etc.) Wifi - The house has unlimited down load - We use one of the Major Telecomunications companies in Australia - Some times the wifi is slower when using tablets/ ipads -( not sure why) -  Other parts of the house the wifi works well no problems with speed.
transit: Surry Hills is quite central, and well serviced by public transport. There is a 3 minute walk to busses to the CBD and a 7 minute walk to busses headed for the east (Bondi, Coogee and other famous beaches). We're a 7 minute (downhill) walk from Central station - Sydney's main railway station - for local and long distance trains and buses. Railway Square, just behind Central station is a hub for busses heading for the West - Newtown, etc. You can walk to many attractions on foot, Botanical Gardens, Opera House etc.
access: There is no access to a washing machine or dryer. There is a Laundromat 3 minute walk from our house. You are welcome to use the fridge or kitchen cupboards to store your snacks , takeaway food or drinks. Meals are not provided.  No cooking of your own food available. No facility available to heat up food or prepare food. No microwave in the house. Surry Hills is a hub of café culture, with lots of great restaurants nearby.
interaction: Let us know if you'd like some local knowledge of Surry Hills. This centrally located suburb is well serviced with public transport to some of Sydney's other distinctive neigbourhoods - we'd be happy to advise. There's always something to do in Sydney (hopefully free!) ask us for some ideas.  When you arrive we will greet you and give you your key, and show you around the house. We don't own a car so are unable to pick you up from the airport etc. Though my husband is retired, we are active people, so we are usually in and out of the house all day.

Hi there, my husband and I both love traveling, reading, cinema, cooking, gardening and the arts. Above all we enjoy interacting and meeting diverse people from all countries and cultures & seeing the world, from perspectives different to our own. We’re LGBTIQ friendly. We had one of our best holidays on our first Airbnb experience in 2009, since then when we travel we look forward to booking our accomodation on Air bnb. We are now hosts on Air bnb and have enjoyed the social interaction of our guests- this is the most rewarding part of hosting.
Our style of traveling is as close to being a local as possible, usually planing our own itinerary.

I am a female residing in Sydney who enjoys traveling, music, culture and language, art, dancing, festivals, food & wine.

I have lived in my neighbourhood for many years and have enjoyed living in Ryde.  The new regional shopping centre offers cinemas, cafes, restaurants, boutiques, food stores, etc., at walking distance.

I am offering a room for those staying in Sydney requiring a clean, pleasant room in a family orientated home style living.  It is a large room with timber floor boards, lots of light and comfortable living area with free WiFi, functional kitchen and bathroom.

The Art Deco character home is conveniently located on bus route and walking distance to the ferry service to Circular Quay or Darling Harbour.  The Ryde Aquatic Centre is about 200 metres away and the regional shopping centre is a short 12 minute walk.

A minimum of one month to long term stay - we will require you to discuss this further.

I hope to be hearing from you soon..
