name: Large Townhouse Prime Location Surry Hills & City
summary: Our charming old heritage townhouse with original features is in a prime location, just off Crown Street and a short walk to Oxford Street, Darling Harbour and the Sydney Harbour - Circular Quay! On one of the most sought after tree lined streets in Surry Hills, out of the hustle and bustle whilst still in amongst the centre of the city. Please note the property is over 150 years old and is updated but shows the charm and wear of old age.
space: Large rooms, with plenty of space to have drinks in our cocktail lounge, or hangout on the large comfy sofa.  Cook dinner in our large kitchen, with 6/8 person seating dining table. The bedrooms are spacious & with master having a large double balcony at the front of the house, the courtyard is a secure area with seating, a bbq, access to the outdoor laundry.

neighborhood_overview: The house is a 20min bus ride to Circular Quay and The Opera House, with two bus stops less than a 2/3min walk from the front door.  Central station is less than 10 mins walk away.  The main centre of Oxford Street is only a 10 min walk away, perfect to be near the hustle and bustle of Mardi Gras. Maloneys Grocery shop is again a 2/3min walk away and has the tastiest fruit and veg around.  Coles and Aldi are equi-distance from the house if you prefer to do a larger cheaper shop which you can get to either by a 5 min bus trip or 15 min walk.  Surry Hills is one of the main spots in the whole of Sydney for dining and drinking :-)  plus lots of cool shops and boutiques to visit during the day. The house is situated in a street  behind the small/park green so just enough to keep the noise at bay, but also so that you can walk to either The Clock or Dolphin, Cuckoo Calley, Nour etc etc in 3/4 mins flat.
notes: This is our home and our belongings will be present even though we are not. We try to minimise this though and have things packed away but you may see a trace of us around the house.
transit: The house is a 20min bus ride to Circular Quay and The Opera House, with two bus stops less than a 2/3min walk from the front door.  Central station is less than 10 mins walk away.

house_rules: In regards to lights and especially the cool fans and heaters – these are not cheap to run and we are more than happy for you to make use of them whilst you are in the room and at the house but if these are left on when out, charges may incur, please be mindful of this.   You are most welcome to entertain people at the house guests, family, friends etc. but we request that you please be respectful and not to have additional overnight guests stay unless pre organised when booking.   We try to be as ecofriendly as possible, so there is a recycling bin in the pantry separate to the bin in the kitchen.   We ask that you eat your meals downstairs in either the kitchen or lounge, just to keep the bedrooms as clean as possible and minimise odours.   Please be conscious when you come home late or are leaving early to remove hard soled footwear upstairs as the noise can be incredibly loud and disturbing to others as well as not slamming the doors. name: Bondi Beachside Bliss
summary: Light and spacious 2 bedroom apartment in North Bondi. Great for a couple or a family, it has everything you need for a home away from home.
space: The apartment has 2 bedrooms - 1 queen (smaller room) is set up as the adults room with a queen bed, lots of light and right next to the lounge and main area of the apartment. The the other (the main room) is set up as a kids retreat for my 3 yr old boy with a single bed + single trundle, giving a nice separation of adult and child when needed.  We have a modern kitchen with all the amenities (dishwasher, microwave, new fridge, gas cooker and oven, Nespresso coffee machine). Lovely comfy corner lounge (6 seater), with cable tv (full Foxtel package including movies, sport and kids package) and unlimited wifi. Lovely balcony to watch the sun go down over the park and get some fresh air.

The apartment is ideally located -walking distance to the beach and slig
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is ideally located -walking distance to the beach and slightly longer to the harbour. Transport options abound, no need to drive.  Across the road from the apartment is a huge park, public tennis court and Bondi lawn bowling club (cheap drinks and pub lunches/dinners) and only a block from Seven Ways cafes, 2 blocks to Bondi Farmers Market on a Saturday and a 5 min walk to iconic Bondi beach.  There’s two options for buses within 1 min walk in either direction - to Bondi Junction (Westfield and the transport hub of train and bus stations), or to access the other beaches of Tamarama, Bronte and Coogee. 1km walk to Rose Bay ferry and all the magic of Sydney Harbour if you get bored of the beach! And a short 7 min drive to South Head / Watson’s Bay for a beautiful lunch on the water looking back over Sydney.
transit: There are bikes to hire, buses within 1 min that go everywhere and the ferry at Rose Bay. If you’re driving there is free street parking available.

interaction: I’m available for guests as needed.

neighborhood_overview: Zetland is a urban redevelop area, use to be warehouse areas about 10 years ago, now there are all new apartment areas. With close distance to CBD(15 mins public transport or 10 min drive), it has become popular among young professionals and students. especially after the open of the nearby shopping mall, this area has become a very convenient modern village.
notes: Please let me know if you need the sofa bed set up, or just leave it as a sofa. Some people asked in hotels they provide a fitted sheet and a flat sheet, why I only provide one sheet. the reason being is that the guests in hotels are meant to sleep between the fitted and flat, so they don't need to wash the quilt cover that often. but I wash the quilt covers every time. that's why I don't need 2 sheets. hope that explains the reason. By default, we only one sheet for each bed, however, there are extra sets of sheets available in the wardrobe.
transit: 15 mins by bus to CBD, 10 mins drive 20 mins by train to international airport 15 mins to UNSW univercity

interaction: I tend to give my guests privacy and always reachable by phone
house_rules: More information - quiet time after 9pm - Strictly NO PARTIES, If a party is found, will charge $2,000 fine and $300+extra cleaning fee is payable.I will be reasonable and reserved the final explanation rights to what a “party” is. - please consider out neighbour and no laud music,don't make excessive noise at all time. - This is a self-contained property. Generally, you don't need to do the cleaning, cooking is allowed, but please make "reasonable" effort to clean up, especially after kids. All garbage is to be removed or packed. If too messy, an additional cleaning fee will be charged for properties left in an unsatisfactory state which includes washing very dirty dishes left in the sink or too many garbage left in the unit. We ask that furniture is not moved. Should furniture be moved, or damaged additional fees will apply. - please use the rubbish chute next to the lift to dispose of the rubbish, general and recyclables. The location of Rubbish room will show in the guidebook. - If

The house is shared with two (very lovely) others from Brazil and Sweden, but you will have your own private bedroom and full use of the kitchen, dining room, living room and garden. The house is on the border of Redfern and Surry Hills, less than a 5 minute walk to bustling Crown Street, and 2 minutes from the nearest Coles.

notes: We've set different discounts for trips over 7 days/14 days/1 month which will be automatically applied to qualified trips. If you are planning to stay for a longer period (i.e. longer than 1 month), special discounts can be negotiated upon requests.
transit: There's bus stops next to the apartment building (route (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) ). You can take the bus to Central Station in 40 mins.  Chiswick Wharf is about 10 mins walk from the apartment.
access: Our guests will have full access to our apartment including the parking spots
interaction: We will be available for help when needed
house_rules: NO SMOKING:  Any evidence of smoking would result in a penalty of $150 to us and extra penalties may be levied by the strata. USE OF BALCONY: Please be advised that as requested by the Owner's Corporation, hanging of washing/laundry/clothes in the balcony is strictly forbidden. Penalties would apply. NO PARTY/PET:  Please keep your excessive noise at the minimum level, or our neighbours may call the police and/or report to the building management, and penalties may apply. NO PARCEL DELIVERY:  We strongly recommend our guests not to set our apartment as the delivery address for their orders during their stay (food deliveries are fine). The postal delivery service in Sydney is quite out-dated and your parcels, even those scheduled to be delivered during your stay, may well end up being delivered days later. If that is the case, we will not hold responsibility for collecting them or sending them to you as we cannot be in the apartment all the time and other guests may be staying there. LO

name: Light-filled, 1 bedroom apartment in Potts Point
summary: Enjoy this light and spacious apartment with exposed brick-walls and reclaimed railway sleeper bench tops set right in the heart of cosmopolitan Potts Point. We lovingly renovated this apartment and enjoyed living her for 2 years but now are moving to somewhere bigger and hope someone else can benefit from the fruits of our labour! You'll love walking just 1 minute to an excellent bar or restaurant, 4 minutes to our local grocer or take your pick of heaps of coffee options for a caffeine hit!
space: This apartment has a fully equipped kitchen with induction stove set in our beloved reclaimed railway sleeper bench top. The bedroom is separated from the lounge with an exposed brick wall (something that came as an accident during the renovation but we loved and kept!) and a sliding door for privacy. The bathroom is bright and includes an internal washing machine. There is a great shared rooftop that has a glimpse (totally just a glimpse) of the Harbour Bridge. Particularly visible during winter when the leaves on the trees out front have fallen.

neighborhood_overview: Potts Point AKA Kings Cross has been through some interesting changes in the past 3-5 years. These days it's less about the clubs and pubs and more about the restaurants, apartments and shops. You'll find heaps of options for coffee and cocktails. This apartment is 4 minutes walk from Kings Cross Station (and the famous Coke sign), 6 minutes walk from Woolloomooloo, 15 minutes from The Art Gallery of NSW and The Royal Botanic Gardens and just 25 minutes walk from Martin Place (about the centre of the city.
notes: Note that some of the furniture & artwork has changed since these photos were taken. Namely there is a new Tv unit and TV as well as the bedside tables are different.
transit: You really should walk everywhere from here if you can - it's the best way to get around! Otherwise, being 4 minutes from Kings Cross Station you are about 20 minutes on Public Transport from Darling Harbour or Circular Quay, 30 minutes on Public Transport from Bondi Beach and the same (30 minutes) from the domestic & international terminals at Sydney Airport. Ubers or Taxis are a cinch but parking isn't great so I wouldn't recommend being here with a car. That said, there is a paid parking station nearby or you can try stalking a car for their spot!
access: Guests have access to the whole apartment as well as all common areas in the building which mainly just includes the rooftop (and foyer & bin room - yay!).
interaction: There is a lockbox to fetch the keys so guests will be self-sufficient from check-in (unless I'm nearby at the time to meet you...if you're lucky!). I am always available on email/text if anything is required or you need advice. As a host, I expect guests to communicate their arrival and departure at the least. I like to check-in with guests during their stay via the Aibnb messages to ensure everything is going smoothly with your stay.
house_rules: - Shared areas are not to be used after 9pm or before 7am - This is strictly a 2-person apartment with only 1 bed available for sleeping (no sleeping on the couch/sofa) - Guests are expected to communicate their arrival and departure times through Airbnb's messages.

host.host_about:
Hey, I'm Julia. I'm in my thirties I use Airbnb when I travel, usually with my partner Daniel, and as a host for our apartment in Potts Point as well as on behalf of my mother when she travels and her great apartment in Rose Bay is vacant. 
As a guest I understand what it is to be a host and as such, I will treat your place with respect. 
As your host, I can then be in contact with you as much or as little as you like. Both properties have a key box so access can be within your time restrictions. I can be on email/text if needed during your stay.

name: Bright & Stunning 2BR APT w/City View &Wifi
summary: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION !!!  Explore and live like a local in Surry Hills which ranks as the 23rd most stylish neighborhood in the world & No.1 in Australia! If you are looking for an amazing apartment in the best location in SYDNEY CBD look no further. Step outside to the vibrant and colourful Elizabeth St with easy 3 min walk to Central Station, Chinatown, Darling Harbour, World Square and short stroll to Opera House & the Rocks. 2 Bedrooms + Double Sofa Bed, 1 Bathroom, Free Wifi.
space: This is without doubt THE BEST LOCATION you could ever ask for when visiting Sydney. Surry Hills is an amazing inner city neighbourhood in Sydney's Eastern Suburbs, recently voted 23rd most stylish suburb in the world! Incredibly relaxed place, great facilities including a start of the art new library, awesome bars, cafes & restaurants. 2 minute walk to everything that is wonderful and local in the inner-city village of Surry Hills, and a short walk further to Sydney's CBD, Hyde Park or Centennial Park. Across the road from the iconic Sydney Cricket Ground and other sporting venues, 15 minutes to Sydney's beautiful eastern suburbs beaches including the world famous Bondi Beach. Start your day with a coffee at the amazing Bourke Street Bakery just few minutes away. Fantastic mix of creative types, families, professionals & interesting locals :-) You will love it here. While in the neighbourhood, be sure to enjoy a well-known Sydney pub, there are many to choose from! Enjoy a meal at one
description: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION !!!  Explore and live like a local in Surry Hills which ranks as the 23rd most stylish neighborhood in the world & No.1 in Australia! If you are looking for an amazing apartment in the best location in SYDNEY CBD look no further. Step outside to the vibrant and colourful Elizabeth St with easy 3 min walk to Central Station, Chinatown, Darling Harbour, World Square and short stroll to Opera House & the Rocks. 2 Bedrooms + Double Sofa Bed, 1 Bathroom, Free Wifi. This is without doubt THE BEST LOCATION you could ever ask for when visiting Sydney. Surry Hills is an amazing inner city neighbourhood in Sydney's Eastern Suburbs, recently voted 23rd most stylish suburb in the world! Incredibly relaxed place, great facilities including a start of the art new library, awesome bars, cafes & restaurants. 2 minute walk to everything that is wonderful and local in the inner-city village of Surry Hills, and a short walk further to Sydney's CBD, Hyde Park or Centennial Park.
neighborhood_overview: Surry Hills is just 1km South-East of Sydney city and the area has an abundance of restaurants, pubs, cafes, shopping and parks. Great coffee! Fabulous shops to explore, and local places to dine, you will love living locally or enjoy the location for easy access to all of Sydney. You are within walking distance to Central Station, CBD, Oxford St and Circular Quay. With great public transport links, grab an Opal Card and get to Bondi Beach, Centennial Park and enjoy Sydney. Central PIZZA is right next to our building if you're too hungry :)
notes: NOTE: Please take off your shoes at the entrance and please leave the apartment clean and tidy as when you first find it. We really appreciate your courtesy! Take advantage of our LATEST PROMOTION and SPECIAL OFFERS and make your stay with us truly unique! Book early to secure your accommodation because we are often booked out during this period. Sydney is a bustling city and we're located right in the heart of it (which is part of the reasons why we love it!) so noise is inevitable. There is a construction going on from the right hand side of the complex so you might hear some noise during the day but hopefully it won’t affect you much as you’ll be exploring Sydney during daytime. This pad accommodates 4 adults comfortably but a max of 6 overnight. Any more than 4 adult guests overnight or extra sofa will attract an extra AU$30 per night, per additional guest. The sleeping arrangement for the 5th to 6th adult would be on a 2-seater sofa bed which folds out to a double with extra quilt
transit: 2 minutes walk to Central train station and bus interchange this apartment is perfectly located to get around Sydney. Leave the car and just walk everywhere! The City Centre is a 3 minute walk, Sydney Opera House 20 minutes and the Botanical Gardens 25 minutes. If you want to go further afield or just prefer public transport there are several bus stops within a 5 minute walk, which can take you around Sydney, including to Circular Quay, Bondi Beach or Centennial Park and of course you can get anywhere from Central train station. All public transport is close by. On street parking is available and the airport is literally 15 minutes away by cab or train.
access: Everything is yours to enjoy so treat the apartment as your own. Up to 1 x Key Fob and apartment keys will be given to each party or individual to access the apartment, and I will meet you in person or make suitable arrangements if I can not make it. FAMILY & CHILD-FRIENDLY Accommodation! Baby travel cot, high baby chair and stroller can be provided at additional cost. There is also a laundry/dry cleaners below and they're amazing at ironing! and you can store bags at this location before and after you check in and out. There is no left luggage or luggage storage available at the property before you check in and after you check out. There is a Storage Service in the Laundromat below this building (Sydney Laundry @ 234 Elizabeth St). Costs are definitely the cheapest in Sydney CBD: only $2/day for small bag, $5-6/day for large luggage. Another options: Across the road at Central Station called Smart Carte (5 minutes walk) or World Square Shopping Centre (4 minutes walk).
interaction: You'll be the only guests staying, so enjoy the space! We will be there to welcome you in and answer any questions you might have, then we will be just a quick text or phone call away! Guests will check themselves out and leave keys on the table. All we ask is that you be respectful to our neighbours. Please note I like to accommodate my guests arrivals and departures as best as possible, just let me know what time you would like to check in and check out and we will do our best to let you stay as long as possible, but at times we will need the apartment to be vacated by 10am and the check in to be after 3pm. The best way to contact us is via AirBnb. Otherwise you can also reach us via SMS or Mobile when necessary. Rest assured, my response time is pretty much instant. I or a trusted friend will be available leading up to and during your stay to answer any questions you may have.
house_rules: - - - Welcome to our cozy and comfortable apartment - located in the most convenient location in Sydney CBD! We want you to feel like home, this is our policy and it worked for a very long time. Many of our guests are friends now and we do keep in touch and visit. If this property is booked, look at the other one which is linked to this one. Respectful, quiet (no parties) and clean & tidy people are welcomed in my home. NO rowdiness please consider other guests. The house is always spotless as I am a very proud home owner. I love to socialise but privacy is also respected and assured. Happy to give you directions & ideas about touring Sydney etc. Smoking is only allowed outside if required. Please leave the room as nice and tidy as you found it. *Key pick-up:* Please text me via Airbnb few days before the check-in date to arrange key pick-up. *Keys: A LOST KEY WILL BE CHARGED $250 - THIS IS NON NEGOTIABLE FOR WHAT A KEY FOB COSTS TO REPLACE IN THIS BUILDING. *Check-in time*: Check-in i

host.host_about: Mind building. Body building. Soul building. That’s all I’m after

name: Spacious 2 Bedroom Apartment
summary: Stylishly decorated and roomy 2 Bedroom apartment located in Dover Heights.  Short walk or bus ride away from all the great sites that Sydney has to offer - Bondi Beach, Watsons Bay, Rose Bay and the City (CBD, Darling Harbour, Circular Quay).
space: Spacious and quiet 2 bedroom apartment with massive outdoor dining and lounge area.  One bedroom is a large queen bedroom, and the second room is currently set up as a study, and not a bedroom.  But we have a fold-out double futon in the living room that can accommodate a second couple.  The space can comfortably fit 4 people, or would be an amazing, spacious haven for 2 people.
description: Stylishly decorated and roomy 2 Bedroom apartment located in Dover Heights.  Short walk or bus ride away from all the great sites that Sydney has to offer - Bondi Beach, Watsons Bay, Rose Bay and the City (CBD, Darling Harbour, Circular Quay). You will have access to a huge queen bedroom, fold-out futon if required, living area with TV and sound system, kitchen, bathroom with built-in laundry, Wi-Fi Internet, outdoor dining and lounge area with a new BBQ.  None of this has to be shared with other guests - it's all yours! We have a cat, but neither he nor us will be here during your stay - you will have the
neighborhood_overview: Dover Heights is a beautiful and leafy neighbourhood set on the cliffs of Sydney Harbour.  Dover Heights has stunning views of the ocean, Sydney harbour and the City. Rose Bay shopping village is a 5 minute walk away, where there is plenty of options for food shopping and eating out. Dover Heights is also very accessible by Bus, Ferry & Train if you want to go to Manly or the City.
transit: Bus stops are a 3 minute walk away and can take you to Watsons Bay, the City, Bondi Junction, Bondi Beach, Coogee, Randwick etc etc. You can even get the Ferry from Rose Bay to the City or Manly if you want to see Sydney from the water.  If you are coming from the airport there are a number of ways to get to get to Dover Heights. 1. Get a taxi from the airport which will cost about $40-$50. 2. Get a train to Bondi Junction ($15) and then catch up a bus to Dover Heights/Rose Bay. ($4).
access: You will have access to a huge queen bedroom, fold-out futon if required, living area with TV and sound system, kitchen, bathroom with built-in laundry, Wi-Fi Internet, outdoor dining and lounge area with a new BBQ.  None of this has to be shared with other guests - it's all yours!
interaction: We have a cat, but neither he nor us will be here during your stay - you will have the place all to yourself!
house_rules: The apartment building is a non-smoking area.

host.host_about:
Hi, I'm Dave and I'm from Sydney. My wife and I are new to airbnb but loving it so far. We just listed our home on airbnb so that people can come and share the Eastern Suburbs of Sydney with us. We also plan to do some travelling later on in the year to Europe and look forward to using airbnb for the first time!

We love travel and recent highlights have been New Zealand, Fiji, Vietnam, England, France and Spain. We also love to travel around Australia too, as we live in one of the best countries around.

When we travel we like to do it the Anthony Bourdain way. Food intertwined with culture is one of the things we like most about travelling.

We look forward to seeing you on our travels, or hosting you when you visit.

name: Ocean Views and Pool Lounging in 3-bed near Beach
summary: A 7-min walk from the beach, you can stay at our 3-bed self-contained unit located on the bottom floor of our home. Offering you privacy while sharing our family sized pool and ocean views on your own balcony area.  A true heritage house, this home was built in the rock formations, truly reminiscent of Greek holiday homes. This spacious home offers 3 bedrooms, 1 double bed and two singles.  With desk space in every room, it's perfect for families or tourist who want to experience beach living.
space: Whether you are looking for a place to refresh after a day on the beach or a quiet flat to explore Sydney from, our flat is perfect for you. There is nothing quite like living on the Northern Beaches. Our Home: We have an open plan living area with a fully equipped kitchen and dining table for 4. There is another table outside that you can use to enjoy the last summer sun next to the pool and looking at the ocean. The master bedroom has a double bed that will be made with five-star fluffy pillows and sheets. The other two bedrooms both have single beds which will also be made with hotel-grade linen and towels will be provided. All bedrooms have a desk and some space to put your clothes.  There is also a newly renovated bathroom.  The great features of this area: - Numerous world famous beaches and surfers - An abundance of shops, restaurants, bars, cinema within walking distance - National Park and walking trails close by - The marine park at Shelly Beach is a short bus ride away, go s

The master bedroom has a double bed that will be made with five-star fluffy pillows
neighborhood_overview: Dee Why beach is one of the famous Northern Beaches, only three beaches from Manly. Besides being known for its surf and outdoor activities, the strip is packed with great restaurants and cute little pubs.
notes: I live upstairs, meaning that the full house is shared. I will however respect your privacy and will give you all the privacy requested. The home has a staircase connecting the upstairs and downstairs, but as you said this staircase will not be used and you have a fully private entrance.
transit: Public transport is the easiest way to get around Dee Why and the surrounding beaches. As there is plenty of unlimited parking in this area, you can easily take the car as well.  Taking the ferry from Manly will be a scenic ride all the way into the city. The view of the Opera House when coming around the corner will even let the most jaded daily commuter skip a beat.  Using a bicycle is a popular way of getting from beach to beach for most locals and is highly recommended.
access: Guests have access to the full property
interaction: I have Tam helping me host my home so you can ask her all of your questions and she'll be able to help you. I also live on the upstairs floor of the home, but may not be home to help you at all times. Tam is great though and is always able to send someone over to try to help you with whatever you need.
house_rules: - This is a very quiet home, please keep our neighbours in mind and respect the houserules as it's very important to us - No Parties - No Noise after 10pm - Please remember that if the keys are locked in the apartment at some point of your stay or after check-out, we might need to call a locksmith or have the keys replaced and this will need to be charged to your account - Please remember that our property is located in a tropical country and therefore some small insects such as mosquitoes and cockroaches are present in the area. We love the warmth of summer and so do these bugs. Be careful with leaving food behind and/or with leaving windows and doors open at night as these critters will find their way in. We do our utmost best to prevent this, but please do not be alarmed if one is sighted and simply inform us and we’ll make sure we do our best to help you - Please respect the 10am check-out time, if our housekeepers are not able to do the cleaning on time, we may need to charge you

name: Private room in Coogee
summary: Beautiful, clean and bright beach apartment. The place has all the amenities ready to use, including an internal laundry room. It is a private room with street views, 2 wardrobes and a queen size bed.  5 minutes walk distance to the beach, supermarkets, Randwick stores and The Stop.  30 minutes by bus to the city. Buses are running almost all the night from the city to Coogee.  This is quiet building so no crazy parties are allowed.  Note: this is a smoke-free building, therefore only non-smoker people are allowed.

name: Large, comfy & bright North Sydney 1 bed apartment
summary: Managed by Sydney Holiday Rentals this is a large and comfortable one bed apartment in a quiet and secure block located close to the North Sydney ferry wharf and Milsons Point train station. It's perfect for visitors who want functional, good value accommodation with the support of a professional agency if you have any issues.
space: Larger than the Sydney average for a one bedroom apartment this one has lots of windows to make sure it is bright and cheerful and plenty of space to relax and unwind after a busy day out exploring the city.  There is a queen size bed in the bedroom along with blackout blinds. There is free wifi for guest use and a well equipped kitchen.  Please be advised the carpet is quite old and not in perfect condition in some places with some minor marks etc. It has recently been professionally steam cleaned to make it as clean as possible for the arrival of our guests but if you are expecting perfect presentation of every aspect of the apartment this will not be the place for you. We have done everything we can within the limitations set by the owner to make this apartment clean and inviting and we hope guests will have a comfortable and enjoyable stay. There is no allocated parking with this apartment but there are two visitor parking spaces for the building which can be used along with a row
description: Managed by Sydney Holiday Rentals this is a large and comfortable one bed apartment in a quiet and secure block located close to the North Sydney ferry wharf and Milsons Point train station. It's perfect for visitors who want functional, good value accommodation with the support of a professional agency if you have any issues. Larger than the Sydney average for a one bedroom apartment this one has lots of windows to make sure it is bright and cheerful and plenty of space to relax and unwind after a busy day out exploring the city.  There is a queen size bed in the bedroom along with blackout blinds. There is free wifi for guest use and a well equipped kitchen. neighborhood_overview: Many people think of North Sydney as the CBD alone, but the CBD is surrounded by some of the best living in Sydney. If you work in the city you are spoilt for choice when it comes to transport. Trains and buses are constant. On a nice day walk to work across our great bridge. Stroll to nearby restaurants at Blues Point Road, Crows Nest or Neutral Bay, or stay in North Sydney itself with a great variety of restaurants and good pubs. Everything is walking distance in this suburb. There are great shops at Greenwood Plaza, Walker Street, Neutral Bay or Crows Nest for all your grocery needs or late night requirements.  Visit the great markets near the North Sydney council on Friday nights and Saturdays. Parks are plentiful with North Sydney oval and Cammeray park perfect for kids and families, or take a leisurely stroll to the harbour.
notes: All the apartments we manage come with a welcome letter and a full instruction manual so you know how everything works to ensure you can get the most out of your stay. The manual also contains many menus from local restaurants to give you some idea of what is available nearby and also information on tourist activities available in Sydney. There is also a local map with some highlights such as the local supermarket and train station plus maps of Sydney for those not familiar with the area. All bedding and towels are included for two people along with beginner basics such as tea, coffee, sugar, milk, shampoo, bodywash and toilet paper to get you through the first few days. We try to meet all guests on arrival in person so a time will be arranged in advance of your arrival which will also be confirmed in the day once you know your plans. On arrival we ask all guests to quickly fill in some contact information and tell them a little bit more about how we hope they'll look after the apartme

neighborhood_overview: Darlinghurst is full vibrant and in an exceptional of life just like Surry Hill which is across the street. People in this neighborhood is very friendly and different. Darlinghurst is an inner city eastern suburb adjacent to the Central Business District, Hyde park and Central station. It is fun at night with dancing classes from Kizomba, Tango to Salsa within few minutes walk from our place. French, Manpower shows and Slide show is just across the street  If you are lucky you might see some very colourful customs on the late weekend.  I am sure you won't be bored when you stay with us. There are lots of cafes and patisseries for you to try in every direction you face. My only concern is that you will run out of time. Crown St, Bourke St, Stanly St, Pitt St, George St and Haymarket is full of excitement for food,  restaurants from different nationality cuisines, bars and dumplings places for you to try. Bars and clubs just across the road or 2 mins walk If you feel like Korean food the
notes: Occassionally, there might be 2 x four legged friends visiting you especially on the weekend. They are very friendly and cute small white and caramel poodles. We have bikes for you to borrow if you wish to ride down to Botanical garden and a scooter. You need a license  to ride a scooter. Helmets are available if you need.
transit: The best way to appreciate the city of Sydney is by foot, there are so many bars and gens only you can discover them by foot. Eg "Wall in the hole"  Grandma Bar. Bike is your next option if you want to travel a bit further like to cycle down to botanical garden and opera house. Bus at door step to Bondi beach Train is only 3 to 10 mins walk Have fun and enjoy your love of our famous city of Sydney.

notes: The unit is on the ground floor and does not have an ocean view but the view is right there as soon as you walk out the door! access: Entire Apartment, Building is security access. Common Internal Laundry. Common Rooftop Terrace overlooking the beach.
interaction: We live on the other end of Bondi Beach and are only a phone call away if our guests require assistance. We look forward to hosting you and will do everything to ensure you have a wonderful stay.
house_rules: Please be careful of our new kitchen Bench tops and use cutting boards supplied. Use pull out range hood when cooking.Please hang wet towels on the bathroom hooks behind the bathroom door.If using the sofa bed please use mattress protector and linens on top shelf of wardrobe.Please be careful not to lose swipe cards as these cost $100 . Lost keys or swipe cards will need to be deducted from the damage deposit. Please close window when you go out and turn off all electrical appliances. Please no high heels on the wooden floors.Please swim between the flags on the beach as currents and waves can be strong and we want you to be safe. Maximum of 3 people thank you.

Life is Beautiful!

summary: This spacious split-level apartment, with outside dining area is perfect for couples or singles, providing both luxury accommodation and unbeatable convenience to the heart of Sydney.  Not only will you be in walking distance of many of Sydney’s iconic attractions but you’ll have an endless supply of incredible bars, cafes & restaurants all on your doorstep. neighborhood_overview: Staying in Woolloomooloo you’ll be in walking distance of some of Sydney’s top attractions, including the Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge, Darling Harbour, Botanical Gardens, Chinatown and various local markets, as well as the iconic suburbs of Kings Cross, Potts Point, Surry Hills and Darlinghurst. On your doorstep is Woolloomooloo Wharf which continues to be a favourite location for visitors who seek its incredible views of the Sydney skyline. Woolloomooloo is also home to Finger Wharf, the largest wooden structure in the world. Its dining options include a variety of ethnic restaurants ranging from Asian to Italian, and visitors can enjoy a quick meal before heading off to the historic Old Fitzroy Theatre for a show.
notes: There really is no better place to explore the city of Sydney than in this location, so take advantage of all that there is to offer.  Not only are you in walking distance of all the central attractions and an endless supply of bars, cafes and restaurants, you’re only 15 mins ride by public transport or Uber to the beautiful beaches of the Eastern suburbs, including Bondi, Coogee, Bronte and Clovelly.
transit: One of the key features of this apartment is the exceptional convenience of its location. So whilst there is a selection of both limited free street parking and paid parking areas, the location lends itself to taking to the streets by foot.  You’ll be in walking distance of many of Sydney’s iconic areas and attractions and only a 15 mins walk from 2 major train connections of Kings Cross and St James, as well as numerous bus routes.

transit: Plenty of easy free on-street parking for those travelling by car. If you are going to Vivid or any other Sydney centre icons we recommend public transportation. Bus 243 stop is literally two minutes away, note though that aside from frequent peak hour timings ( (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) ) bus 243 leaves every hour starting from 10:05. Alternatively 10 minutes walk will bring you to the Military road with myriads of "CITY" buses to catch. Both bus options will bring you to Wynyard station at the heart of Sydney CBD in less than half an hour. A great alternative for those going to the Sydney Opera House or the Circular Quay or the Royal Botanic Gardens is to catch bus 225 at the Cremorne Junction (10 minutes walk from our house) followed by the iconic ferry from the Cremorne Point Wharf that will take you to the Circular Quay in 10 minutes - with all the Opera House and Harbour Bridge views that the harbour crossing can bring you. GOING BACK FROM SYDNEY: From Wynyard (STAND A):  B

neighborhood_overview: This apartment is just a 5 minute stroll to the beautiful Sydney University campus and the renowned Glebe Markets. It's also just a few minutes from vibrant Newtown with it's numerous restaurants, boutiques and cafes along popular King Street. It's also just a few minutes to Royal Prince Alfred Hospital. You can walk to Sydney's Central Station in 25-30 minutes, but there are plenty of city buses stopping within a few footsteps of the house.
notes: There is currently no wifi at the apartment. However, you can find a number of cafes offering wifi along Glebe Point Road.
transit: Buses on Parramatta Road come very frequently, and go direct to Central Station.
interaction: Myself or my sister will be available to hand over the keys and show you around. You will also be able to call one of us if you require assistance at any stage :) If you need to check in a bit earlier or later, don't hesitate to ask as it's very likely that I can accommodate this!

name: Fun & Games in Potts Point
summary: This apartment is in the perfect location for anyone looking to get the most out of Sydney. Everything that you need including transport, food, shopping and entertainment is within easy WALKING distance of the apartment.  The apartment is stylishly fitted out with a comfy Queen size bed, large couch & TV, fully equipped Kitchen etc.  We have a lock box for after hours check ins for your convenience.
space: This executive studio apartment is situated on the second floor of the well known “Regents Court” boutique hotel in the heart of Potts Point, prime location for quality dining and direct access to the city. Modern fit out including kitchen/dining, bedroom and separate bathroom with full size shower, the apartment has a scene of sophisticated charm.  Sit back and unwind in the Livingroom in front of the 49inch flat screen. Or sink into the couch, kick your feet up and enjoy getting lost in your favorite literature.  The kitchen is well-equipped with everything you need to put together that fantastic home cooked meal, if the local cuisine hasn’t persuaded you to dine out. Fitted out with an electric stove, cooking utensils, kettle, fridge/freezer, toaster, and basic pantry supplies. We all enjoy and great night’s sleep so I can assure you, the bed is fantastic. A comfortable Queen size bed is fitted with hotel quality linen you can sink into, professionally laundered after every stay. If

neighborhood_overview: Potts Point is in my opinion the prime location for a traveller. Firstly it's walking distance to pretty much anything you need. The Sydney CBD is a 10 minute walk away through the beautiful Hyde park. The Opera house, Mrs Macquaries chair and the Botanical gardens are 10 mins away. Party destination such as Oxford St and Kings Cross are a 5 min walk away. And world famous Bondi beach is a 20 minute bus ride. Local Eating. The local area is home to some of Darlinghurst’s best cafes and restaurants. Zushi on Victoria Street is great Japanese for either lunch or dinner. Casoni is located in Taylor Square and just a short stroll away for Italian. Bills is just down the road on Liverpool Street and is a local institution for both coffee and breakfast/lunch. If you are up for a short walk, Potts Point is a 10 minute stroll down Darlinghurst Road. Here you will find some of the city’s best restaruants including Apollo for Greek, Cho Cho San for Japanese, Billy Kwong for modern Chinese, Frate
notes: Please take note that our cleaning fee includes professional cleaning after each guest along with the restocking of essentials such as toilet paper, soap, conditioner etc. The sheets and towels that we use are high quality hotel standard linens which is guaranteed to be clean, fresh and pressed. If you have any problems with the cleanliness of the house when you arrive please let us know AS SOON AS YOU ARRIVE so that we can send the cleaners back to complete the job.
transit: As mentioned most of the things you need are WALKING distance, Sydney harbour, the CBD, Surry hills, Kings Cross, Museums, Library, Pubs, Clubs, Restaurants, Cafes. As mentioned I lived here for 5 years and never had a car, it's perfect. If you want to take the ferry to Manly or the Zoo circular quay is walking distance as well.
access: You will have access to the entire apartment which is directly accessible from: Springfeild Ave, Potts Point. This apartment is a non-smoking, so if needed please step outside. This is a relaxed and peaceful neighbourhood so we ask you to respect the environment in such a manner while enjoying your stay.  Key collection has been made easy, as I use a lockbox system. This allows you to come and go on your own time. Once you have confirmed the booking I will send you through the details on how to find and operate the lockbox. And if you would prefer me to meet you at the property for checkin this can be arranged.
interaction: I live 15min away in Newtown, so if anything comes up during your stay I am more than happy to help. Once the booking is confirmed I will send you through my mobile number, if needed you can contact me at any time during your stay.
house_rules: - No loud noise after 10pm - No parties

Looking forward to meeting you.

neighborhood_overview: King street is 3 minutes walk, just on te corner there is really good and affordable Italian food and there is countless cafes and bars on either direction of King street. It would be a good idea to have a stroll towards Newtown station on king street and explore any place that tickles your fancy!! Chances are you will find a place to suit your style regardless of what you are looking for, Newtown has you covered!!
transit: Public transport at the doorstep, and 8-minute walk to nearest trains station that will take you anywhere from the CBD or all the way to Bondi. It is easier, faster (15min) and almost the same price ($18-$20) to uber vs taking the train ($18) from the airport.  There is also payed parking on all 4 streets surrounding my place, but no parking on premises.

name: Treetop Suite, Magical Location, Wonderful People
summary: Climb the stairs, and you are in a world of your own. A luxury Queen bed, modern ensuite bathroom and forest view is yours.   Its a house with Japanese levels of thoughtfulness, good people, and a cute cat and chickens.
space: This home was made for people who are busy changing the world, or at least their part of it, and need a leafy green re-charge, right here.   Your room is at the top of the stairs, with sunshine and a view of the leafy forest below.  There is a big lazy ceiling fan, and for those hot summer days, we provide you with an extra pedestal fan. There is a high-quality Queen bed, excellent quality linen, and modern bathroom. The main living room is airy and high-ceilinged.  There is a cute cat, and 3 chickens roam the garden. They will give you an egg for breakfast.  All this peacefulness is just 10 minutes to Sydney Central Station. Our house is semi-Japanese. That means, we aspire to be super-observant, doing the small things that matter. Like keeping your room crisp and restful, and making you happy. I usually have live-in assistants who help keep the place nice, and you looked after. We often do easy yoga in the evenings, and you will be invited to join in.  There is no T.V. here, that hel

There is a high-quality Queen bed, excellent quality linen, and modern bathroom. The main living room is airy and high-ceilinged.  There is a cute cat, and 3 chickens roam the garden. They will give you an egg for breakfast.  All this peacefulness is just 10 minutes to Sydney Central Station. Our house is semi-Japanese. That means, we aspire to be super-observant, doing the small things that matter. Like keeping your room crisp and rest
neighborhood_overview: Its leafy, with lovely cafes and creative shops nearby in cute Booth Street. There is even a scientific gift shop. Sydney's "little Italy' is down the road, in Norton St, with quirky bookshops, cinema, events and street life.
notes: If you look at the profiles of my past guests, you will notice they are all rather wonderful.  I prefer to leave rooms empty otherwise.  "You are the average of the 5 people you spend the most time with".   If you are here, you are already an honoured guest.
transit: Its 4 minutes walk to the Bus stop on Parramatta road, with busses to the city every 5 minutes. Have you heard of O-Bike? Its a dock-free bike borrowing scheme with lots of bikes lining the bike track, waiting for you to scan and ride, wherever and whenever you like.
access: Feel free to use the kitchen for your breakfasts, and you dinners too, by arrangement before booking.  We will make a spot for you to keep your ingredients. Check in is from 4pm.  If you want an earlier check-in, just ask and we will arrange it for you, wherever possible.
interaction: As much or little as they wish.  I choose guests who I admire and enjoy,  so our interactions are meaningful and fun. Because of the Japanese culture, we are good at yielding to each other, to make life collision free. There are other wonderful, thoughtful volunteers and housemates living here, and are a joy to live with, even if you hardly see each other.
house_rules: This house is for sociable introverts who are thoughtful, yielding, soft-spoken and contributing to a better world.  Make sure you have a profile that tells me about what you do: your hobbies, interests, profession, and dreams for the future.  Make sure it has a clear photo, and the person you are traveling with is also clearly described.  Guests must be over 26 years of age, or equivalent.  Make sure you are able to share a bathroom gracefully, clean up after yourself. Make sure any phonecalls, or watching videos is done privately, so as not to disturb other residents.  Use of the kitchen is by arrangement.  Don't smoke on the street in front of the house.  Sorry to have to say all this. I usually only choose people I know will do this naturally, but Im trying instant book for the first time.

host.host_about:
I'm a permaculture designer and Illustrator, with a serious commitment to making my world luscious. So far, so good, thanks to the excellent people who come and stay in my house, and who let me into theirs, long before AirB&B.

I've been living and working part of each year in Australia, part in Tokyo, and little working trips all over the place.

I write a Magazine column in Japanese, 'Cecilia's Permacutlure Slow Life'. Its about creative ways to de-trap your life of wasted time, energy and affection, freeing you up to do the good work you were put on this world to do. 

For more than 10 years I've run a share-house for creative people - you can read about it on my blog Balcony Garden Dreaming.

My hobbies are Japanese tea ceremony, creative dinner gatherings and drawing illustrations of the quirky world I dream to live in, and often actually do.  

I've been a WWOOF host for many years, hosting travellers who volunteer their talents to help look after this house, garden and all its creatures.  

I don't have a life motto exactly, but when thing go wrong, I ask myself 'Whiner or Designer?'.  That gets me positive and resourceful.  If things go wrong for you I won't say it though. I'll just help where I can xx

name: Renovated Federalist House with a Private Garden and Hot Tub
summary: Stand on the front porch of a beautifully preserved period home and admire a stained glass transom window. Many original features remain inside, from woodwork to fireplaces. A careful renovation has produced a contemporary kitchen and bathrooms.
space: The home has many of the old features you so crave in a period home such as wide hallways, beautiful stained windows and stunning wooden floors. Yet it also has all the modern features you would wish for such as ducted air con throughout and modern bathrooms.
description: Stand on the front porch of a beautifully preserved period home and admire a stained glass transom window. Many original features remain inside, from woodwork to fireplaces. A careful renovation has produced a contemporary kitchen and bathrooms.
neighborhood_overview: The house is in Drummoyne, one of Sydney's most prestigious suburbs. The neighbourhood is situated by the water, and is home to many yachts. Drummoyne is away from the hustle and bustle of city but close enough that is never a hassle to get there.
transit: If you arrive by car there is lots of parking space at the property with easy access to the main roads getting you easy access to all areas of Sydney. If you are using public transport there is a bus stop approximately 240 meters away and can get you to the CBD in around 25 minutes. notes: STAIRS: This is a 1st floor apartment with no lift. 23 Stairs. NO PARKING: This apartment does not have any parking. Most street parking in Coogee is time restricted but there is paid secure undercover parking just 100 meters from the apartment block for $18/day. It is located in the Woolworths car park which operates between the hours of 6am – midnight, 7 days a week.
transit: TAXIS AND UBER There are also regular taxis and Uber services in front of the building. The cost of a trip to the CBD or the Airport is around $40. BUSES There is a public bus stop just around the corner on Arden St (2min walk) with very frequent services. Buses to the Sydney CBD leave almost every 15 minutes and the cost is around $4. You will need an 'Opal' public transport card which you can buy from City Mart 250 Coogee Bay Rd or EzyMart 227 Coogee Bay Rd. interaction: You will be welcomed by one of the hosts upon arrival, given a tour of the apartment and an opportunity to ask any questions you may have about the apartment and Coogee area. name: 'The Dunes' Luxury 2 Bed Beach Guesthouse Cronulla
summary: A NEW 2 bedroom private designer guesthouse with its own access, minutes to the beaches of Greenhills, Elouera & Cronulla. Situated under the iconic 'Wanda Sand Dunes' in a quiet residential suburb, the position of the apartment is an outdoors and nature lovers dream. A 3 minute drive or 20 min walk will have you at the trendy cafes, bars & restaurants of the famous surf village of Cronulla. At ‘The Dunes’ you can escape, unwind and enjoy the coastal lifestyle in absolute comfort and privacy.
space: An immaculate ground floor 62 square metre guesthouse apartment with an open plan living/ dining room that leads into a 'chefs' caesar stone kitchen. This guesthouse is set up specifically for air b n b guests meaning that there are no personal belongings in here and it really is your own place. Two spacious bedrooms and a great size bathroom ensure there is plenty of room for all guests. Ideally suits a couple, two couples, singles or a family of four. Decorated in contemporary coastal colours 'The Dunes' has porcelain tiling, luxurious soft carpets and is beautifully styled for that perfect relaxing get away.  Accommodation  Spacious living/dining area - Large lounge, comfy cushions, 4 seater wooden dining table with chairs, a 55 inch Ultra Definition 4k SMART TV with unlimited  access to Netflix, celling fan Designer Kitchen - Westinghouse oven, hob, microwave, large fridge/freezer, Breville kettle & toaster appliances, Nespresso Latissima coffee machine, ample storage Master Bedroo

neighborhood_overview: The unique thing about Greenhills Beach is it’s spectacularly beautiful and convenient setting. A relaxed coastal neighbourhood surrounded by 90 hectares of national park and water but it is only a couple of minutes into the heart of bustling vibrant Cronulla. Greenhills Beach has a beautiful sea breeze,  it has a boardwalk lake full of ducks and lots of walking tracks around. A 15- 20 minute walk to the viewing platform at the top of the iconic sand dunes is a must as you can view the whole of Bate Bay into Cronulla and the Sydney CBD. If you are feeling up to it, walk at the edge of the water to pristine Boat Harbour and back or along the whole length of Bate Bay (4kms) . There are so many things to see, do and experience in the local area.  From The Dunes Guest Apartment:  Walk into Cronulla along the Esplanade - 20 mins  Swim in the Cronulla, Shelly Beach or Oak Park rock/ sea pools - 3-8 mins drive  Drive and park at Boat Harbour (4WD and subject to park fees) Get a coffee at Bian
notes: Included: Bedding, house towels (please do not take to the beach), tea, coffee, milk for hot drinks, salt, pepper, cooking oil, shampoo, toothpaste, toilet paper and household cleaning products. Please make sure you read the house rules. There is absolutely no smoking allowed inside or outside the guesthouse. We kindly ask you to treat this guest apartment the same way you would treat your own home and clean up to the best of your ability before your departure. NOTE: There is a  minimum 2 night stay Please note: There is no pool, no outdoor area for kids to run around, only small outdoor seating area in laneway path at side of apartment. There is a community deck/ pond area nearby and Wanda playpark 8 minute walk away.
transit: Sydney Airport 25-35 mins in car  Walk home from Cronulla along the Esplanade - 20 mins  Cronulla and Wooloware train stations - 20 mins walk or 5 mins drive Sydney CBD 35 - 45 mins on train Uber and Taxis - very easy to get
access: The guesthouse apartment is self-contained and it has been described as 'like your own personal home away from home'. It is attached to the main house but we enter our premises from the other side of the block. Guests have exclusive use of a side path at the front (right side) of the property. There is street parking space directly outside the black gate in front of your access path which is always available. There are additional public street parking spaces in the street. Guests have unlimited access to Wifi and guests must agree not to use it for illegal uploading, downloading, or other illegal activities (air b n b disclaimer).
interaction: I am around occasionally but mostly I am contactable by my mobile if you have any queries or need assistance. If I miss your call, leave a message or text me and I will do my best to get back to you as soon as possible.
house_rules: No extra guests are permitted in or to stay in the guesthouse without prior consent, thank you. No pets inside or outside please. NO Smoking or Vaping Rule. This premises inside and out is absolutely no smoking. If this policy is not adhered to and if there is a smell of smoke in the apartment, there is a fine of up to $500. The smoke alarms will be triggered if they detect smoking inside the apartment and the homeowner will be alerted. Strict no Party or Drugs Rule - this is a beautiful, quiet part of the world, so please be respectful towards the neighbours and keep the noise to an acceptable level, especially between 10pm and 8am. So please no exceptionally loud music.  If you have visitors please ensure that they observe the House Rules. Please look after the keys, replacement of keys will result in $30 from security deposit. If any of the house rules are broken as per Air b n b Policy the homeowner can cancel the booking straightaway and guests will be asked to leave immediately.

notes: This is the external building/garage area of a family home, which is occupied by a couple and their 18 year-old son. host.host_about:
Honest and hard working, Rod is native to Australia while Lynsey is Scottish...they met in Sydney when Lynsey was on a gap year in 2005.

We enjoy watersports and spending time by the pool/at the beach or camping.  

Lynsey spent the first 14 years of her life in Malawi (C. Africa), then lived in Scotland.  Rod lived in Scotland with Lynsey and his son Brandon for a couple of years (exposed to the coldest winters we've experienced during 2009/2010), before we all decided to move back to Australia for the warmth!

As hosts we want you to have a comfortable and enjoyable stay with us.  We open our home to you as guests.

The studio is a lovely getaway for 2 looking for a romantic escape which has great river views,  many large trees which are home to the wonderful bird life and yet so close to amenities.  Its a beautiful spot to unwind with a glass of wine & watch the sunset.
space: Overseas guests from all backgrounds are  welcome. Guests have use of an outdoor fire & seating to watch the sunset, enjoy a wine &  watch the rowers pass on the river. name: Quiet Hideaway in Middle of Everywhere
summary: Number One is a cute, private 1 b.r. apartment suitable for singles or couples with separate bedroom, living room, dining area, kitchen with full gas cooktop and electric oven, refrigerator and microwave.  There is one other apartment in the building and the neighbourhood is quiet and residential, although so many local amenities are just two blocks away.  Less than 5 minutes walk to light rail, buses, shops, cafes and restaurants, off the main roads and close to parks and bicycle tracks.
space: The apartment has its own courtyard area with bistro table and chairs.  There is also access to a larger courtyard which is shared and which provides a quiet spot to read in sunshine or enjoy with friends.  The two high quality single beds can be fastened together with foam topper to convert easily for king bed use.  The beds will be prepared with appropriate linen for your stay when you let us know how you wish them configured.  The space works well for couples or two friends.  All linen and towels are taken to a commercial laundry for your hygiene protection as their commercial washing machines have higher heat settings than domestic ones.  This is actually the law, but many do not observe this.  Although we quote $100 for each additional guest, this does not apply to your child.  One child could be accommodated (without charge) if you wish to use our single air floor mattress in the living room - we will be happy to provide some extra linen etc.

There are lots of parks and recreation areas nearby as well as being near a popular local shopping centre which has a food court and coffee shops in addition to a number of busy cafes and restaurants nearby. The popular Norton Street Palace cinema complex is about 15 minutes brisk walk or 5 minutes on the nearby buses both at rear and in front of the Market Place centre, and that location also has its own Norton Street shopping centre, wifi, cafes, coffee shops and pubs.
notes: As we have unlimited wifi here at our property you should find it easy to keep up with all your ongoing matters.  At the nearby Market Place once again there is ample opportunity for free wifi, so you need never be out of contact.
transit: Street Parking outside the property and in surrounding streets is free and usually quite easy, although it occasionally can be a bit competitive during business days...very available at night.  If going in to the centre of Sydney city, I prefer the light rail which finishes at Central station to change to other trains or buses depending on destination.  I will explain this more fully to any guests who have particular destinations in mind.  Suffice it to say, for now, that it is very very convenient and easy.  There is also access to plenty of Government buses which will take you to many locations....I just happen to really like trains!  At the nearby shopping centre there is a pick up drop off area for ‘Go Get’ cars, which can be very handy if guests would like to drive occasionally.  Registration and booking is all done on the ‘Go Get’ (Website hidden by Airbnb) (Hidden by Airbnb) will oblige.  If you prefer taxi, it costs about $30 to travel to and from the centre of the city, althou
access: The apartment shares the laundry and dryer with No.2  - accessed through the large courtyard -  but also has its own clothes line located in its own courtyard.
interaction: I usually give my guests privacy and space, but I am a friendly soul and happy to socialise when at home.  Always available by phone, text and email.  I also love my country and have been to lots of places, so am always ready to suggest places to go or things to do if guests ask.
house_rules: If bringing an infant please advise if you wish me to arrange hire of cot and/or high chair. I only approve a small dog as an accompanying pet and require to be advised of full details before confirming a booking.  For the 2 bedroom apartment dogs are not allowed beyond the rear patio and kitchen area...i.e. not on timber floors where their feet scratch.  There is a very large tiled kitchen/sitting room and tiled deck with direct access to the large rear courtyard area, so doggies are usually quite happy with that I find. Please deposit rubbish in outside bins before leaving and wash all kitchen items which have been used.   If a pet has been agreed to accompany you please ensure that all waste is picked up in a plastic bag, secured, and deposited in red bin. When leaving the unit, please ensure that lights, aircon and heating are switched off. The neighbourhood is private and quiet, and it is hoped that you will enjoy this environment and behave similarly. If using the larger common c

host.host_about: Hello, I am Robeen, a retired flight attendant with Qantas International.  I loved my job withs its regular opportunity to look after people and share their travel experiences.  I also love to travel myself and am always ready to give and receive any travel advice or suggestions.  When I travel I love to absorb the local culture, and I do hope that through Airbnb I can provide a good experience for those who might be new to our State or Country.  Having lived out of a suitcase for so many years, I do know the enjoyment it can bring to have a warm and welcoming place to stay, and I am doing all I can to make my property such a place for visitors.  An earlier Airbnb venture was most successful and enjoyable, and it was so good to read of my guests pleasure and appreciation.  I hope I can achieve this standard once again as I welcome guests in 2018......I will certainly be doing my best to make every stay a great experience.

neighborhood_overview: Strathfield is a suburb in the Inner West of Sydney, Australia. It is located 12 kilometres west of the Sydney central business district. Strathfield's residential landscape is extremely varied, ranging from country-style estates to high-rise apartments. Many styles of architecture have been employed over past decades, with dwellings having been constructed in Victorian, Federation, Interwar period architecture, Californian Bungalow and contemporary periods. One of the oldest surviving houses built in the 1870s is Fairholm which is now a retirement village called Strathfield Gardens. Strathfield is known as a regional centre for education.
notes: Bedroom 1 has 2 single beds. Bedroom 2 has 2 single beds. Bedroom 3 has 2 single beds. All bedrooms can be locked. Bedroom 1 is described in my listing 1. Bedroom 2 of the house is described in my listing 2.  Bedroom 3 of the house is described in my listing 3. If you are three or more people, you will have to book more than one of my listings. All listings/bedrooms can be locked for privacy.  Street is quiet.  Minimize noise after 10:30PM on weeknights. There is one parking space which is long and can fit two cars. You may have to negotiate with another driver to move the car. Please contact me if you have any questions.
transit: Train station 5 minutes walk from the house and is a very convenient way to get into the city centre or in a west direction to the Blue Mountains. If you bring your car you can park it for free at the house and then use public transport to get around.  Opal travel cards are easy to purchase.  Strathfield railway station is a major interchange on the Sydney Trains and NSW TrainLink networks and for buses serving the inner west.
access: Guest have accesses to:  • Their private room  • The other 4 shared rooms  • They have to share the bathroom and kitchen with other possible guests  • The maximum number of people that may be sharing the bathroom with you is five. The house is a shared facility and you have to work with each other.

name: Executives Den - Suite 3 - Buxton House
summary: Buxton House - Suite 3 - is a cosy self contained private double room, en suite, kitchen and eating area. Large windows give a lot of light. You will enjoy the Sydney city terrace living in quality. Located in the heart of Redfern and a 15 min walk to sydney CBD.  ⚒ New bathroom and huge kitchen for state of the art inner city living ⚒ Smart 32"TV ⚒ Central location! 5-10 min walk to surrounding inner city suburbs of Surry Hills, Newtown, Chinatown ⚒ Great food dining and bars venues
space: Redfern Street runs eastward from the Redfern railway station and 500m down the road The Buxton House is one of six brick Victorian Terrace houses of two stories. The house is zoned under conservation heritage and if only walls could talk this house would no doubt have some notorious under belly stories to tell. We founded this house neglected, run down and decrepit but saw beauty within its colonial Architraves, Kauri Pine and Red cedar stair case, Sandstone window sills and natural Victorian Charm which led us to our restoration to its former colonial glory. Redfern over the past couple years has seen a revival and is now starting to establish itself with some world class bars and restaurants. Upon arrival we have put together a welcome book containing our favourite recommendations all tested personally first hand.

neighborhood_overview: Redfern is a real eclectic diverse mix of characters which makes for a fascinating never boring neighborhood. Our journey restoring the Buxton House has allowed us to meet and befriend the local community. Our neighbours have been so friendly and welcoming to our new presence on the street. The Redfern people are down to earth and from my experience very welcoming.
notes: All Linen is of Hotel Quality. 100 percent cotton towels and hand towels and Bed Linens is at a high Thread count. On arrival please read the welcome book which contains important information and recommendations that have been tried and tested. PARKING - generally pretty good for an inner city suburb. 1-2hr parking on Redfern street and 4hr parking limit on Chalmers street with no machines. If you drive to the back streets you will be able to find all day parking. Strictly NO Smoking in all Suites or balcony. A strict cleaning fine will be asked for if guests smoke inside rooms. However if you would like to smoke please feel free to smoke out the back in BBQ common area or out the front of the house.
transit: Buxton House is 500m from Redfern station or around the same distance to Central station. Cleveland street has bus's that take you all over sydney. Redfern station is the hub of all lines and all trains stop here. The eastern suburbs line will take you to bondi junction, which makes getting to the beach super easy. 8ks to the beach
access: Your Suite has its own bedroom kitchen and bathroom eating area completely yours. Common hallways are shared along with the laundry and back bbq area.
interaction: Buxton House was designed to be personal however incorporate zero human interaction at check in and out to ensure efficiency and privacy with our state of the art security system which is keyless and cardless. We will give you the information to access upon booking. However if you do require any assistance or just want to chat about the area and place we would be more than delighted to make your aquaintance.
house_rules: NO SMOKING - if smoking in room or on the balcony a 100 cleaning fee will be charged.

name: Comfy & Leafy Miranda approx 5km to Cronulla Beach
summary: Stay in our basic but comfortable & clean granny flat (converted garage, detached from the house). We have a lovely private backyard, just a few kilometres from the beach, with transport nearby, & various tourist-worthy things that southern Sydney has to offer.  Other guests have enjoyed the homeliness, the leafy backyard, that they can enter the granny flat at night, without the need to go through the house & having their own, private space.
space: Granny flat styled accommodation, cheaper than the backpacker hostels charge and way cheaper than a hotel! It has been described as a good base! Features: - Private entry to the quiet granny flat at the rear of the house, there's solar lights if it's dark when you come home. - Lovely, large leafy backyard (with BBQ) for you to relax in after a day of exploring our amazing city - Shared kitchen in the main house which is fully equipped to prepare your meals   - Share the large, full bathroom with one other - you are welcome to watch TV and relax in the lounge room, or use the DVD and CD player in the granny flat. DVD's provided! The granny flat has a comfy single bed with fresh sheets. There is also a double fold out sofa bed if needed (standard rate is for one person. Extra person $12 per night, (paid upon arrival). - Laundry: washing machine and clothes line - Off-street parking  You will have plenty of privacy but we love having a chat. And if needed, we can make suggestions for plac

neighborhood_overview: The area has lovely tree lined streets and there is lots of native bird life. Miranda is a suburb in southern Sydney, located 24 kilometres south of the Sydney central business district. You can look up local information on the internet for  'CRONULLA' + 'Royal National Park' to see some of the excellent Tourist Attractions nearby. The 'Sutherland Shire' is one of the cleanest, safest places to live in Sydney. The area is full of trees and therefore native birds. As this is a residential area, it is less cluttered than the city area. Parks and bushland are in close proximity to Miranda, so when you are back from exploring Sydney, you will be able to relax in peace. Miranda also has a huge shopping centre on The Kingsway. There's a smaller shopping centre with a Superbarn supermarket and various grocery shops located in Gymea right near the train station. Cronulla Beach – famous and only 5km drive away or a 7 mins train away Bundeena Ferry Ride – from Cronulla railway you can catch a fe
notes: I encourage you to read the profile carefully so you have a clear idea of what to expect, especially if you are new to Air BNB.  It is our preference to host guests who are fully verified with a form of Government Identification (ID) such as a license or passport and photo. No additional cleaning fee charged. No heavy drinkers please.
transit: A bus across the road takes you to Miranda railway station in 5 minutes or you can take a leisurely stroll to either Miranda or Gymea Railway station in about 15-20mins. Both are equal distance from the house. If we are free, we might even offer you a lift!  Trains to the city take about 43 mins (at peak times) or about 50 mins (at other times). The trains usually come approx. every 15 mins.  If you have a car, there are many lovely places to visit within an hours drive. For example, the Royal National Park is lovely for bush walking, a picnic, row-boat and bike hire (15 mins drive away) Check out 'Guest Resources' for directions from the airport to here.
access: Private access to the accommodation is via the driveway. When you arrive, I'll give you the key to access the main part of the house (for the bathroom, kitchen etc.).
interaction: We always try to meet and greet you. Otherwise, we'll leave a key for you. We are contactable by phone if and when necessary.  We are always happy to have a chat and provide you with information. If you'd like to keep to yourself, that's fine too!
house_rules: Smoking is is fine outside, on the back verandah. Normal expectations of respecting and looking after property.  In the interest of all, please clean up after yourself, no food or coffee in the room.  Wet towels should be hung up to dry, please remove shoes before walking on the carpet -  :) No heavy drinkers and no drugs.

host.host_about: You'll find that I'm a friendly, sociable and easy going person. I love travelling, discovering new places, live theatre, music of all sorts.

name: Comfortable large single bedroom for female guests
summary: Our home near Sydney Olympic Park, is close to bus stops, marketplace, medical centre and multi-cuisine restaurants. We are looking for friendly, tidy female guests for short-term stays.  The single bedroom has an adjacent shared bathroom/toilet. The east-facing well lit room has a comfortable bed, study table, built-in wardrobe and ceiling fan. Walk through the recycled backyard garden  with veggie patches, worm farms, compost bins, native beehives and see a home biogas system in action.
space: The room, on the top floor of a two-storey house, has a leafy outlook. It has a single comfortable bed, a desk with lamp, a side table and ceiling fan. There is a mirrored wardrobe for your clothes and bags. The adjacent bathroom has a bathtub, toilet, vanity unit and shower recess. The bathroom is shared with my aged mother who lives in another bedroom.

There is a mirrored wardrobe for your clothes and bags. The adjacent bathroom has a bathtub, toilet, vanity unit and shower recess. The bathroom is shared with my aged mother who lives in another bedroom. Besides your bedroom and bathroom, you have access to the kitchen facilities, lounge and backyard. We are mostly available in the evenings after 5pm
neighborhood_overview: Newington started as the Athletes village during the Sydney Olympic Games of 2000. It was built as a green suburb with solar power and greywater recycling. There are bike paths to the sporting complex of Sydney Olympic Park and beautiful surroundings of wetlands, mangroves, lakes and parks.
notes: Newington has no railway station and you would need to take a bus from Strathfield or Parramatta or Sydney Olympic Park to get here. There are limited buses at night, last bus being around midnight.
transit: The house is close to bus-stops from where you can get buses to Strathfield, Sydney Olympic Park or Parramatta stations for rail links to the rest of Sydney. You can also take the bus or walk (about 20 minutes) to the nearby ferry wharf for a lovely journey to the city along Parramatta river. There are limited bus services late in the night. Ample street parking is available for cars. You can use our bicycle for short distances such as visiting the Sydney Olympic Park.
access: Besides your bedroom and bathroom, you have access to the kitchen facilities, lounge and backyard.
interaction: We are mostly available in the evenings after 5pm on weekdays and home most weekends. We go to bed around 10pm and would appreciate quiet after this time. You must inform us if you are going to be back later than this hour. We respect our privacy as well as yours but at the same time would love to help you out with making your stay comfortable and smooth.
house_rules: 1. Guests are expected to clean and maintain their rooms (bedroom and bathroom) in a tidy state.  2. If kitchen/laundry facilities are used, please tidy up after use and wash the dishes/utensils when done. We are happy to provide some space in the fridge to store your food. Microwave, oven and gas is available for basic cooking / heating. 3. Dirty laundry should be placed in the laundry basket provided and you can use the washing machine when required. There is a clothes line in the backyard but you can also be provided with an internal drying line for rainy days. 4. This is an environment-friendly household. Please use water and electricity wisely, for example ensuring at least a near-full load for laundry, switching off appliances at the power point after use, taking short showers etc. Please recycle appropriately.

host.host_about: We are a married couple with one daughter, now empty-nesters. I am interested in all things sustainable and environmental and our living reflects this philosophy. My husband loves making movies but he works in risk management. We like a quiet,unhurried life where there is time for reflection and creativity.
