neighborhood_overview: The name of the suburb is Kingsford, which is a vibrant suburb. It is where University of NSW is locating. It is ten minutes by bus to Fox Studios, Sydney Criket Ground and Centennial Park, five minutes walking to Prince of Wales Hospital. The main road is Anzac Parade.  There are at least 50(yes, fifty) restaurants at the main road, Anzac Parade, serving Western, Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Thai, Indian, Indonesian, Malaysian, Singaporean and Vietnamese food, etc. There are about 10 cafes and 2 bars. Besides, there are McDonald, Subway and Oporto restaurants. It is a food lovers’ heaven. The neighbouring suburbs are Kensington, Randwick, Rosebery, Matraville, Daceyville, Mascot, Pagewood and Maroubra, etc.,
notes: The tenants in this area are mostly college students. During summer vacation, most of them have gone back to their countries for holidays. The price have been heavily reduced during vacation. It is the best opportunity to take advantage of the discounted price. It is economical single room. It suits tourists on low budgets.
transit: The accommodation is one minute walking distance to University of New South Wales, shops, restaurants and transports at the main road, Anzac Parade.  The buses go to Sydney CBD, airport, beaches, shopping centers, Railway Square, Central Station, Bondi Junction, Randwick, Pagewood and Maroubra etc. It only takes fifteen to twenty minutes to go to Sydney CBD and airport, about five minutes to shopping malls and ten minutes to beaches.  There are ten different buses. During peak hours, there is one bus every minute. It is close to Bondi, Coogee and Maroubra beaches also.

notes: PUBLIC TRANSPORT NOTES LIGHT RAIL  700 M walk to Rozelle Bay Light Rail (station) The light rail comes every 10-15 minutes during the week and 15-25 minutes on weekends. It is about 30 minute ride to the city.  The light rail stops at: The fish markets, Paddy's markets, The Star, Darling Harbour, Central Station (where you can get buses and trains to anywhere around Sydney)  (website hidden) BUSES The nearest bus stop is about a 5 minute walk, which is on Booth street near Johnston street.  The 470 takes you into the city which takes about 25-30 minutes The 370 takes you to Newtown 20-25 minutes bus ride.  Newtown has multiple cafes, bars, restaurants, pubs and is good for shopping. name: in the heart of Sydney
summary: The location is perfect - walking distance to the city and some of the best food in Sydney. Redfern is a quick uber ride to the beach (could ride a bike) and the airport. Surrounded by creative spaces and parks . Only 200 metres to the train station. You'll love this sunny, artsy space and the vibe of Redfern. Redfern is a place of many stories - come and create a story yourself.
description: The location is perfect - walking distance to the city and some of the best food in Sydney. Redfern is a quick uber ride to the beach (could ride a bike) and the airport. Surrounded by creative spaces and parks . Only 200 metres to the train station. You'll love this sunny, artsy space and the vibe of Redfern. Redfern is a place of many stories - come and create a story yourself. I’m a local of the area and I’m happy to answer any questions you have about Sydney and/or the history of Redfern. Redfern is rated one of the top ten places to live in Sydney. Redfern is a dynamic community that is home to one of the largest Indigenous populations, political and cultural activists, artists, trailblazers and leaders. Redfern is steeped in Indigenous history. Redfern has always been an important cultural place for Indigenous peoples. Redfern has something for everyone  - it has award winning restuarants, hipster cafes, and is surrounded by parks. Redfern is also a short walk to Surry Hills whic
neighborhood_overview: Redfern is rated one of the top ten places to live in Sydney. Redfern is a dynamic community that is home to one of the largest Indigenous populations, political and cultural activists, artists, trailblazers and leaders. Redfern is steeped in Indigenous history. Redfern has always been an important cultural place for Indigenous peoples. Redfern has something for everyone  - it has award winning restuarants, hipster cafes, and is surrounded by parks. Redfern is also a short walk to Surry Hills which has some of the best food in Sydney.
transit: Redfern has it's own train station and has numerous bus routes all around sydney. Redfern has off the street parking. The location is perfect right in the centre and close to beaches and the airport. You can even walk to Central Station which can connect you with the rest of NSW and Australia.
interaction: I’m a local of the area and I’m happy to answer any questions you have about Sydney and/or the history of Redfern.

host.host_about: Hello, I believe that travelling allows you to find your best self. When I was 19 I went overseas for the first time for four months and the experience provided me with the courage to follow my dreams - two degrees later and 20 years of working experience I set off on a gap year. This experience helped me find the courage to start my own unpaid project.  In that year I stayed mostly in air bnb and it allowed me to experience the culture of the place first hand. Now I'm opening up my own studio.  I hope people get to love Redfern and Sydney as much as me :)

summary: Beautiful, quiet, newly renovated city apartment in lush Chippendale area. Stays cool in summer, and has a massive private courtyard with a barbecue and outdoor dining area. Includes a secure underground parking space. Surrounded by trendy cafes, restaurants, bars and galleries. Across the road from beautiful Victoria park (with outdoor pool). All within 5-15 minute walk are: Central station, Chinatown, trendy Newtown nightlife, Universities (Sydney Uni, UTS), CBD.
space: The apartment is our home, and we're away on holidays, so we have left all the amenities you may need for your stay. This includes items such as towels for the beach, ping-pong rackets and a basketball for the park, and a fully stocked kitchen. The apartment has been recently renovated, with a new kitchen, bathroom, and courtyard, so it's ultra comfortable. Additionally, it's perfect for Summer, as the outdoor area gets lots of sun, which is great for lounging around, yet the inside area remains in the shade, so the indoors are nice and cool.

neighborhood_overview: Surry Hills is an evolving area known for its stylish cultural and cafe scene. Terraced houses on Crown and Cleveland streets showcase hip coffee joints, fashion boutiques & global eateries. Trendy pubs, wine bars & galleries dot this community hub with a contemporary design. Held once a month, the Surry Hills Markets lure shoppers for snacks and vintage goods. It is an excellent place to be!  As well as being the name of the most impressive city in the world, Sydney is the name of the suburb that covers the CBD, Opera House, The Rocks, Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. So, you know you're going to get views, history and plenty of places to booze with the suits. But what makes Sydney great are its fabulous little mini-burbs.
notes: To ensure a pleasant stay for all, please show consideration for all the guests sharing the premises. •Guests shall maintain their rooms in a condition that does not create a fire and/or hazard. •No overnight visitors are permitted. •Guests are responsible for the behaviour of their guests, no additional guests allowed without prior getting consent from the host.  •The building is always to be kept clear of garbage and debris. •No smoking, alcohol, bad language or drugs on the premises. Smoking allowed outside the property with proper disposal. All facilities are communal. Please clean up after yourselves, especially in shared spaces like the kitchen and bathrooms. Do not leave dirty dishes in the sink. Please KEEP QUIET after 10 pm, no loud music, conversations or devices allowed. Please be respectful of others and only whisper after 10 pm. All lights out in common areas before midnight. Check-in is from 2 pm and self check out is at 10 am. Thank you for your consideration.

summary: This unique, stylish 4 bedroom, 3 bathroom residence features bespoke interiors, a lush private garden, in-ground salt water swimming pool and security car space.  Perfectly located for a relaxed, beachy lifestyle, the home is less than 10 minutes walk to Sydney’s Coogee beach, as well as shops, bars and eateries.
space: Featuring gorgeous polished walnut timber floorboards and ducted air-conditioning, this spacious, comfortable home is perfect for a family or several couples holidaying together.  Upon entering, you’ll find 2 bedrooms, both with queen sized beds and plantation shutters.  One of these bedrooms also has a work space and an elegant bay window with a sofa.   Adjacent to these bedrooms is a bathroom with floor-to-ceiling white tiles and a double vanity.  Head down the hallway and you’ll come to a dedicated study/office on your right and then a family bathroom, also with floor-to-ceiling white tiles, a roomy shower recess and separate spa bath.  Opposite this large bathroom are stairs which lead to a loft bedroom with its own queen sized bed, and is perfect for children with games and books. neighborhood_overview: The coastal suburb of Coogee features one of Sydney’s most beautiful beaches, along with a multitude of shops, eateries and bars to suit all tastes and budgets.  On the south side of the beach you’ll find ‘Wiley’s Baths’, a heritage listed 50 metre sea water pool.  A grassy parkland with grand old fig trees on the north side of the beach provides the perfect picnic spot next to the water.

host.host_about:
Hey, I’m Aymeric!

I’m a French expat from the vineyards of Bordeaux with a love for animals and traveling. At 18, I moved to the USA for 10 years and lived in Boston, Miami Beach and San Francisco while exploring most of Canada, Central and South America. For the past 15 years I’ve lived in Sydney, Australia, mainly because of the beautiful beaches here. On weekends in summer, you can find me volunteering as a surf lifesaver on Tamarama beach.

I work for MaisonNets, a boutique agency specializing in short-term rental management. The MaisonNets portfolio has over 125 properties, encompassing mid-range to luxury apartments and houses in Australia’s capital cities, as well as country homes and a villa in Bali.  

Our properties are all specifically selected for their amenities and prime location - the accommodation of choice for urban sophisticates, professionals, couples and families looking for a uniquely comfortable experience.

With a focus on organic products, MaisonNets offers unparalleled personal service and attention to detail ensuring that you, our valued guest, have a wonderful stay with us.

name: Bronte B&B Studio
summary: Under a towering white mulberry tree is a delightful,  private studio with bathroom for two people to enjoy a sojourn in beautiful beachside Bronte. The ocean beach,  local cafe & restaurant strip plus bus stop for Sydney CBD are an easy stroll.
space: The wooden floored studio consists of a bedroom with a queen size bed, a comfy armchair, table, two chairs, a cupboard, shelves with a sink, microwave, fridge, toaster, Nespresso coffee machineopp  and crockery. There is a flat screen TV, iPhone dock and Wi-Fi. The bathroom has a shower, toilet and basin.
description: Under a towering white mulberry tree is a delightful,  private studio with bathroom for two people to enjoy a sojourn in beautiful beachside Bronte. The ocean beach,  local cafe & restaurant strip plus bus stop for Sydney CBD are an easy stroll. The wooden floored studio consists of a bedroom with a queen size bed, a comfy armchair, table, two chairs, a cupboard, shelves with a sink, microwave, fridge, toaster, Nespresso coffee machineopp  and crockery. There is a flat screen TV, iPhone dock and Wi-Fi. The bathroom has a shower, toilet and basin. The studio has its own verdant garden of orchids, avocado trees, banana palms and passionfruit vines. It is surrounded by a hedge and is private from the main house, set 20 metres away across the garden. There is a large outdoor timber topped table to spread out on. The access is level from the street. Follow the brick paved drive way to the back gate to the garden. Guests can conveniently come and go without disturbing others. Your hosts, Sus
neighborhood_overview: Bronte was recently featured in the New York Times travel article, 36 hours in Sydney. “About a mile south of the more famous Bondi Beach, along a breathtakingly beautiful waterfront walkway is Bronte Beach, a boomerang of golden sand nestled between wind-worn cliffs, a verdant public park and the Tasman Sea." The beach also features ocean baths. Take a mask and snorkel and walk to the next beach, Clovelly Beach, to see the protected Blue Gropers or a boogie board to the surf beaches, Coogee, Tamarama and of course, Bondi.  Our street is quiet, even when the beach is very busy on hot days.
notes: It is located around the corner from Three Blue Ducks, a casual cafe and restaurant opened by three surfer friends that is featured in the 2014 Good Food Guide as one of the best cafe and restaurants  in Sydney's eastern suburbs. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby too: Vietnamese, Italian, Seafood, macrobiotic, modern Australian and much more. Food allergies are catered for if you need gluten free or lactose free breakfast. We try to be sustainable and use recycled products and the garden is watered by a combination of water captured in rainwater tanks and town water. The garden is fertilised by organic compost produced in both compost bins and worm farms. We have Australian native stingless bees that are kept away from the studio that help pollinate the garden. This means that we don't use any pesticides in the garden as we don't want to harm the bees.
transit: A 2 minute walk to the 440 bus that will deliver you into the city in 20 minutes or 10 mins to Bondi Junction where you can catch the train to the city.
access: The studio has its own verdant garden of orchids, avocado trees, banana palms and passionfruit vines. It is surrounded by a hedge and is private from the main house, set 20 metres away across the garden. There is a large outdoor timber topped table to spread out on. The access is level from the street. Follow the brick paved drive way to the back gate to the garden. Guests can conveniently come and go without disturbing others.
interaction: Your hosts, Susan and Greg, provide local knowledge of the eastern suburbs of Sydney as well as their favourite Sydney sights, what's on in Sydney, where to eat and getting around on public transport.
house_rules: No smoking.  There is a no visitor policy as it is our private garden which guests are welcome to use. However if you want to discuss please check with us about visitors well in advance.

host.host_about: Susan and Greg live in Sydney's east. Susan is a magazine journalist and Greg is a financial consultant on retirement systems and an academic. We love to travel, see movies, cook and am addicted to box set DVD shows. We like gardening, growing our own food and keep native stingless Australian bees.

neighborhood_overview: Rushcutter Bay is neighbour to one of Australia's most famous suburbs Kings Cross which is known worldwide. It has a great mix of travellers and locals and the suburb is very eclectic with a wide variety of people from all walks of life. If you like to stay where the action is stay at our place. Walking distance to the city and a great selection of restaurants/bars and nightclubs you have everything you need right at your doorstep.
transit: The apartment is located right near Kings Cross station. One stop to the City and two stops to Bondi Junction. You can also easily walk in the City Centre in around 20 minutes. And if you feel lazy, especially at night, an Uber is always a good and cost effective way to get home quickly.
access: You will have access to the whole studio. You will sleep on a brand new bed and all other amenities are set up so you can have a very comfortable stay with 2 people.  The bathroom has a shower and also houses the internal laundry with washing machine and dyer.  The house is stacked with all essentials for your convenience. There is also a small balcony on which it is nice to relax.
interaction: We usually leave you to enjoy your stay and give you privacy. However if you require help with anything we are always just a phone call away.
house_rules: - TERMS and CONDITIONS:  Please read the following before booking our house. We have a beautiful home we like to share with you and we have to make sure the house and our neighbours are happy with you there.  With large houses like this there are just a few extra rules we want you to be aware so we all have the best possible interaction with one another.  1. We have a strict no events policy at this house. We can NOT accommodate any type of event. No parties, no hens/bucks weekends or functions.  2. Noise complaints. Most neighbours live here permanently and so they do have the right to expect it to be quite during the hours of 10pm-8am. Any complaints from neighbours may result in immediate termination of rental and loss of all remaining monies paid including bond.  3. Any breach of house rules in general can result in eviction and loss of bond. House rules are  a. No extra people on premises. If booked for 5 people 5 people can stay even if the property accommodates more guests.  b.

name: Relax on the Terrace of a Darlinghurst Home
summary: Soak up the sunshine on a lounger at this inner-city house, tucked away in a quiet street, yet close to the action. Recharge in this bright, modern, air-conditioned space, which opens onto a secluded outdoor terrace area.
space: Welcome to Sydney! This quirky terrace house has been recently renovated from its old corner shop origins to be a bright and airy open-plan designer residence with quality inclusions throughout.  The house has two bedrooms and two bathrooms (one of each occupied by the owner). The rented bedroom has a mirrored built-in wardrobe, and private access to the outdoor raised terrace area - perfect for catching a bit of Sydney sun. The room also comes with a double bed, an LCD TV with Entertainment channels from Foxtel/cable TV, and a radio/alarm clock that also acts as an iPod/iPhone charger and music player.  It is also fully air-conditioned (as is the remainder of the house). Guests have their own bathroom (on the ground floor), and use of the new kitchen (gas cook top and electric oven, dishwasher and fridge) along with use of the front-loading washing machine. The lounge and main TV area is also available for use by guests. The house is situated in a quite street in Darlinghurst.  The gr
description: Soak up the sunshine on a lounger at this inner-city house, tucked away in a quiet street, yet close to the action. Recharge in this bright, modern, air-conditioned space, which opens onto a secluded outdoor terrace area.
neighborhood_overview: Victoria Street, Stanley Street, and Crown Street are culturally rich destinations. These high street areas are connected by a network of laneways and street corners replete with small bars, cafes, and boutique indie retail.
transit: Getting around the inner areas of Sydney is easy from this location. Most attractions are within walking distance (within 20-30 mins walk). However, if you're not so keen on walking, there are numerous bus routes that service the area (from Flinders Street and Oxford Street). The Sydney public transport network can most easily be accessed with use of an Opal Card - which I can supply if needed.
access: Guests have full access to the living area and kitchen. They have their own bathroom (on different level to the bedroom), bedroom, and direct access to the outdoor terrace area.
interaction: I'm happy to socialise with guests, but just as happy to give them their own space if that is what they're after. I generally work weekdays, but I'm just a phone call away if needed.
house_rules: No smoking inside. As I work full time I can only guarantee a late check-in (after 6pm) on weekdays. However, there is some flexibility with this, depending on your arrival day and time (any time on weekends is fine for example, and I can sometimes get away during lunch breaks if my workload permits).  So if you have your travel details and would like an earlier check-in..... please ask and it may be possible.

host.host_about: Inner city Sydney guy, loves to travel, but has mostly only explored Europe and the US so far! Favourite destinations are Berlin, New York, Chicago, and Barcelona. Looking forward to exploring more, and hosting visitors from all around the globe!

name: Spacious room with private floor in 3 story home
summary: Relish in the charm this beautiful three story terrace home has to offer, situated in a quiet leafy tree lined street in the heart of Rozelle. Meander up the hill to enjoy the many popular pubs, restaurants, fashion and gifts shops. On Saturday's head down to the famous Orange Grove Farmer's Market or enjoy a picnic at the park, at Balmain ferry wharf. Due to its close proximity to the city, Rozelle is an ideal location for professionals.
space: Styled for comfort and relaxation, boasting city skyline views, a comfortable king sized bed, a flowing working area and large living quarters with your own private floor. The common areas are shared and can be enjoyed by our guests. The house offers a private gated courtyard filled with fresh herbs and edibles grown by us! A fully functional kitchen, laundry with washer/dryer facilities, and a large comfortable living and dining area. There is one bathroom with a shower and bathtub, as well as 2 separate toilets on the ground floor and second level. Internet access is available and can be used throughout the duration of your stay. BBQ facilities are also available. We ask that you please clean the area including all utensils and grill plates if you decide to use it. For our guests with cars, unmetered street parking is available. Your room is located on the top floor where there are two flights of stairs. Long term stays are preferred however, it is not a requirement. GETTING AROUND R

What's not to enjoy!
notes: We ask that you please use all common areas with respect, and clean up after yourself. This includes cleaning of used dishes, rubbish and the BBQ if you decide to use it. Extra fees may be applied if the house is left unkept. Please do not bring anyone other than yourself, to our home. Parties are strictly forbidden. We are a working home and ask that you respect all partrons by keeping noise at a minimum, from 10pm.
access: You are welcome to access all common areas and of course, your room during the entirety of your stay. Out of courtesy, the two bedrooms located on the second floor are not accessible. A guest book will be kept at the house for you to go through should you have any questions however, please feel free to contact me or speak to your two hosts Jacqueline and Justin who will be present (intermittently), if you are unsure of anything.
interaction: I will be away during your stay so I won't have the pleasure of meeting you, however you will be greeted by two other beautiful hosts, Jacqueline and Justin. If you're lucky enough, Justin might also treat you to a visit and a cuddle by his gorgeous french bulldog, Pebbles (Pebbles does not live on the property).

name: Sydney City Apartment  Petersham
space: Hi, my kids are now grown and living on their own so I am keen to share my Sydney apartment. It is located parkside in Petersham with a great view of the surrounding area and City Skyline. It is a modern, bright large split level space, with living areas upstairs and 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and 2  veranda's downstairs. The complex has a lift and is security coded. There are 2 train stations and a bus stop within 5 minutes walk. all of which are 10 minutes from the centre of the City. It is an easy walk to the restaurants and cafes of eclectic  Newtown or the sensational tastes of little Portugal in Petersham and little Italy in Leichhardt. Bookshops, curios and arthouse theatres are all in walking distance. name: Secluded semi moments to everywhere
summary: Flexible, casual living in our pretty coastal home. Endless days spent relaxing by the pool, or a short walk to beaches or hop on a bus to the city. Child friendly yet an adults haven, you will enjoy Australia at its best in this beautiful spot!
space: Open-plan living, with flexible arrangements for sleeping; the hammock is my favourite place... A contemporary styled home with all your creature comforts plus some extras! DOWNSTAIRS - Front terrace - Entrance - Queen bedroom - King single and trundle bedroom* - Shower room and laundry - Kitchen - Living room - Courtyard and pool * Every space will happily sleep an adult, the 10th space being a trundle bed which may only suit up to 14yrs old. UPSTAIRS - Master bedroom with balcony - Family bathroom (Bath and separate shower) - Single room with extra full-sized-single trundle - 2nd living area/queen size sofa bed room with balcony and hammock With plenty of space to escape to and a generous indoor/outdoor living area to gather in, you will be sure to have a wonderful holiday.

neighborhood_overview: Walking distance to almost everything. A beautiful 45 minute walk along our coastline boardwalk to the famous Bondi Beach, via Clovelly (5 minutes), Bronte (20 minutes) and Tamarama (25 minutes) beaches. Excellent surf and snorkelling opportunities along the way. Coogee (and the spectacular New Years Eve family fireworks) is only a 5 minute walk down the road. Coogee is a bustling beach with an abundance of restaurants, cafes and the newly opened Coogee Pavillion. Just around the corner from us is an excellent Thai takeaway, sushi bar, coffee house and famous fish and chip shop. A bistro, deli and bakery complete our very local area as well as the Clovelly Hotel (pub). We are 1 minute from Gordons Bay, with an amazing underwater snorkelling trail, calm water and an interesting rocky shoreline, perfect for sunbaking and lagoon-style swimming.
notes: We have a Nespresso machine with a starter pack of coffee. Shampoo, conditioner and soap to make travelling a little easier! All bed linen, bath towels and beach towels are included. Please strip beds before you leave. A clean will be required on departure and is also available if you require during your stay.
transit: Just around the corner you can catch the bus to Bondi Junction (10 minutes) for Westfield shopping centre or the City (20 minutes). 2 pre-loaded adult and 2 pre-loaded child Opal cards are provided for your convenience. There is also free parking on the street. The airport shuttle is the best way to get here, or of course a taxi.
access: Access to computer, wifi, gas heated swimming pool, gas Weber bbq, Sonos in most rooms, PlayTV, Nespresso machine, washing machine and tumble dryer, dishwasher and ceiling fans.
interaction: Feel free to text or email me anytime for hints and tips on the house and the area.
house_rules: Staying with us means you can live like a local!  Please be mindful of noise in our close community. Please smoke outside only. Parties, gatherings, functions are STRICTLY PROHIBITED. In the interest of being green, we ask guests to ensure that lights/heating/cooling etc., are switched off when not in property, and when checking-out. Check-in/check-out is flexible depending on other guests arrangements. We will try to accommodate your needs as much as possible. Any damages and/or losses to property or contents must be immediately reported to us via email. All damages and/or losses to property or contents are the express responsibility of the Guest making booking and any of the Guest's Invitees. So, you or your guests will be responsible and are obliged to pay for any damages and/or losses to property or contents. How to use machines, run the pool and anything else will be available for you in a booklet on arrival at the property, or you can just message me if you prefer!

host.host_about: We have lived in Sydney for 14 years, started our family here and live happily in the Eastern Suburbs. We have 3 girls and enjoy our beachside suburb lifestyle. We love eating out, the beautiful walks and our little dog.

name: Private Luxury Apartment Sitting atop Pittwater
summary: Escape to a beautifully located modern design apartment with a private pool and sauna. Scan the panoramic views above Pittwater from an open walk-out living room, or head down to the water to watch the boats before sunset.
space: This near new luxury apartment has everything you need to enjoy a comfortable and serene break away. It's private and tranquil and you will enjoy the stunning views of Pittwater from every room. It has it's own private outdoor  area and pool overlooking Pittwater, large separate   Queens bedroom, designer bathroom, lounge/ dining, full kitchen facilities and it's own sauna. The apartment includes WiFi access, it's own private pool and Sauna, Fully Equipped Kitchen, TV, DVD, Luxury Linen and Hairdryer.  Guests will enjoy all the amenities of the apartment to themselves it is self contained and private.  We will be happy to welcome you at check -in and  after that you have the apartment to yourselves. Just give us a call if there is anything else we can help you with. Enjoy all the beauty of Sydney's northern beaches at your doorstep.  Stroll down to Paraidise Beach for a swim, kayak or enjoy a fish from the public wharf. Avalon Village is within walking distance with it's wonderful cafe
description: Escape to a beautifully located modern design apartment with a private pool and sauna. Scan the panoramic views above Pittwater from an open walk-out living room, or head down to the water to watch the boats before sunset.
neighborhood_overview: Paradise beach is just a few minutes' walk away. Take the spectacular walk up to Palm Beach Light House in the winter to spot whales, or visit Ku-ring-gai Chase National Park with its Indigenous rock carvings and roaming wallabies.
notes: Wedding Preparations We are the perfect location for Brides to be for their pre wedding night and Wedding preparation and pre wedding photos. Ask us about the availability to have photographs on our top deck with stunning views across Pittwater. We are happy for you to invite your bridesmaids, make up artists and photographers to our beautiful apartment and off course we have the perfect romantic location for your Wedding Night!!
transit: We have a bus stop at our door step - this will take you into Palm Bach or Avalon village. From there you can take an express bus into the city.
access: Guest access is private
interaction: I am very respectful of my guest privacy - most of my guest choose Pittwater Paradise as a romantic get away or for a secluded break. I am, however always available to give you advise on the best restaurants and things to enjoy in the area. Just let me know how I can help make you stay as enjoyable as possible
house_rules: No smoking within the apartment and no pets allowed.

name: Oh this one's lovely... and cheap!
summary: Situated only 4km (1 bus stop) from the CBD, this quiet & cosy 2 bedroom unit is just what you've been looking for.  Wake up to sounds of birds chirping, not traffic noise.  Free Wi-Fi Internet, very clean, everything you could want in a convenient location. Weekly and Monthly discounts of 12% and 20% apply to this booking and will automatically apply when you enter your required dates.
space: Your own fully furnished room in a quiet 2 bedroom unit in Rozelle. The room has a wardrobe, chest of draws, a small book shelf, bedside table/draws & a queen sized bed with linen and an extra blanket.  Towels are provided.  Unlike many other Airbnb hosts who charge close to hotel prices,  our purpose is to provide a basic, clean and welcoming “home away from home” at an affordable cost.  Our nightly rate is less than half that of the closest hotel and roughly the same as you would pay for a couple in a backpacker’s dormitory.

Guests have full access to:  *Kitchen - contains pretty much everything you n
neighborhood_overview: Rozelle is a lovey quiet neighbourhood.   There is a nice park just up the road and we are close to both the Bay Run and the Rozelle Bay walk.  It is a 10 minute walk to Darling Street Rozelle where you can find a variety of restaurants and cafes.
notes: *Smoking outside only please.   *Single guests or couples are preferred (its one Queen size bed), we are also a gay friendly home.   *No additional guests or visitors without consultation, this works both ways. *You will need to confirm your identity through AirBnB to make a booking. *We do not accept cash to extend bookings, all transactions are through AirBnB only.   *Airport transport depends on the time of day that you arrive. During peak hour it will be cheaper to catch a train & bus.  *If you are catching the bus from the city, we are about a 500m walk down Lilyfield Rd from the first bus stop after the ANZAC bridge (White Bay).
transit: The bus stops are roughly 500m from the front door and will take you into the city.  You can find specific travel information on the transport NSW website. You will need Pre-paid Opal cards to travel on public transport.  It takes approximately 40mins to walk into the city over the ANZAC Bridge.
access: Guests have full access to:  *Kitchen - contains pretty much everything you need except food. *Laundry - clothes line around the back or dryer for rainy days. *Shared Bathroom - shower over bath.  *Lounge Room - soft leather couches,  55” curved 4K LCD TV with HDMI support for laptop connection,  DVD player with a small range of DVD's. *Wifi Internet - 4G+ home wireless connection (roughly 11 Mbps) *There's plenty of free on-street parking.
interaction: We are quite friendly and always happy to have a chat about our favourite parts of Sydney.   We tend to work a lot so you may not see us too often.
house_rules: If you have an incomplete profile... i.e. No photo, A blank "about me" section, or no info about who you're traveling with... We will decline/cancel your enquiry straight away.... We hate to sound harsh, it's just that if we are opening our home to you, then we'd expect some basic information about you. You're expected to clean-up after yourself. We shouldn't really need to list any rules but basic common courtesy and respect should sum everything up... Just remember that this is a home and not a hotel.

host.host_about:
G'day, I'm Duncan.
I'm in my 30's, Australian and work in the Maritime Industry.
I've travelled all over NSW by motorcycle, been to every state in Australia and OS a few times. I've also done a few good camping trips around NSW by car.
Originally from rural Australia, I made Sydney City my home roughly 15yrs ago. 
In the past, I spent a lot of time interstate staying in hotels for work and know how monotonous it can become. 
There's nothing quite like coming "home" to a real kitchen, lounge room, bathroom & bedroom when you're indeed away from your normal residence.
My experience hosting has been great! 
If you're looking for somewhere clean that has everything you need with someone who can give you a few good traveling tips, look no further.

name: Art Deco Apartment in Bondi
summary: Homely, large one bedroom art deco apartment suitable for a couple or single person in desirable Eastern suburb of Bondi. A home away from home...that's only a ten minute walk from the beach!
space: My apartment is a cosy home away from home, it has charming original features such as stained glassed windows and is cool and airy - important in an Australian summer! Fully functioning kitchen, gas stove, with washing machine, iron and ironing board. The very large bedroom has a king sized bed and opens up into the sunroom. Large separate lounge space with L shaped sofa and an extendable dining room table that seats 4 -6, smart TV, Foxtel and DVD player. This is my home and I'm away periodically for work, so no party people please!! neighborhood_overview: Bondi Beach is the most iconic beach in Sydney. Home to the Bondi Rescue lifeguards, Sydney Hipsters, great bars and restaurants it sits at one end of the coastal path. There's a reason why every celebrity who visits Sydney, makes sure that Bondi is on the itinerary! Take your pick from: sunbaking, surfing, walking to coogee, going for a snorkel or a dive or sitting on the balcony at Icebergs or North Bondi RSL and watching the sun set over the ocean, glass of wine in hand.  It's the perfect holiday destination. My apartment is positioned half way between the beach and Bondi Junction, close to shops, cafes and the major bus routes. It's a ten minute walk to the beach one way and a ten minute walk to Bondi Junction Westfield shopping centre, Bus & Train station the other.
notes: There is a cleaning charge and I require a deposit, prior to stay.
transit: The nearest bus stop is a five minute walk away on Bondi Rd. The 333, 380 and 381 will all take you to Bondi Junction bus and train stations, or onwards into Paddington 15 minutes away, the CBD or Circular Quay a 20 - 30 bus ride away. A taxi will get you into the city in about 15 minutes and cost around $25 depending on traffic.
access: Gas stove cooking Well equipped kitchen Washing machine & washing powder/conditioner Books & board games Dining table that sits four L shaped, 3 seater sofa Smart TV, Foxtel (cable TV) & DVD player Bath & Shower King Sized bed Clean linen and towels Built in wardrobe
interaction: Myself or a friend will let you in and hand over the key, but will give you complete privacy during your stay. Please feel free to call, text or email with any problems.
house_rules: No party people please, singles or couples preferred, the flat is only suitable for two people maximum.  No smoking inside the flat please. No parties please, no illegal behaviour and please respect my neighbours. I have to live here!  Please leave the flat as you found it!  Please DO help yourself to any food or condiments you find in  the cupboards or fridge. If you finish something it'd be great if you could replace it?  I'll have put clean linen on the bed and left clean towels out. If you need more you'll find them in the cupboard by the bathroom.

name: Bronte Beach Jewel Apartment
summary: Our beautiful one bedroom apartment is located at only 5 min walking from the beach (green link path), with a nice and wide balcony with amazing ocean view. Perfectly located: food stores and bus stop at few steps and 10 min away from Bondi Junction,
space: Located in one of the best and most quite suburb in Sydney (Bronte), our place is perfect for couples, singles or just friends who want to spend an amazing holiday in Sydney. The amazing terrace with ocean view, the peaceful neighbourhood, the beach and public transports just at few steps make our apartment a real jewel. We love it and we really hope you will as well!

Bronte beach offers many different chances to enjoy the beach such as the rock pool, a beautiful park with BBQ's and sport activities.
notes: It's very easy to get here: by using public transports you can jump on the bus 378 from the city and Central Station (from early in the morning till late night) or from Bondi Junction interchange if you want to catch a train (e.g. from the airport or from the city.

Our block is very quite and neighbours are super kind and polite: we won't to bother them with party or loud "events". We like to keep our house as much clean and tidy as possible and we expect our guests will do the same in our absence.

host.host_about: Easy going, always with a big and true smile on my face!

name: Beautiful Bondi family beach house
summary: Stunning luxury beach house just a short 3 minute stroll to Australia's most famous beach - Bondi. With 4 large queen bedrooms, designer furnishings throughout, spacious open living area and a huge private garden retreat with hot outdoor shower, it's the perfect home to unwind in the summer, or stay cosy by the indoor & outdoor fires in winter. Indoor/outdoor dining options and large open living areas make it the perfect place for families, and 1min walk from the best restaurants of Bondi.
space: Stunning tropical beach home just a short 3 minute stroll to Australia's most iconic beach - Bondi. With 4 large bedrooms, designer furnishings throughout and open living/dining with a huge private garden retreat, it's the perfect home to unwind. This North facing, family-sized semi feels more like a holiday retreat than a home. The open plan kitchen flows effortlessly onto a stunning tropical garden that boasts everything you need for a perfect summer getaway - a hot outdoor shower, family hammock, designer outdoor entertaining lounge area and a beautiful dining table which is perfect for long afternoon lunches or sunset dinners.  Located on a coveted beachside cul-de-sac, this dual level semi is just a few minute’s level walk to the beach and to Hall Street’s village café scene and vibrant new restaurant precinct. The interiors reveal beautiful presentation, offering all of the essentials for a comfortable family lifestyle, including four bedrooms and a level lawn for kids to play. D

neighborhood_overview: Year-round beach lifestyle At any time of the year, Bondi Beach is a buzzing morning, late afternoon and night-time scene. Enjoy a tasty coffee and some breakfast before walking the Bondi to Coogee coastline. Take in a long, lazy lunch in one of the suburb’s excellent restaurants. Among the dining options is Sean’s Panaroma, a landmark of Bondi culture. It offers a mix of classic Italian and Australian dishes as well as superb views of the beach and ocean. At the other end of the beach, you’ll find Icebergs Dining Room and Bar, with its stunning views. Join the queue at Gelato Messina - it will give you time to make your choice from the daily ice cream specials board. Share family fun meals at the huge range of casual singing options, or finish a perfect day in Bondi with a cocktail as you rub shoulders with popular Sydney stars who call this beachside icon home. Best of all, everything you need is within a few minutes walk, so you'll never even need to get in the car! Bondi Beach Whil
notes: Minimum 7 night bookings.
transit: There is 2 hour limit parking along the street outside the house, as well as a GoGet hire car  located a convenient 50m away. With the beach and Hall streets cafe and restaurant precinct just minutes walk away there is really little need for a car.
access: Guests will have access to all amenities, including the surfboards and herb garden which are located around the side of the house.  The only off limits part of the house is the attic storage.
house_rules: Strictly no parties, no pets indoors, and no smoking indoors.

host.host_about:
Hi,
I am Hannah from Sydney. 
Hope you enjoy your stay in my stunning beachside retreat,
Cheers!!

name: Studio with bathroom and kitchenette in Newtown
summary: This private studio is inside our family home. It has its own private entrance & you access your private bathroom via a shared hallway with a partition, which separates your private space from the rest of our home. The queen-size bed sits in one corner, with a kitchenette in the opposite corner (no kitchen sink), leaving the rest of the room as a living area with TV. There is a clothes rail with hangers in the shared hallway next to the partition. Please don’t come past the partition uninvited.
space: Your room is like a hotel suite, but without the expense. Your kitchenette includes a fridge, microwave, toaster, sandwich press, kettle and pod coffee machine. Also like a hotel suite, there is no kitchen sink. Tea and coffee are provided as well as milk, fruit, cornflakes, muesli and various spreads. We have added a bluetooth speaker so you can listen to your own music. There is a heater and ceiling fan in your room. There is also whole-house heating and air-conditioning, which can be put on by request.

neighborhood_overview: Newtown is an interesting and vibrant place with great restaurants, bars, pubs and shops and a lovely community spirit.
notes: Please note, there is no kitchen sink in your studio. I am happy to put your dishes in our dishwasher, or if you prefer, there is a washing up basin that you can fill with the shower head and empty into the toilet (not after 9pm please by reason of noise). For the same reason, please turn the bathroom fan off when you aren’t in there. We also kindly request that you do not put glass or ceramic near the bathroom sink. We are a family with two children, 14 and 11 years (bedtime is 9-9.30pm). We are friendly and welcoming and will consider any requests to make our guests' stay as comfortable as possible. We will make an effort to keep noise to a minimum during your stay and we ask that you do the same for us. Keeping your door (and bathroom door!) closed while you are in there helps insulate us from each other’s noise. Thank you
transit: Newtown Station is 10 minutes walk and there are buses to the city a few minutes walk away on Salisbury Rd. We are within walking distance of RPA hospital and Sydney University. There is unrestricted parking on one side of the road and 2 hour parking on the other until 8pm, which becomes unrestricted overnight.
access: Guests have their own private entrance to the studio, which is separated from the rest of our house by a partition in the hallway. Please respect our privacy by not coming past the partition uninvited.
interaction: This is advertised as a private space within a house, so interaction is by your request only
house_rules: We would like our guests to be aware that this is a private space at one end of our family home and to be respectful of that. This is a no smoking house with no pets. If you are going to smoke outside, please do it away from the front door, preferably in the back lane and do not drop cigarette butts on the ground please. Thank you

host.host_about:
I am originally from Northern Ireland. I live here in Newtown with my partner, from Yorkshire, and our two Aussie kids. We love living in such a vibrant area with such great cafes, restaurants & bars and such a great variety of shops. We have a lovely community here, plus we are really close to the city.
The mottos I like to live by: "Kindness costs you nothing" and "Take nothing personally".

name: Modernist Urban Retreat
summary: Located in an iconic building in Elizabeth Bay on Sydney Harbour, meticulously redesigned with high quality finishes, fittings and furnishings my home in Sydney is the ideal urban retreat a step away from the uber hip Potts Point precinct
space: With only two apartments per lift on each floor there is a complete sense of privacy, in this iconic Harry Seidler building. There are widows with views in each room, natural cross ventilation and a seamless flow of spaces. A a spacious balcony off the living and bedroom area is ideal for 'al fresco' breakfast and meals. The apartment is located in Elizabeth Bay village and is quite and private in a green setting with lovely filtered views to the harbour. Floors throughout are in Italian basalt with high quality bespoke built in furniture, designer furniture and quality furnishings.

neighborhood_overview: Elizabeth Bay is a small and  exclusive green harbourside location 10 mins from the Sydney CBD, it is a 5 min walk to the uber hip Potts Point precinct with its boutiques and cool bars and restaurants. There is nothing to not like about the area it is the perfect urban retreat.
transit: Sydney city centre and the Opera House precinct is an easy 20 min walk past parks and the harbour, there is a metro 10 mins walk and buses nearby to take you to the main transport hubs. Taxis are at the doorstep.
access: Guests have access to the full apartment, including an under cover security car space. Some built in robes will be locked for personal effects.
house_rules: No smoking and or pets. Guests are asked to respect the quite amenity of the building. Soft shoe policy. The apartment has stone floors throughout and to avoid sound transmission to the adjoining neighbours guests are asked to wear soft sole shoes within the apartment.

host.host_about: I am a design professional with my home base in Sydney Australia and a 'retreat' in Lucca Italy. This is the place that I come to to keep myself grounded and re tune myself from the pace of a big city.  My home is my sanctuary. I can't live without light so it the most light filled space I could find, with complete privacy and a zen environment. The most important things for me are good friends and a sense of self. The place you live in, the things you surround yourself with are key to the quality of life you have as are good food, art and the places you love.  There are a lot of places one can love but only a few one can call home.

name: Ocean front apartment great views
summary: Spectacular apartment, with 180 degree views of Bondi  Beach. Modern kitchen & bathroom. Large living room plus sun room with daybed. Close to cafés, bars & surf club. Live the beach lifestyle & wake up to the sound of waves!
space: Very large apartment, with huge living area and sun room to chill out in. Sun room could accommodate young kids and we're happy to supply baby cot. Married with 3 beautiful girls, a lovely wife and now a puppy. Love the water and swim at the beach as much as I can. Lived in the area for 30 years and love the beach life style. Into cycling, surfing and skiing. Also a life long traveler and have lived and worked overseas in U.S & Canada. Travelled extensively in South & Central America.  I really enjoy meeting new people and helping them have a great experience here in my home.
Moto: "You've got one life, enjoy it"

name: Quiet Comfy home near Sydney with carspace + wifi
summary: My bright & convenient dual level apartment is just outside Sydney's CBD. It's an easy 4 min (400m) walk to Redfern Station. It has a car space and wifi, and sleeps 4 guests (2 on a Queen bed and 2 on   spacious and modern sofa bed). Note that the apartment requires guests to ascend a flight of stairs. It's pretty quiet for its location, which is very convenient.
space: "This was our first experience with an AirBNB booking and we were very impressed with how easy Linda made the whole experience from getting the key, the welcoming packet of biscuits, the offer to use all and sundry within the apartment. The location was perfect for us in that it was outside the CBD area yet walkable to it. The local restaurants, cafes were great and we have no hesitation in recommending the apartment to others" Chris and Bob, Canada  "It was an honor to have had Linda as my very first AirBnB host. She was very accommodating and easy to talk with. She made sure we had everything we needed during our stay. She also provided directions to the best restaurants and tourist attractions. As for her place, it's well-organized and has an ample amount of space. The space is very comfortable that we were easily able to settle in. It also has all the essential appliances that a home needs. Its location is very convenient as it is relatively near to the city, close to grocery store

neighborhood_overview: This property is located where the suburbs of Redfern/Darlington/Chippendale meet. Its a very convenient neighbourhood, however its on a quiet street and close to cafés and restaurants.  The apartment is located an easy walk to the neighbourhoods of Newtown, Redfern and Chinatown and walkable (2.5km) to Darling Harbour. For groceries, I recommend going to the SPAR supermarket at Redfern station.  This old Sydney neighbourhood is predominately made up of lovely old terraces but there are also many green spaces nearby.  There is a cafe is located just across the street, and there is a quiet boutique pub just next to it. There's also an organic tea shop just down the street too. Guests should try: * Going to the Harbour, I can suggest going for a walk across the bridge! You can also walk up a Harbour Bridge pylon (The South east one) for $13, or for something really special, book a bridgeclimb. Make sure you see the Opera House, and the entry to the Botannical Gardens is just behind it. *
notes: You can use the space as you please however to comfortably accommodate 4 people, 2 would sleep upstairs and 2 downstairs in the living space on a convertible queen sized chaise sofa bed (Frieheiten Ikea sofa). The apartment is 64sqm in total including balconies. * The apartment has 2 toilets (one upstairs and one downstairs in the laundry), but just one shower (at the upstairs bedroom).  * I have a hairdryer, a rice cooker and even a baby cot! * Full kitchen use is included. Milk is provided and some sauces, butter etc. Note you are completely welcome to consume any food you find in the apartment. Tea and coffee is provided. * The complex has lots of fire extinguishers should you need them. * An early check in/late check out maybe available. Let me know in advance if you would like this option and I will check if it's possible for you. An extremely early checkin may attract an extra night's accommodation charge since it makes it difficult to rent the apartment out for the night before.
transit: For your convenience I provide Opal cards (transport cards) for your use while in Sydney. If you use them I just ask that you top the cards up again to a balance similar to how you found them before you depart from Sydney.  The best way to from the airport to the apartment is to take a taxi. You are likely to get change back from $30. It's also just a 4 minute walk to Redfern station (which is 1 stop from Central), and you can be almost anywhere in the Sydney region pretty quickly.  You need to change trains at Central though. It should only take ~15 minutes and cost just under $30 for a taxi. (To go back to the airport I suggest hailing a taxi from the other side of Cleveland St outside the convenience store, taxis come very regularly.) There is a car share (GoGet) car 20 metres down the street, a bicycle hire cafe across the street and (some) buses nearby on Cleveland St.  And... the apartment has a car space too. :) If you are very keen, you can walk the whole distance through the c
access: Easy check in procedure - if you want to arrive 11pm? No problem! :) You are free to access and use everything, except for spaces noted as "host only". Please let me know if you need the car space too. You are welcome to consume whatever food you find there or use any bathroom products in the apartment, it's provided for your benefit. :D
interaction: I live Sydney but I do not live in the apartment. Having said that I like to touch base during your stay via text and/or email to check that everything is ok. If there are any issues I am contactable via mobile or through Airbnb.
house_rules: Just a few items to take note of: * Please advise planned checkin and checkout times as soon as you are able. I need to know this so I can arrange cleaning and not have overlapping guest stays! * Please be considerate of neighbours at night, and keep noise to reasonable levels after 10pm. * No smoking and no pets please. Any trace of smoking or pets will result in loss of security deposit. * Please advise if you will have more people staying than you may have booked for as soon as you are aware - unauthorised guests will be subject to an extra $25 per person per night charge, or I may request you/them to seek other accommodation if their presence creates a scenario so my guest occupancy limit is exceeded. * Please keep the kitchen area as tidy as you found it, and if you happen to spill anything in the oven it would really assist me if you can clean it up. * Please turn off lights and empty the bins before you leave in case I don't have it cleaned immediately after your departure. I do

host.host_about:
I'm a volleyball player (and competition manager) who loves Australia!
Love Asian food.
I can ride a unicycle.... And can help you with that too :)
Have travelled to Europe, Turkey, Dubai, SE and Eastern Asia incl. China, Japan, Taiwan and San Francisco. I really enjoyed Siem Reap. I love New Zealand too!
I'm currently improving my Cantonese speaking.

Supporter of equality. :)

My motto: Be the change you want to see in the world.

name: BONDI BEACH RETREAT

name: Sydney Parkside Apartment
summary: This flat has all the features you desire whilst travelling- comfortable bed, rain-shower head, big kitchen while being centrally located to Sydney city, beaches, great restaurants,entertainment and with beautiful Centennial park right on your doorstep.
space: The Apartment The apartment features a new kitchen kitted out with everything you need to cook up a storm- induction cooktop, dishwasher, oven, pizza stone and fridge.  The bedroom is big with comfy queen size bed and massive wardrobe space.  We have installed a new bathroom with a wonderful  rain-head shower and full sized bath and heated towel rack. Other features include bamboo floors, 6 sea- dining room, awesome couch (you won't want to get off it!), TV, stereo, DVD's and internal laundry with washing machine and portable washing line on the balcony. Location We are located in the Eastern Suburbs of Sydney on Alison Road in Kensington which is approx 4 kms to the Sydney CBD. The flat is centrally located and within walking distance to Moore Park Entertainment Quarter- movie cinemas, bars and restaurants,  Sydney Football stadium, Cricket grounds and Golf course, Randwick racecourse and the University of NSW and beautiful beaches like Coogee or Clovelly beach.  Across the road is Ce
description: This flat has all the features you desire whilst travelling- comfortable bed, rain-shower head, big kitchen while being centrally located to Sydney city, beaches, great restaurants,entertainment and with beautiful Centennial park right on your doorstep. The Apartment The apartment features a new kitchen kitted out with everything you need to cook up a storm- induction cooktop, dishwasher, oven, pizza stone and fridge.  The bedroom is big with comfy queen size bed and massive wardrobe space.  We have installed a new bathroom with a wonderful  rain-head shower and full sized bath and heated towel rack. Other features include bamboo floors, 6 sea- dining room, awesome couch (you won't want to get off it!), TV, stereo, DVD's and internal laundry with washing machine and portable washing line on the balcony. Location We are located in the Eastern Suburbs of Sydney on Alison Road in Kensington which is approx 4 kms to the Sydney CBD. The flat is centrally located and within walking distance
neighborhood_overview: Kensington is a lovely little suburb. It is very safe area. There are many food options within walking distance on Anzac Parade such as Thai, Mexican, Indonesian and Italian.  Plus a lovely cafe called Cafe Jacks that has good coffee and good options for breakfast and lunch. Two blocks walk away is the foodie haven of Danks Street Waterloo where you can have your pick of many restaurants and do your grocery shopping.  The cool area of Surry Hills is also 5 minutes away by bus, Surry Hills also has great restaurants and bars our favourite is Vascos bar and the Clock Hotel- for good pub grub. This area also has a number of designer clothes and jewellery shops.  On Crown st is Messinas the best ice cream shop in Australia!  5 minutes by bus or car and a 15-20 minute walk is Randwick Spot, where  you will be spoilt for choice of restaurants. There is also a  movie cinema- Randwick Ritz and a and a few cool small bars, our top pic is Bat Country right opposite the cinemas.
notes: We would appreciate contacting us via airbnb before making a request.  If you have children then it is your responsibility to ensure their safety at all times in the flat.
transit: The flat is on a major bus transport line and busses come very 2-5 minutes. There are bus stops on both Anzac and the corner of Alison and Doncaster Roads. It is a 7-10 minute bus ride to Central station and 15 mins to Coogee Beach via Randwick. It takes between 20-25 (depending on traffic) minutes to get to Circular Quay- where you can see the Harbour Bridge and Opera House!
access: Price includes unlimited WIFI broadband internet. Also includes all linen and towels and use of all the pots, pans, plates etc in the kitchen. Fresh herbs We have a small balcony that overlooks centennial park feel free to sit out there and have your breakfast whilst listening to the birds in the trees.
interaction: My husband (John) or I will welcome you to the flat and take you through all you need to know for a great holiday.  We will happy to field any questions you might have.
house_rules: We ask that you keep the place neat and tidy. By all means have a fun time, but please respect our neighbours by not having the music up too loud, slamming security door or walking in high heels.   There is to be no smoking inside the flat and please don't ash in our herb garden. We would really appreciate if you could water the plants if you are staying for more than 1 week.

host.host_about:
I am a  fun loving person with a taste for travel and adventure. I like to travel off the beaten path which has taken me to some amazing destinations. I am passionate about nature and find myself more at home in a rainforest then in the city. I love to garden and we have a small balcony garden with a green wall and lots of herbs to add that extra spice to cooking.

The apartment reflects my partner and I laid back style with all the comforts that you will have at home. I will go out of my way to help you during your stay and ensure its clean to a very high standard. We hope that you enjoy your stay.

name: 1 Bedroom Apartment at Hyde Park/Darlinghurst
summary: Sydney CBD - East Sydney - Darlinghurst  Beautiful art deco entire one bedroom apartment in a historic building located on one of the most vibrant streets on the edge of Darlinghurst and Sydney CBD.  Suitable for guests who wants to experience living like an Australian locals but also enjoys the convenience and luxury of living in a walking distance to the city centre.
space: The space is one bedroom apartment with a newly renovated ensuite bathroom. You will have a queen size memory foam bed with clean sheet set and clean towels. Bathroom has been renovated, it has frameless shower with good water pressure, marble counter and build-in washing machine.  The apartment has a high ornate ceiling and French windows and chandeliers. Located in a charming and quiet street of Darlinghurst, and just a minute walk to Hyde Park and museum station, 5 mins to Sydney CBD, 8 min walk to Townhall station.

Bathroom has been renovated, it has frameless shower with good water pressure, marble counter and build-in washing machine.  The apartment has a high ornate ceiling and French windows and chandeliers. Located in a charming and quiet street of Darlinghurst, and just a minute walk to Hyde Park and museum station, 5 mins to Sydney CBD, 8 min walk to Townhall station. Entire apartment 1 bedroom 1 bathroom, 40 sqm. Suitable for up to 2 people.  Check in 10 am Check out 1
neighborhood_overview: East Sydney suburb is located on the adjacent right side of the CBD, next to Hyde park. It is in a walking distance to surry hills, darlinghurst, woolloomooloo, kingscross and Chinatown. This area is vibrant and has plenty of restaurants, cafes and in a quiet spot. You will get the feel of living in a village in Eastern suburb mixed with Sydney business district.  Down the street (approx 30 metres) there are plenty of trendy cafes, bars and restaurants. Many of them are very reputable and affordable. You will get the feeling of charming and vibrant suburb of Darlinghurst, whereas Sydney CBD is only 5 minutes walk across Hyde Park.  Cook and Philip park aquatic centre (2 minute walk) has heated swimming pool and gym that guests can use for a cheap entry. In adjacent, there is St Marry Cathedral and you can get to the Royal Botanical Garden in less than 10 minute walk. Darlinghurst/Victoria road and Potts Point offer a selection of restaurants, deserts, night life and more.  Bondi beach
notes: Please have at least a formal form of formal verification such as driver license or passport when you arrive.  Please respect neighbours as it is very quiet in this building.
transit: From Airport, take a city circle train to Museum station and walk approximate 2 minutes. The building is located just across the park. If you get off at Central, it will be about 10-12 minute walk and 8 minute walk from Town Hall station. There is a bus stop right outside the building. The bus 389 comes every 10-15 minutes and it will take you to Darling Habour. You can also take this bus in opposite direction to Bondi Beach in just half an hour. At Hyde Park there is a major bus stop that will take you anywhere across Sydney. If you wish to rent a car, there are plenty of car hire companies in the surround area and they offer competitive rates for car hire.  Unfortunately there is no car park in the building, you will need to park on the street but there are always parking right outside the building.
access: Entire apartment 1 bedroom 1 bathroom, 40 sqm. Suitable for up to 2 people.  Check in 10 am Check out 10 am Pls enquire about checkin/out for other times.  You will be provided with fresh towels, bed linens, iron/ironing board, TV, tea and coffee and unlimited fast internet Wifi  etc  There is a build-in washing machine and detergents available in the apartment. Cloth lines and communal dryer on the roof top area are also available. Rooftop deck has amazing view of the city, great to chill out on a sunny day.  Kitchen is fully equipped with all the cooking utensils. It has fridge, gas cook tops, oven, microwave, kettle, toaster etc. The living room is open plan, has a 3 seater couch, 40" TV screen, dining table, and french chandelier.  Smoking is allowed on the rooftop or outside building only. Could potentially be some noises from local school during the day
interaction: I would like you to feel comfortable and have a great time during your stay so please let me know if there is anything I can assist. I will make sure I respond to your message quickly.
house_rules: This building is strictly on fire safety so smoking in the apartment is not permitted. However you can smoke outside the building and on the roof top area. The common rooftop area is open from 7 am to 9 pm. You will not be able to access outside this time. Please treat as your own home and respect neighbours. Party not allowed.  Please keep fly screen closed as there are some insects coming from outside of building.

name: Chic Inner City - 3 mins to Trains
summary: We are 3 mins walk to trains and 1 min to buses. Train/bus ride 10-15 mins to Sydney City! Quiet B&B house but walk to trendy cafes, restaurants, theatre and trains/buses. Shared home, CLEAN & MODERN bathroom, kitchen and plush bed!
space: Only 3 mins walk to the train station and 1 min walk to the buses! Then only a 10-15 mins ride into the Sydney City!  Perfect for getting around Sydney! Seriously! - 3 minutes walk to Trains (Newtown Station) - 1 minute walk to Buses (on King Street or Enmore road) - 10-15 mins train/bus ride to major TOURIST attractions - Opera House, Sydney Tower, Darling Harbour, Westfield Pitt Street, Chinatown, Sydney Fish Market, Circular Quay, The Rocks. - 15-20 mins taxi ride to/from airport - 1 minute walk to King Street's buzzing cafes, restaurants and pubs - 3 minutes walk to the Famous Enmore Theatre - 15 minutes walk to RPA hospital - 1 minute walk to two nearby Bag Wash Laundry facility (NOTE: Not suitable for children under 10 years old)

neighborhood_overview: "Newtown" Suburb - You will not be disappointed!  - Famous for its young and trendy neighbourhood.  - Home of the famous Enmore Theatre! Think "Cold Play," "Aqua"  "Burlesque" concerts!  - King St, Newtown filled with endless Cafes, Pubs, Restaurants and Theatres  - A very SAFE, friendly, buzzing suburb.
notes: - Sharing the home with other travellers - I am a neat and clean freak so will try to keep all common areas like that to provide a pleasant stay for all guests. - We will try our best to be flexible with your check-in and check-out time. - Security Deposit explained - No cash payment is required to be paid to me. Airbnb has a charge/hold over your credit card for this amount in the event it is needed.
transit: Don't waste time travelling! Public transport are only 1-3 mins walk away! Train or Bus!
access: - The Bed: Real Queen Bed Mattress in your own Private Bedroom on the ground floor of the double storey 4 bedroom home.  - Spacious bedroom with quality linen and plush pillows. - Additional charges apply for 3rd guest. A quality single mattress is provided for 3rd guest. - Shared lounge with large comfortable sofas  - A shared kitchen with kettle and fridge.  - Breakfast: Cereal, milk, coffee and tea  - Stove cooking facilities for light cooking with pots and pans provided.  - FREE Wi-Fi  - Two Bathrooms to share - Clean towels, shampoo and soap provided.  - Parking:  (1) In front and behind of the property: Limit to FREE two hours between 8am to 10pm. Outside those times, it is UNLIMITED FREE.
interaction: We enjoy our privacy so we will do the same for our guests, leaving our guests alone as much as possible so that you can have your own privacy.  This place is NOT suitable for: Children under 10 years old, Family, Babies, do not enjoy having too many people around, do not like meeting new people, need private bathroom or kitchen (this is all shared). This place will suit: Young adults, Clean and Tidy Travellers, enjoys modern living without the price tag, can share a bathroom and kitchen, enjoy people/travellers interactions, wants value for money, convenience to public transport, low maintenance in terms of host interaction.
house_rules: (1) No smoking inside the property. There is an undercover area at the back of the house for smoking area.  (2) Only guests checked-in with us are allowed onto the property. No outside guests allowed into the property. So No Parties! (3) For extended stays, existing guests need to book as soon as practical on Airbnb to block out the dates yourself.  (4) As it is a shared house, we expect guests to be CONSIDERATE to others and CLEAN UP after themselves.  (5) Common areas are for common general enjoyment so you will not be allowed to use it as your sleeping area or storage area. All your personal belongings must be stored within your own room. (6) Lost keys or failure to return keys is a $20 penalty charge.  (7) Lockout fee to your room and the house is $50. (8) Follow all house rules displayed around the house. (9) By booking the room, guests agree any injury incurred whilst situated at the property and host premises will not incur a lawsuit.

host.host_about:
Living in the Inner City suburb of Sydney. Sydney's inner city suburbs are surrounded by cafe cultures. Love eating and living in the inner city buzz without living right in the middle of the city either. My fave cafés and restaurants are in Newtown, Enmore, Leichhardt and Surry Hills! 

I love to travel to eat and shop. I have travelled around Europe staying with many "Airbnb" accommodation so understand the importance of being a good host. Plus I do genuinely enjoy giving advice to guests. It is also a very rewarding feeling when I hear my guests having a good time because of my advice. :)  However, my husband and I do lead incredibly busy lives and because we lead such busy lives, when we do have downtime, we love to have a chat with our guests, catch up for supper etc to wind-down. We have gained friends through hosting and I do believe that hosting is like "hosting my friends that I haven't met yet!" I treat all my guests like I would my longtime friends so I do hope my guests treat me back the same way by being polite and respectful of my house.

When I am a Guest at an Airbnb accommodation, I will always treat the house like it is my own and respect it. And when I am a Host, I will try to add a personal touch by personalising the experience to each individual that visits as I know each individual guest is different.

My life motto? "Treat others the way you would like to be treated"

neighborhood_overview: Ahhh Glebe - so leafy and quiet, yet so close to the City!  Cafe & student culture mix with aging hippies, inner city professionals and families. Big rambling parks with water access to enjoy spectacular City skyline views.  Glebe Village on your doorstep with plenty of pubs, small bars, Saturday markets, cute cafes and cheap eats. name: Idyllic Sanctuary in Mosman Village
summary: With private leafy gardens & set in the heart of Mosman's cosmopolitan cafe strip, this charming terrace provides an idyllic sanctuary. A quick stroll to shops, restaurants, parks, walking trails, zoo, cinema & beaches + 10min bus ride to Sydney CBD.
space: Layout Upstairs there are 2 very large double bedrooms, each room currently has a queen size bed in it and a balcony off it. One also has an adjoining sunroom. There is also a very large bathroom with double vanity, spa bath and separate shower. Downstairs, is a 3rd bedroom which is very small (single bed only) but has its own small adjoining bathroom with a toilet and hand basin. There is also an open plan kitchen and dining area, which flows through to the living room, which again flows out via French doors to the terrace and garden courtyard. Re parking, There is also unlimited street parking directly outside the house (one of the few streets in Mosman where you can find this) but it is highly coveted so you need to be quick to get it! There is plenty of street parking in nearby streets, however it is mostly for limited time frames eg 2hrs during the day.

host.host_about:
I live in Mosman and love the vibe and location of this gorgeous Sydney suburb. I enjoy the cosmopolitan lifestyle Mosman offers with its vast array of boutique shops, restaurants and cafe's. With it's own beautiful Balmoral Beach, Taronga Zoo, local cinema, library, Mosman Markets, and an array of parks and waterside walking trails, I truly believe this location to be idyllic. Above all Mosman's close proximity to the city means I can be 'at the office' in 10 mins!

I love classical music and enjoy being around creative people. I think I have the perfect job in my capacity as Orchestra Manager of the Sydney Symphony Orchestra. I am lucky to be able to call the Sydney Opera House my place of work, and daily enjoy the vibrancy and excitement of this iconic Sydney venue along with it's sublime location on Bennelong Point.

In addition to my work with the orchestra, I run my own business which specialises in providing classical musicians, ensembles, orchestras, singers and entertainment for a large variety of public and private events. These include weddings, corporate events, TV commercials, concerts, recordings, cruise ships etc

I love travel and have a particular interest in European countries, history and cultures. I also enjoy meeting people, making friends, exchanging stories and generally interacting with others.

I am really excited by the unique travel experience that Air B&B makes possible for travelers, and look forward to welcoming Air B&B guests to Sydney and to my beautiful home.
Rachel
