host.host_about:
Hi  
I am both a Super Host and traveller, so my places are designed for absolute comfort with discerning travellers like myself in mind!

As a long standing Australian Super host, I strive to offer fabulous, unique, sparkling clean accommodation in the vibrant Sydney suburb of Newtown just 3km from the CBD, walk to Sydney Uni and RPA Hospital.  I have been offering accommodation for 17 years, before Air BnB I was listed on more commercial sites.

My point of difference is I have a ABN and my business is run to a professional standard with correct insurances etc. There are no common shared spaces. You are not squeezing into someone else home! My places are your home away from home.

Having returned from travelling, 3 times to Santa Barbara in 2018, and in 2017  (kayaking in Antarctica and exploring Chile) and having worked in Geneva and NYC, I strive to offer guests what I need myself, a very comfortable bed, quality linen, quiet but interesting environment and a place to eat and work (a real table and chairs!), a couch, outdoor space and Wifi!

Much of my time is spent travelling  and hosting and I also have my own Clinical and teaching mental health practice so I am busy!

Here's my hosting story:

In 2000 I purpose built Studio Q as a stand alone Studio in my garden in O'Connor, a sought after leafy inner suburb with cafes a easy 10 min walk away.  The City is 3km away and ANU a 15 min walk.  This property has been sold but Simon is now hosting Studio Q.

In Newton (Sydney) I have 3 fantastic apartments in the same complex with a roof top garden.  3 mins to the train and on "the strip" of restaurants, cafes, bookshops, movie and live theatres.  Please read more under Newtown Mews listings.

You will find my favourite local tips in each unit (i.e. best local cafes, great walks and the best the area has to offer).  I am a non intrusive host, and available by phone or email between 9-7pm,  I do not offer a 24 hr Concerige service but reviews conclude I am helpful and available in reasonable hours.

name: Designer Warehouse 1BD City Living
summary: Our chic, spacious, cozy & light-filled converted warehouse apartment is located in a quiet street of vibrant Surry Hills. It's within easy walking distance to the city and close to Central Station and its transport links. City living at its best!
space: A contemporary transformation of a warehouse in a quiet street of Surry Hills. Our apartment comes with generous ceiling height, large glass doors and windows drenching the entire apartment with light. But don't worry shutters and curtains are there to protect your lazy lay in. This large (69sqm) contemporary warehouse apartment with mezzanine bedroom includes:  * super comfortable queen size bed with hotel quality bed linens and a generous built-in wardrobe  * private district views from the tranquil & spacious balcony * air conditioning ensuring you are comfortable no matter the temperature outside * complimentary Nespresso coffee (or visit one of the many specialist coffee shops nearby) * spacious and modern bathroom including natural hand, body and hair care products, hair dryer, washing machine & dryer (incl. detergent)  * fully equipped kitchen incl. dishwasher, oven/stove, microwave, toaster and kettle * 55" TV with Cable & Blu Ray Disc player (including a selection of DVDs)  *
description: Our chic, spacious, cozy & light-filled converted warehouse apartment is located in a quiet street of vibrant Surry Hills. It's within easy walking distance to the city and close to Central Station and its transport links. City living at its best! A contemporary transformation of a warehouse in a quiet street of Surry Hills. Our apartment comes with generous ceiling height, large glass doors and windows drenching the entire apartment with light. But don't worry shutters and curtains are there to protect your lazy lay in. This large (69sqm) contemporary warehouse apartment with mezzanine bedroom includes:  * super comfortable queen size bed with hotel quality bed linens and a generous built-in wardrobe  * private district views from the tranquil & spacious balcony * air conditioning ensuring you are comfortable no matter the temperature outside * complimentary Nespresso coffee (or visit one of the many specialist coffee shops nearby) * spacious and modern bathroom including natural hand
neighborhood_overview: Surry Hills is world renowned. A vibrant suburb boasting a huge variety of fantastic restaurants, bars, cafes, galleries and shopping. It is adjacent to Centennial and Moore Park, Hyde Park and many smaller pocket parks, where you can picnic, play a round of golf, horseride, team playing fields, cycle routes (and hire if you didn't bring your own). Or just watch everyone else. You will enjoy strolling the streets where you can view some of the best restored Victorian terrace houses.  All of this is within walking distance of Sydney's CBD and Downtown. The apartment itself is less than 5 minutes walk to Central Station. Please refer to our guidebook for some of our favourite restaurants, bars, etc.
notes: If you love to cook, supermarkets, grocers and delicatessens are close by. We're sure you'll find what you're after. For special occasions, you can pre-order champagne and Lindt Chocolates, which will be awaiting you at arrival. These products can be paid for either at time of booking or separately via (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) before arrival. You have a selection of: VEUVE CLICQUOT YELLOW LABEL at A$80  VEUVE CLICQUOT ROSÉ NV at A$110  MOËT & CHANDON IMPÉRIAL at A$70  MOËT & CHANDON ROSÉ IMPÉRIAL at A$100 MOËT & CHANDON ICE IMPÉRIAL at A$110 LINDT LINDOR CHOCOLATE HEART TIN at A$15 Secure undercover car parking is available, please confirm when booking to secure. For monthly stays, fortnightly cleaning at A$85 per clean will be added. Additional cleaning including change of bedlinen and towels can be organised at A$85 per clean. Lost keys and/or lost/damaged pocket WiFi will incur a fee of $AU150 each. Please note that this apartment hasn't been set up for families with children.
transit: The apartment is ideally located in a quiet residential street, less than a 5 minute walk to Central station with major train, bus and light rail connections. It takes you about 12 minutes from and to the airport by train. You can walk to the Sydney's Centrepoint Tower in 15 minutes, Chinatown in 10 minutes, Darling Harbour in 15 minutes as well as catch the train/bus to Bondi Beach in 30 minutes, and the Blue Mountains in 1.5 hours. Ferries are available from Circular Quay for a leisurely journey to Taronga Zoo and Manly Beach. For the sports enthusiasts, apart from the onsite gym, there is also a public 50m lap pool within a 5 minute reach at Prince Alfred Park. There is an abundance of Yoga and Pilates studios in Surry Hills. There is a 18 hole public golf course at Moore Park, and plenty of running courses. Without a doubt your fitness levels will be maintained.
access: Entire apartment is yours to enjoy, with security access and lift.  Secure undercover car parking is available, please confirm when booking to secure.
interaction: We live in the area and can meet you at check-in and show you around. We will provide you with a list of our favourite places to eat, drink and shop - there are lots. Should you need to contact us during your stay, we are generally available on our mobiles between 8am and 11pm.
house_rules: Be considerate of the neighbours and keep noise to a minimum after 10pm - No parties at any time. This is a pet and smoke free apartment. Air Conditioner, fans and heater to be turned off when not in the apartment. Please leave the apartment the way you found it, remove shoes in the apartment, and leave the sand at the beach.

name: Charming and quiet historic terrace
summary: A quiet street in vibrant Balmain, close to the water and 10 mins by ferry or bus to the city. Three bedrooms sleep 4 comfortably, with a cosy sitting room, separate dining room, kitchen and courtyard. Are you happy to feed (and pat) our two cats?

Upstairs are two single attic bedrooms. A separate cosy sitting room with TV is an inviting space to relax, and the airy dining and kitchen space opens through French doors onto a sandstone courtyard with outdoor eating.

name: Beautiful apartment near dining, professional hubs
summary: A well-appointed room in a two-bedroom apartment in the heart of the Sydney CBD and nestled on the harbour steps from Barangaroo and the International Convention Centre Sydney. Darling Harbour and the acclaimed Sydney ferry service are on your doorstep. Located within walking distance from Sydney's iconic destinations, including intimate bars and cafes, all modes of transport and shopping heaven are mere minutes walk away. Private bathroom, beautiful bedroom and everything scrupulously clean.
space: You will have the benefit of a very comfortable queen size bed, access to plenty of wardrobe / closet space, your own bathroom.
description: A well-appointed room in a two-bedroom apartment in the heart of the Sydney CBD and nestled on the harbour steps from Barangaroo and the International Convention Centre Sydney. Darling Harbour and the acclaimed Sydney ferry service are on your doorstep. Located within walking distance from Sydney's iconic destinations, including intimate bars and cafes, all modes of transport and shopping heaven are mere minutes walk away. Private bathroom, beautiful bedroom and everything scrupulously clean. You will have the benefit of a very comfortable queen size bed, access to plenty of wardrobe / closet space, your own bathroom. There is no cooking other than using the toaster for your toast each morning.  Cold water is on hand at all times. There is no microwave and therefore no facilities to heat food. You are free to bring takeaway in, please sit at, the kitchen bench and not the formal dining table. You will have access to the balcony with water glimpses and a lovely cityscape view.  There is
neighborhood_overview: Steps from the King Street Wharf entertainment precinct, moments from Darling Harbour, down the street from Barangaroo - the largest urban renewal project in Sydney's history - and an easy walk to any point in the CBD, you will be staying within easy reach of Sydney's dining, entertainment, and drinking venues.  You will be near the harbour and in an entertainment area, therefore there is some noise from traffic and people. When windows and doors are shut there is virtually no noise. However if you like to sleep with your window open there is traffic noise.People who are city dwellers and global travellers claim there is no noise.
notes: I have a home office, and at times I am quite busy. Please don't think I am being unfriendly, if I am not talking to you, I am just working. I am also often out, attending meetings. I am always available if you have any questions or concerns.
transit: You will have the benefit of easy access to public transport to any point in Sydney. You will need to purchase an Opal card (Sydney's touch-on, touch-off integrated ticketing solution) at any corner store, news agency or at the airport.  Once you do, Sydney (and NSW) are all accessible. If you are flying into Sydney Airport, your room is a 21-24 min train ride (running every 6 mins during peak hours) and an easy 7 min walk away.  If you want to lap up the sun at Bondi, you'll be a 45 min bus ride away.  Taronga Zoo is a pleasant stroll to Circular Quay and a 12 min ferry ride away.  These are just some examples, but hopefully you get the idea!
access: There is no cooking other than using the toaster for your toast each morning.  Cold water is on hand at all times. There is no microwave and therefore no facilities to heat food. You are free to bring takeaway in, please sit at, the kitchen bench and not the formal dining table. You will have access to the balcony with water glimpses and a lovely cityscape view.  There is an internal laundry with washing and drying facilities in your bathroom which you may use. Ironing facilities are also available.
interaction: The benefits of inner-city living and being located on the harbour are enormous, and I am more than willing to share some insights, tips and recommendations of places to go, eat, and drink. You will be able to walk everywhere, or catch a ferry, train or bus - all are within minutes of your accommodation. I work from home on occasions, so may not always be able to chat even if I am home.  That said, it goes without saying that I'm more than happy to do my best to help out with any challenges you may face during your time in Sydney.
house_rules: You should aim to keep the living room - a shared space with the host - in the same state as you find it.  That is, tidy.  Feet with shoes on are not to be placed on the furniture.  Please place glasses/cups that you are using, onto drink coasters provided. If using your laptop on the dining table always use the placemat provided.

host.host_about: I would prefer guests who are closer to my demographic and in Sydney for work, conferences or have a busy tourist schedule. I love living in the hub of Sydney, on the water - next door to Barangaroo and sitting on Darling Harbour where there are many wine bars, restaurants, good food, cafes and a short stroll into the city. I enjoy theatre, art house cinema, galleries, exhibitions, good wine and food. My guests have told me my home is five-star accommodation. My apartment is at all times scrupulously clean. I am a vegetarian and I would prefer no meat is brought into the apartment.

neighborhood_overview: Redfern is great for restaurants and cafes.  There are still many housing commission flats and I recommend using Central Station rather than Redfern.  Especially at night.  We are on the border of Surry Hills.  The best side of Redfern.
notes: We live on a very busy street, it is a great location, super close to the city with a bus stop right out front.  This may not be ideal if you are a light sleeper and/or like to sleep in late.  The traffic out the front of the house is very noisy during peak hours.

Off street parking for one car and easy access to city transport including iconic Manly ferry. You won't be disappointed. Positioned right on Manly Beach with stunning 180 degree ocean and beach views, this bright and sunny 2 bedroom, third floor apartment with elevator is only a few footsteps to the world famous Manly Beach and kids play areas. And just a short 10min level stroll to Manly Corso, the cafes, bars, restaurants, ferries, aquarium, harbour beaches and all other attractions Manly has to offer. With two large double bedrooms, both with queen sized beds and built-in wardrobes, the apartment is ideal for one or two couples or one couple with up to two kids. There is a separate bathroom and toilet, bathroom with large bath and separate shower, internal laundry with washer/dryer, open plan kitchen with sto
access: With two large double bedrooms, both with queen sized beds and built-in wardrobes, the apartment is ideal for one or two couples or one couple with up to two kids. There is a separate bathroom and toilet, bathroom with large bath and separate shower, internal laundry with washer/dryer, open plan kitchen with stone bench tops, dishwasher, oven and fridge/freezer and seamless living/dining areas leading onto your large balcony with BBQ directly overlooking the beach!  Other features include off street parking for one car, a 65 inch Ultra HD LG LED TV with Foxtel Platinum package and Telstra high speed cable broadband internet with wi-fi.  Transport options include bus at your doorstep to ferry wharf and all other destinations, regular fast ferry that takes 18mins to city, opera house and harbour bridge.
interaction: You will have access to a dedicated manager full time during business hours for any issues during your stay and for key pick up/drop off. After hours key pick up/drop off can also be arranged with enough notice.

host.host_about:
We are a married couple with a baby daughter who enjoy travelling the world. But we love our place in Manly - and while we are away, we like to offer it up for others to enjoy. We love the fantastic lifestyle that Manly has to offer and are fortunate to be able to live and work in such an amazing part of the world. 

We hope that you will come and enjoy it too!

neighborhood_overview: Sydenham is in the Inner West of Sydney and a very cosmopolitan, multicultural, eclectic area. The train station is two minute walk from my home and a pub with a good restaurant and entertainment is just across the road from the station. A popular jazz venue Camelot, is a five minute walk. The beach is 15 minutes by car. It is 15 minutes by train to the city of Sydney for you to explore Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge and all the nightlife and venues of this beautiful city. The airport is 15 minutes by car or 30 minutes by train. There are several music venues, restaurants, clubs, pubs and cafes within walking distance. Central station is 9 minutes away where you can take buses to the Blue Mountains, Jenolan Caves, Snowy Mountains and trains to country areas and outside the Sydney Metropolitan area such as Newcastle. There are bus services to Coogee Beach and University of New South Wales. There is a park in the rear of my home and Sydney Park is a 1
notes: We are under the flight path as we are very convenient to the airport. This means we have planes which fly low at times. Sydney airport has a curfew from 11pm to 6am so no planes fly at this time. We have never had a problem with people sleeping well here but it is important for you to know. Please note we have a cat. I also have another room available  "Room Close to City and airport." "welcoming room in home Sydney CBD,airport

Please let me know of any breakages.

host.host_about:
I love dancing for fitness and socialising.  Travel is my next passion and enjoy staying in air bnb as much as being an airbnb host. I prefer to travel without an agenda and love cruising. So far my favourite places I have visited are Lapland, Savannah and Amsterdam.
I have met so many wonderful people in my travels and believe "Your vibe attracts your tribe."
Hope to meet you in my travels or in my home as a guest.

name: Cosy room@ Avalon-near beaches,cafes & Pittwater
summary: A pint-sized room with style & comfort! The space is bright, airy & cosy with a separate entrance & private ensuite. The comfortable double-bed & quality linen ensure a great nights sleep.  The house is a 5 minute walk from beautiful Pittwater & a 20 minute walk from Avalon Beach & cafes.  Palm Beach is only a 15 minute drive away.
space: The room includes a selection of herbal & regular teas, coffee pods & a nespresso coffee machine.  A toaster & microwave are also provided & the bar fridge includes healthy breakfast options (muesli, fruit & yoghurt).   As well as bath towels, beach towels & beach bag are provided.  And of course, wi-fi is available . Whether exploring the Pittwater & Avalon/Palm Beach area or attending a special event such as a wedding or 21st, the space makes a great relaxing & peaceful base. Or you may just want to chill out & enjoy what the local area has to offer.  The room is naturally cool in summer & has central heating for winter.

neighborhood_overview: The house is situated between Avalon surf beach & Pittwater. Shops, cafes, restaurants, Pittwater Paradise Beach, Clareville Beach & Avalon surf beach are nearby.   Early risers can walk down to Avalon Beach to watch the sunrise or it's just a short walk from the house to watch the sunset from Pittwater.  Stand-up paddle board lessons are available at nearby Clareville Beach.  It's also a popular BBQ spot.
transit: It's a 5 minute drive or 20 minute walk to Avalon village & beach or catch the local bus from the stop opposite my house.  A 15 minute drive will take you to Palm Beach. The Northern Beaches can be a difficult area to get around if you don't have a car, however, at Avalon village you can catch a bus to the city (L88 & L90) & Palm Beach (L90). The L88 & L90 will also take you to Mona Vale where you can catch a bus to Manly.   There is also a limited bus service at the end of my street to the city.  If needing to travel by taxi to an event, it is advisable to book in advance.
access: As well as the room & ensuite, guests have their own courtyard, entrance & off-street parking right outside their room.  Laundry facilities are available on request.
interaction: We will greet you on arrival, get you set up with a key to your room & give you some tips on the local area. We respect your privacy but will be around if you need us.
house_rules: Check-in & check out by arrangement. This is a non-smoking household.  If you want to smoke, please do so outside. Please be respectful of noise, especially at night. No pets.

host.host_location: Avalon Beach, New South Wales, Australia
host.host_about: I love living in this area with my two adult sons & a somewhat lazy airedale. I enjoy the village atmosphere & being close to Pittwater Beaches & Avalon surf beach.

neighborhood_overview: Rushcutters Bay is a lovely harbourside eastern suburb neighbourhood of Sydney, New South Wales. It is situated in a perfect location, close to the city centre. While the district is quiet, it is very close to one of the most iconic areas of Sydney, Kings Cross with loads of great cafes, restaurants, and bars. It is also surrounded by the suburbs of Elizabeth Bay, Darlinghurst, Paddington and Darling Point, Double Bay, and Rose Bay. Watsons Bay is only a bus ride away. The city centre central business district is only 3km from Rushcutters Bay which is approximately 30 mins walk or 10-15 mins by bus.  This area is ideal for tourists who like to live in a strategic location to explore the city and have a place to rest when at home or alternatively someone who possibly works within the city.
notes: There is an underground car parking space provided and also free on street parking available. Included own Key Fob and Keys for access to building, apartment and secure underground car park. There is also enough space for a blow up/air bed within the master bedroom should this be required
transit: Buses leave regularly from right outside the door of the apartment into the city and also the eastern suburbs. Kings cross and Edgecliff train stations are approximately 5-10 mins walk.  Quick and easy commute to Sydney CBD, Paddington and Bondi Junction. Bondi Junction is only a 10 minute train ride away.
access: Secure building with an outdoor BBQ, garden, sunbathing and entertaining area, swimming pool and secure underground parking space all with fob access. Wi-Fi, Smart flat screen TV, Dishwasher, Washing Machine and Clothes Dryer and utilities included.
interaction: The apartment is shared with two friendly females Gayle (29) and Beccy (26) who are both professionals working in Sydney who will both be happy to help or assist you if required during your stay.
house_rules: Smoking is only permitted outside on the balcony which is overlooking the pool.

name: Tranquil Beach & Bush Cottage + Backyard Studio
summary: If you want to explore Sydney's nature and still be close to the city, this is the place! A few minutes from pristine Long Reef beach and marine conservation area, and the cafes of Manly and Dee Why, you can walk or cycle to the beach or  Narrabeen Lake bushland. For bright lights, get the bus to the city. Surf or swim at Sydney's best beaches then come back and relax surrounded by birds in this peaceful retreat with plenty of room for the kids to play.
space: Relax in this 2 bedroom character cottage plus modern one-bedroom studio with a sunny outdoor entertaining and garden, with a vegetable garden, worm farm and BBQ, you'll enjoy chilling in the backyard in between surfing, swimming and bushwalking. The modern kitchen and 2 bathrooms, dishwasher and laundry, vegetable patch and trampoline are all for your use. We can also supply a surfboard or 2 on request. For music lovers, there's a piano and guitar, and plenty of books to read in the bookshelf, and some board games! WiFi is also available, TV with access to a large number of digital stations, and an off-road car space. Wildlife commonly seen in the backyard includes Kookaburras, Cockatoos, Lorikeets (parrots), Red Parrots, wattle birds, blue tongue lizards (harmless!) and more. Transport nearby includes the bus to the city (about 30 - 40 minutes), plus you can walk or bike to Long Reef, Dee Why or Collaroy Beaches, and Narrabeen Lake - all around 20 - 30 minutes walk, 10 minutes by bik

neighborhood_overview: Collaroy Plateau is a green area with lots of trees and native birds, and national park and beaches nearby. If you're lucky, you'll spot native brush turkeys in the street as well as the beautiful King Parrots.  Collaroy Plateau is a quiet family area, but it's great location is catching on with film producers and media celebrities moving into the area. It's also close to bars, great food and coffee, and there's an Art Deco cinema just a short walk away. Dee Why is a 20 minute walk and Manly a15 minute drive. There's a great, character-filled Indian restaurant a short walk up the road, as well as plenty more restaurants a short walk - great Italian, Asian fusion and a pub. Tell us what food you like and we'll tell you the best food around! Cycling is also a good way to get around provided you can ride up hills! If you'd like to hire a car, let us know and we can help organise it.
notes: Ask about discounts for weekly and 2-weekly stays!
transit: There's parking on the street and a bus stop with buses that take you to Dee Why and Sydney city centre only 5 minutes walk.
access: You'll have access to the whole house and backyard, assuring privacy. we'll ensure there's someone on hand to help you out if needed.
interaction: We'll be away, but we have a friend who will be available for help and questions. We're also available by phone (free call).
house_rules: Given we live here, we expect guests to use only items as agreed and specified in our listing, and take the usual care they would as with their own house to avoid damage etc. If you have young children, the backyard is great place to play and is enclosed. They may still need some supervision, as there are a few high steps and places they could hide! It's a great garden for adventures and running about though. The front yard is not, and we ask children don't play there. This is a non-smoking house, and while pets are allowed, it's expected they'll spend most of their time out in the big backyard. This is a great house for families - note that there are 2 sets of around 4 stairs going into the property, and if you have an inquisitive toddler, things may need to be moved out of their way! Note that water is valuable in Australia, so please use water, particularly for baths and showers, sparingly where possible.  We are conscious of the environment, and have a worm farm for your scraps. We

host.host_about:
I love nature - walking, cycling or just being. Generally, when I travel, I come with my husband, Glen, and sometimes our son, Alex. We are all very much into the outdoors, peace and wildlife. 
At the same time, we enjoy great food and different cultural experiences. Glen and I lived and worked in Vietnam together, and I've lived in a few other countries, including Canada, the UK, Malaysia and Austria.
Alex is a very well-behaved well-travelled boy (not just saying that!), who has been with us to Europe and South East Asia. 
We all have itchy feet and love to travel and meet different people and experience different cultures, whether near home or far away.

name: Perfectly Located Apartment With View
summary: Stylishly modern, clean & comfortable apartment in a character filled Art Deco building overlooking cosmopolitan Potts Point, with its cafes, bars, restaurants & supermarkets, just minutes from central Sydney & close to all transport. It's the perfect base to explore this vibrant city.
space: Welcome to our gorgeous apartment in the heart of Sydney's most stylish neighbourhood, Potts Point.  The apartment is located on the second floor of a secure charmingly older Art Deco building typical of the area. The building is currently under renovation to bring it back to its former glory, however the apartment is newly decorated and includes some stunning mid-century furnishings and polished timber floors. A large sunny outlook with views of the famous Al Alamein fountain and square in front are magic to wake up to in the morning.  Our apartment comfortably fits two people with a real double bed, but can easily accommodate a 3rd guest with our inflatable mattress.
description: Stylishly modern, clean & comfortable apartment in a character filled Art Deco building overlooking cosmopolitan Potts Point, with its cafes, bars, restaurants & supermarkets, just minutes from central Sydney & close to all transport. The apartment is located on the second floor of a secure charmingly older Art Deco building typical of the area. The building is currently under renovation to bring it back to its former glory, however the apartment is newly decorated and includes some stunning mid-century furnishings and polished timber floors. Our apartment comfortably fits two people with a real double bed, but can easily accommodate a 3rd guest with our inflatable mattress. Guests will have access to the enti
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is centrally located in Sydney's very own slice of Manhattan, the village-like Potts Point, and regally overlooks Fitzroy Gardens on tree-lined Macleay Street , with all the conveniences at your door step. There is no better place to stay and you will have the best of Sydney at your finger tips. There are three supermarkets within a 2 minute walk so it's easy to stock up on groceries for your stay, as well as laundromats and dry cleaners a few doors down, and the Post Office is located in the square in front of the apartment.  It is close enough to all the action and nightlife Kings Cross has to offer, as well as being a tranquil haven overlooking the square and gardens, and is just walking distance to the harbour. The area is at the forefront of the Sydney food scene with some of the best restaurants the city has to offer as well as some of the best coffee, pastries, and local produce, literally at your door step.  We will supply our "insider tips and recommendations" on
notes: This is inner-city living at its best, if you are a light sleeper, please note the apartment is located on the main street of bustling Potts Point which can get noisy particularly on weekends. The apartment is located on the second floor affording a great view over the neighbourhood and leafy square. There is no lift and 2 flights of stairs, and located in a characteristic older Art Deco building (what it lacks in modernity it makes up for in buckets of charm). The bathroom is original but has been updated with a new basin, mirror & shower.
transit: It's conveniently located to all transport with Kings Cross Station a 2 minute walk down the road (one train stop to the CBD). There is also a bus stop right out the front of the building that has regular buses to the hip enclaves of Darlinghurst and Surry Hills, and picture-perfect Circular Quay. The Sydney sightseeing tour bus also has a handy stop right out front of the apartment on Macleay Street where you can hop on or off. On foot, the city centre is a direct 15 min walk, or a leisurely 20 min walk along the harbour. For some lovely green space, you are a 5-10 min walk to Rushcutters Bay Park and the harbour, or the famous Botanical Gardens are  just a 15 min walk along the waterside area of Wolloomooloo. It is very easy to get to and from the airport via taxi (20-30 min), airport shuttle, or train.
access: Guests will have access to the entire apartment - a 1 bedroom apartment + study, featuring a double-sized bed, a compact bathroom with shower & large bath, separate fully equipped kitchen with stove, oven & fridge/freezer, study/office space, walk-in wardrobe , ample built-in storage, and a well designed, spacious living room with dining area, digital TV and wi-fi, as well as our amazing collection of books ranging from design, fashion and architecture coffee-table books to craft, cooking and travel guides. You will also be provided with clean linen and a set of towels. Wendy, our wonderful cleaner, will be happy to provide extra towels for longer stays.  *There is an extra single blow-up bed (with additional pillow/linen/bedding) for a 3rd guest.
interaction: You will enjoy the place entirely to yourself - and we won't bother you at all. If you do need help, we just live down the road and are contactable via email or phone. Early check-in and/or late check-out available by request, additional fees may apply.
house_rules: Please treat our apartment as you would your own home. No pets, no parties, and no smoking please.

host.host_about:
Hello from Luke and Paul in Sydney, Australia. 

We both work in the creative industries and love to travel whenever we can. Having also lived overseas (in Japan and Italy respectively), Luke and I have travelled through much of Europe, the US and Asia. Our favourite cities include New York, Paris, Rome (I know predictable)... and when it comes to Italy, we can never decide on just one favourite spot...

We love to fully experience a city/country, and immerse ourselves in the culture, eat the local food, and mingle with the locals for a genuine travel experience.

We have stayed at some great Airbnb places on our travels, and decided to take the plunge and do the hosting. Sydney is a great city and we would love to welcome you to all it has to offer. & we look forward to connecting with people the world over on our travels.

Talk soon,
Luke & Paul

Situated near public transport plus cafes/restaurants & shops everything you need is on the doorstep! As about rates for long term
space: Our open, bright and stylish 2 bedroom  apartment (3 separate spaces) is the perfect place for your next beach holiday! It’s directly across the road from Maroubra Beach and only a few minutes walk from great cafes, restaurants, parks and playgrounds. With wooden floorboards throughout and polished concrete floors in the kitchen, the living space is chic,  yet cosy, and is the perfect place to relax and unwind. It includes an open plan lounge, dining area and kitchen with everything you need to make yourself at home. The kitchen is fully equipped with fridge, dishwasher, microwave, stovetop and oven, as well as all pots, pans, crockery and cutlery you need to make any meal at home. The lounge area is complete with TV, Wifi and Netflix available for use.  The master bedroom has a queen bed, and the second bedroom has 2 single high loft beds, leaving plenty of room for 4 to stay comfortably. The bathroom has a shower. There is also a Bosch washing machine & dryer downstairs if you need t
description: With beach across the road, this light & airy 2BDR apartment (3 sep spaces) is the perfect getaway! 1 Queen & 2 high loft singles. 4 ppl will enjoy the coastal Sydney lifestyle. Situated near public transport plus cafes/restaurants & shops everything you need is on the doorstep! As about rates for long term Our open, bright and stylish 2 bedroom  apartment (3 separate spaces) is the perfect place for your next beach holiday! It’s directly across the road from Maroubra Beach and only a few minutes walk from great cafes, restaurants, parks and playgrounds. With wooden floorboards throughout and polished concrete floors in the kitchen, the living space is chic,  yet cosy, and is the perfect place to relax and unwind. It includes an open plan lounge, dining area and kitchen with everything you need to make yourself at home. The kitchen is fully equipped with fridge, dishwasher, microwave, stovetop and oven, as well as all pots, pans, crockery and cutlery you need to make any meal at home.
neighborhood_overview: Maroubra is roughly 10km from the centre of Sydney, in the Eastern Suburbs. We have lived in the area for around 6 years, and we absolutely love it! It has a great community atmosphere and it's hard to walk down the street to the beach without running into people we know. We know and love lots of the cafe and restaurant owners in the area, and have made friends with lots of the neighbours.  The beach is the highlight of the area, and it's right across the street! Maroubra beach is 1km long and is popular for surfing, swimming, a BBQ, a nice spot to sit and have lunch/dinner or just a walk to get some fresh air, space and relax. It's less crowded than its neighbour up in Bondi, but no less beautiful. To the south end there is a reserve with no buildings or houses, so it's particularly beautiful looking down the sand and waves to the trees and headland. Maroubra has plenty of cafes and there are several great options for a morning coffee or brunch/lunch. If you breakfast at Marini and en
notes: - Our apartment is on the ground floor, so there are no stairs to climb - Free car parking on the street  - Column heaters available to use if it gets cold - Toys and books suitable for kids - Private rear access to apartment.
transit: Transport is very accessible. There is a bus stop right in front of the building with buses that go directly into the city (around 30-40 minutes). There's also a bus that runs directly to Bondi Junction where there is a Westfield shopping centre, and also a train station that puts you in contact with train lines across the whole city and beyond.
access: You will have access to the entire  apartment
interaction: Please contact us on AirB&B or our mobiles if you need anything during your stay.
house_rules: We love our house and have put a lot of time and effort into making it a beautiful place. We would expect you to treat it with care and respect, so as such ask: • Absolutely NO smoking inside the  apartment or around the building. There are plenty of benches near the beach across the street that you can use. Just make sure you put any rubbish in the bin, to keep Maroubra beautiful! • NO parties - we live in a quiet,  small building and our neighbours treat us with great respect. We do the same for them, and so would expect you to do the same by keeping noise to a minimum at night. Within reason, you're welcome to have friends/family over, however absolutely no parties. We have a zero tolerance for this area.  • Please be nice to our plants!!

host.host_about: We love traveling & enjoy new spots.

name: Large Home near Manly and Northern Beaches
summary: Renovated 4 bedroom family home. Open living area with district views, opening to a covered entertaining deck with BBQ. Additional family room (Website hidden by Airbnb) garden with cubby, swings and trampoline. 5 minutes to beaches and short drive into Manly.
space: A comfortable, fully renovated family home.  Upstairs is an open plan living area with living, dining and kitchen areas. Wide sliding doors open to the verandah, back deck and garden. The kitchen window opens to the alfresco entertaining deck.  On this level  are two bedrooms with king-single beds and one bedroom with a single that can open out into a double. The main bathroom has a separate bath and shower.  Ceiling fans are in all bedrooms. Cupboard space plus access to books, toys and games for those young of heart. Downstairs is the master bedroom with queen bed and ensuite, the laundry and family room with large TV. Outside is the entertaining deck, BBQ, pizza oven and yard with a large trampoline, cubby, swings and slide.   Please note that there are 2 flights of stairs to enter the house, and one flight of stairs from downstairs to upstairs. There is always a lot of on-street parking available.
description: Renovated 4 bedroom family home. Open living area with district views, opening to a covered entertaining deck with BBQ. Additional family room (Website hidden by Airbnb) garden with cubby, swings and trampoline. 5 minutes to beaches and short drive into Manly. A comfortable, fully renovated family home.  Upstairs is an open plan living area with living, dining and kitchen areas. Wide sliding doors open to the verandah, back deck and garden. The kitchen window opens to the alfresco entertaining deck.  On this level  are two bedrooms with king-single beds and one bedroom with a single that can open out into a double. The main bathroom has a separate bath and shower.  Ceiling fans are in all bedrooms. Cupboard space plus access to books, toys and games for those young of heart. Downstairs is the master bedroom with queen bed and ensuite, the laundry and family room with large TV. Outside is the entertaining deck, BBQ, pizza oven and yard with a large trampoline, cubby, swings and slide.
neighborhood_overview: Located in the leafy suburb of Beacon Hill. District views. Coastal breezes. 5 minutes drive to Curl Curl and Dee Why beaches. 10 minutes to family favourite Freshwater Beach. 15 minutes to the centre of Manly. Restaurants, coastal walks, golf courses, bicycle trails, parks, bush walks, lakes and dam all nearby. Large shopping centre 10 minutes walk away. World famous Taronga Zoo only 25 minutes drive away.
notes: Guests need to know are that we have 2 pet cats living in the house normally. When we are away, they stay elsewhere and we clean the house prior to guests. However those with allergies need to consider this prior to booking.  We also have stairs leading directly to the main living room without a gate. We  do ask no gate be put up incase of damage to our property. We ask guests with toddlers or babies to please consider this prior to booking.  Thanks you
transit: 5 minute walk to bus stop, with regular buses for Manly wharf, the CBD and north along the Northern beaches to Palm Beach. Express buses take around 25 minutes to travel into the city. A ferry from Manly Wharf to the CBD is our favourite though. Only a 30 minute ride through the most beautiful harbour in the world. Manly Warringah Cabs are very quick to arrive at our home. There are multiple car hire agencies within the area with a range of cars for all types of needs.
interaction: If you need to contact us during your stay, we will leave a mobile number and email address. We will endeavour to return messages within the day. If you want any recommendations of things to do, places to visit or restaurants we are happy to answer any questions.
house_rules: Easy - we ask you to look after our home and leave it as you found it. We are very house proud and love our home, we are clean and tidy and would expect for you to treat our home with respect.  We are non-smokers. Please do not smoke on our premises.   All linen used be left in the laundry on departure. When you're leaving please don’t leave dirty dishes/glasses/cutlery etc in the sink. Wash them by hand or pack the dishwasher and turn it on before you go.  No loud parties (small dinner parties and gatherings are fine, but remember that you have neighbours who are more than likely not on holidays and may have to get up and go to work the next day)  We will ask you to pay for any damage that occurs during your stay.  If there are any problems, please contact us as soon as possible. Pets are unfortunately not able to stay. Thank you!

host.host_about:
Hi! I live in the beautiful Northern Beaches with my gorgeous family. 
We love living here with the closeness to beaches, national parks, parks, the zoo, restaurants and arguably the best hot chocolates and coffee in the country. 
We love our home and hope that we can share it and our beautiful patch of the world with you. If you have an questions - send through a message.
Love Mari xxx

name: Spacious Family Home in Coogee
summary: This Sydney Semi is ideally located between Coogee beach and ‘The Spot' in Randwick. It is a spacious 2 story house with  3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 2 lounge rooms, plus study. It has a generous sized garden & deck offering expansive district views.
space: This traditional Red Brick Semi Detached has had extensive renovations with an entire new level built. The house is built to capture as much natural light as possible with over sized windows and doors that bring in the outside so that you enjoy summer. With consideration of  Sydney temperatures the house is designed to allow for maximum airflow, keeping it cool during the hot months. Downstairs level is a modern and well appointed open plan kitchen. The dining area has an extendible table that fits 10 people.  The downstairs lounge has 3m bifold doors that opens up onto a specious deck and garden. There are district views from the downstairs level that go out as far as the Blue Mountains on the horizon. There is also a new bathroom, laundry and study on a split level giving you that little bit extra space to sit and plan your day.   We have a  perfect size garden for kids to play in, And you can have lots of Aussie style BBQ on the 3 burner natural gas (not bottled) hooded bbq.   Upsta

The house is built to capture as much natural light as possible with over sized windows and doors that bring in the outside so that you enjoy summer. There is also a new bathroom, laundry a
neighborhood_overview: 'The spot'  with its gentle heritage ambiance is a easy 10 minute stroll away. It offers a wide range of restaurants and cafes. It has the Ritz cinema which shows new release movies.  Coogee beach is an easy 15 minute down hill walk. (1.4 km) Climbing back up the hill might be not be quiet as easy. A 3 minute  car drive down to the beach might be a better option if you are pushing a pram.
notes: We are a family of 4 with 2  young boys and understand the importance of adult space.  The TV room is designed to be sound proof when the door is shut so the parents can sit and enjoys the view while the kids watch their TV upstairs. The Xbox is wired in so feel free to bring your favourite games or you are most welcome to use ours.  Alternatively you may use the upstairs lounge as a fourth bedroom. However please note that this room has the only TV in the house.  You will have access to Netflix and with unlimited wifi you may watch as many movies as you like. ***Please note, at this stage ideally we prefer quests who are looking for a minimum of 7 nights  accommodation over new year period. Thank you for understanding.
transit: Rainbow St is very central there are several bus stops all around. Fortunately none stop out side our house. However there are a few options depending on where you would like to go. Just (Hidden by Airbnb) Sydney buses to see alternate options.
access: You will have access to the whole house and garden. At the far end of the block is a shed and a small sandy area that we ask guests to please stay away. This area will be developed next year and is currently not suitable for use.
interaction: you can contact us any time via email or phone. There will also be numbers available in case of an emergency.
house_rules: We are a non smoking family and pet free home.  Please respect our preferences for no smoking and no pets. The Xbox and Wii are all wired up and ready for your kids to use. Please do not unplug these. The cables are hidden through conduit and difficult to get in or out. The house is designed to allow maximum light and air to flow to keep the house cool during the Sydney summer months and filled with light during the winter. The flip side to this, is that the house is very exposed to wind and rain when left open.  We therefore ask that you please ensure that the south facing doors and windows are closed during any rain or strong winds. Please do not leave the house with the south facing door and window open. and please do not sleep with the south facing doors or window open. There are many other windows in the house that can be left open for ventilation at all times.   If it rains while these windows or doors are left open there will be significant water damage to the interior of the ho

name: Beautiful House, Views, Single King, Own Bathroom

Close to Carlingford station. Bus to Epping, North Rocks Shopping Centres & Parramatta. Safe parking. A great starting point to explore Sydney. Fast M2 bus connect direct to Sydney CBD City. We are happy active couple who enjoy meeting people from all over the world. We are looking forward to welcoming you.

Our home is in a terrific location just outside the hustle and bustle of Sydney city life. Own use of large beautiful sandstone full tiled bathroom.  We live in a quiet area of Sydney. Set above Hunts Creek where you can bushwalk or mountain bike all the way to a wild life reserve and Lake Parramatta.  Secure yard, friendly lassie collie dog and awesome rabbit.  It's very green here and out of the hustle, bustle and noise of Sydney. The M2 bus is nearby, 30 minutes to city center. Carlingford Train station is 1.2km a 15 minute walk. There is a new bakery Jenny's and 2 Westfield's shopping centers (North Rocks and Carlingford Court) within 15 minutes walk.  Sydney Olympic Park, Castle Towers and Parramatta Westfields shopping with Eat Street, Theaters and Movies nearby.  UNSW and Macquarie University are both easily accessed within 30 minutes.
notes: We have a house alarm code that we program for you, to allow access. We enjoy people who are themselves, whilst being respectful.

If you are really nice and helpful we don't mind giving you a lift. There is safe parking here both on and off the street.  Our home is a brilliant base to use for exploring Sydney and getting out of the City.  Or working locally in Norwest, Parramatta or Pennant Hills.  Also handy for work, as access to many areas is easy on transport routes from here.

Fun activities and enjoy cooking meals to share if you like sharing and contributing. Or you can be totally independent.
interaction: Happy to interact or provide personal space. We enjoy meeting people from all walks of life. We are an Australian couple, youthful energetic aussies in our 30-40's live here. 1 with European heritage - Swiss, Austrian, German. The other full Australian with Hunter Valley wine country heritage. Loves having a laugh. We are both helpful and organised - mostly!  There are extra rooms, air matresses, sofas and Queen beds can be set up for your partner or friends for an extra charge. Be nice and friendly to us, as we are at home and like to relax too.  Our beautiful Lassie dog is friendly and would love for you to throw his frisbee, rope or join us for a walk.  We are open to playing evening games, Finska, Badmington, dice, 5000 chess...  Having a friendly social drink, sharing stories. Practicing your English or teach us and share what you know.  You are welcome to walk, mountain bike, paddle, exercise, cycle or relax with us.  If you're ever bored we can provide you lots of fun things to
house_rules: We appreciate treating us and our home with with respect and care.  Clean as you go.  Keep safe and Secure the house with Alarm code & key provided.  Communicate arrivals and departures.  Plenty of space in The Fridge and Pantry welcome to facilities for preparing meals, washing and watching TV/DVD's.  Friendly Pets allowed - please check with us 1st. Pets may incur additional daily charge.  Keep yard secure as we have a friendly outside pet collie dog and a lovely rabbit. Non-Smoking.

name: Room for two in amazing Surry Hills
summary: Only one block from Central Station and walking distance to all of Surry Hills' great bars and restaurants its hard to find a better location. In a secure building the room has a queen size bed and plenty of wardrobe space.
space: Make my spare bedroom your home away from home when staying in fantastic Sydney.  It's been a few years since I've had airbnb guests but I thought it might be a nice change to have a few more. Availability will be limited so hopefully your trip and my dates match. I'm probably at the bottom of the search results and my photos aren't professional so read the old reviews because you might have found a great place to stay. It's only a short walk to some of Sydney's best restaurants, pubs, bars, cafes, shopping  It's two minutes walk to Central station (really!), there's plenty of taxis nearby and buses to the Eastern suburbs beaches, UNSW and beyond. I also have a hair dryer even though I don't need it myself. One less thing for you to pack.  Getting to my apartment from the airport is super easy and the proximity to the CBD and train station are my apartment's best feature. And it's all on a relatively quite street. My apartment is walking distance to everything in the Sydney CBD, there'

notes: Please check with me about check-in times as I work Monday to Friday which makes check-ins during the day impractical. Either very early in the morning or after 6.00pm is best. If you're arriving on the weekend any time is usually ok.
transit: My place is VERY convenient for public transport and you can walk to the CBD and most parts of the city.
access: Yes you can: Use the kitchen to cook provided you keep it clean Put your food in the fridge or cupboards Use the washing machine
interaction: I'm usually around during guests stays. Happy to have a chat, discuss your travel plans and answer all the little questions that make a trip more enjoyable.  Interaction all depends on each others' needs at the time. Sometimes my guests come and go with not more than a quick hello and goodbye. They're busy, have limited time and lots to do. I'm not offended by this.  Other times I find myself sharing meals with guests, going out for coffee or visiting tourist attractions. There is no rule for how much interaction we have or don't have.
house_rules: No smoking, pets, random guests or drugs you can't take through airports. Keep the kitchen clean and please don't keep food in the bedroom. There is plenty of space in the kitchen to store food. Treat my apartment, the building and my neighbours with the same courtesy you treat your own. I work full-time so check-in is typically after 6:00pm. This is flexible for weekends and public holidays so please discuss it with me prior to booking.

host.host_location: Surry Hills, New South Wales, Australia
host.host_about:
Born and raised in the suburbs of southern Sydney I've lived here all my life. I've travelled to countries in South America, Central America, US, and Europe plus one or two other places.  Loved every minute of travel and found I always had a better time when I was staying with locals. So if you're staying with me I'll do my best to make you feel at home, provide you with tips and advice and generally try to help you get the most out of your holiday.

Skills: cooking skills, running skills, language skills (falo algum portugues), tour guiding skills, 'girls only want boyfriends who have great skills' - N Dynamite

Likes: Australian Rules Football (it'll take some explaining, maybe we should go to a game), getting down to the beach, good food with friends, ice-cream and chocolate, red wine over white, 

Sense of humour: Satire and black - Jon Stewart, Stephen Colbert, Ricky Gervais, Doug Stanhope etc

Reading list: Any non-fiction - my favourite author is Michael Lewis, newspapers (but not Murdoch papers!), 

Documentaries: Love 'em.

name: Modern Balmoral Beach Apartment
summary: Sunny modern apartment only five minutes walk to stunning Balmoral Beach and super close to the city. White with beautiful wooden floorboards, the apartment has a sunny balcony, serene leafy views, a dishwasher, large sun-lit bedroom, a large bathroom with bath/shower and wi-fi.
space: The apartment is perfect for a couple or a single person. It's situated on the third floor of a small block of apartments in a very quiet street. It has lovely wooden floorboards and large windows which look out to a peaceful, leafy setting.  The kitchen is well-equipped with a coffee machine, an electric stove-top, modern oven, fridge, heaps of cooking and baking utensils, wine glasses, martini glasses etc, a smoothie-maker and microwave. There is a large dining room table and a comfy lounge which is very sunny. It features a very large plasma TV, DVD player, iPhone stereo player and wi-fi.    The bedroom is large and has a queen-sized bed, a little desk and access to a stand-up fan and heater (feel free to read any of my books:)  The bathroom is beautifully finished and features a combination bath/shower and use of shampoo/shower gel and fresh towels.

White with beautiful wooden floorboards, the apartment has a sunny balcony, serene leafy views, a dishwasher, large sun-lit bedroom, a large bathroom with bath/shower and wi-fi. It has lovely wooden floorboards and large windows which look out to a peaceful, leafy setting.  The kitchen is well-equipped with a coffee machine, an electric stove-top, modern oven, fridge, heaps of cooking and baking utensils, wine glasses, martini glasses etc, a smoothie-maker and microwave. There is a large dining room table and a comfy lounge which is very sunny. It features a very large plasma TV, DVD player, iPhone stereo player and wi-fi.    The bedroom is large and has a queen-sized bed, a little desk and access to a stand-up fan and heater (feel free to re
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is literally a five-minute walk down to Balmoral Beach, which is consistently named the most beautiful beach in Sydney. There are a number of cafes and restaurants at Balmoral and it really is idyllic, whether you go for a stroll along the foreshore or take a dip in the ocean.  It's also an eight-minute walk to the heart of Mosman which is known for its boutique shops, wine bars, cafes and eateries. There is also an IGA supermarket and Franklins which are very close.  The apartment is 12 minutes by bus to the heart of the city. I get the bus every day to go to work and it's very easy and close.
notes: I grew up in Sydney and I'm very social, so I'd be very happy to send you an email highlighting the best coffee shops, restaurants and bars in Balmoral, Mosman and across Sydney, and anything else you would like to know about Sydney before you arrive. I know all the secret spots:)
transit: The apartment is very convenient to public transport and it's an eight-minute walk to Spit Junction which is the main transport hub for Mosman. You can catch a bus (they literally come all the time) from Spit Junction to the heart of the city to Wynard, Town Hall or Circular Quay (12 minutes) or an array of places like Neutral Bay, North Sydney New Town (M30), Manly or Chatswood.    There is also street parking and access to taxi services like Uber, but I honestly use public transport all the time.
access: You will have access to the entire apartment, any essentials that you need like coffee, tea and sugar etc and access to the washing machine and dryer (on the same floor). There is also a small clothes line that can be automated on the balcony.
interaction: I  will meet you to give you the key and I will be in Mosman. I'll be contactable via phone and text if you have any questions or need any help. More than happy to help you plan your holiday in Sydney and make suggestions!
house_rules: No children please. A couple or a single person only. When you leave I expect the apartment to be as clean as when you found it.

name: Quiet Tropical Beachside Haven
summary: Our home has a light & airy feel mixed with homely decor & charm; positioned in a quiet, leafy neighbourhood. Walking distance to Manly, Queenscliff and Fairlight beach. A tropical beachside haven, with a sunny garden - what more could you want?
space: A real 'home from home', in a quiet leafy suburb. Our house is split level, with the front entrance being at the top of the house. All bedrooms and main bathroom are situated upstairs; the main bedroom has a queen bed, ensuite and a private balcony, and the front bedroom has a queen bed (nor the sofa bed that's shown in the picture). There is a 3rd bedroom is set up for a baby - this is only accessible for guests that require a cot, please add this to your booking request if it is needed. The dining area is on a separate level to the living room and kitchen, along with a small study area and laundry, which has a washer, dryer and separate toilet. The tropical garden and undercover eating area is accessible from the lounge and kitchen area, with a area set up for the hammock!

neighborhood_overview: The house is positioned in a quiet street in Fairlight but is within walking distance to Manly, which has a wonderful beach, a multitude of bars and restaurants and good shopping. Also within waking distance is Fairlight beach, which is harbour side, linking up to part of the Spit to Manly walk. A multitude of outdoor activities awaits you: amazing coastal and bush walks, kayaking, diving, beachvolleyball, cycling and of course surfing! Manly Swimming pool is within 5/10 minutes walking distance, as are sea pools at Manly, Queenscliff and Fairlight Beach. There are also 3 golf courses nearby. For your daily supplies, you're also a 5 min walking distance from the new shopping complex Stockland Mall.
transit: We're a 5 min walk to the City buses, 1 min walk to the free community shuttle that will take you to the heart of Manly or if you prefer you can easily walk into Manly within 15/20 minutes. From Manly Wharf you can access ferries into the CBD or across to Watsons Bay, to Taronga Zoo and to Darling Harbour. Buses from the area also service all of the northern beaches, all the way up to Palm Beach. There is plenty of council run car parks in Manly, most of which have the first 2 hours free.
access: Guests will be able to access all rooms of the house, expect for the third bedroom which is set up for a baby. This room will only be accessible to those guests that request access.
interaction: We will be available to help you during your stay and our parents will also be available in the event that we are not.
house_rules: We respect our neighbours, so no loud parties here please! We also expect all guests to treat our home with the upmost respect, as if it was their own, and to maintain a clean and tidy environment. You are not permitted to smoke in our home and we do not allow guests to bring pets.

We’re very considerate & caring humans and would treat anyone’s else’s home as if it were our own.

name: Rustic Home in Perfect Location

Open plan, light and airy with living area opening onto pleasant courtyard.  It is in a great location - close to everything - shops, transport, parks, and beaches.

You are welcome to use the kitchen and dining areas, but this does not include entertaining your own guests or visitors. I am well-travelled and enjoy meeting new people. Although I'm usually pretty busy, there is usually time for great conversation around the kitchen table, a shared a meal or drink, or simply sharing local knowledge. The house is in a great location for accessing all the best parts of Sydney. Close to beaches and parks and easy access to the city and universities. A 10-minute wa
neighborhood_overview: The house is in a great location for accessing all the best parts of Sydney. Close to beaches and parks and easy access to the city and universities. A 10-minute walk gets you to Bondi Junction train station and Bondi Junction itself, which is like a mini-city with all services and shopping ranging from Armani to Zara, as well as a multiplex cinema. (Art house cinemas are short bus rides away.)  A 5-minute walk to the local village of Charing Cross and you will find cool cafes, interesting shops, a cheap gym, two pubs with good menus and atmosphere, one of the best Vietnamese restaurants in Sydney, awesome, healthy food and even fine dining. There is also a late-night local supermarket that has a good selection of everything from basics to gourmet food.  Bondi, Tamarama and Bronte beaches and ocean pools are a 5-minute drive or 20-minute walk away - or you can take the bus.  Waverley Oval is nearby or walk to Queens Park and on to beautiful Centennial Park.  You can walk or catch a bus
notes: There is an indoor/outdoor cat so this may be a consideration for some guests.
transit: From Bondi Junction, it is a 10-minute train ride into the city centre (trains run frequently). There are also buses which go in every direction - to the beach, to the city and to universities - UNSW, UNSW Art & Design, UTS, and Sydney University (also by train).
access: Bedrooms other than your own are off-limits to guests. You are welcome to use the kitchen and dining areas, but this does not include entertaining your own guests or visitors.
interaction: I am well-travelled and enjoy meeting new people. Although I'm usually pretty busy, there is usually time for great conversation around the kitchen table, a shared a meal or drink, or simply sharing local knowledge.
house_rules: No smoking at all in the inside areas of the house please.  No overnight guests.  This is a residential area so noise needs to be kept to a reasonable level - no parties and no visitors. You are welcome to use the kitchen facilities but please clean up after use, leaving everything the way you found it. Please respect the space of those who live here. Access to wifi Internet is included but downloading of movies, etc. is discouraged, unless through an authorised site. Please do not take bath towels to the beach, gym, etc. Replacement cost of lost towels is $50 each.

host.host_about: Hi, I am a Sydney-based writer and academic who used to work in the film industry. I try to travel somewhere each year and, once there, like to get into what a place has to offer. Surfing, yoga and (sort of) running break up my time at a desk. I read, go to movies, art galleries, museums, music etc a lot. Also like just hanging out and good conversation. I have my own home so am very respectful of the space of others.

neighborhood_overview: Mascot is an inner-city village of Sydney. Only about 2 stops from the Sydney CBD (Central Business District) / Core.  Mascot was once a vital component of Sydney's industrial suburb, with manufactory yards, factories and wool-stores. That history remains and in recent years Mascot has experienced a resurgence with an influx of residents and office workers. Cafés, restaurants, warehouse and outlets for shopping in the neighbourhood.

I've been left waiting too many times to be able to make other arrangements… Please talk to me about it *before* you make your reservation.    :)  I'd ask that you'd please not smoke inside the house. interaction: As much or as little as you like. My work load can be busy sometimes, so you may see me work from home or won't see much of me until evenings. When I'm around, I'm happy to chat as little or as much as you like. I love meeting people and learning more about the world. I'm open minded, honest, affable and have an immense passion for life, and learning. :)
house_rules: My house rules are very simple: - Please be energy efficient (turn off lights/appliances when not in use)  - Be considerate of–and respectful to–my neighbours  - Keep noise to a minimum  - Be neat and tidy, don't wear shoes inside  - Please don't have food in the bedroom or on the couch  - No pets, smoking inside or parties  - Keep the house locked when you're not at home  - Leave the place as you found it and  - Wash dishes as they are used  - If you don't know where something is - ask.   - If you break something - tell me.   - If you like anything of mine then feel free to say so and I might be able to tell you where to get one of your own!   - Most importantly, enjoy your stay! That's all there is to it :)

neighborhood_overview: Palm Beach is a very unique area. It is well known that 80% of the homes are Holiday homes with only 20 % residents. For all but a few periods i.e. Xmas holidays and long weekends it is unbelieveaby peaceful and quiet.  The nearest shopping village is Avalon Beach, just 5 1/2 kms or 8 mins back along Barrenjoey Rd.  In Avalon you will find Banks, Woolworths, Service Stations, Cafes and Restaurants and the normal sorts of shops you would find in a small village.
notes: We respect your rights to smoke but ask that you respect our right to have a NO SMOKING premises.  Please limit smoking to balconies or outside and please remember to keep the balcony door closed as wind draught can waft  smoke right through the house.

neighborhood_overview: Freshwater is one of the Sydneys best beach suburbs most versatile places. Perfect for adults, couples, families and kids, it has everything you need for a relaxed stay in Sydney.   The beach is beautiful, and perfect for swimming or learning to surf (depending the waves).  The sun rises over the ocean, and there’s nothing better than diving into the ocean or using the awesome salt water pool if you want to get some lengths in at sunrise or enjoy the ocean without the waves. There’s also plenty of space to relax on the rocks if the sand is not your thing.  Within 100m of the beach are 3 cafes, including the epic Pilu Cafe for a coffee with ocean views, and the trendy Cafe Calm for an afternoon burger and beer after all the hard work at the beach!  To kick start your day after a morning swim, venture into Freshie Village (only about 500m from the beach) for even more epic cafes. Fuel up with great food, a coffee and a smoothie before you tackle the surf! There’s also the best bakery in
notes: Feel free to use the little things that make our cool apartment feel more like home; - State of the art wireless speaker - TV with Netflix and Apple TV - Playstation 4  - WiFi - Volleyball set  - Beach chairs
transit: The northern beaches are on your door step. Walk north along the coast path to Curl Curl of Dee Why, walk south to take in Queenscliff, North Steyne, Manly and Shelly beaches The 139 bus stops right outside the apartment. This will take you to Manly (if you don’t fancy the beach side walk),or Warringah Mall if you need some retail therapy or a trip to the movies.  There are many ways to get in to the Sydney CBD. The ferry wharf is a 35 minute walk along the beaches, or a 15 minute bus ride from right outside (139).  Or you can grab a B-Line bus from Warringah straight into the city. During the working week, an express E65 bus will take you to the CBD during morning and evenings.
access: You will have access to the entire apartment. There is a lift up to the apartment.
house_rules: Our apartment is a lived in home, and we want guests to feel at home during their stay.  Feel free to put your feet up, relax with a beer and enjoy the stunning views and lifestyle. All we ask is that you treat it with the same respect you would your own home. No Pets. No smoking.

Cafes and restaurants are abundant in the area and the suburb is a quiet village that have easy access to other parts of Sydney. neighborhood_overview: Annandale is a charming area based in the Inner-West of Sydney, the village features some heritage listed architectures, cafes & restaurants, and is very close to the City, Glebe, Newtown and Sydney University.  10min walking distance you get to the bay at the foot of ANZAC Bridge or you can go explore areas like Leichhardt & Balmain which is all fairly close.
notes: We recently adopted two kittens, so now we have a house with cats.  If you are allergic to animals and dislike pets in the house, this place isn't the right fit for you.  Please be very mindful with the kittens as they will want to get out the house at any given chance and / or making discoveries, trying to get into your room, under the bed to have a play, or they might follow you asking for a hug.  If you think any of the listed behaviour can cause some inconvenience to you and your stay, please do not book the place.  We just discovered that feeding two kittens is like taking two small babies, it involves work on our end, and understanding on the guests' end.  Please do not feed the cats as they follow a particular diet and don't let the cats run out as they are still small and can get lost, attacked by larger birds and/or hit by a passing vehicle.  If you think you can live with two tiny friend in the house who are generally clean and cute, we believe the kittens can also bring you
transit: One minute walking distance to the closest bus stop, where you'll get two buses, 15min bus ride to central and the other bus takes you to Coogee Beach.  Bus comes around at 15min interval during peak hours and 25min interval off peak.  You can also walk 10min to Parramatta road where there's a selection of about 8 buses that goes into the City or western suburbs of Sydney.    There is a light rail station within 10min walking distance and you can take a light rail into the City on a 15min ride that goes through Fish Market, Darling Harbour and China Town eventually Central.   You can get here from the airport either by train then bus (45min) or Taxi (25min).  In terms of parking, you'll get plenty of street parking free of charge 7 days a week.
access: Other facilities: - Street Parking (free 24x7) - WiFi available Please be mindful that this isn't a hotel or serviced apartment. It's a sharing house where you get your own rooms. host.host_about:
Easy going, optimistic, spontaneous, creative and adventurous person. After former corporate life that propelled me to explore what life has to offer outside of what many people see as an attractive 'career path', I have been happily living an unconventional life experiencing it to the full.

I'm quite active, I love ocean swimming, riding my motorbike, go hiking, skating or long walks to enjoy the outdoors. I go dancing from time to time (tango or salsa) and I channel a fair bit of energy through my creative outlet in photography. I love to travel, even though I haven't been to nearly as many places as i wished to, but each and every travel experience brings immense joy, learning and friendship that I value. 

I enjoy meeting people, I especially love spending time with those who are positive, easy going, adventurous, open minded and passionate in following their dreams.

Recently i have swam the English Channel (yes UK->FR) and am now working on my next challenge (and a few of them too :)

host.host_about:
Hey, I'm Julia. I'm in my thirties I use Airbnb when I travel, usually with my partner Daniel, and as a host for our apartment in Potts Point as well as on behalf of my mother when she travels and her great apartment in Rose Bay is vacant. 
As a guest I understand what it is to be a host and as such, I will treat your place with respect. 
As your host, I can then be in contact with you as much or as little as you like. Both properties have a key box so access can be within your time restrictions. I can be on email/text if needed during your stay.

name: Charming Home 10 Mins from Beach
space: The House: "The Sudan" is a gorgeous 1880 Victorian Semi, with beautiful floorboards throughout and high, decorative ceilings and plenty of privacy. Relax in our elegantly furnished spacious lounge room with beautiful bay windows. It has a 32 inch flat screen TV. There is a separate dining room and a fully-equipped kitchen.  Outside, there is a leafy back garden with a covered courtyard and gas Barbeque, perfect for alfresco dining. A modern bathroom with shower and bath plus heated flooring. It has three bedrooms. Bedroom 1 and Bedroom 2 both have Queen beds, while the third bedroom contains a Double bed. Luxurious hotel quality linen provided. There is also a spare fold out bed if required. Location: Only a 10 minute walk to Coogee beach, this beautiful place is only 50 meters from the buzz of "The Spot" at Randwick, which is famous for fantastic cafes and restaurants, including a great tapas bar. There is also a heritage cinema and a local heritage pub. We are also located very clos
