name: Surry Hills - Large Room w Balcony
summary: This beautiful large room with private balcony comes with a tv/cable, WiFi, dresser, night stands, full wall built in closets for all your things, and a beautiful balcony overlooking the quite tree lined Bourke Street.
space: It is located on the second floor of a two story townhouse.  There is a full bathroom with heat lights and glass enclosed rain shower that is sometimes shared (if another room on that floor is occupied) but more than likely just for you during your booking.
description: This beautiful large room with private balcony comes with a tv/cable, WiFi, dresser, night stands, full wall built in closets for all your things, and a beautiful balcony overlooking the quite tree lined Bourke Street. It is located on the second floor of a two story townhouse.  There is a full bathroom with heat lights and glass enclosed rain shower that is sometimes shared (if another room on that floor is occupied) but more than likely just for you during your booking. You will have access to the rest of the house (other bedrooms are locked by tenants when in use), the kitchen, lounge and tv area, and dining area, and beautiful garden outside with a deck, table and chairs, and full washing/drying machine for your clothes.  The kitchen is fully stocked with everything you would need for your culinary desires and is equipped with an oven, gas fire burners, toaster, mixer, microwave, pots and pans, dishware, and so on.  There is also a full sized refrigerator and freezer with some comm
neighborhood_overview: Our newly renovated terrace home is on a quiet street, close to all the action in Sydney's heart. Although the Central Station is only a 10 minute walk away and can quickly jet to you anywhere you want to go, we are also walking distance to Sydney's downtown, Chinatown, Darling Harbour, Opera House, and the Sydney Convention Center.  We are right in the center of Surry Hills's "scene" offering Restaurants, Bars, and Coffee shops.  There is also plenty of shopping, art galleries, markets, and parks nearby. If you want to know more about the area, check them out on AirBNB's new Sydney Suburbs guide! There are plenty of kid friendly areas and playgrounds nearby. The terrace home is kid friendly, but please keep in mind that the home is not modified for small children and has steep stairs that do not have a gate and no children toys are readily available.
notes: There is an entrance in the front and the back of the house.  There is one parking space allocated for the house, though parking on the street is sometimes available at own accord.  There is a gas BBQ on the patio for your grilling enjoyment.
transit: Central Station is only a short 10 minute walk away and it is easy to get around most of Sydney to see the attractions this way or by foot!
access: You will have access to the rest of the house (other bedrooms are locked by tenants when in use), the kitchen, lounge and tv area, and dining area, and beautiful garden outside with a deck, table and chairs, and full washing/drying machine for your clothes.  The kitchen is fully stocked with everything you would need for your culinary desires and is equipped with an oven, gas fire burners, toaster, mixer, microwave, pots and pans, dishware, and so on.  There is also a full sized refrigerator and freezer with some commonly used condiments.
interaction: There may be other guests occupying the terrace house at the same time of your stay.  Please be courteous to your fellow mates and neighbors.  Respect common areas by keeping them clean and only keep personal items in your designated room when not in the house.  Make new friends who love to visit Sydney as much as you do!
house_rules: The open dining space and lounge/TV room greets you when you enter through the front door down the hallway. The dining room table accommodates 6. Wi-Fi is available throughout the home. You are then led to a big beautiful kitchen stocked with all your culinary needs. There is a dishwasher, gas burner cooktop, oven, microwave, mixer, toaster and full sized fridge/freezer for your convenience. The townhome has a full sized bathroom on each floor equipped with heated lights and glass encased rain showers. Each of the 4 bedrooms is accommodated with its own flat screen TV and cable box for personal enjoyment. The rooms are equipped with floor to ceiling sliding mirrored door closets with plenty of space to hang or store all your items. Bedroom has a queen bed and is at the front of the house on the second floor, with balcony overlooking Bourke Street. There are full wall built in closets with mirrors, a dresser, and night stands. (There are a total of 4 bedrooms in the house) I am availabl

name: Single  Bedroom in Dee Why
summary: Single bedroom in a two bedroom apartment.  Double built in wardrobe, single bed, sunny, leafy private outlook. The apartment features a comfortable living room, well-equipped kitchen, private balcony with BBQ, clean bathroom, internal laundry
description: Single bedroom in a two bedroom apartment.  Double built in wardrobe, single bed, sunny, leafy private outlook. The apartment features a comfortable living room, well-equipped kitchen, private balcony with BBQ, clean bathroom, internal laundry You have access to the living room, bathroom, kitchen, balcony and laundry. Dee Why is the central suburb of the Northern Beaches. Buses can be caught to most parts of Sydney from here, including the city, Manly and Palm Beach, which are all short trips.  The beach is a 5 minute walk. It features a pool, lifeguards, fantastic walks to the next beaches and a good selection of restaurants, bars and cafes. All shops are within walking distance. Many cafes and restaurants, especially on Dee Why Beach. Several major supermarkets, including a Coles next door. There are bakeries, butchers, delis, fruit markets, pharmacies and medical centres.

name: Beachside apt in North Bondi
summary: Perfect place for a couple and / or with two kids - just like us! Cafe doors open up the living / dining rooms on to a north east facing garden making for the perfect sunny mornings. Cross the street and Bondi Beach is all yours.
space: The apartment has one master bed room with a California King. Timber louvres can be opened to get a view of the garden and the morning sun. Living and dining are side by side and positioned to maximise the morning sun from the garden. The kitchen and bathroom (bath and shower) are compact but functional. A second bedroom is perfect for kids with two bunks. There is also an external laundry.   A 2 minute walk gets you to glorious Bondi Beach. Either head to the end of the point and jump in or walk to the sand. We've lived here for 15+ years and will never leave!!

neighborhood_overview: Ben Buckler point is a special part of Bondi situated at the northern end. My wife and I have lived here for 15+ years and are now raising our two kids. You can walk to everything - cafe's, restaurants, supermarket and the bus stop that can take you everywhere else.  Of course glorious Bondi Beach is just a minute away on foot. Either head to the end of the point and jump in off the rocks or walk to the sand and plunge in. It is beyond heavenly.
transit: The bus stop is a 3 minute walk away and can get you to nearby Bondi Junction for some hard core retailing / cinemas. From there trains can get you into down town Sydney, circular quay, harbour bridge, Opera House. There is also a bus service from up the road all the way into the city - no train required.
access: It's all yours!
interaction: We will be available during your trip if you need anything!
house_rules: Please use the space as you would your own place! No smoking and be sensitive to our neighbours.

host.host_location: Bondi Beach, New South Wales, Australia
host.host_about:
My wife and I have 2 kids 16 & 13. We moved home to Bondi Beach after 10 years running our company, gDiapers in Portland, Oregon. 

We have a ton of fun running the business which allows us to travel to the US, Canada, UK, France, Germany and Spain. 

I enjoy running marathons eating Indian and Thai food and the odd movie. 

We love using AirB&B to get a different take on the cities we visit and as host want to reciprocate after fantastic experiences in Rome, LA, New York and London.

name: Characterful Heritage Building in a Prime Location in Sydney
summary: Wake up on the super king-size bed in the master bedroom that has a raw industrial look and an eye-catching wine cellar. This 3-storey heritage home boasts spacious open living with a cozy courtyard and exposed brickwork by the dormer window.
space: Master bedroom is located on a lower level than the street and has a raw industrial look with open plan bathroom king bed and wine cellar off to one side  Second bedroom is on the 1st floor overlooking the street with Queen  bed and the main bathroom A great place to watch the acletic people of Darlinghurst  Third bedroom is on the 2nd floor located in the roof space with a dormer window facing north and Queen bed looking over Darlinghurst rooftops It has a small ensuite bathroom with a glass wall exposing the original brickwork from 1840  Living space is located on all of the ground floor it has a 6 person sofa Bose surround sound tv dinning table and a modern kitchen with filtered water and sparkling water on tap the rear of the house is glass sliding doors that opens up to a small courtyard
description: Wake up on the super king-size bed in the master bedroom that has a raw industrial look and an eye-catching wine cellar. This 3-storey heritage home boasts spacious open living with a cozy courtyard and exposed brickwork by the dormer window.
neighborhood_overview: The house is in Darlinghurst in Sydney. It’s within easy walking distance of the Museum Train Station, the Royal Botanical Gardens, and the Sydney Opera House.
notes: Best location in Sydney just have great time in my home
transit: Walking is best but train and Uber are great and very easy
access: You have access to the whole house
interaction: Hello your host meets you on arrival and gives you there number to help if anything goes wrong
house_rules: Not suitable for elderly, children below 12 years old or wheelchair. No shoes in the house please,  No smoking in the house.( rear courtyard allowable ) No partying allow. No one allow to stay over unless listed guests.

host.host_about: 51 year old semi retired. I love to travel and have been to 35 countries. My passion is in renovating old homes,  bringing them back to life. Darlinghurst is my sixteenth major renovation. I love gardening and cooking and I hope you will enjoy my home as much as I do.

host.host_about:
I'm an active, community minded recently divorced single parent. I live in with my children in our family friendly home in a great suburban location in Sydney. My home is conveniently located close to shops, parks, transport in a quiet leafy street, very centrally located and close to hospitals. 
I have listed my home as I share the care of my children with their father and I travel frequently for work, and Airbnb seemed like a great opportunity for my family to help cover costs. 
I've previously hosted overseas students and always found it a really positive experience for both myself and my kids. We are a welcoming happy family who like to enjoy all our beautiful city has to offer and we look forward to welcoming you and your family.

neighborhood_overview: Absolutely everything at your footstep from Chinatown, to Darling Harbour to the bustling CBD and main transport railway/bus stations. It is about 10 min walk towards the Opera House/Harbour bridge. Also 10 minutes walk to Pitt St mall for all your shopping needs. You'll have heaps of food options to choose from. It depends on your tastes but I can recommend my personal favourites : Chat Thai 20 Campbell St. Haymarket - best Thai food Haymarket Hotel - Cheapest but excellent australian steak and chips deal for only $12 Din Tai Fung World Square - fantastic dumplings. Also try Uncle Mings on York Street. Macchiato Wood Fire Pizza corner liverpool and Pitt Street for Italian food. Also try  Vapiano on York Street.
notes: I have a carspace in a nearby building I can rent out to you if you require a carspace at $40/night. Please let me know if you require this in order to reserve it. Note the hot water in the shower is now 100% fixed and working as of May.
transit: The apartment is a short walk between 2 major train stations in the city. You can find Town Hall station or Wynyard station just a short 5-10 min walk depending on which direction. To get to Circular Quay you may walk along George Street and it is around 7 mins. The transport system is simple now you just buy a card called "Opal" that you can use to catch trains, ferries and buses.
access: Everything is yours to enjoy so treat the apartment as your own.
interaction: I live in a nearby building so can attend to any emergencies or questions.
house_rules: No parties or excessive noise after 10pm. Take shoes off when entering as it has carpet. Please look after children when in the gym or pool area.

host.host_about:
Hi there we are Sam and Janelle and we are excited by the sharing economy that sites like AirBnB provides. 

Janelle works in aged community care and she looks after the properties you will be booking.

Sam is a professional musician who has  travelled to various parts of SE Asia and I plan on a big European trip next year followed by the USA sometime after that. 

My apartments are carefully selected to provide our guests with the most comfortable stay possible and we hope you enjoy the little touches we put into each apartment.

name: Overlooking the Heart of the Cross.
summary: You've found the perfect location for your stay in Potts Point. Your apartment combines a sapcious double bedroom and private sleeping alcove, sunny dining area overlooking the Fountain, modern kitchen and bathroom and a comfortable living area.
space: Your apartment is located in an historic building known around the village as 'The Fountain'. The building is accessed from both the beautiful tree lined Macleay Street and Lankelly Place, home to Pott's Points best restaurants, cafés and laneway bars. The apartment is comfortably furnished with high ceilings, spacious living areas, a light and airy double bedroom and original features. There's an additional fold out double futon sofa in a private sleeping alcove to accommodate up to two extra guests. You'll have very fast wifi and excellent television reception. The building itself, like the Cross is an exciting mixture of residential, cultural and commercial spaces. Cafés and restaurants are literally downstairs at your doorstep, as is a laundromat (and a dentist if you need one!) Perhaps its most appealing feature is the large sunroom windows through which you can look down and watch Kings Cross pass you by. The building is very secure with gates at both entrances that are locked in
description: You've found the perfect location for your stay in Potts Point. Your apartment combines a sapcious double bedroom and private sleeping alcove, sunny dining area overlooking the Fountain, modern kitchen and bathroom and a comfortable living area. Your apartment is located in an historic building known around the village as 'The Fountain'. The building is accessed from both the beautiful tree lined Macleay Street and Lankelly Place, home to Pott's Points best restaurants, cafés and laneway bars. The apartment is comfortably furnished with high ceilings, spacious living areas, a light and airy double bedroom and original features. There's an additional fold out double futon sofa in a private sleeping alcove to accommodate up to two extra guests. You'll have very fast wifi and excellent television reception. The building itself, like the Cross is an exciting mixture of residential, cultural and commercial spaces. Cafés and restaurants are literally downstairs at your doorstep, as is a laun
neighborhood_overview: Space doesn't allow for a comprehensive list of the amenities that can be easily accessed from this location, but you'll find that Marcelle's cafe, located at the front entrance to the building on Macleay Street is fabulous for breakfast and lunch, and at the Lankelly Place side of the building, the LL Wine and Dine offers a stylish pan-Asian menu, weekend Yum Cha, cocktails and live music. Coffee at Yuca is great, the best Parisian croissants can be found at Croissant D'Or, there's awesome Italian food in Bottega del Vino and some amazing restaurants (among the best in Sydney) like The Fish Shop, Fratelli Paradiso or Billy Kwong are a few minutes stroll from the apartment. You're just a few minutes walk from all the restaurants and night spots of Darlinghurst to the south, the famous Woolloomooloo Bay pubs and eateries to the north (just walk down Macleay Street), where you can continue walking to the Botanical Gardens, the Sydney Opera House, Circular Quay, and then a little further
notes: Note that the street level gates to the building are locked to the public from around 6.00pm each evening and you'll need your security key to enter after that time.
transit: You are two minutes walk to Kings Cross train station, there are bus stops to the city and the eastern suburbs on Macleay Street and taxis are everywhere. Secure parking is available at Wilson's Parking in nearby Ward Avenue, just across Fitzroy Gardens and a two minute walk to your apartment. Airport shuttle services also access Kings Cross, as do the Sydney Explorer open-top bus sight seeing service.
access: You'll have the entire apartment to yourselves.
interaction: We've been long term residents of Potts Point but now live an hour away on the Northern Beaches and have been using this space to stay overnight in the city. If we are unable to meet you on arrival, our friend Ian who lives around the corner will be happy to meet you, give you access and answer your questions. But we are always just a phone call away.
house_rules: Please treat the appartment as you would your own. No smoking, no big parties, but given the location, you'll have no shortage of places to entertain yourselves.

name: Glebe Treetop Cottage. Just 200m to Sydney Harbour
summary: You’ll love the treetops, bridge and Sydney skyline views from this cosy 1890's terrace on the hill of Glebe Point. Only 200m to the waterfront, 10mins to the Fish Markets and 25mins to the CBD. Relax in privacy.
space: No doubt you’re an individual, so why stay in a soulless apartment block or faceless hotel room??? Come stay in an authentic Sydney terrace, surrounded by village atmosphere that's just 2mins from the harbour and only 2.5km from the city centre.  Treetop Cottage is a cosy terrace built in 1890 on the eastern side of Glebe point. It has two bedrooms (one has 2 beds), one bathroom, separate lounge and dining room. The kitchen and laundry are brand new. A covered rooftop deck provides a view of the ANZAC bridge, portions of Blackwattle bay and the city through the trees.

Treetop Cottage is a cosy terrace built in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) on the eastern side of Glebe point. It has two bedrooms (one has 2 beds), one bathroom, separate lounge and dining room. The kitchen and laundry are brand new. A covered rooftop deck provides a view of the ANZAC bridge, portions of Blackwattle bay and the city through the trees. The house is accessible 24Hrs a day. On the front door there is a small combination safe which contains two door keys. The internal stairs are narrow and may
neighborhood_overview: Come to our village of Glebe and you'll find a myriad of cafés and restaurants, foreshore walk ways, parklands and proximity to the wonderful city of Sydney with all that it and its beautiful harbour have to offer. Travel to the city by light rail (tram), by bus, an inexpensive taxi or simply walk.  In Glebe besides fantastic food, there are bookshops, fashion stores and collectables. On Saturday visit Glebe Markets on the grounds of Glebe Public School.  'The Glebe' was given to the church by the Governour in the first few years of European settlement as a means for the church to support itself.  Most of the suburb was sub-dived and built upon in the 1880's and the vast majority of the terraces you'll see today were built in that era. Workers unions and left wing politicians managed to fend off building developers in the 1970's resulting in charming terraced townhouses and cottages surviving so close the the city skyscrapers.
notes: *The house can accommodate up to 5 adults and two babies. Stored in the house there are; two portable cots, two prams, two baby feeding seats and one baby car seat. Please inform us if you wish to use the car seat.  *There is unlimited WiFi in the cottage with speeds between 10mbs to 15mbs (sufficient for most streaming services). The TV is fitted with a ChromeCast connected to the WiFi for streaming from your phone. Great for YouTube. *For late/early arrivals there are staple food items free for use. *A folder is in the lounge contains local menus to the closest restaurants and some maps. In the folder you'll also find two public transport Opal cards and starter phone sim cards. If you use the Opal cards please return them when you leave (with enough credit for at least one trip, if you can). The sim cards can be registered online. *There are numerous books in the house ( mainly sci-fi ). If you become engrossed in a particular book and cant leave it, please talk to us and we'll see w
transit: You’ll be in the centre of the inner-inner west and just a hop to the city centre, get about and make the most of it.  (Hidden by Airbnb) Maps on a 4G smartphone will make your trip so much easier.  WALKING;  Walking is a great way to see the area as everything is so close for the average walker. It's only 10min walk to the fish markets and only 20min to Darling Harbour. The shops at the top of the street are 2min walk and it's a mere 2min to the wonderful Glebe foreshore parklands.  At the bottom of Forsyth Street turn right and you can walk along the waterfront all the way to the city via the fish markets (with a few street portions). If you turn left at the bottom of Forsyth Street, it's a beautiful waterfront parkland walk as far as Annandale. PUBLIC TRANSPORT; In the folder in the lounge room, you should find two public transport Opal cards. The cards work for all public transport, be it bus, ferry or train. If you use them, please replace them, with enough value for at least one
access: The house is accessible 24Hrs a day. On the front door there is a small combination safe which contains two door keys. The internal stairs are narrow and may be difficult for those with mobility issues.
interaction: We live just minutes away and can be on hand personally, by Airbnb app, by phone, by text or by email should anything arise.
house_rules: -Please respect our neighbours. No large parties please.   -No smoking allowed anywhere on the premises. -Sorry, no pets allowed. -Children under 10 must be supervised while on upstairs deck. -The Internet access is unlimited. -The phone is free for local and national calls. No outgoing international calls please (unless in an emergency). -Please be aware that the stairs to the main bedroom and deck are narrow and may be difficult for those with mobility issues. -Red and yellow garbage bins need to be put on the footpath on each Monday night. Red bin is for general waste. Yellow bin is ONLY for recyclables such as metal, paper, plastic and glass. Please bring the bins back in on Tuesday afternoon.

host.host_about: I've lived in Glebe for over 20 years, but have travelled widely and called Tokyo, Singapore, KL and London home as well. I work in the media, have a two daughters (a baby and a 5 year old) and therefore a Wiggles phobia.

name: Manly Beach House
summary: Metres from the golden sands of Manly's iconic beachfront, this charming freestanding cosy home is a hidden retreat . Light and bright with a large outdoor deck which is perfect for sun-filled BBQs after a day at the beach
space: Located 200m from Manly's beachfront and tucked away from the street on a fully fenced level block in an exclusive 'Manly flat' location. Lead the ultimate beach lifestyle footsteps from shops, cafes, restaurants, bars, buses, city-bound ferries and pristine surf and harbour beaches. Light and bright with crisp Hampton-style interiors, this recently refreshed single-level home has an outdoor entertaining deck in an idyllic child friendly outdoor sanctuary.  Its centrally located with the Manly Corso & Ferry only 5minutes walk away.  The kitchen has all the essentials with a gas kitchen top & the convenience of an adjacent laundry. The 2 double bedrooms both have wardrobes and drawers for all your holiday storage while a neat and tidy bathroom with updated fixtures and fittings with a bath an overhead shower.  Additional features include reverse cycle air conditioning, a garden shed, recently landscaped gardens, timber floors, high ceilings, Foxtel (cable TV) and wireless internet.

neighborhood_overview: We are located in the Ocean Precinct at North Steyne just slightly out of the hustle & bustle of Manly but close enough to get amongst it.  We are closest to North Steyne Surf Club where you can learn to surf at Manly Surf School. This part of Manly is where most of the locals come to relax and get a spare piece of sand to themselves!
notes: All Linen and towels are included so you can enjoy a stress free weekend away.
transit: If you are travelling by car you are likely to park it & then never use it when you are here. We are so close to everything! The Fast ferry gets you into the city (Circular Quay) in 20mins.  The beach is 200m away and you can walk to some of Manly's best coves (Shelly Beach, Little Manly, Dewood Beach and Fairlight Pool) in minutes. The bus is right outside of Pittwater Rd (50m) away and can take you north all the way to Palm Beach (30mins), to the shopping mall (Westfield in Brookevale 5mins) or to the city in around 30mins.
access: Access to the property is via a side entrance down the side of a neighbouring house. It is a paved area with easy access. You will have access to the entire house besides from a locked shed at the back of the property.
interaction: We've lived in Manly and the Northern Beaches our whole lives so can help you with any tips & restaurant guides.
house_rules: All neighbours are lovely and friendly so please keep it this way.  No loud noise after 9pm and no parties. There is also a bunkhouse next door & these are the same rules they abide by.  No pets please or smoking inside.

host.host_about: In my thirties and like to travel the world & see cities like a local.  I live in Manly with my husband of 6 years a little Cavoodle called Charli. We love life by the sea and enjoy dinning out, music , entertainment and good laughs with with friends.

Hello and thanks for taking the time to read my profile. I am a roaming New Zealander now settled in Australia's most picturesque city of Sydney. I am delighted to become an Airbnb host of apartment/condominium/self-contained/flat style of accommodation right here in Sydney. 

45 years old, I have been a travel agent since my early twenties, this job experience coupled with my own extensive travel around the world (including many successful stays booked via Airbnb) plus meeting my travel client expectations has armed me with extensive knowledge base of what guests require of their stay.

name: Sanctuary Bundeena
summary: Relax and revitalise in our spacious, self-contained studio apartment, with lush private garden. Bundeena's four beautiful beaches, the magnificent Coast Walk and the shops, cafes and artists studios of Bundeena village are just a short stroll away.
space: Sanctuary is a large, self-contained apartment in the downstairs area of our two story home, with views of the Royal National Park to the south and opening onto a lush garden and angophera forest to the north. It includes a spacious living area with lounge suite, television, DVD player and stereo system. An extensive in-house DVD lending library is also available. The sleeping area contains an extra long and wonderfully comfortable Queen bed with fluffy doona and luxurious pillows. All linen and towels are provided. There is a small kitchenette which includes a refrigerator, microwave and tea and coffee making facilities. A complimentary continental style breakfast is provided to get you started and a gas BBQ is available. The large combined bathroom/laundry includes a shower, a bath for luxuriating in, and a washing machine and clothes dryer.

neighborhood_overview: Sanctuary is tucked away in the quietest corner of Bundeena, close to the shops, beaches and the magnificent Royal National Park. Our native garden attracts plenty of birds, possums and other wildlife.
transit: Bundeena is accessible by private car (through the Royal National Park) or a 20 minute ferry trip from Cronulla. If you would like to walk some of the more distant areas of the national park we can arrange to drop you off and/or pick you up.
access: Sanctuary is private, self-contained and has its own separate entrance.
interaction: We are very happy to help you with advice on local attractions and transport to and from various parts of the national park.
